review_body: Good location. Reception staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Went out of their way to help us with the few queries we had. Location excellent, close to restaurants , metro and central railway.would be happy to stay here again

review_body: We stayed here the night before we had to fly out of Malpensa and it worked really well. It's located very near the train station and the staff were very helpful. We left early before breakfast was being served, but they provided us with a small bag packed with food. The room was very clean and check-in/check-out went very smoothly.

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located across Milano Centrale station and is the perfect place to stay if you happen to be in the area. The rooms and bathroom are new and have tea and water in the room. I would gladly stay at this property again.

We elected not to have the breakfast but breakfast room setup appeared to be very nice.WE were looking for a fairly inexpensive hotel in walking distance to Milan Central and this fit our needs.

review_body: Nice hotel near central station Milan. Good breakfast. Nice atmosphere. Good staff. Rooms a bit small but practical and nice. Great location in center. Rooms are clean and comfortanble. Good value for money

review_body: Great location but the staff is horrible not friendly at all only if you speak French I noticed the staff was friendly to people speaking the same language but if you’re an American I didn’t find the hotel staff to be friendly at all the guy that worked on the corner that provided us with excursions was friendlier than the people at the hotel. The bathroom is so small that two people can’t be in at the same time. your bed is three steps away from the room door. I also took a picture of a bed . Do not stay at this hotel. Horrible place. They also say breakfast is included. Nothing is included. You pay for the breakfast. Horrible place. Worst hotel I have ever stayed in while in Europe and I travel for Vacation twice a year for the past 10 years.

review_body: Close to the city and station. Convenient. Close to eateries and bus stand for tours and their interior decoration was classy for a small hotel. Great break fast and friendly staff. Will stay in this place again if we do another trip to Milan.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Booked at the Bernina because central to station arriving and leaving , only half block to walk with luggage. The metro was quick to get to all sights, once we got our head around it. The staff were friendly and efficient with our booking. Breakfast was continental with plenty of choice, cereal, fruits pancakes toast pastries coffee and tea. the room was clean and cosy fresh towels daily, I would stay again for the convenience.

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Rooms were very clean and comfortable. When we requested a room change, as we were next to a noisy lift, there was no issue and we were given a new room.The location was good as we were very near the train station.

review_body: Rooms are small but well organized. Very nicely decorated. Staff was very friendly. Very clean. The breakfast. Wow wow wow! Gorgeous spread, pastries, fresh expresso and cappuccino, fruit, cheeses, meats, yogurt, warm pastries. Quiche, fantastic!

review_body: Close to the central station as well as the metro station this is a clean and efficient hotel giving value for money.Good filling breakfast including eggs, fresh fruits, deserts etc much more than the continental breakfasts provided by other Italian hotels. Bathrooms are clean and thoughtfully provided with heated clothes stand.

review_body: Small but quaint little hotel tucked away minutes from grand central station. Great staff, cute little dining area with a delicious breakfast of various pastries. Single room quite small but well equipped.

review_body: A really pleasant spot, excellent location, clean and modern throughout with thoughtful design in room with limited space. Good choices for breakfast and pleasant and helpful reception and dining-room staff.

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Very comfortable beds, newly renovated and quiet rooms in a good location near Central station; the rooms are not big but as they are really reasonably priced, this is fine. The breakfast buffet is plentiful and served in a nice room, also newly renovated
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Hotel Bernina is a beautiful hotel situated really close to the central train station. The hotel is well appointed and clean. The staff are most helpful and provided me with excellent information and advice. It's not too far to walk to Duomo but there are transport links nearby. The rooms were bright and airy. I would certainly recommend.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent two nights at Hotel Bernina. Rooms are modern, clean, bright and beds are comfy. Breakfast was excellent and the staff are very friendly, professional and service minded. Location is perfect for arriving and leaving from Milan Central station. I’ll definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to the train station, 5 minutes walking with luggage. Clean rooms. Because we were close to the metro it made it easy to see all the sights. Good restaurants are near by. The staff was helpful.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My over all rating is excellent in spite of a few things out of their control.....The price was excellent....The Location was excellent...the breakfast was very good....the room was very clean every day with a really sweet house cleaning lady, i was able to catch the hop on hop off bus near the hotel....I felt very safe there....they allowed me to check in early....the central train station was a block up the street....I was able to take day excursions to Pisa, Venice, cinque Terre and Lake Como with no problems...there is also a ticket office for the train station a few feet away (where I booked all my excursions.... most of the staff attitudes were ok .....a few were a bit impatient...my only issues were the bathroom had a weird smell and the elevator was too small....so I had to take the stairs to the third floor everyday but I would put my luggage on the elevator, lastly book your tickets in advance to see the Last Supper”. Didn’t get to. See Leonardo Da Venchi painting ... over all I love Italy and Hotel Bernina!!!!!!!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is definitely cheap and cheerful.The rooms themselves are very small, and not the most modern. However, they are clean which is a bonus. The hotel is ideally located just across the street from Milano Centrale Train Station giving you access to trains and Metro.Overall I would stay in this establishment again but only if I was not planning on actually spending much time in the room.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: we had a booking from Agoda with double bed and a picture of a double bed room, as we book 2 rooms so we did not notice as we check in we were told the double bedroom is for 1 person, sounds like daylight robbery? yes so I got confuse we were then told to add EUR30 per day per pax.i never book a double bed hotel room with a double bed picture only for 1 pax.....thats a hilarious daily robbery attempt.we were tired so we check in and regroup myself I thought it was the same picture we booked and we check in so we confront the rude staff then he started to slow down and says manager agrees 50% discount since the initial payment is a refund policy I had to agree.beware!other than that the hotel is so over rated!look nice from the outside, lobby pretty chick and artsy right? thats all!small lift and barely fit 3 person, we had a spoilt kettle, fridge that do not work and it melts all my aiscream that I bought as I was not aware, stains on towel, dripping washroom it will make your floor wet and slippery & dripping shower hose so the pressure will be slow.one word, pretty run down for the price we paid.so DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Excellent, comfortable and central. Ideal for Milan. This is my favourite business travel location. Have used it for years and the recent improvements have made it a very good location. Good working space available as well

review_body: Just a short walk to Milano train station, this hotel is about location. Modern fittings, the hotel probably had a face lift. It does have stylish & modern furnitures in my room, but the kettle wasn't real clean. It must have been in used for a long time, I wouldn't use it. A beautifully decorated dinning area, but limited selection of breakfast served.11am sharp, I was called up to leave. Staff wasn't that interested to talk, maybe because of language.

review_body: It was a good choice because of the perfect location (metro, restaurant and mini market). The staff was gentle and receptive. The breakfast was delicious, but poor in fruits.The room was simple and nice, but in the morning the hall was noisy because of the people keep chatting and slamming doors.

review_body: Great breakfast, hotel was centrally located and service was as expected, nothing out of the ordinary! Very close to the train station and surrounded by good restaurants :)Staff is sweet and helped me find my way around!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Bernina for one night this week (8th-9th October). It is the perfect location for a quick trip to Milan - really close to the main station (less than 5min walk) and easy access to the Metro station. The room itself was quite basic in terms of decor but it was all we needed. There were tea and coffee making facilities and a hairdryer, and the bed was very comfortable. There was also a mini fridge and we had two free bottles of water included. Breakfast was varied and fresh and the staff were helpful.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: close to everything....so close to the milano centrale station and a few steps away from the hotel is the Metro Station going to the Duomo. breakfast is good. i would stay there again and would recommend this hotel to friends. room is small but comfortable, AC is good and the hot shower is great and WiFi is fast. a lot of restaurants and cafe around the area and is safe at night. bus going to the airport is also available at the milano centrale station which made the trip going to the airports really convinient and saves you a lot of money from taking the taxis.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Hotel Bernina is located very close to Centrale Station making it very convenient to get around Milano and eventually to Malpensa airport. The decor is fantastic; breakfast service staff amazing and the rooms clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gem this place was. Close to the main train station and two metros. Hotel staff were always extremely helpful. The room was large by European standards and very clean. We chose not to have the hotel breakfast and instead had a typical Italian bar breakfast at many of the nearby establishments. Being so close to the train station meant there were a few homeless around at night but that’s no different to any major city. It was a great way to kick off our stay in Milan.

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Good location and the personnel was very friendly, very good amenities and the breakfast Room was very clean and spacious, also the Food was very good. The Room was very clean all the times. I will recommed this Hotel to my friends and relatives. Also the location of this Hotel is ve4y good because is very close to the Milano Centrale were you can take the Trains to go any place you want.

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Within in walking distance to the train station, the Bernina is an ideal spot for an affordable stay. While the rooms are small, the hotel is quiet and the service is very good. Our included breakfast was fantastic. There are restaurants up and down the street and the neighborhood is safe at any hour. This is a great stay.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone was friendly and I loved their breakfast. Good location. Close to pier and downtown square. We had an awesome view of the mountains from our window! The room had AC and decent space. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Great location and nice room and lobby area. As soon as we opened the bathroom door the smell of cigarettes was intense, being a non smoker it was disgusting and we just used the bathroom as little as possible. Wouldn’t return for this reason.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Excellent service and a very nice breakfast and nice coffee! The room is amazing (though the bed is quiet small) but the interior and toilet is nice! and staff are so friendly! Easy access to metro and restaurants nearby! Would definitely recommend and will book this hotel again once we come back Milan!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a week in April, and while it was certainly adequate, I wouldn't return. My room was very small as was the bed. It had all the advertised amenities, free bottle of water daily, a kettle, a small fridge, AC, television with English stations etc, etc.I couldn't access the wifi and the remote for the tv was difficult to operate, I never did figure out how to turn it off and there was a glare from the screen every night for a few hours until it finally shut down. The walls were paper thin and lacked soundproofing. Of the three front desk staff I spoke with, 1 was sharp and abrupt, the other 2 were okay but not what I would call friendly, a smile would have been appreciated.I was travelling alone and I did feel safe though, it was very convenient being across the street from the main station as I used Milan as a base for day trips. I could go and get a coffee and pastry early in the morning before starting off. I didn't get breakfast because I would be l gone by 6 every morning and breakfast started later than that, plus it was quite pricey in my opinion.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came across The Hotel Berna based on reviews, location and price. We had a great stay, albeit just one night. We stayed in a quality room w/ sofa. Average to larger size for similar Italian hotels. It met all of my needs in a hotel (clean, cool and quiet) at a reasonable price. Within walking distance of Milano Centrale as well as the Metro makes this a logical place to stay if arriving by train as well as being centrally located for business and pleasure activities in the city. The breakfast was outstanding as well as the service from all of the employees that we came in contact with. You can even personalize your stay prior to your arrival with the type of pillow you want, what complimentary beverages that you want stocked in the mini-fridge and what temperature you want in your room upon your arrival. Future trips to Milan will always find me here
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: What I love about this hotel is the wonderful breakfast spread. Also, its close to Milan Central Station, only about 5 mins walk. However, the reception staff was very unfriendly and was not helpful. Whatever we enquired (about Milan), it was answered with a shrug or 'I don't know'.Rooms are a good size and clean. It was comfortable for the 2 of us. I just wish the staff were friendlier.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: A comfortable location - near the central station of Milan. Rather small room, corridor and lift. A hotel just for sleeping and passing days out. Nice lobby and exterior view, friendly staff, free wi-fi.

0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: We stayed in this hotel with my wife during our visit to Milan in Apr 2018.Location of the hotel is very convenient - direct connection with airport, a lot of restaurants, supermarkets, car rental offices and shops are near the hotel.Rooms are very very small, it would be difficult to stay longer than over weekend.Rooms are old but pretty clean, no serious concerns.During our stay the next building was under reconstruction, so we were waking up because of loud voices of construction workers, but I believe that construction will be finished soon
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: A nice, simple, easy, and clean hotel to stay in Milan that is very near the main train station. Breakfast was good too. If you are a business traveller this hotel works best for you too. Travel from airport to the central station via a single bus ride and the hotel is walking distance from where you get dropped off.

review_body: Booked two single rooms which clearly had just been renovated, the rooms are small but have good size bathrooms. My TV was not receiving satalite, so was moved to a double room with no problems. The hotel seems to have been totally updated and the reception rooms are a little quirky with modern paintings. the lift only has room for 2 but works. The breakfast spread is exceptional and the coffee to italian standards. Staff friendly and helpful , and reception 24/7

review_body: i stay just one night in the hotel and didn't use food service so i can't write any comment about that. but i can say the rooms was quite comfort and in high standard level in compare to the payed value. one important thing is that it's quite close to the Milan central station and also you can find enough good restaurants in around.

review_body: I went and look for a hotel and I decided to see the room before I pay.after checking the room was too small I decided not to stay and I sit down at the lobby and I was chased away by the receptionist who was on the duty at night shift at about 2230pm.He use his finger sign and ask me to leave.i immediately stand up and walk away and check in at another hotel.The management please train your staff well and even if you don’t allowed non guest to stay at the lobby.you should not point your finger in such way.i will not stay at this hotel I will not recommend this hotel to anyoneDear guest please don’t stay at this hotel.the staff is so rude
hotelName:

review_body: Very clean up to date, but small, room right across the street from the train station. Walking distance to all the major sites of Milano. Most hotels in the area were much more expensive and we found this to be much more than adequate for a 1-2 night stay.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room might be small but everything works! The breakfast spread is wide enough to satisfy your craving. Very easy to locate this hotel. As you get out of Milano Centrale ahead of you is a big road and a building with a signage that says Generali. Look towards the left, at 11 o’ clock position. You will see a small road between two buildings. Hotel Bernini is there, a short 4-minute walk away. Service here is great. Front office staff very responsive. We were even allowed to have our breakfast before the 7 am opening time so that we can catch an early train. Decor is unique and refreshing. Nice ambience.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are on a budget, and need to be near the Central railway Station, this hotel may suit you. It is walking distance (5 mins) from the station, has a decent lobby with some modern art on display, and breakfast is ok. The lift hold only two people (can be embarrassing) and the rooms are very small, yet clean and reasonable.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Hotel Bernina in September 2017. The rate for a single room was very competitive. Breakfast staff were very hospitable and the food was varied and very tasty, especially the spinach and ricotta tart (which was made by the lovely senora in the kitchen). The lady also made excellent cappuccino. On the other hand I was very surprised that some of the hotel reception staff were not very sociable. As I have worked in the hospitality industry, I would always welcome customers and ask them how their day was going and in this case, the staff should have engaged in conversation with me as a tourist i.e. what have your seen today in Milan etc. Overall a very clean hotel and the staff who cleaned the room did an excellent job.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The lobby and common areas of the hotel are full of modern art and very welcoming. The rooms are small-ish but the AC is VERY good and the location is super convenient, with the train station and a metro stop very close by. Breakfast was very nice and the breakfast attendant Sveta was just the absolute nicest ever.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience ! Despite the single room looks a little bit small, the bathroom has the necessary room and equipment. The entire breakfast service was a really enjoyable experience, and the staff at the front desk were always helpful and kind.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very convenient location - not too loud (you can sleep with the window open) - rooms not too big or modern (but were there to visit Milan not the room) - freshly renovated, colourful and artistic entrance and dining spaces - great breakfast - inexpensive compared to other hotels right next door (we have been to Milano often an stayed in the neighbouring hotel unknowingly)
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Basic, immaculately clean perfect for quick stopover. Simple and clean. I had a 7:00am train to catch one morning and then later in the week when I returned to this hotel I had the Bergamo Airport bus to catch at 07:35 beside the station. Hotel location was ideal for both these early starts. I didn't have breakfast as I left too early. Staff are v efficient.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel a few days ago and we really enjoyed our stay. Convenient location, good service, lovely breakfast, beautiful and clean hotel!! In this hotel you will feel very safe and welcomed)) Staff is very kind and helpfull especially Sveta - lady who served breakfast.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a few meters away from Milano Centrale railway station, Hotel Bernina is an urban oasis. I only spent one night there, but I wish I could have spent more. Kind staff, great location (metro stop is 30 meters away), very clean rooms, and lovely shower. Cool design in the lobby/breakfast room as well. The room is a little small, but you have plenty of space for all you need. I was pleasantly surprised. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Bernina

review_body: Overall Hotel Is Nice with Very Kind and Helpful Staff at The reception but The rooms are extremely small and in such 4 star property we faced Major inconvenience due to 1 OUT OF SERVICE Lift out of 2 which is major Turn off and Makes u stay Waiting for the lift all the time and that too in whole stay of 3 nigts and 4 days. In such a property it should be Repaired within Minutes with such heavy footfall and Such Nice restaurant at Roof.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale

review_body: Perfect for our overnight stay between connections at Milan Centrale. Easy walk with baggage, efficient front desk, clean well furnished room, multiple options for drink or late night snack. Plus, outstanding breakfast.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Renovations were just being completed when we arrived so things changed everyday. Spa downstairs was free which included, pool, salt room, sauna, steam room & gym. We had a standard room which was clean, quiet and comfortable. Free Wi-fi. Breakfast was extra 18 Euro each which was good value as it had a good variety and as many cappuccinos as you can drink! Staff were lovely. Reminder there is a tourist tax in Italy this hotel was 5 euros each per day on your check out bill. Short walk to Central Station where you can get the Hop on Hop off bus.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance from Central train station but a decent walk to other sights.Breakfast did have gluten free options which is pleasing considering Europe doesn’t have much to offer elsewhere.Room was fine but bed wasn’t very comfortable
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is okay but and the hotel is quite new.However, the service is not good at all, we called for checking if possible we request additional mineral water, but the one who answered my call was very rude. The room is very small though.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here based on the reviews but wouldn’t recommend it. Our city view consisted of the construction of two large buildings (I checked with reception that this was a city view), no coffee machine in room as stated, the lifts were very slow and there was construction of the foyer during our stay ( it states on their website it would take place until the day we arrived and it was still going on the day we left). Overall very disappointing.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was close to railway station which was very handy because this is how we travelled. A ramp would be useful at the entrance because there are quite a few stairs. The hotel was very clean and tidy.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Milan for one night as we passed by from Paris to Rome. Although the lobby was under construction everything else appeared to be in working order. The highlight of the hotel was the wellness center which offered a Roman bath and saunas. We wished we stayed another night.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at the Hyatt Centric to be near the milano centrale station for our early morning bus transfer to Bergamo Airport. This hotel is now (august) going through lobby renovations and this area is limited in size. they have a great roof bar terrace but the drinks and food are too expensive. In general the rooms are small with king beds. Just a clean hotel near the milano centrale (walking) for those who want to stay short visit for connections in train. Breakfast is expensive try to get the room with breakfast included.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is no parking available in the hotel when I arrived. I asked for a fish for dinner and was awful. The room was not well cleaned. The tables in the rooftop and in the breakfast stay dirty for a loooooong time, leaving the ambient disgusting. The housekeepers like to talk in your door at 8:00am. Definitely don’t recommend. I am currently at the hotel, unfortunately.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel were absolutely amazing. I was dealing with a medical issue while staying there and they went above and beyond to make sure that I and my husband got what we needed. They were incredibly kind, attentive, and knowledgeable. I really do not know what we would have done without them -- by far the best hotel staff that I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All over a premium hotel. Staff: All over very helpful and polite! Big smile and ready to solve every issue. Room: A couple of shelves was full of dust, but they was up high - my guess is that the cleaners didn’t reach it. Beside that, the room was top notch with all you need.The rooftop bar and restaurant is a must experience, the view is breathtaking!
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While there is still some construction, the staff do a great job of making you feel welcomed and comfortable. The rooftop bar is a must. The food is delicious and the drinks are very cool. The view of the city and the mountains is fantastic after a long day shopping! I look forward to returning!
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hyatt Centric has a great central location steps away from Stazione Centrale from where you can zip anywhere in italy , great staff incredibly friendly well mannered and well spoken comfortable modern rooms perhaps the control panels for lights and other items in the rooms is too messy and you never get it right. Hotel has a beautiful restaurant and a great roof top. elevator are not too fast and sometimes have to wait around. overall would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and updated. Love the black-out blinds !Hotel is very close to the Central Station. Many very good restaurants within a 5 minute walk. The roof top patio has an awesome view, and good live music on Tuesday and Thursday.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: <Good Points>Location is near Milano Centale. Convenient to access.Room was modern and clean.<Need to be improved>Lots of mosquitoes on the roof top bar, it made us uncomfortable stay there.No slope in front of the lobby. Guests have to carry their heavy luggage for more than 10 steps.Only two units of elevator for the size of the number of rooms, which make guests wait too long.Front desk staff was impolite, he underestimates how guests feel from his attitude. Actually we asked him to call back to us and we missed it since we left the room shortly. We understand we had some responsibilities for that but what on earth then he could have such right to scold us in the public lobby for that tiny reason?! We felt so sad and uncomfortable.I regret to say that we will never use this hotel again and never recommend to others unless they will be improved
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was at this hotel for 2 nights and had nothing but superb service. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I did love the feature lights around the windows - made my stay worth while. I did have a slight hiccup which was the lights of my room stopped working from night 1 onward HOWEVER the staff were helpful and fixed it whilst we were out. Will be back to stay here soon. Would highly recommend it to others as is very close to central station and close to the Duomo and other sights.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got an excellent stay at this hotel. The staff was really friendly and welcoming. Our room was really big, clean and modern.It is really close of the main train station. My only deception was that we wanted to eat something late (around 12:00 am) and nothing was available except the mini bar. Otherwise great stay!
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Feels like a business focused hotel. The night entertainment was very good upstairs on the terrace with the views over Milan. Easy to catch a train for a few stops into Milan. Walking around at night past midnight might not suit everyone as it’s very quiet. A lots of offices are nearby so it’s quite deserted at night. Not near trams.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and tidy. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located near the train station which was handy. There are a number of nice coffee shops and restuarants close by.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay with good connections, helpful staff and great response from the room service. Close to Centrale train and bus station so you can reach anywhere very easily. One of the better peaceful locations
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale. I stayed for four nights and it was ideal walking distance to sights such as the Duomo. The hotel reception kindly recommended the old town area of Brera as well. All of this was within a nice relaxing walk in the sun. I used the rooftop pool each night and the staff were friendly. The views of the Milan skyline were great and the food choices and cocktails were excellent too. I enjoyed the Spa at the hotel. I would say it was on the small side but it was fine for me as it was quiet when I was there. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Milan Centrale station so easily accessible. I would stay there on my next visit to Milan.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week... ON 12th FLOOR Balcony Room. One of the best. View to die for. Corner balcony with glass walls. Large comfy king bed. Separate lounge room. Very large marble walk-in Shower with great pressure. Views to Milan from shower. TV in Bathroom. Power points where they should be. Very good air conditioning.Staff super friendly! Breakfast excellent and morning smiles and greetings every morning. BREAKFAST Staff there among the best we have seen. Young lady very impressive. Bar downstairs well appointed and quiet after long days of walking. CLOSE (300 metres) to Station Centrale into Duomo Milan (4 stops) and out to Como or even Switzerland.Reception is excellent - Counter staff couldn’t be kinder and more helpful.Really, this is a great hotel. Will be sorry to leave!Danmagpie
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a bad experience with the SIEMENS computer system managing our room and a positive experience with the service and management. The room climate control broke down at 3am in the morning, trying to cool down our room to 18C with tremendous noise. Lights and entrance card did not work any longer, however, the service was great, even at that early hour. Within 10min. the service guy appeared and fixed the problem together with his colleague at the reception desk (by remote control). Next morning the hotel took over our evening drinks in the rooftop bar as a compensation for the sleepless night - 5-stars for the service! Only breakfast quality did not match with our experience of a Hyatt hotel, some room for improvement still left after all.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I must comment that the hotel is very well located and near Milan Centrale station. When we arrived, no one greeted us, no one helped us with our bags... and being hungry, I asked for food options as my child was hungry - they said there is only the bar option left. Which was basically pizza- cold. The food in the hotel is extremely limited and the staff while very helpful, are not well versed in English. For example- I wanted to hire the hotel car to take a day trip to Verona- they asked me to take a train instead. They didn't give us directions. The rooms- Clean but dusty. The plumping is weird. They said that the room downstairs complained it was "Raining" when we showered. On all days i found floating waste (that wasn't ours as we were all asleep during the night and the toilet was definitely clean before I went to bed) in my toilet in the morning and had to flush again and again. The rooftop is ok. Overrated. I asked for Airport Transfer - and twice, they had lost my details. One good thing is- they did let us have late checkout till 2pm as my car was arriving at 3pm.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very supportive in some emergency and gave us full support i could not visit them but the way they supported i will visit them, special mention for federico in reservations good support from the team.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, I’d recommend to stay here - it’s clean, modern, helpful staff and has comfy beds. When we arrived we had a large heavy luggage and there are only stairs to get into the hotel! No slope whatsoever to get the luggage up and no one to help us. We had to drag a heavy case up stairs to even get in. The entrance is also an entrance to other buildings so is in a very random place, it’s not very luxurious. When you enter the reception you can feel it’s not Hyatt quality. The decor and the darkness all look a little tacky/dated. The check in staff were lovely! Even printed one of my online tickets for me which I’m very grateful for. Breakfast was good, good amount of choice but slightly tasteless hot options. The room was very small! I couldn’t even open my suitcase anywhere - no where to keep and open the luggage. Couldn’t even open my case out on the floor because then you can’t walk. The blinds are super noisy and slow. Bathroom was clean and modern - no complaints there! There was a kettle too. The bed was comfy and everything was fairly clean. The corridor is so dark!!! Can barely see anything - slightly eerie. Lift is extremely slow! No help with bags unless you ask but the bellboy does not have a trolley so just manually picks them up and takes your cases down the stairs. The carpet and the tiles on the staircase are really poor design and a little tacky, completely takes away from the glamour a Hyatt should have. Turns out it’s only been a Hyatt from early May 2019. 8 min walk from the station which is easy to navigate but not easy with a large case. Close to tram stop too! Supermarket and shops available in the station for amenities. We enjoyed our stay but felt this hotel could up their standards a little to be a Hyatt.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are small for a twin and even when stated ahead of time it was made up as a double. The lift is soooo slow but the staircase is spiral so not for the faint hearted to use. The spa costs 15 euros to use not worth it on top of the room cost. The hotel is very dark inside. Rooftop is a great view, it was busy when we went so no tables available as good seats were reserved and empty. I wasn’t advised to book a seat there. Staff are friendly and helpful even when our shower flooded the bathroom.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After 3 years we came back to stay at this hotel again for a few days. This time we added breakfast, which we really enjoyed. It's a decent range of good quality food, fresh fruit and things like cappuccino can be ordered at no extra charge.The rooms are in the same style as on our first visit before the hotel rebranded to "Hyatt" – it's all modern and high quality. The room was very clean, although at one point a long hair fell out of the towels.Their information booklet in the room says you can borrow all sorts of things at the reception for the stay, including travel adapters and phone chargers, however when we asked for a USB phone charger, they didn't have any.Room service is a bit odd in this hotel. Although the room was made up nicely every day, sometimes they only took away the smaller towels without replacing them with new ones. We didn't even throw them on the floor. Either leave them where they are or replace them. There was only one spare role of toilet paper in the bathroom, but once we started using it, they never added another one for the rest of our stay, so it was not an oversight. I would expect a tiny bit more care in a hotel like this.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What’s not to love. The location is excellent. Like 5-7 minutes from the railway station. Great restaurants around. Friendly and helpful staff. Got an upgrade to a fairly spacious suite. If I had to say something negative, it would be that the lifts were damn slow. So much so that we chose to walk up and down to the first floor with our baby’s stroller rather than wait for the elevator. Still , overall a great stay and highly recommended.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A familiar place under a new management umbrella. Not much has changed though. The deluxe rooms & bathrooms are spacious. However, the hotel needs to fix a few niggles & with alacrity especially when pointed out by the guest.In our room, one of the blinds didn't work for the entire duration of our stay although we had pointed it out right at the start. Replenishment of tissue paper, creamer/ milk was not done.The staff was courteous, friendly and helpful. They were eager to assist with taxis, restaurant recommendations and so on. Overall a nice experience despite the niggles.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location, about 5 minutes from central station. There is a rumble every now and then from the tram line outside but the beds are comfortable. The staff were professional and did what they're there to do but it seemed to be lacking a bit of personality. No room service and fairly average tea and coffee making facilities. It just felt like the right boxes has been ticked to get the four star rating, but it didn't feel like a 4 star. Would stay again if on business but if you're looking for something better than a holiday Inn for a family trip you'll probably be a little underwhelmed.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good location for getting about the city and the surrounding area. It hasn't been a Hyatt long. When we booked it was the MGallery but not sure there have been many changes yet. Interior of the hotel is very dark. Rooftop bar was good and breakfasts were OK. Beds were very uncomfortable.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had previously stayed at Hyatt Centric (then LaGare) on our last trip to Milan and liked it so much we booked it for our most recent trip. Our second visit was even better than the first! The location is great, the rooms are very modern and comfortable and the service was fantastic. They upgraded us as it was my fiancé's birthday and our room had a large balcony with a beautiful view! The concierge organised our dinner reservation and gave us some fantastic tips for the rest of our trip! We will definitely stay at Hyatt Centric next time we are in Milan.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hyatt Centric. It was located very close to the Milan Central train/metro system. Yes, a five minute walk to the hotel ! Some friends informed me that there was a grocery store in the lower level of the train station...if one wants some bottled water or snacks...Other than that, there is not one shop around the hotel for such things. The staff was helpful and accommodating as I became familiar with the many switches in the room. Yes, the hallways are dark...the neon room numbers are cool though.I stayed in a junior spa suit. The room had three floor to ceiling windows. The room was large and very bright and felt wonderful to walk into after a busy day. So, the dark hallways did not bother me. The elevators were never an issue for me either. Breakfast was all encompassing and there wouldn’t be one thing that one would desire...It had everything...plus efficient staff and a nice large, bright room...excellent..I did eat in the restaurant in the evening and it was adequate.I am really picky about my hotels and this was an excellent stay for me..I would highly recommended and return !
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I use the Hyatt brand whenever I can so we used this one in Milan. It looks nice from the outside and the lobby was nice as you can expect from Hyatt. Then the room as we walked in we turned the lights on they didn’t work so we called reception they sent someone to fix it and we went out for a bit, when we returned to our room later on we wanted to see and use the spa at the cost of €15 per person per use we paid a lot of money for the room you would of thought it would of been free for guests. We left the aircon on the coldest setting until we returned to our room when we got back it was boiling and blowing out hot air so hot in fact we had to stay in the hallway for cool air again had to get it fixed. At check out we told the lady about our problems and she refunded us our mini bar and spa usage even so I think with the money the room cost plus the service you expect from the Hyatt chain these problems should happen in the first place.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came here for a short weekend break with my best friend from London and we found it to exceed our expectations. Summary is as follows:Location - Hotel in the the best location! Short walk (5mins) from central station - which you can get the train directly to the airport and lake Como. Also short cab ride to the main shopping area and cathedral.Room/hotel - A little on the small side but modern decor and very clean as is the rest of the hotel. Had a great nights sleep with minimal noise. Spa - Extra surcharge to use the spa but we didn't mind as we had it entirely to ourselves! The pool could be warmer but other than that great ambiance, very clean/well maintained.Staff - Majority were very helpful and polite, except from one young lady at reception who when asked told us there was no shopping centre nor anywhere to do shopping in Milan. I know right? She was rather patronising and abrupt when asked where to find Gucci/LV stores and instead directed us to the 'lower end shops'. Her much friendlier colleague (young man at front desk) gave us a map and showed us where the 8floor mall was located and other sites of interest.Breakfast - Good selection, small dining area. 5* to the lovely pastries and cakes every morning.The rooftop bar was closed during our stay as spring season hadn't fully commenced yet, but were welcome to have a look around. Would definitely return here again when staying in Milan.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is nice and the room has been spacious but from a technical perspective the setup is too complicated given that the building is rather new. There are around 10 buttons to serve the light (even with a printed menu on what each button does). Also for the remote control, the TV usage wasn‘t intuitively (therefore another instruction was printed to explain it to the guests). There are around 200 Italian channels but only around 5 international news channels in English language. Not really good enough for an international hotel chain. Given that we have reached the digital age, it would be not too much of an ask to support at least HDMI access or a smart TV to overcome this problem
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently spent 3 nights at this hotel. Very close easy walk even with luggage from train station if you arrive in Milan by train. Hotel is modern, clean and comfortable making it a nice stay. A little further out from the centre of town but it depends on what you are doing with your days. A special shout out to Annalisa at breakfast service this lovely lady went out of her way to make our breakfast special Bringing us a special treat. Really surprised us and was an unexpected treat which made out morning. So big thank you to her. Would recommend if using trains to get around especially.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very modern and stylish. The staff are polite and welcoming, we requested early check-in and our rooms were ready upon arrival. The location is great as you have access to 2 stations 3-5 minutes walking distance. The only issue we had was the staircase to the front of the hotel, there is no ramp and we had no one to help us drag our suitcases up the stairs. Would have expected better access for a Sofitel Hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New hotel . Really nice and pleasant.. kind of boutique hotel . Nice rooms , big , a shower you want to stay all day ...centrally located... great breakfast with a grand selection.definitely I am coming back .....
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In short, better to spend €40 more and stay at next door Hilton or Sheraton. I chose this hotel because of SOFITEL Accor membership but understood it was a big mistake the moment I entered the hotel and saw the ground floor rooms like dark prison cell they offered me. It has nothing to relate to first class Accor hospitality nor Sofitel service. After such disappointment I regretfully booked at another hotel despite prepaid room at the Lagare hotel. It is normal that staff at most centrally located hotels are spoiled in Europe but at least show some sign of positive approach.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Next to central station this rather new hotel is a great place to spend a few nights for visiting the city of Milano. Staff at the reception and everywhere else are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern but still cosy and the whole infrastructure very satisfactory. Unfortunately, the roof terrace on the 13th floor was closed (it's only open in summer) But what a view! We had a small dinner at the restaurant which offers many local specialities which we liked very much. Prices are really reasonable for Milano standards and for hotels of this level. Would go back anytime.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent city location a short walk from the Central Train Station, yet still offering privacy & great noise insulation. Very modern, clean & comfortable rooms & a comprehensive buffet breakfast. Five stars from me!
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My impression of the hotel: Slightly rude service, nothing works and everything costs extra.Lighting, curtains and the disco-esque color-changing LED-light in the window were controlled by a panel in the room, which was clearly of Italian design. 16 buttons, and no indication of what would happen when pushing each of the buttons. Extremely frustrating! I also do not understand why I would want to adjust the toilet lighting from the bedside?The electronic curtains were very loud when being lowered/raised. I could hear when my next door neighbors woke up due to the noise of their curtains being lifted.I asked for an iron for my shirt, but they had none. I could have my shirt ironed by their service during some specific hours... for an extra charge obviously. If you make up rules of an iron being not allowed in the room, you should at least provide one in a common ironing room etc.The hotel building is very tall, but there are only 2 "Italian style" extremely slow elevators. Every trip to the lobby took 3-4 minutes due to this.Breakfast was mediocre at best. Everything looked like it had been on the table for a bit too long. Regardless of paying for a breakfast during booking, an omelette from the kitchen cost 8€ extra. This seems weird considering the price range.The hotel had a spa, which as I understand consisted of a sauna and lounge chairs. The price was not included in the hotel stay, and was around 16 €. Seems like a total ripoff.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was in a great location, very easy walk to train station and close to restaurant and shops. Was not up to the standard of other Sofitel properties we have stayed at in other countries. Bed not very comfortable and pillows were terrible. Service was nice though.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm frequent traveller and Accor addicted since years, so I always choose Accor hotels around the world. Normally I rate 5 stars for every Sofitel and/or McGallery structure, but for LaGare in Milan was not the case. When I made the reservation I asked for an early check-in and I didn't get; I also asked for a Nespresso machine in the room and I didn't get. I would have expected to know that upfront (maybe by email or call) instead of realizing when I arrived. Last, should be great if breakfast started at least at 6.30 am instead of 7am or - at least - having a bar available for espresso 24hrs.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is close to Central Station, and you can get there from Malpensa airport by the train service (which is often unreliable, sadly). It is also close to subway station.When you arrive, a huge stair is waiting for you in front of the hotel. They have someone to help you with bags, but if there are a lot of people upstairs and down, you would have to wait for a while for your turn.The biggest problem here are the elevators, as they have huge number of rooms and only two elevators. You would wait for ages on the morning before elevator will arrive, a huge planning oversights.Breakfast is nice, but selection stays the same, and it is rather modest. I stayed for 5 nights and I could not see those same dishes anymore. They also reuse yesterday's pastry, which is an embarrassment for a 4-star hotel. Breakfast room is very small and it is packed with tables, very hard to walk around without a risk of bumping into somebody. And it is unpleasant to eat here with people constantly hovering over you.Also, they do not provide irons to the rooms, you have to use their service, and I did not see anything like this in my entire travel experience.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a Superior King Room, we were staying at the hotel in November. Really nice welcome, the hotel speaks perfectly (!) English -- it was also nice as a fellow colleague that the FO had a small team who recognizes you immediately. The room was pretty, the view not so pretty. Breakfast was nice, loved the service, but it was not very spacious. However, very very big range of choice. Spa was AMAZING! Especially the pool and the turkish bath was absolutely magnificent. Bed was extremely good as well and the room was cozy warm. Only thing that was missing was water, but that got solved immediately -- my compliments!Grazie per tutto e ci vediamo un' altra volta!
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located, less than five minutes walk from Milano Centrale railway station and close to several metro lines, allowing you to access the hotel and the city with ease. From the outside the hotel is very striking at night. Inside it is very comfortable and well designed. Rooms are large and very pleasant. The spa is well worth a visit and very relaxing. We were a bit surprised at the bar prices, €26 for two spirits and two mixers, however, the measures for spirits were very generous. We spent five nights at the hotel and would definitely return.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at LaGare for two nights and it was as great of an experience as it had been in 2017. The rooms are very stylish and comfortable, as well as providing an ideal location with a 10-minute walk to Centrale. I have already made my reservations for 2019.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, clean, renovated and modern hotel. We visited this hotel already not the first time and for the time being never disapointed. Friendly staff. Walk to Doumo takes about 20-25 minutes depending on the route chosen.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights at La Gare and we loved every minute of it. It’s a modern hotel with beautiful décor (from the reception area to the hallways to the stairwell to the rooms themselves), friendly and helpful front desk, spacious quiet comfortable well-equipped rooms, excellent breakfast buffet, great in-house restaurant La Gare Bistrot, and easy access to the Milan’s main train station and metro lines. At night, the facades of the hotel are brilliantly illuminated with ever-changing colored lights. The effect this had upon entering the hotel and from inside our room was mesmerizing. We highly recommend the hotel and we would gladly stay here again. 5 stars across the board. Helpful hint: the nearby restaurant Osteria Italiana Milano on Via Napo Torriani was fantastic. It was so good we ate there twice.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can only be positive about this hotel as a bed and breakfast establishment - -see below - it will be scored as such.The room was spacious, with a large bathroom and comfortable bed - room 704 was nice and quiet.Breakfast was good, although the coffee was not great and the chef needs to learn how to make scrambled eggs! Waiting staff were impeccable.I was on a business group booking so the menu for the evening meal was limited - should not have been a problem. First evening. Ravioli pretty al dente but filling was nice. Turbot was overcooked to jelly - what a crime!Second evening. Pasta so al dente it was barely cooked - inedible. Pork fillet served with a bloody, raw centre - a risk to health and not touched. No offer of any alternatives. Went to bed hungry.Reception staff excellent. It transpired that the kitchen was a different company. The manager did not take up an offer to meet with me. Not good enough and damaging to an otherwise good operation.
hotelName:
1    Hyatt Centric Milan Centrale
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quaint hotel that appears to be family owned. Staff were very helpful. It was clean and comfortable. We had a lovely room with a big window.Can walk to MIlan Central and other train stops, good restaurants close by. Our breakfast was included - really good coffee and lots of delicious pastries. I would have also like some healthy breakfast options (other than yogurt). I would stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -Taking 1 nights payment after booking when it was clearly stated that it was a pay at the hotel booking.-Breakfast was not included at the price (I thought it was,.. OK, I might have been inattentive while booking.. They told that is why it's so low price). But in the end, I got the receipt where the pay for the breakfast was not included either!-The neighbourhood does not seem very secure, I would not walk around alone there in the late evening. -Very steep and narrow staircase, difficult to carry heavy luggage. You have to leave the key all the times at the reception, whenever you leave the hotel. Orherwise, the hotel was cosy and clean, close to the train station, etc.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a small and friendly hotel. A few minutes walk from the central train station, very convenient. Our room was very clean and well equipped with everything we need. Nice small garden, homey and comfortable service.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very welcoming and charming people. Place was well presented. Lovely quite garden to unwind.The room had windows onto street. Very good breakfast. Welcoming dog keeping an eye on every thing. Great stay
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose Hotel Charly because it looked good on the internet site. The reception was clean and bright and the staff were attentive and helpful. Our room was across the entrance courtyard in the second building, and was perfectly clean and up to the same standard as the main building.The room was large with a superb en suite bathroom. We also had a balcony overlooking the garden, which was a bonus. Breakfast was the usual continental, but with better quality than I have had at more expensive hotels, Hams, cheeses, yogurts, pastries, tea, coffee, cappucino cereals and orange juice, but what made it all special was the staff and their helpful attentive manner. Absolutely no problems during my week stay, and would stay there again.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan seems quite expensive for hotels and we thought this one looked good value and in a convenient location, so we chose to spend our 3 nights in Milan there - and it lived up to expectations. It's about 10 minutes walk from the main station, close to the Lima metro stop (for direct metro line to Duomo etc) and about 40 minutes walk to the Duomo. It looks like you need to book directly with the hotel through their website.There are quite a few restaurant and snack options within 10 minutes walk and the busy shopping street - Corso Buenos Aires - is close by.Our bedroom and ensuite bathroom with shower (in an adjoining building next to the main building) were comfortable and well serviced. Reasonable sound insulation. Kept warm (by radiator) in cold weather during our stay.Pleasant staff. Fair breakfast. Would certainly stay there again on another visit to Milan.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We staid for 1 night in Milan at this hotel. It is very clean, close to the metro station(Lima) and very cozy. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms have a nice vintage look. Will stay here again for sure. A little minus is the breakfast.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For this hotel I can say a lot but we need to be focus of what it is! First of all the people that work there is very polite and always with a smile in the face! The hotel room was in another building they the reception was with balcony(after my request) and garden view! Very peaceful and quite neighborhood and 3 minutes walk from “Buenos Aires” street( full of shop)! The room was a little disappointed for me! It was small very nice bed but without fridge and slippers( you have to take your own)! The breakfast was full and very fresh things!
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very satisfied with our couple of nights at this hotel. The accommodation was very clean, good and a short walk from the Central Station giving easy access to transport to get around town.The room had a large double bed, a desk a couple of chairs, coat stand and wardrobe with plenty of hangers and a safe. The bathroom was quite small, but had an easy to operate shower with plenty of hot water and a well lit mirror.Buffet breakfast had a cooked ham, cheese, sweet and savoury pastries, corn flakes, fruit juice, yogurts, bread rolls, jams etc. Hot drinks of various types were available, the cappuccino was particularly good.We would definitely recommend Hotel Charly for a short stay.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice property with garden, but in a very busy, noisy area. 3-4 blocks to Centrale Train Station, easily walkable. We had a room in front, right on the sidewalk, literally couples arguing 2 feet from our window. Also the owner informed us it is a "musician's district." Someone practicing piano upstairs until 01:00 am every night! Told there was nothing we could do about it & music supposed to stop by 11:00pm. Staff was unhelpful. We had a problem with passport stolen & they refused to allow us to use their computer simply to print 2 forms we were told we had to have by US Consulate. Room was clean, comfortable, en suite bathroom, safe in room, very basic breakfast, no elevator, all stairs. No computer for printing boarding passes, etc. Long walk to any restaurants, nothing close. Would NOT stay here again. If you do, request a room upstairs (but that may be closer to the piano) & in the back overlooking the garden. That might be more quiet.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in walking distance from Milan Central Station. Friendly staff, nice room. Simple but adequate breakfast. Rather expensive for a two star hotel. Main asset is location in a quiet street not far from the underground.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is on a quiet street, 10 min from the Central Train station. We stayed there twice and the first room was on the 1st floor and overlooking the street, so the window shutters were locked. Our second room as on the 2nd floor overlooking the beautiful garden. The breakfast is very good - apart from the sweet pastries they offer ham, cheese and different coffee drinks.The staff was very nice and helpful too.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked it here. We booked because we were travelling by train and it's an easy walk from the main station (worth a visit in its own right). It's in a quiet street but close to the metro station. Everything here seemed peaceful. Check-in was low key and straightforward and we stayed in the adjacent building a simple hop through the gate. Our room was on the ground floor but was very quiet and perfectly well equipped. Everything was clean and just as we needed. A real plus to this place is the lovely garden. Breakfast on the edge of the garden was simple and very pleasant and a perfect way to start the day. This was a short visit but very enjoyable. This felt more like a B&B than a hotel in that it's cosy, friendly and comfortable. You felt like you were guests in someone's home, which I think is a great quality to have.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was out exploring Milan most of my trip but it was the perfect little hotel to retreat to at night. Nice and clean, with friendly staff. The breakfast included was very simple but that's expected with the low prices.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the central station. The neighbourhood looks rough but it's quiet and safe. The hotel is a well restored old building with a beautiful garden. The staff is very friendly and helpfull.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow this was a very good hotel in a good location. Metro and buses are a short distance away and. If you are keen on walking the city centre is about 30-40 minutes walk. I love walking so this was great for me. Also plenty of good restaurants nearby. The room is not the best - but it is enough for what one needs - a bed and ensuite bathroom. Also, the staff were very friendly which was also good. What surprised me was that breakfast had gluten free options which was great for me. Overall a pleasant experience.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, close to Milan Central railway station and close to metro lines 1 (Lima stop) and 3 (Centrale stop), both of which lead to Piazza Duomo (Duomo stop). Clean room. Safe building. The room has no fridge. Breakfast is good but with no many options.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm welcome ... easy to find from train station. Nice large bed, clean and enjoyable breakfast with made to order good coffee. No frills yet comfortable with all what one needs including excellent wifi.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This charming little hotel is about a seven minute walk to the train station. There's a very nice man at the front desk who speaks English. He let us keep our luggage at the hotel even after we'd checked out, while we saw more of Milan, as our train didn't leave until much later in the day. The hotel has no elevator, and our room was on the second floor, but no problem. The clean, modestly-sized room with a high, pretty, molded ceiling had a nice big bathroom and adequate water pressure in the shower. The bed was pretty comfortable. The breakfast room off of the lobby has a large view of the pleasant garden at the back of the hotel. It was like sitting in somebody's house. Breakfast included rolls, pastry, yogurt, cereals, meat and cheese, coffee or tea.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to stay! Got off my train after a long trip and found the hotel easily. They had great wifi, it was very clean and there was breakfast in the morning. It was also 2 blocks from the shopping street which was convenient. They even were nice enough to let me leave my bags in the lobby after I checked out so I could walk around and not feel unencumbered.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for a second time based on an excellent value stay one year ago. The room we were given - no 7 - was even better value than the one we had previously. It's large balcony was suffused with the exquisite perfume of honeysuckle and wisteria from the garden below ...
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean comfortable hotel worth the money, comfy beds, polite staff and very helpful, well furnished with good sized room, good breakfast and top back garden with a lot of sunlight..good location just 3 minutes walk from the central train station..would stay again definitely!
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Charly is a perfect one night stop in Milan. Services are simple, hotel is incredibly clean (it seems that someone is always cleaning up) and rooms are quiet and nice. Nothing over the top - a simple, very good place to stay. Good breakfast and excellent staff.Warmly recommended.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simple hotel close to train station and a short walk from Duomo. Neighborhood does look very nice but seemed to be safe when we were returning in the dark. Room is simply furnished but requires some critical repair. Price is high now probably due to Expo. Simple breakfast included.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small 2 star hotel. Walking distance from Milano Centrale railway station. Arrived off the street with heavy suitcase, without a booking. Friendly staff found me a ground floor room. Breakfast next morning in a beautiful garden; one staff member solely devoted to making whatever coffee you can think of. Tea served instead with grace and kindness - nothing too much trouble.Probably a good idea to book ahead.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was OK - nothing special, handy for Centrale and the metro but not a short walk into the centre. We had a one night stopover en route to Verona, and it was fine, for that, not sure I would have wanted to stay longer.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful staff, clean with nice breakfast room that opens onto rear lawned area. Automatic entrance doors are useful when laiden with luggage or shopping bags. 10 minutes walk from Milan shops, and 2 minutes from nearest tube station.Receptionist gave lots of advice whilst we were there and as we left for Garibaldi station(30 minutes walk).
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here during our Italy trip. Hotel was only a 10-15 minutes' walk to Milano Centrale which suited us perfectly. Don't be put off by the general "old" (and maybe slightly rundown) look of the buildings and shops as you walk down the main road, Via Vitruvio, to the hotel. Entrance to the hotel was not grand but you get that "good feel" about it when you enter the place. Breakfast was included but don't expect a spread - think minimal. Rooms and bathrooms were clean and nice. Friendly staff - they even understood our need for more internet access (my son was watching something or other on youtube during our stay there). Easy walk to Lima metro station (on Line 1) which took us to the Duomo area and Conciliazone (the latter for The Last Supper viewing). The hotel owner recommended an Italian restaurant, Sabatino, which was within easy walking distance, for dinner on our first night in Milano. Wonderful food and wine!! By that time on our trip, my husband was already getting tired of pasta and pizzas ... we stumbled across this Chinese restaurant which served yummy yummy food at relatively cheap prices. Surprise - the restaurant was just a stone's throw from the hotel!!
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, clean rooms, nice bathroom, and a quiet street. It's also very close to Milano Centrale which was perfect for our needs, since we had an early train to catch. Unfortunately, that train was so early that we missed breakfast here, but we'd stay again!
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the rate (289 euros for 4 nights) we regarded it as really good value.The room was very good. Basic but clean and comfortable. The building itself was old and, in its own way, quite grand. We had a room on the ground floor of a second adjoining building so it was probably more convenient than rooms on the 2 or 3 higher floors.Breakfast was cold and continental but, again, more than adequate.WiFi was always available although user name and password changed each day.The staff were all helpful and pleasant, although we did not have too much need to talk to them.The location is very convenient to the main railway station, although the street on which it is located is nothing special. However, the Google Maps instructions for walking the 7 minutes from the station to the hotel were not clear, mainly because you are never sure of your drop off point/starting point (it is a big station) and which initial direction to walk in.Make sure you walk down the major road (Via Vitruvio) in front of the main station entrance (Piazza Duca d' Aosta) not the side of the station where the buses arrive (Piazza Savoia) - off of which you will find a parallel road (Scarlatti), which can be a bit dark and intimidating at night.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My room was on the first floor facing the garden. Thus can smell cigarette smoke when I left my window slightly opened occasionally. The staff was okay except the elderly gentleman who was not friendly. Maybe because he spoke little English. Breakfast was decent but not great. Walking back to the hotel at night was uncomfortable as the security in the area didn't feel safe. Okay hotel but I don't understand why is it 2-star. It felt more like a 1-star. I will not stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apart from the good location and a semi decent breakfast there's nothing to be recommended about this hotel..the staff seemed aloof and oblivious to the guests needs and comfort...plus it has a very steep stairway which ain't ideal to carry heavy luggage's
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the hotel in September 2014 (Second Week) with my wife. The hotel is walk able distance from the Milano Central station.The stay was very comfortable and convenient.Pros:- Room and hotel clean- Bathing very comfortable- The room was very comfortable- good wifi (you get free wifi codes from reception)- 24 hour reception (so we kept our luggage at the reception and went out sight seeing)- We got the map and directions to the popular sight seeing areas from the receptionCons:- No liftRecommended.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in to Hotel Charly late last night, and had emailed ahead. The response and confirmation of my room relieved my worry, and my request for a room over looking the garden exceeded expectations. It is a quiet oasis in the middle of a bustling city. The staff is friendly and helpful, and immediately attend to little difficulties (the safe in the room was not working right and it was fixed in no time). Now I can do a couple hours work on the balcony listening to the birds, and then spend the afternoon taking in the sites.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a relief....Hotel Charly was everything it promised it would be; very handy for the train station and the Metro, not too noisy, very clean and very friendly. The staff spoke good english (phew!) and couldn't have been more accomodating and helpful. Breakfast was good, with lots of coffee, and the option of taking it in the quiet little garden at the back.I plan to revisit Milan for next years Expo...I hope this hotel has a room for me.P.S. Forgot to mention fab shower.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice budget option offering good value just several blocks from Milan Centrale train station in section of town with a good number of ethnic restaurants (if you're a bit weary of pizza and pasta). Room was relatively small, but clean and quiet (Charly sits on a side street with not much vehicle traffic). No lift/elevator in the annex I stayed in, but not a problem if you pack light. Breakfast was standard fare small buffet served in a (too) small sun room. Staff were efficient and helpful with such matters as arranging taxi to airport.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is great value! Wifi and breakfast are included in he room rate. The rooms are clean, comfortable and quiet. Lots of shopping nearby and close to transport (Central station and Lima metro station). I'd definitely recommend it, and would come back.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was incredible! It is walking distance from Central Station and looks immaculate! The owners were helpful and breakfast was great. It is close to public transportation and technically walking distance from the city center if you don't mind walking. If we ever go back to Milan, we wouldn't even think of staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I (29 years old) were looking for an affordable, clean, comfortable and quiet place to stay when arriving in Milan for the night. We found it! Easy walking distance from Central Station and easy access to the rest of the city. Very friendly front desk and good breakfast. After staying for the night, we also made a reservation for our return trip to Milan for later that week. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
2    Charly
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
