review_body: A nice, modern and large bedroom, very well decorated, a bathroom very clean.A good location, only 15 min to the city by train.Tha parking is very usefull!Spa area is very smallThe bar has a good atmosphere
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located close to Villapizzone urban train station and no12 tram (30 mins) to city centre. Very good facilities including pool, spa and steam room. Efficient and very helpful Reception staff. Well appointed rooms. Difficult to sort out room temperature without hotel staff (very helpful). Full breakfast and decent range.Location good for Politechnico di Milano. Limited restaurants / night life close by but trams and trains are very regular.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time I stayed in this hotel. Room 924 for two nights.Nice large clean roomGood kingsize bedMini barLarge shower in a clean bathroomSilent non- smoking roomBar, restaurant and breakfast are okParking available
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a night at the Radisson Blu Hotel and hope we could stay longer. I booked a standard room the day before our stay and I was surprised for the low price. As soon as we got to the hotel, we had a free room upgrade, so we had the chance to stay in their great suite, with one huge bathrooms (bathtub and shower) and an amazing view of the city! We had also the time to enjoy the spa and interior pool (free and open until 11pm)If you use public transports the location is convenient, just 3 minutes walk from a train station, in 20 minutes you can be in the Brera area.After staying in different hotels in Milan, I can say this was the best experience I've ever had and I'll come back for sure.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As al radisson blue hotel, services and rooms are great , but the problem is with it’s location. It is about 5 km away from the active part of the city which made things a little bit difficult, knowing that Milan has a lot of traffic and a bad Uber and taxi service.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here and loved this hotel. The staff were fabulous and room suite was we stayed in was ideal with large luxurious bathroom. The location initially we wondered if would be a little too far from centre but we enjoyed the relaxing location within easy tram ride from centre. Restaurant and facilities were very good too. Great spa and pool along with outdoor drinking area. We went on a leisure break but Highly recommend this hotel and we would return again . Business or pleasure this hotel in Milan should be top of list.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb staff and very good room. overall i had a very good experience staying at this property. the staff was friendly and helpful. They were eager to serve and happy to give me information on how to go about the city.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast is not of 5 stars hotel, it is 3 stars hotel. small place for having the breakfast, coming after 08:30 , you have to wait outside the restaurant to find empty table, also some items of the breakfast finish without replacement. Restaurant staff is very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely, modern hotel. Nice swimming pool. The room we had was spacious with a large, clean, and modern bathroom. The only problem was that the room was heavily perfumed. We opened the window (which was necessary to cool the room off too since we could not reduce the temperature below 21 degrees). Unfortunately then our 5th floor room filled with mosquitoes.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After many years of travelling I think we have found one of the best hotels ever. We could not fault this hotel. From the first step inside we got excellent service. The check in staff extremely helpful and professional. As we had a very late flight we asked for a late check out but unfortunately they couldn't help but kept our suitcase for the day and offered us facilities to take a shower later on. We could not speak highly enough of all the staff here. A good breakfast with plenty of choices. This hotel is out of town so no problem with noise but the local tram into the city is 2mins away. Thank you Radisson Blu Milan for a most enjoyable stay
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited the hotel years ago when it was called Chendi and because we had been impressed. It still is a nice hotel, proper facilities, great breakfast, clean and with very helpful staff. It is just that the passage of time and people has left its mark and a renovation should come in the immediate future. Till then, the hotel is perfectly adequate and the service is just fine.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights , not in a tourist area of the city. It is a 25 minute tram ride from outside of the hotel into the Duomo area and tourist Centre. They let us check in early at arrival. The rooms are modern with nice beds , excellent buffet breakfast and professional staff. Gym and sauna on site. You can get a good nights sleep here and are still close enough to take in the sights. Nice toiletries with bathrobes and slippers etc.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was booked in for the weekend of the Italian GP,due to convenience of trains to the track,as well the reputation of value for money the Radison group has build up.I was booked into room number 444,only to find that the basin plug was unable to be opened,and the bath plug did not seal,this room did not have a shower,so bathing was the only option.The inter-leading door had water stains running down,the ceiling had hand marks around the smoke detector,the carpets were filthy,the coffee tray was swollen and chipped,the curtains were ill fitting and appeared to have been for different sized windows, the final nail was when the TV switched on,but could not switch off,due to the poor state of the remote.I complained,and the reception Lady was very accommodating,and moved me to room number 731,the overall appearance of this room was much improved,however,the basin in the bathroom did not drain,the shower door leaked when showering,and the bathroom door was water damaged and swollen.The positive was all the staff were very pleasant,but the facilities including the sauna wet area are in need of some serious management attention.I do have photos should management show interest.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly be aware that the hotel is quite some distance from the centre, however this is made easy as there is a tram stop just a few steps from the hotel, and tickets available from reception. Aside from this, a very clean hotel with added bonuses : sweets and water in reception, free water in room, nespresso machine, best hotel hairdryer I’ve found, very large room (117), good breakfast, restaurant on the premises for dinner (important as it’s far out of the centre), good internet connection, indoor pool, very reasonable gym. No complaints and especially convenient for attending Monza as the train station was very nearby. Perhaps being out of the hectic bustle of Milan centre isn’t a bad thing either, although it’s about 25 Minutes on the tram.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Actually came back from here today, I was looking forward to writing the review.Before arriving I informed the hotel I was coming to celebrate my second year anniversary (14/08) and they did not disappoint. Arrived on the Monday to such professional and welcoming staff. We were told we had been upgraded to a king suite and someone would be up to see us soon.Walking in we were greeted by strawberries with chocolate and a lovely note. Five minutes later a bottle of champagne and glasses were brought up to our room, this was a lovely surprise.The room itself was clean and had all the things you would need. The king size bed was comfortable and gave us a great nights sleep- no noise outside. Bathroom had a best feature (husband said it is a must add to review) when refreshing etc you are able to listen to the tv (English channels only news) through a speaker - can be turned down if you want quiet time.Called down for extra milk and tea, these arrived in good time considering we were on the 9th floor again by professional staff.There is a spa and gym available for your leisure. If we needed a taxi we could press M2 and ask them to call before we got down. Be aware the taxi begins charging from the time of the call so make sure you are ready to hop in as soon as they arrive- usually takes them 3-6 minutes to get there.Location is out of the way and local shops bar two or three food and market shops were open during the night and day so did need to taxi out to other areas. Travel from airport- cheaper to hop onto a coach/bus €8 get into the central train station and get a taxi around €20 from there. Taxi from the airport costs roughly €100.Definitely worth the stay and would love to come back in the future.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overalll is an excellent value in Milano. They take care of you very easily. We were here for a quick visit to boutiques in Milano. Price is very at this period and we enjoy all the ammenities free from hotel. Super service for an apero time in bar, great barman and coktailsFood is very good also and service is amazing and very quick if you need to leave in the early morning Great place we will return with pleasure
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super service from incheck - during stay - good and safe garage - nice pool etc - taxi service - smiling and nice breakfast / dinner staaf - correct and nice at check out .................................total Very Good !We will be Back !
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let's just get it out there: the location is awful. It is in a run down area of Milan, well away from the sights. I was there because I was doing something with the Politechnico, and frankly I imagine that's the only reason anyoneo would be there. But that said...The hotel was really nice. Our room was large, with a cool multi-room suite layout. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom large and modern. They had a very nice range of branded amenities in the bathroom (I'm an amenity snob; I cannot help it, I used to sell little shampoos and conditioners to hotels when I worked for P&G and you can tell a lot about a hotel by the amenities it chooses). It wasn't a brand I was familiar with but my daughter recognized it, and they included the extra things like a toothbrush, shaving kit, etc. See how easy it is to win me over? But I haven't even gotten to the really good stuff. There was a lovely indoor pool that really made the hotel fun for my kids. The water was a little cold for my tastes, but they had a blast, and the benefit of them playing in cooler water is they crash out for hours afterward, so we're all winners. But the BEST part of the hotel is probably the breakfast buffet! First, it's a stylish area with an ample spread. It was definitely higher end than the other breakfast buffets we had while in Italy. But the highlight was definitely the fresh, full-sized vegan croissants!! Score!! We went vegan about six months ago and it's usually hard to find vegan food when we travel. I had pretty much written off things like croissants. But these weren't just vegan croissants, they were EXCEPTIONAL vegan croissants! My kids talked about them for the rest of the trip (and we stayed at four hotels after this one!) They were so good that I'm including a picture. So, Radisson Blu, you had disappointed me in Leeds, but you won me back in Milan. I'm happy we're on good terms again.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here since I was at a conference in Polytecnico de Milan. Hotel was good, staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is a bit worn. Negatives are: Shower in my room was inside bath tub with no glass cover or shower curtain to keep the water from making the whole bathroom wet; TV picture HORRIBLE, this was during the World Cup....Internet very slow. Gym really good, breakfast ok, bit pricey, location a bit off the beaten path, but TRAM right near hotel.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late at night and perfectly handled by the hotel team. The room was perfect. The breakfast is very good and the coffee is very tasty. The equipment of the hotel: the fitness room is very well equiped, the sauna and steamroom are small but nice and the swimming pool is large enough but quite cold. The parking is very useful since parking in the street is not easy. Less good point: the airco is not very well positioned in the room, too close from the bed.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The team is very helpful! Rooms are good, breakfast was ok, not very impressive. The location is good if need quick access to the highway. You can buy a ticket to the trum in the reception. About 30 min to Duamo. In the area there is nothing to do. Hotel restaurant and Bar are good. Il Centro shopping center is 10 minutes driving.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Radisson Blu in November with my friend, having a great spacious room on the 2nd floor. We were very nicely welcomed and greeted by the reception staff and their service was outstanding the whole time of our stay. The staff at the bar and at the restaurant were great too - there's really nothing we could complain about. We went to the bar and to the restaurant both evenings we've been there and had a nice chat with the staff - it felt really amazing.Now the location - the hotel is not exactly in the city centre but it's soo easy to get there. Just a tram ride where you can rest before and after the day spent in the city. They have the tram tickets at the reception. Also the whole staff speaks great English.And last - the pool and the gym were amazing as well! :) If I'll go to Milan ever again I will choose Radisson Blu again for sure! Thank you! :)
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: super clean hotel, very modern , lots of parking space, nice lobby area and bar. rooms are comfortable and VERY nice. they upgraded me to a suite that had a WALK IN bathroom that was great.Small gym area, would have been awesome if they had a nice gym...but it was still ok for a quick run and workout. they have a nice indoor pool too.I love this hotel I had my car so i am not sure if there was a Metro station around me.The hotel location is not in the main attraction area for Milan. lovely place and well managed
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What more can you ask?This is one of our favourite hotels now.We got there a bit frazzeld by a flight from Edinburgh/45min taxi drive, and slightly early to check in. The 'bellhop' came to take our bags from the taxi, took us inside. The receptionist checked us in straightaway while the bellhop plied us with lemon water. I mentioned to receptionist about our trip to St Moritz on Tues, when a bus (I thought) would be picking us up. Buses dont normally call here, she said, and copied our trip details, phoning us later to say that a SUV would pick us up and driver would wait in reception. In the meantime, the bellhop (I do wish Id taken their names) took us and bags to our room, made sure the air con worked, and arranged for a porter to bring us milk for our tea.The room was on floor 2, near the lift, over looking the courtyard next to the restaurant, protected from the traffic noise by a row of tall trees. There was minimal noise from inside or outside the hotel. The bathroom was great, including a multihead shower room, plenty of storage. The room had loads of wardrobe and drawer space and space for cases, minibar (reasonably priced), safe, TV with English news channels, bedside tables, a comfy club chair and footstool and comfy chair to sit at desk console. Nicely decorated.We couldnt face going out for dinner so went to hotel bar. All items on the main course food menu were between euro 10 and 18. I chose lasagna, he chose macaroni. Both were in an absolutely gorgeous meaty tomatoey sauce. There is only one draft lager in the bar, but it was very good, on a par with Stella. The drinks menu included long cocktails, all for about e12, so we had one each night. We availed ourselves of the bar meals each night after treks round Milan/S Moritz, and found the food great, bar ambience good and friendly.Our booking included breakfast, which although buffet style, was equally good. The hot selection was crispy, very tasty bacon, Italian sausage not to our taste, scrambled eggs, and 'coddled' eggs ie eggs cooked in an egg cup, but just right with runny yolk. Him indoors reckoned really good. There was the usual fruit juice and yoghurt, fresh fruit and cereal selection, loaf bread, croissants and bread buns in all shapes and sizes, and the cold selection defied belief: vast array of cheeses, cold meats, smoked salmon etc etc Lovely atmosphere in the restaurant as in the bar.The hotel is near a small train station, bus route and tram route. We twice used the tram (you can get a ticket from reception), other times we used taxis which reception booked for us.All the staff were really helpful, friendly and professional. I hadnt been expecting it in Italy, and was worried about the language barrier. However, they all spoke very good English.The only negative is that its a little way out of central Milan, so because of the never ending graffiti in Italy the area can look a bit run down (but then so does central Milan with gorgeous buildings covered in stuff Banksy would be ashamed to be associated with).The tram fare each way is e1.50, and taxi about e12.If Im being supremely picky, some of the paintwork in our room was showing signs that its time for a lick of paint, but nothing significantWhats not to like?
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I must admit we choose this hotel initially as we could use our QANTAS points. Having said that it was a great stay. The hotel is large and modern with all the things you would expect. The staff were fantastic. Helped us in every way. Directions, maps, local information. Can’t speak more highly of them. The rooms were spacious and spotless. Tea and coffee making facilities and a mini fridge. Local supermarket a short walk away. The hotel is very close to the #22 tram and metro so no problem getting back to the centre in about 25-30 minutes. However if you want to be right in the centre with all the city attractions and restaurants at your finger tip then this may not be the hotel for you. There is a great pool which was sadly closed for annual works while we were there. I think the biggest downfall of this hotel is the very high price for breakfast. No doubt perfect for business people putting the cost on an account but absolutely out of the reach of a family of mum dad and a couple of kids staying for a week for example. €25 per person per day. No doubt the food was extensive and lovely but it is absolutely price inhibitive for most, except for a treat.
hotelName:
6    Radisson Blu Hotel, Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with our recent stay at the Lancaster. The staff are very well trained and really helpful with good advice. We took their recommendation for a local restaurant with homemade pasta and were so pleased we visited it twice.Advice on the finer points of Italian coffee was explained to my daughter at breakfast, and there was always a friendly smile at the reception desk. The Lancaster is a historic building and this results in a slightly small room, not really a problem unless you plan to bring lots of suitcases. Our room had effective double glazing and shutters which kept out any noise that was outside. The bed was comfortable and the shower powerful.A substantial breakfast was included in our room price. We liked the location which is slightly out of the main tourist area, however this is no disadvantage as the frequent trams whisk you to your next sight.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are so polite and helpful room is small but very clean breakfast was so good Italian and American breakfast many varieties and delicious hotel is a little far from Duomo but with tram you can go there and by 30 minutes walking you reach new and beautiful mall we had good time I recommend this hotel
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Milan and I chose this hotel based on its location (within easy walking distance of Parco Sempione and multiple choices of public transportation for which you can buy tickets at the hotel desk) and other reviews here. I was not disappointed; the room was spotless and quiet (it was not on the side facing the street), had a comfortable bed, there was AC if needed and a big shower. I appreciated that breakfast was available from 7-10 am and it was quite good. But I was most impressed with the staff - everyone was cordial, readily available and knowledgeable. As a solo traveler that was important to me. I’d happily stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel just outside the centre of Milan, easy access to centre via tram. Located close to the arch of peace, a carbon copy of the Arc de Triomph. Quaint, characterful rooms. Excellent coffee, some of the best scrambled eggs I’ve eaten anywhere at breakfast time. No evening restaurant, but no problem as many excellent restaurant options within a short walk. Really helpful staff, full of good ideas on places to see and things to do. Recommended.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights in this boutique hotel and all was perfect. Good Service with top kindness, clean rooms, good breakfast included in an affordable price range. Situated behind the castello sforzesco we had no problems to move back and forward to the center walking (20 mins) or with Public transportation ( team are every 10-15 Minutes).Some parts of the hotel have been just renewed.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s in a great area, all major attractions are walkable. So cute, rooms are very clean. The staff here is SO nice. Wish I could stay in hotels like this one all the time! Great place in Milan! Won’t be disappointed
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel, exceptional staff and good facilities. Quiet and comfortable room in a nice older building. Excellent breakfast, brilliant coffee. Close enough to walk to all the interesting places in Milano, on a quiet street.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were looking for a hotel to stay at for two nights after attending a wedding on Lake Como. I came across a review of this hotel and am really pleased we did. We had two interconnecting rooms, one standard and one superior, and both were very clean, well equipped and a good size. The location was fantastic as we were able to walk everywhere easily from the hotel- central Milan and Duomo in about 20 mins with two teenagers in tow. There were plenty of nice bars and restaurants around yet you were in a nice quiet residential street. The breakfast was great, a nice selection of food and the coffee was amazing - try the latte macchiato. This is a small hotel with great old school hospitality and fantastic location. We’d definitely recommend and would return.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a few nights and enjoyed our stay. While a wee bit old fashioned, as are a lot of hotels in Italy, our room was clean and comfortable with effective air conditioning. There was a bit of peeling wallpaper in our room, but nothing that spoiled our stay. The staff were helpful and friendly and the breakfast was nice, although the coffee served wasn't hot enough. There is a small lounge/bar area adjacent to reception which was handy for a nightcap after a night out. The hotel is close to the Peace Arch at Sempione park and there are restaurants close by. The tram stop is close by too. A good value hotel worth considering. I would use it again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want boutique style hotel with personalized service this is great choice. Our room had a balcony with nice view onto courtyard. Breakfast buffet has many options and the friendly owner (or his father?) greeted us each morning and ensured we had what we needed. Only reason not giving 5 stars is the room accommodations themselves were perhaps a bit dated and the location does require a long walk to major sites. But it was perfectly clean and pleasant so if you want taste of residential neighborhood, boutique experience, and don’t mind a walk, check this place out.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice location to the MiCo convention Center and the old city sights. Clean, competent, and very reasonable for Europe. It has a traditional three star rating but deserves more than that. Reminds me of B & B or Guest Houses as it it smaller, and you get to know the staff.Stay here!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for my wife and daughter. The staff was friendly, rooms clean and quiet, breakfast excellent. Location in walking distance from Stazione Cadorna, so transport from airport is smooth. Will definitely return!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week in April 2019 on a business trip. Thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Very relaxing environment, clean comfortable rooms and proximity to Cadorna train station as well as restaurants makes it a great option. The staff is super nice. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good choice of hotel in regards to being central and near to all the sights. From the attitude of the staff to the included breakfast it was top notch.Rooms were of a good standard and included most of the mod cons (hairdryer/toiletries/fridge but no kettle) Double windows with a black out blind was a bonus. Rooms are advertised as soundproofed but some noise can be heard from outside rooms I. E. Pipes/other guestsThe staff are the main bonus to this hotel. Friendly, helpful and willing to go the extra mile.Hotel is easy to locate from the main train station, getting the connecting tram 10 and then just down the road.Good choice to stay in main Milan
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place easy to get to all the things you want to see. Staff really helpful saved us cash with excellent advice. Standard breakfast just what you expect. Good rooms with everything you need. And a nice big bowl of sweets on the reception desk. Can't fault the place.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nicely located close to the centre and the park. The service in really professionals. In the morning you get a good buffe and a waiter asks you what kind of coffee you want and they make it for you. The rooms are clean and good sized. Would definitely come back
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little hotel, clean rooms. Great friendly staff. Spotlessly clean. Great location, just a five minute walk from the Central Park and tram lines. Room 322 is the room with the lovely balcony at the front which our friends had. Breakfast is great too. Thank you for a lovely stay
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 4 nights here on a triple room with our 10 year old son. The room was big enough for all of us with a huge bathroom and a small terrace at the front of the Hotel. It's a 3*, but I think it should be a higher grade. The staff are all lovely and helpful. The little touches make it special such as slippers (appreciated on the cold wooden floors). The mini bar is reasonably priced too at €2 for water, it's not much more expensive than the shops. Breakfast is included from 7-10 am. There is enough choice of pastries, cereals, fruit and bacon, sausage and egg. The staff make you feel like you are staying with friends rather than a hotel. It's 5 minute walk from Sempione Park and the Arch. There are also lots of restaurants and bars around if you don't want to venture far. The Tram stop is also close by to catch the Tram to the Duomo Area or La Scala. We walked through the park regularly as it's beautiful. I highly recommend it here. It's definitely home from home. A lovely Hotel without paying crazy city prices.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I have just returned from another wonderful weekend at the Lancaster Hotel. The hotel has really become like a 'home from home' for us. The owner and his staff are so kind and nothing is too much for them when it comes to customer service. The rooms are furnished to a high standard and are always immaculately clean. Breakfast is plentiful and offers a good selection of cereals, fruit, pastries, meats and cheeses. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within a 5 minute walk and the centre of Milan is only a 20 minute tram ride away. For high quality, great value and wonderful customer service, the Lancaster Hotel is highly recommended.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at 0900 after the flight from hong kong, room was ready and the coffee was on the house.A very welcoming atmosphere in a beautiful setting. Nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was excellent. Room was great and the beds were very comfortable. Only a short walk to the centre of town. Restaurants close by.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my family had a very nice experience at this hotel close to the Arco della Pace in Milan. The hotel itself is situated in a beautiful Art Noveau building containing a lot of details. The rooms are quite typical 3-star but nice and comfortable with all the basic things you need. They also serve a small but nice breakfast buffet and the hotel also boasts a nice bar. The main reason to stay at this hotel though, and i really want to highlight this thing, is their fantastic service. The hotel beams a very familiar atmosphere combined with outstanding service. You really have the feeling of being taken care of. The staff here is amazing and hence the high rating.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good experience from the first greetings to the taxi ordered for my trip to the airport. Cordial, helpful staff who didn't wait to be asked before they offered assistance.Nice large room, comfortable beds and a balcony to sit by. Nice bar for an evening drink and a good breakfast in the morning. About a 25 minute walk to Milan's main tourist sites but the walk can be taken most of the way through a lovely park. This hotel was recommended by friends and they certainly gave me good advice.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a perfect welcome to Milan and Italy.Front desk was most helpful with directions and advice.Room was very clean and spacious.Breakfast was wonderful and well stocked.Good location for visiting Milan,.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lancaster hotel was one of many hotels we stayed at during our 5 week Europe trip and there is no question it was one of our favourites. Staff are all nice and friendly, and willing to help. The hotel rooms are clean and spacious, and very positively for us noise is not an issue at this hotel at all. You can get a good night's sleep here if you need! The wifi is very strong and the breakfast was served with all fresh ingredients buffet style. I would definitely come back to this hotel next time in Milan.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Holding true to their presentation on the website Lancaster hotel is a smaller hotel just outside the really most central part of Milan with great service as their top priority. We got all the help we could ask for when asked for. The breakfast was perfect in it s own way with all the ingredients you want without being unnecessary grand. Good gluten free bread and crackers when asked for! Outside the most central part of Milan is not a problem as that means within walking distance of the most relevant attractions in the City. Walking to the Duomo took approx. 30min. Closest tram 10min. Closest metro 15min. Two great Gelato shops approx. 10min.Thank you so much for your hospitality Lancaster!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After 4 days at the amazing Monza F1 Grand Prix we stayed at the Lancaster Hotel for 4 day stay. Staff at the hotel went out of their way to be helpful. The standard of accommodation was better than a 3* which they say they are. We would definitely book this hotel again when we return to Milan. It was in a lovely quiet area just 15 mins walk from the Duomo and hubbub of the centre.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very kind and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Great quiet neighborhood close to good restaurants and the beautiful Sempione Park. Very ample and delicious breakfasts. The hotel had just undergone some renovations when we were there, in fact they were ongoing but did not bother us, so lots of fresh paint, new flooring etc. The management takes a lot of care in the maintenance and operation of the hotel. Would definately recommend. I had trouble with a wifi connection, but perhaps it was my computer, Overall, a very good experience. Thank you Hotel Lancaster!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed staying in this hotel. It has a great feel of family and history here. Great service at breakfast and reception staff are very helpful. The room is very comfortable, clean and mine even has a little balcony. It’s also reasonably priced. It’s so near to the eateries and parks that is just within walking distance.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From first walking into the hotel, I was impressed by the very friendly staff. Their professionalism and enthusiasm really added to our hotel. They were eager to help us plan our outings in and around Milan on our first visit to the city.Our room was large and comfortable. There was a large wall-mounted TV, maybe 50 inches. There was a minibar in room and you can ask in the bar for a complimentary bottle of water for the room. Large bathroom with two basins, tub/shower, bidet. Unfortunately, we found that it was impossible to shower without getting the floor very wet. The tub enclosure covered less than half of the tub and was leaking at the bottom.There was a tasty breakfast buffet with lots of variety--hot bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs. There were also cold cuts, bread and rolls, fruit, yogurt, pastries, juices, and all kinds of coffee and tea. The Wi-Fi signal was strong throughout the hotel.We greatly enjoyed our stay in this hotel and would certainly return on a future trip to Milan.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staff and the owner of the hotel are always available to assist you with everything you need!!! Very clean rooms and they are spacious!! Hotel is close to all main attractions!! The hop off and hop on bus stop is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel! Great restaurants around the hotel and on the main square , where you will discover a beautiful park with a huge fairytale castle!!! Amazing experience!!! Strongly recommend and I will definitely visit again!!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: .Great Hotel, Warm hospitality.The staff was very helpful and kindBreakfast was good, wide range of fruits, juices, ham, bacon, cheese , bread etc.Good size room, bathroom, and very clean!About fifteen minutes from the center of Milan...Viviana
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my mum have just returned from 4 nights at the Lancaster and what a fantastic hotel. Not only is the hotel lovely but I have never come across such friendly and welcoming staff. It is in a great location being a 15/20 minute walk through park sempione to the centre of town. As well as that it is only a 15 minute walk from Cadorna station where the Malpensa express from the airport stops. You can also get the train from there to Lake Como.The rooms are a great size (we stayed in a standard twin) and they have all you could need including a free safe. Breakfast was brilliant, from bacon and eggs to pastries, fruit, cereal, meats, cheese and cakes! What more could you want. (They make a great cappuccino too!)Thank you to all the wonderful staff that made our stay extra special and helped out with our trip to lake como. If we ever return to Milan we won't hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent the one night, as it was really just a transit stop back on our trip. The check in at 2 was great, even got us in a little early (just planned on dropping off our bags). The room wasn't massive, but we've stayed in much smaller. The small balcony was nice, plus the bathroom is of decent size.The staff is really what I wanted to write about. Such nice and pleasant people, always willing to go the extra mile for us. It doesn't always happen, and we wanted to thank Valeria, Ilaria and Leonardo there great work and welcome hospitality at the end of our trip.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Lancaster Hotel for three nights in May. What a great hotel. Breakfast was included and that is a big bonus. I prefer a cooked breakfast, not the coffee and pastry style breakfast, so the scrambled eggs were very welcome. The room was comfortable and clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The trams are nearby and Parco Sempione is a short walk away. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great staff who could not of helped us any more. A very filling breakfast, with scrambled egg as I like it. The hotel was in a quiet location, but near to many restaurants close to the arch and park. The rooms were very comfortable, some with balconies, and all the facilities. We would visit this hotel again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I booked this hotel, I was a little concerned that it was too far from the things tourists need. I was so wrong. Great reviews and a leap of faith and here we were in the wonderful Hotel Lancaster, on a quiet street just blocks away from all the action.Restaurants nearby were great, the trams are a few blocks away and Arco della Pace is a beautiful neighborhood. Our room, 225, had a balcony so we could sit outside, a nice bathroom with a shower, bidet and big white towels, The bed was comfortable and the pillow were non allergenic.Breakfast was a cozy affair and the food was very good. Filippo, the owner, was always around to make things personal. The front desk is amazing and we got all the help we needed to make our adventures around the city easy. Gracious, generous, attentive describes the service. And the people! Small hotels make it easy to connect with your fellow travelers. This one is just wonderful.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel might be small but it made it extra special. Each morning we would be remembered by the staff and what particulars we liked for breakfast. Felt like a home not a hotel. All the staff were so friendly. We were booked in promptly and were shown the main tourist areas on a map. Made you feel really welcome. We had a triple room with balcony. It was a good size and the balcony had good views. Breakfast each morning was lovely, plenty to choose from. Choice of cooked items, bread, pastries and even cakes and doughnuts. About 10 minutes walk to an area with restaurants and about 25 mins to main tourist area. Lovely walk through the park and castle though. For the price we paid, this hotel exceeded our expectations and we would definately stay here again. Whether your young, old, a couple or a single traveller, this hotel can cater for all. Thank you to all the hotel staff for making our weekend Milan break memorable
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the Lancaster Hotel! We arrived quite early and they took our luggage and even offered us a room earlier if we wanted. We used the general bathroom and went on our way in to Milan via the tram routes which the staff helpfully explained to us. We were able to purchase a 24 hour tram ticket from reception which I highly recommend. Upon our arrival back that afternoon our bags were already up in the room! The room was clean and quite spacious. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the Cadorna train station through a lovely park. It is in a nice restaurant district; most restaurants did a buffet service but as we wanted something authentic for our first night in Italy, we went to ‘Mammina pizzeria e cucina genuina’ down a side street close to the hotel which we really enjoyed! Breakfast at the hotel was the best we had on our trip; every food available under the sun! The staff made amazing coffee and were helpful answering questions about local shopping etc. The next day we checked out and they again held our luggage while we explored before returning to collect it on our way to Milan Centrale station. Would 100% stay here again. Great location, great service, great rooms and fantastic breakfast :)
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I started our tour of Italy in Milan May 4th and 5th and wish We would have stayed longer. The service is so first rate you can’t help but brag about the place. My wife first saw the building and lived the outside and when we went in she loved it also. We arrived at 9am well before our room was ready, and met Leonardo who was AMAZING! He explained the hote was one of the few buildings intact after WWII bombing and fighting and also told us to drop our backpacks and mapped out some places we could go until formally checking in around noon. The hote is located just over a block from Parco Sempiore which is one of the main parks. On one end it has the Napoleon peace arch and the opposite end Sforza Castle. The park in between is gorgeous and not even the light drizzle stopped us in any way. After walking the park and seeing the castle, we kept waking out the other end and enjoyed a great bottle of Vino. By the way, it was past 5 at home and there are no bad bottles of wine in Italy. We then headed back to the hotel to see our room and then get cleaned up for dinner. They don’t eat very early in Italy and lots of placesDon’t even open until 7pm. Leonardo recommended a place we could walk to and we made it close, but ended up eating elsewhere. It was amazingly delicious and worth the walk. It was by now 9:30, so we took a taxi back rather then walking. We had done about 6+ miles that day. When we got back we met Aldo at the desk and Antonino was manning the bar at the hotel. We cracked a bottle of wine and talked with a Swedish couple on vacation and once they went to bed we chatted with Aldo until almost 2 am. Next day was more re walking and sightseeing and plenty of Vino. Valeria and others worked the desk as well and all were first class and should be recognized as that. We even met the owner our last day there and let him know how great everyone was. He runs a great place and we LOVED the hote and every inch of Milano we visited.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A 5 star for the hotel hostess and concierges and also for the cooker and bartenders, all very sympathetic, cordial and nice. The hotel is old but charming and very cosy indeed. It was a pleasant surprise in a very nice city.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful during the whole stay, such as how to get to different parts of the city and for food recommendations. ;-) We enjoyed the daily walk through the Sempione Park a lot. Due to the location, it is quiet enough during the night but close enough to the centre so that one can reach a lot of locations by foot. The rooms are as on the pictures, not too big, neither too small, perfect for a city trip. Moreover, the breakfast with delicious sweets was a great way to start each day. :-)
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a week recently and was very happy indeed. The staff were all really wonderful, the building was lovely, right close to all the amenities. Breakfast was fabulous. Comfortable room, with fantastic shower. Lovely balcony overlooking the town. We would definitely not hesitate to return here.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the city centre but at the same time in a quiet area. The staff is friendly and they speak so many languages, even russian! Breakfast is rich, they have high quality Italian products, and they even serve you at the table. Super recommended.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Lancaster hotel for one night only, because we had troubles with someone and so we've been brought there.As we entered in, we could tell that the staff and employees were so nice to - just decent and sweet people welcoming us.As we entered the our room, we could feel the warmness of it, for a 3 Star hotel, I have to admit that the rooms are more than adjusting. The mattress was so good, so we had a very good sleep, in total I would say that the atmosphere was just nice and we felt very comfortable in our room. The next morning we went to have the breakfast that was included, we've been welcomed very nicely there as well, the chef of the hotel made sure we'd get a coffee, the buffet was bigger than expected, for Italian standard very high-quality was incredibly good and also we got another one for free.The waiters were so nice, we asked for hot water with some tea cans and other stuff, we've been given these things without been asked for our room number and for free, of course.It is a small hotel, but that "small" is just great, we felt so welcomed and everyone, staff and chef were so nice. Couldn't imagine to have the same comfort in another 3 Star hotel-it was definitely worth an experience & my friend and I would definitely stay there again, no question. If you walk a couple of minutes, you have a metro system, but we thought walking suit us better, so we walked into the centre twice, which took us 15ins only. It's good for the feet and you can see a lot. After we checked out, we took a picture with the owner of the hotel, who was just the sweetest and nicest owner you could imagine. Thank you Lancaster hotel!Best regards, Holly&Maya
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from here, we stayed 3 nights, the hotel is lovely and the staff are fabulous! Our room was very clean and well kept, tea making facilities would have been nice though! We had a few drinks at the bar one night and they ran out of gin and vodka! They made sure there was plenty for us the next night, the park is lovely, we walked through there quite a few times, there was a really big fair in there and we enjoyed looking at all the rides, we didn't try any out Would definitely stay there again but would pick a room with tea and coffee making facilities as we really missed our morning cuppa in bed, our travel agent made the arrangements as a package and we got an economy room.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely fabulous hotel.The whole building is brand new, they are still in the pre opening process. Design of the hotel is beautiful and facilitates are really comfortable. We've enjoyed the most comfortable bed ever. Staff members are really friendly, professional and helpful. Also location of the hotel is perfect, underground is just behind the corner. Definitely, we will be back!
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great boutique hotel within a lovely walk, bus or tram ride to central location. Easily find restaurants within walking distance. Lovely helpful staff. Only downside was no tea and coffee facilities in room
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I have recently returned from a weekend break where we stayed at the wonderful Lancaster Hotel.Located in the quiet Sempione district, the hotel is a short walk from the Arco della Pace (Arch of Peace) and Sempione Park.Cardorna Railway Station (with direct links to Malpensa Airport) is a 20 minute walk to the hotel or a short tram or taxi ride. The Reception offers a 24hr service. All staff speak very good English and are extremely efficient and happy to assist in any way that they can.Our room (223) was spacious with twin beds, TV, safety deposit box and a very reasonably priced mini bar. A kettle with a selection of tea and coffee was also provided. Our bathroom was again spacious, with twin basins, a bath with overhead shower, w/c, bidet, heated towel rail and hairdryer. Complimentary toiletries and bath/hand towels were also provided.The bedroom and the doors leading onto the balcony from the bathroom were double glazed with additional shutters. We were at the front of the hotel and experienced some noise from the road, but it certainly didn't bother us.Housekeeping is of an exceptionally high standard and the hotel is spotlessly clean throughout.Breakfast offers a wide choice of cereals, eggs, bacon, cold meats, cheese, fruit, yoghurts and cakes with a choice of teas, coffees and juices. Staff are extremely attentive (without being intrusive) and food is regularly replenished.Central Milan is a 20-30 minute walk (through Sempione Park) or a 15 minute tram ride (tram tickets are available from Reception).There are several bars and restaurants within a 5 minute walk from the hotel and my daughter and I felt perfectly safe walking back from these after dark.The Lancaster Hotel certainly exceeded our expectations and we were particularly impressed with the way that the staff were so welcoming. We would certainly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again when we next visit Milan.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good location which is a short train ride or under €10 euro taxi ride from Cadorna station which is great if you are coming from Malpensa airport. It is a small hotel and older building but the decor is up to date and quite modern. Rooms are clean and well kept and a good size for a city hotel, they were well maintained and the bathroom was modern and looked if it had been recently upgraded. As a first time visiter who does not speak Italian, the staff were very helpful in pointing out the location of all the tourist places to visit and drew them clearly on a map. Restaurants and bars were a short walk away and plentiful, they were also less expensive than the ones in the city centre. You can walk into the city centre thru the park with the big arch which takes probably 45 mins although it took us longer as there was a market it the bottom end of the park around the castle. The other option we used was a tram either a 19 or a 1 gets you there. The breakfast in the hotel was really good for a continental breakfast offering the usual cereal, cold cuts, fruit juices, fresh fruit and also some hot food.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for 4 nights in November. A pleasant small hotel with attractive pricing for Milan. Important to note: it's not centrally located, about 1/2 an hour walking distance from the Duome, more suitable for a business trip when proximity to the downtown is needed. Some may not like pass through the park on their way to the center in darkness, with groups of suspicious youngsters spread over the scenery (there are mixed police/military patrols there during these hours).The staff is very polite, pleasant and helpful, I really liked them. There was an issue with the room when we arrived in the middle of a night, but the receptionist resolved it quickly. The breakfast was good and well-served.But I would suggest to pay more attention to the maintenance. Our room could be kept in a little better condition, especially the bathroom. The same is about the staircases and the carpets covering them.To summarize everything: good for 3 stars and the price I paid in generally expensive Milan, but if you wish to be in the heart of the city, it's probably worth to pay extra and go to a more central hotel.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel 's location is not that good.It is quite far from city center and any metro station.The rooms are quite small.In my room the shower was not in the bathroom but next to it.It lloked like more like a box.Though it was very clean and i have to mention that they provide you with slippers to have in your room.The breakfast was really good.Big variety and high quality.Also they make you whatever coffee you like.The best thing in this hotel is the staff.Everyone is really friendly,kind and always try to help you.All of them,from reception to cleaning staff,are professional and excellent to their responsibilities.Well done to all of them.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very spacious and I loved the double sink large bathroom. The staff was very welcoming and friendly. The room and bathroom was very clean. Would definitely stay there again. The breakfast was good and the wait staff for breakfast was friendly and very efficient.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 very enjoyable nights in this lovely, well ran hotel. Nicely located in an extremely quiet area ten minutes walk from an array of restaurants and bars, fifteen minutes from the Cadorna train station. Excellent ,friendly and very professional staff. The rooms are not the largest we have had ,but were clean and perfectly adequate. Beds were ok. Breakfast was good with juice,coffee,cereals,eggs,bacon and sausage available. Will almost certainly visit again.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very neat and clean. The service was excellent. It was in a nice neighborhood. I felt very safe in this part of town. There were places to eat near by. The only negative was that one needed to take a cab to and from the central station.
hotelName:
7    Lancaster Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a little worried about staying in a hostel on my own for the first time but this place was so great! Really friendly team, cute outdoor space areas, cheap bar prices and my private room was upgraded to a twin so I had another bed to put all my stuff on which was actually really helpful. Breakfast was lovely and really can't fault my experience! Well done guys I will defo recommend to my friends x
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed this stay. I was travelling solo and sort of a bit nervous but the vibe of the hostel was great, everyone was welcoming and it was pretty easy to meet people in the common areas and your room. The staff are friendly and the rooms are super clean and even have a en-suite which I was pleasantly surprised at. The hostel also really respects not making noise after hours so if you wanted to rest it was super easy to. I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is great and can honestly say I have no complaints. It has the best staff and atmosphere for any hostel I’ve been to in Europe so could not recommend enough. Location wise it’s about a 25 minute walk from the centre but can be done much quicker on public transport. Don’t usually review on trip advisor but felt I had to for this place.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic hostel to stay in. 10/10 for every single aspect. Incredible atmosphere and everybody is very friendly. Exceptionally clean and comfortable. Free breakfast and dinner was wonderful. An event every night ensures the atmosphere is always buzzing and vibrant. Despite staying on the first floor directly above the bar there was not a single sound to disturb a nights sleep. Air conditioning in the rooms is fantastic and rare for a hostel. Ensure to make the most of the free drink upon arrival, 6th floor balcony and ask the staff for literally anything as they are there to help you with whatever you may have to ask.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were welcomed late on (11:30 approx) by extremely friendly staff, she explained the ins and outs of the hostel. We were given a free welcome drink and offered free breakfast which is excellent for the price per night. The rooms were clean, spacious and there was plenty of storage/lockers. There was a much more modern/trendy feel to the hostel and we wish we were able to say for more than one night.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here two nights, and couldn't speak higher of the place. The staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. The atmosphere is homely and welcoming and the facilities are amazing. Breakfast and dinner included was a luxury I definitely was not expecting! Location is brilliant for all kinds of travelors to Milano. The outdoor area and roof terrace is also a lovely spot to relax on a summer day/evening. I'd also like to extend my sincere gratitude to the staff for helping me with both packing my bike down into a box and helping carry it to the bus shuttle for my flight out of Milano. It helped so much. If I'm ever back in town, I will definitely be staying here again! Thanks heaps, Ash
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very much pleased with the entire accomodation. Check-in staffs pleasant, friendly & helpfull. Rooms were great. Free breakfast & dinner. Would recommend to friends for their future stay. Very homely atmosphere.. Great guys... keep it up.. 6 mins walk from Milan Central station.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Without a doubt one of the best hostels I’ve ever been. Everything is taken care of. Met great staff and guests. Good areas to hang out. A lot of activities you can join and everything feels so personal.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in many hostels and this one was one of the best. The facilities are great(they had everything), staff was amazing and great atmosphere. The free breakfast and dinner definitely make up for the price. You don't need to leave the hostel to have a good evening, there's always a good crowd gathered in the terrace until late. Perfect for solo travelers!
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 days in ostello bello grande and I don't regret it. The hostel was full of solo travellers or small groups, which made for the best atmosphere I had never seen in a hostel. There is a bar, a garden, a chill zone and a rooftop and I could have spent my 4 days there drinking beers with random people without ever getting bored.An other big plus is that they don't charge you for anything once you've paid your nights (apart of course for the drinks but there is always free food).
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great, the personal is nice, the cook tastes good, the rooms are clean, the place is well-localizated and it looks beautiful. I’m really happy and would like to come back with my friends! Thank ya
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just spent a night and wish I could have spent more! A very social hostel, they make sure everyone was included. The facilities are superb, all of the workers are extremely passionate, accommodating, and kind!
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of my favorite places I stayed in Italy. Although a bit hesitant about staying in a hostel, it was a great experience. The staff was so friendly and held our bags in storage since we arrived before check in. The rooms are clean and modern. My friends and I also got complimentary drinks and meals/ unlimited snacks were included in the stay. The location was perfect for the subway and train station as well. Only complaint is that it does get a little bit loud in the lobby at night but closing the doors to the hall to our room did help a lot.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nightmare! I'm not really sure where to start with this review.. I had a terrible experience in Ostello Bello Grande and highly recommend you look for another option (madama hostel, cheaper airbnb). - Upon checking in at 3pm, I was told the room was not ready as a group of 100 had just checked out so had to wait for the room to be ready (so I didn't get to explore my first day) - Upon getting to my room it had more the vibe of a jail cell than a hostel room with a strong overpowering smell of cheap cleaning products. - The smell was so overpowering I had to go to a supermarket and buy multiple air fresheners - Dirty walls with a single bed beside up against the wall, I moved the bed to the middle of the room so I didn't touch the walls - Dried snot on the wall above my bed ( I had to pick off the wall, seriously) - Under the beds they have insect catchers so they obviously have problems with bugs. - no activities to help you meet other travellers - made the previous hostel I stayed at look like a palace (madama hostel) - paying over 120 euro per night, I went to the bar and was refused ice because I wasn't buying a drink, female bar tender gave me the worst look I've ever seen every time I passed the bar - so of course I had to avoid it my entire trip. A girl proceeded to go behind me and got 2 glasses of ice by flirting with the bar tender - a staff member tried to charge one of the guests 20 euro for entry to a free nightclub - one hostel staff gloated about kissing 2 girls in the same room and proceeded to make a girl cry by trying to hit on her. He was fired because of this but obviously no vetting process for the staff - asked one of the receptionists how to go to lake Como: her helpful reply, "check the website or the station it's easy to go to Como station" I checked online and they said don't go to Como station, go to vareena, a much more picturesque town. - Asked one of the staff where the nearest supermarket was, she said she didn't know - I walked outside and there was one next door. - They frequently have large groups of school children staying; I had multiple labeled items stolen from the fridge - run down shower / bathroom barely fitted in it - 1 small towel for a 4 night stay - No freezer in the shared kitchen - Slow almost unusuable WiFi in the rooms at night , gets faster when people are exploring during the days and in common spaces - another group of 100 school children checked in my final night. I was woken at 7am to the sounds of screaming children running and chasing eachother (at night too) - walls very thin, you hear conversations in other rooms - for breakfast they serve awful cheap German sausages and eggs like rubber - dinner is another story; pasta and crisps - due to the huge amount of school children all the common areas were taken up by them shouting and screaming. - had another friend who was completely destraught as she couldn't find anywhere to work, study or sleep while she waited for her flight Do NOT stay in a single private room as there are much better options in Milan, if you are looking for the social side you can still experience that by coming to their bar open to locals. If you can get this for under 25 euro per night it's acceptable because Milan is expensive and this provides the basics, my frustration comes from the fact I was paying over 125 per night for the same service. I would have cancelled the momment I got to my room but they don't allow refunds - I'll be waiting for some form of refund after this review. I don't want to leave a bais review , so I'll mention the good things too; the AC in the room was very cold, kitchen topped up with fresh fruit daily, nice rooftop chillout area (but no view), some of the staff were very nice, cleaning staff very friendly and those doing works around the place.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostal was amazing, the customer service is excellent and they really speak so many languages. The rooms are clean and tidy, the common areas are just like in the pictures, with lots of options for entertainment and activities that you can sign up for. They also offer a free walking tour in partnership with an excellent company. The breakfast and dinner is a buffet, and you can find all types of food in the kitchen that allow you to cook a full meal and have snacks for free during the day if you wish to. I wish my stay was longer! I will definitely keep using this chain of hostals.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is very well located near Stazione Centrale. It just takes 2 mins from the station to reach Ostello Bello Grande.Staff is really friendly and the atmosphere nice. Can not tell much about the dormitory rooms as I basically did not sleep in there (i was staying only 1 night) but seemed clean as it was the bathroomOverall good experience for a hostel
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've seen some reviews saying the staff are unfriendly but I found this hostel to offer quite the contrary. You're greeted upon entering with the friendly reception staff who advised on the local sights and metro links to get around. The rooms are spacious enough for a hostel, I liked that the storage was under the beds which meant there was no need to throw a suitcase/rucksack into a high up locker as seen in other hostels. I stayed in a 6 bed shared dorm, the bed was comfy and pillows and bedding were clean. The roof terrace is a great space to relax in an evening and has nice views over some of Milan. Lots of guests up there having a good time at night so if you want a hammock you have to get there early in the evening. Dinner and breakfast were provided free of charge (included in the price) and were pretty good. Dinner runs 7-9pm and consisted of pasta and a few other dishes. You also get a free drinks coupon when checking in which is a really nice touch. Upon eating breakfast the following morning a girl was playing the communal piano which was very nice to chill out to. They have a great set up at this hostel that allows guests to choose the experience they want. Some quiet areas and some more communal areas. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived in the morning and was well received by the staff.However, at night, after having walked all day and having around 5 hours until I had to wake up, I was received by a guy around 9pm who mistreated me and was very unfriendly. All because he didn't hear me saying "Hi" when I arrived (which I did say by the way). He is in no way prepared to deal with guests and the public. Not only was he being unreasonably unfriendly, he complained that I arrived with a pizza, insisted that I had to pick up my luggage immediately (even though I just wanted to have 15 minutes to eat my pizza before going to my room) and refused to look into the schedule of the shuttle to Bergamo airport, saying he didn't have it (even if there was a big computer screen in front of him). That really made my stay (of one single night) really stressful and unpleasant.When I woke up and went to the reception around 3 am for a cup of coffee and checkout, there was another guy and he was nice.I cannot complain about the accommodation and the installations.You should definitely talk to that guy. It's not right to treat anyone like he did. I tried to avoid any confrontation whatsoever because all I wanted was to eat my pizza and go to bed. If I had more time in Milan, I would've switched hostels.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely beautiful hostel!! We loved the hammock rooftop and spent every night there hanging out and meeting new awesome people from all over the world! The personnel takes care of you like friends and there’s even free food all the time so you never go hungry, including fresh fruits and veggies, pasta, rice, and sweet snacks. We stayed in a 5-bed female dorm, a lot of space,everything is new and clean, there are towels, shampoo, and basically everything you need. Portable chargers and hotspots are available at the reception and there are free walking tours, yoga and all kinds of stuff to do!! The reception person even offered his favorite pizza place with free shots haha. Love this place and genuinely wish we stayed longer! Going to miss Milan and OBG!
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel delivers above & beyond. We received a welcome second to non. Professional yet warm. Happy to store our bags as we arrived early. Extremely helpful advised us on local places to visit and with planning our routes. ALL staff were happy, smiling. This place has a great vibe. Loads of areas to chill. Gorgeous roof terrace with hammocks. Rooms are clean & tidy.Location is easy from airport and main station. Close to metro, taxis are easy to come by. Will recommend
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Omg I really don’t know where to start! Everything was amazing , from the Recption desk to the rooftop.Well, the stuff people are very nice and helpful and welcoming, when I arrived to check in they offered me a complimentary drink while they were doing the check in paperwork, after that they explained everything i need in the hostel and gave me a map for the city and where to . The Recption guy Dado was awesome! He is super cool and so friendly, i think he is the best Receptionist i have ever met haha.They have a nice bar with variety of beers and drinks with good price range. The bartender Zoe is very cute and friendly as well .The hostel guests were very nice people! I really love them. I made a lot of friends there in two nights only and it was my birthday and we celebrated together, it was an amazing experience.There are also some Italian people come to sit in the bar area to socialize with foreigners and practice English.The hostel is super clean actually, for me it was as clean as a good 4 stars hotel, especially the common areas like the bathroom, it was very clean all the time.They have free breakfast and dinner, it’s a good value for money saving if you’re traveling on budget. They had an event the night I arrived, there was like a band playing guitar and singing, that was pretty awesome.The hostel is only 3 minutes walking from the central station in milan (milano centrale) , and there’s a supermarket next to it , and some good restaurants as well.I really enjoyed my stay there and i will stay in this hostel again if i come back to milan , and i will also recommend it for my friends when they go to milan. They have free coffee all the day I guess, and they remove the breakfast around 12:00 pm.Thank you guys !!! Everything was perfect and I really don’t think that they need to improve anything. Cuz it’s almost perfect Gratzie
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for 2 nights & 3 days, I choose because of the location and toilet inside the room. And I’m glad I choose it, the room and toilet is clean, which is a hygiene factors. What surprise me is, breakfast and dinner buffet is included, and free coffe, fruits, cookies the whole day. And they have a free walking tour, which is fantastic ! Very recommended for solo tripper !
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hostel because I was only in Milan for a night. It was hot outside, so I barely walked around and explored, so I decided to stay behind in the hostel. Usually, hostels are hit or miss and this one was definitely a hit. The reception was awesome, they were very friendly and gave me a complimentary beverage because it was so hot outside. One of the gentleman that works there (I forgot his name already, but very nice and he's from Milan) gave me a quick run down of the city and a complementary map. Room was clean, very well organized, the bathroom is inside the room so you only share with those in your specific room. The rooftop was gorgeous and this is where I did majority of my socializing. I will stay here again when visiting Milan!
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great time here. The group buffet dinners and bar were a great way to meet other travellers. The patio/garden upstairs is beautiful. The rooms were well separated from the noisy atmosphere downstairs, so sleeping quietly was not a problem in my dorm.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable. The staff are amazing and helpful. The food is great too, I'm definitely returning if I visit Milan again.Lots of people to meet, there are games to play and organized activities.If you are looking for a fun time, this is the place to go. Upstairs it is quiet enough to rest and the beds are comfortable.You get a lot of perks for what you pay, it's THE place to go.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really amazing, very courteous and helpful. There were a lot of "perks" that other hostels don't have, such as breakfast available all day and a free drink at the bar. The bedroom (girls dorm) was by far the nicest I've seen in a hostel. All together it was great.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is perfect for everything you'd be looking for in a hostel... Everything is really clean, it's in a perfect location for getting anywhere, free breakfast & free dinner, 24hr bar, beautiful hang out areas (there are many), and unbeatable staff. Feel free to show up with no plans or knowledge of Milan, because the staff is very willing to guide you to all the best things to do and places to eat or go out. Helder was especially friendly and made me feel instantly welcomed and at home. Be sure to find him (he's the one with the big smile and bigger mustache) and ask him where to go for the best pizza you'll ever eat in your life.
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ostello Bello Grande is quite simple without comparition. Clean, affordable, full of amenities, a lovely place to have an aperitif, close to the station... The only downsize is that no other hostel compares
hotelName:
8    Ostello Bello Grande
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its location is unbeatable, literally steps away from Milano Centrale Station. There’s free breakfast and dinner every day, and oh, a welcome drink of your choice (beer / coffee). The hostel organises events almost daily, so there’s something different to look forward to every day, if you’re looking to get involved as much as possible – e.g. soccer nights, KTV, live music performances, etc. There’s also a really chillax spot at the rooftop lounge, with hammocks and tables & chairs so you could relax there with a book or do your own stuff on your laptop. There’s also a games room and smaller, more cosy & quieter lounge you can access in the basement to escape from the mayhem on the bar area / ground floor. BUT, be warned that it's a party hostel!!! (I’m sure this counts as a plus for many people) And because it's a party hostel, it tends to attract a certain profile of people to stay there. Young, outgoing, lively, energetic and obviously, party animals. Ten years ago, this could be my best place to stay. I love to meet and interact with people from different nationalities, and hang out till late at night, talking or drinking. But, now that I'm slightly older, I actually appreciate more personal time, and also sleep. Sleep is something that you won't be getting much if you stay in this hostel, because it's very likely that you will have someone coming in very late at night after a night of drinking and partying. One guy in my room always came back after midnight, and as his bed is on the topmost deck, he never fails to wake everyone up just by entering the room, opening the lockers, climbing up to his bed, or down to pee. I’m just glad I got assigned to a bed on the bottom deck, and NOT on the top deck (which is 3 levels up – i.e. three tiers of beds!!!) The noise from downstairs can sometimes be heard when the music / people get too loud. So, all things considered, this is a great place to stay (check out the row of awards from Hostelworld.com at the check-in counter!!!) if you're looking to meet people and make friends, and if you're young and looking for love.
