Staff were nice and friendly too, whether this was in the restaurant, at reception or just as you bumped into them around the hotel. If we visit again, we will be back to stay here!
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Western Plus Hotel Galles made my visit to Milan very pleasant. I stayed there for 3 nights and they answered all my requests. They even accommodated an area for me to watch my favourite football team.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, Please inform that you have assorted rubbish on (every?) floor. I found it by chance:)The swimming pool is very pleasant but too small and crowded at all times. Breakfast too poor for 4stars
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice decent hotel, placed centrally in Milano. Clean, spacious rooms and polite personel. The hotel is placed in the shopping street of Milano (outside the city center) and are close to the central station and great restaurants.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed very much my stay at Hotel Galles! First, the staff was super nice, especially some wonderful people I glad I met, and happy to help when they can. Second, the rooms are very nice, the bed very comfortable and the whole thing is very clean. The spa is great and accessible quite late which is enjoyable after a day of wandering or hard work. The food is delicious, and the restaurant is a nice place.Also, just over the Lima station, it is so easy to go and visit the most famous places of Milan. The Duomo is litteraly less than 10 minutes away with metro 1, and the train stations quite close too.I would recommend this place 100%.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I felt very well welcomed. This is the fourth time we come to this hotel. We have already recommended same to our children and they were also very satisfied with the overall service. I would most definitely recommend your hotel to our friends and relatives. Thank you so much.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very functional. Well located. 12 minutes from the station. By the metro station. Or walking distance from the Duomo.Although small, the room is comfortable, clean and well equipped. It has all amenities even if the safe is too small (you cannot fit a PC or a camera inside). You can count on the front desk if you miss anything. The bed is comfortable.The staff is very helpful and warm. From the lobby to the restaurant no forgetting the bar.The breakfast is a typical buffet with a large variety of choice. If you need a particular hot drink, you can order it as well.The Spa is very nice to relax after a day of walking. Even if the guests do not really respect the silence, it remains a cool place with a warm water, sauna and hammam. We felt that the hamman needs some cleaning.A rooftop terrace is nice place for a drink at sunset, but it is a pity that there are 2 big advertisement signs spooling the view.The reason for your 1 star is that despite all the above, we had 3 problematic nights and this is because of the very poor noise insulation. The rooms are designed so that the bathroom of one is back to the bedroom of the other: a major design flow. Moreover, there is no noise insulation: the second design flow. BW would have given up one or 2 rooms per floor, they could have had a very modern insulation. We ended up hearing everything from the next room: the TV, the water of the shower, the splashed of the bath, the shaving of the morning. The first night our neighbor that decided to take a bath just before 7am waked us up.The second night, 3 woman sharing few rooms in our floor decided to have a gathering the room next to ours. We had to go and ask them to lower the noise level before the baby wakes up.The icing of the cake was the last night where the family next door decided to have shower at 2am. They did not open nor reply when we tried to knock on their door or wall. We had to call in the lobby who had to negotiate for about 30 minutes.It is clear that the incivility of the people is not the responsibility of the hotel. But it is clear that would BW choose to spend more money in the insulation and the architect put bathroom back to back between rooms we would have avoided these problems and the nightmare of the last night. I must also say that I was particularly disappointed by the reply I got over the phone by the second staff at the front desk who pretended that they can not call the police and I can use my own phone.If noise is important to you, then this place is not for you. Otherwise, it is a functional place for a weekend or a business trip. For us it is a never again.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel still kept its charm. Staff very friendly and always helpful. The facilities are excellent with use of the swimming pool, Turkish bath and sauna. Rooms comfortable and clean. Five star performance.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, price, cleanliness! Beautiful pool area too! Had a great trip. Was travelling solo and felt very safe. Staff friendly and accommodating also. Would definitely recommend and travel here again
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great central place to stay. Staff always made you feel welcome and we're extremely helpful with anything we needed from metro tickets to ways to get around and also restaurants to eat at. Our room was fantastic with the best beds ever.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 days at This hotel and spaWe Loved itThe People, The breakfast, The spa and The locationWe had an Awesome stayGreat value for small money compared to other hotels This area You have The metro just under The hotel and lotsOf restaurants around and shopsRememberTo visit restaurant “The kitchen” 5 minutes Walk from hotel
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was five nights in the hotel. Breakfast was fine as well as all other services. One point was the room size. For five nights I had wished a bit greater room. I was in a single room for bussiness reasons.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service, good breakfast, good rooms. Good fit for a city trip. Only few minutes away from the Milan duomoI can recommend this place - much better than some 5 Star Hotels in London. TripAdvisor wants me to write more but short is sweet, right?
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel. Staff was very friendly. Good food. Swimming pool and wellness was okay. Situated in the centre of Milan, close to the railway station and subway. You can leave your baggage at the concierge before your check-in or after the check-out.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well located hotel. Easy for the metro and getting about, also near all of the big stores on the Buenos Aires Main Street.Pool a little small but fine and nice to relax at the end of the day.Staff were very friendly, polite and helpful.Only problem was some noise from the metro trains and we were on the 4th floor.Good value though.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good rooms and good breakfast. The staff is really partner for all times. You will have no problem with them. My problem was with the bathroom, too small. I’ll return if I have opportunity.And a tip: the hotel have a vallet service with $30 euro/day. In the street, you will pay $22 euro/day.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly staff specially at the reception who were very helpful during my stay. Hotel has an amazing location, and near to all landmarks. Spa and pool are vary clean and tidy. Definitely will be back to this hotel soon, and would recommend it to my friends as well.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic room for a family of 4 (incl 2 teenagers). Great that the sleeping area can be partitioned to create more privacy. Huge bathroom and tons of space. Staff were all really friendly and the metro stop literally just outside the entrance made sightseeing a breeze.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Woke up to construction noise both mornings, then construction lasted til 6pm. Disappointed BW would our guest in rooms with such noise. Did not enjoy my mornings or evenings. Rooms would have been perfect but can’t stand the noise. Front desk staff great!
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was excellent. the bed, the a/c, the service, the food, the polite and cortious staff. In short a real pleasure. Location is superb. You are 10 meters from the metro, and 4-6 stations from all the major sites in town, and in the middle of a giant shopping center.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near the metro red line, shop and restaurant. After work is possible to go to the spa or to use the gym-machine. I think is good to have some flavored water in the spa, in the room some tisans.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely time in the hotel,very clean and a lovely team. The room is big and very comfortable. Swimming pool is a big bonus. Breakfast was great, dinner not so much and the price is too high. Thank you.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well located in Milan, near to Metro and Central Railway station (10-15 minutes walk), the Best Western Plus Hotel Galles offered a good base for our expolrations of Milan. Our room was quite good by the standards we saw across Italy. Hotel amenities were quite good with roof top terraces for views over the city at night and a pleasant dining room on the top floor. The basement swimming pool was a pleasant relaxation after a busy day. Like all city hotels, there was some sound intrusion from nearby Metro and passing ambulances. Normal traffic noise did not intrude.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel right next to a subway station (Lima) located on Corso Buenos Aires - main shopping street. Our family room was ideal, two connecting rooms. Breakfast is very satisfying, although could have more selection of hot food for vegetarians e.g. fried tomatoes, mushrooms which was only on our last day. The rooftop terrace with views over the city. The spa is a nice plus. We will definitely come back! All in all we had a fab time in Miliano.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was excellent that expected whole usual service such as sauna, swimming pool, fitness, laundry machines, etc. was supplied by the hotel. Because, when we used and enjoyed them even during our trip, we could feel more comfortable as usual. However, one small point is requested. it is better for us that the capacity of the refrigerator is a little larger since we want to enjoy dinner with the family in the hotel room, too.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice property in a great location, with excellent service. Splendid food and courteous and helpful staff made our stay a pleasure. A first-class operation, and we'd stay there again when in Milan.Elevator setup was a trifle confusing, but we figured it out.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights at the hotel and could not have enjoyed our stay more. The hotel staff was attentive, warm and helpful across a variety of needs. Our arrival was late at night but even so, I received a friendly and warm welcome.The rooms were elegant comfortable with good amenities, the TV was excellent with a good selection of channels and the air con. was very efficient and quiet, even on full speed! The bathroom was well appointed with excellent lighting and lovely thick towels.I look forward to staying again
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came as part of a large convention and found our stay very comfortable. The bed was excellent and appreciated the selection of English language channels on the television. Breakfast buffet provided a broad selection of food choices. Your maid staff was excellent--please recognize them. There were some nice cafe and restaurant selections in the neighborhood and we felt very safe walking around. Used the subway to get to major sights. I am afraid we were so busy we did not take advantage of some of the very nice spa and pool amenities but it would be wonderful place to stay and relax for a day.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel might be a bit more on the pricey side but you cannot beat the conveniences. It is located right outside the Lima Metro stop making it super easy to get around the city. The staff is superb. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance plus the one located right in the hotel. Hotel pool was a hit with the kids. Would definitely return again.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property offered most of the services we hoped for and the minor ones that were not available were readily able to be accommodated.The breakfast offered was clearly different from what we would normally have as it is not our home country. That said, what was on offer was generous and varied.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location to stay in Milan. City center easily accessible by metro, located just outside hotel. Superb parking arrangements in safe garage. Very friendly and helpful receptionists who go out of their way to help. Very comfortable room with the necessary amenities.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice, breakfast is very good, all the service available, clean and cozy. The rooms are quite small, but not smaller than typically in Milan. The location is very convenient - the main stations are nearby, metro station right next to the entrance, good for walking around as well, many restaurants in the area.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Why no one mentioned that the metro is passing just under the hotel and some rooms will have the vibration.The first room we had , the vibration was so much we could not tolerate, then we were moved to fifth floor which you could still feel it when you lay on the bed but it was ok. I am not sure, if I had to stay in the first room, it could be the worse hotel but the second one was good. Most of us are traveling from overseas and already so exhausted from the airport and the plan, we choose the best western and a four star hotel to make sure we will be comfortable and it will have the standards but a vibrating room is NOT expected. Changing the room again got more energy out of me and time.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location is excellent. It is close to the train station and many shops. Also, you can find many restaurants around the hotel with many food varieties to choose from. They have free great services such as self Laundry and self Ironing room. All that are free of charge. The hotel is clean and elegant.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a 'lucky find' for us when our booking elsewhere was cancelled - but we were really pleased. It is very conveniently situated next to the M1 underground station and it takes only a few minutes to reach most of the tourist destinations in Milan. The rooms were pleasant and well-equipped. The restaurant was excellent with a good choice of food, many other restaurants are within a short walk of the hotel.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and well-located, although a bit of a long walk to the top spots, but the Metro is virtually a few steps away. The staff is courteous and efficient. The rooms at the budget end are satisfactory. The breakfasts are excellent, and the view from the small terrace at the top of the building are very good.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location,Pretty close to central station staff is good, clean room.Oveall it was pleasant stay. Good amenities. Impeccable service at Front Desk. Great restaurant, with delicious food.Enjoyed the most the swimming pool.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went here for my husbands retirement and we weren’t disappointed. I requested a room with balcony and was delighted on arrival to have got one. Hotel is well situated right outside metro. Room clean and comfy and we had a good view on balcony to sit and people watch after walking all day. Staff very friendly and helpful especially Terrence at the bar Good wee find on right, few streets down from hotel was a restaurant Bella Columbia, great food and cheap. We would recommend this hotel and we would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in good condition. Great breakfast. Very good service and stuff. Great position and surrounding. Nice SPA. Great view from the terrace. Very warm atmosphere. Absolutely would come back. Nothing to complaint.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a brief 1 nt stay at this hotel and we loved it! The best part is the indoor pool and spa area. So relaxing and water very warm.Our room was small but sufficient and the beds were super comfortable.This BW is better than anything you will find in the US. The European standard is completely different (better).The concierge recommend a fantastic restaurant about 10 mins walking from the hotel, Mama Rosa. We loved this restaurant and spent a good couple hours just having lunch. Highly recommend both the hotel and the restaurant.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel at end of March. Everything was just perfect. We loved the central position, the staff could not have been more helpful, the room was very clean, beautifully appointed with great mattress, breakfast was very good offering a great selection of Italian breakfast items. Try the spa area .. is perfect for a relaxation after a busy day!!!Finally we had a great time at the Galles Hotel and for the price, we felt we had great value.
hotelName:
11    Best Western Plus Hotel Galles
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights at the B and B in early June. Our flight was delayed and we had been texting Norma, the owner, to keep her up to date as to our arrival. Communication was always very prompt, whether it was via email as we were planning our trip, or with text messaging when we were in Milan. Her husband, Giampaolo, would be picking us up at the airport, eliminating the need to hire a private car. He was waiting for us after we gathered our luggage and we travelled to the B and B in their van. The location is in a country setting and is more than just the B and B. The family lives on the grounds, but not in the B and B. Everything is nicely maintained. There are several dogs, but they are all well behaved and did not enter the B and B. It’s a comfortable family environment. We were met by Norma, who greeted us warmly. There were the occasional language issues, since we don’t speak any Italian. However, Google translator did the trick for each of us. We had several entertaining moments communicating and that added to the enjoyment of our visit. Giulia, their oldest daughter, spoke very good English and acted as a translator as needed.Norma, Giampaolo and their family couldn’t have been any nicer or more hospitable. They really went the extra mile. Since we arrived late and jet lagged, Norma made us something light to eat. Breakfast each day in the large country kitchen was always more than we could eat and always ready to meet our schedule. There is a bus that stops right outside the B and B and the local Metro station at Bisceglie makes for an easy trip into Milan. On a few occasions, Norma and Giampaolo were kind enough to drop us at the Metro station. We also used a taxi from the B and B to get into the city. The house itself is initially deceiving. Once settled in, we noticed how well-appointed things were. Many antiques throughout really add a home like atmosphere. We stayed in the Green Room and were very comfortable. The bathrooms are all very modern and well designed. The air conditioning worked well as we were there during unseasonal heat. There was also a balcony that opened to the courtyard area. The entire location was very quiet.A final example of excellent customer service actually occurred after we left. We were traveling by train from Milan to Venice and then to Rome and didn’t want to carry all of our luggage with us, so we planned to ship it via Express Courier to our location in Rome. Since we were leaving on a Saturday, and the shipper was closed, Giampaolo offered to take the luggage on Monday to have it shipped. He even wrapped it in plastic for protection and it arrived safely two days later in Rome. Definitely went above and beyond.We left Norma and Giampaolo with warm hugs and fond memories. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent four nights at Atmosfera di Stagionne and hated to leave. Norma and Jean Paul are wonderful hosts, offering advice and recommendations. We felt like family. The breakfasts are varie, complete, tasty and presented like a wonderful picture...almost too pretty to eat. The location is ideal to visit Milan. Set in a pastoral setting, yet within minutes to Duomo and other sites via bus and metro. All in all a warm a d welcoming and convenient place to call home when visiting Milan. I would definitely recommend it to my friends.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in the b&b only for 14 hours and I felt like home wished to be there for longer! All the staff was friendly and always ready to help! The Room was perfect and really clean and a comfortable bed was waiting for us! I had a dog as well and has been welcomed as well as a family member
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is really amazing, you cannot believe it is located in Milan city.. garden, trees, green is sorrounding the whole area and warm welcome, care and pampering , here each guest feels like a princess . Norma is fully dedicated and committed to give satisfaction staying in unique "athmosphere" . Rooms are never the same since every touch/attention brings something new . Here all is telling its true story.. and maybe yours too ❤️️
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second time staying at this B&B. I didn't think this place could get any more beautiful than it already is but I was wrong. They have added 3 new rooms since we visited last. A couple of them have small kitchens with all utensils provided, a fridge and a sink! It was perfect for us since we traveled with our toddler to help store milk, food and heat it up as well. The family was kind and helpful as always. They had a lot of tips to share as always about all the places to explore in and around Milan which is always helpful coming from a local. We love this b&b and we will definitely be coming back here again.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for three nights at this wonderful bed and breakfast located west of central Milan. Afriend recommend it and we thoroughly enjoyed everything about our stay. Norma, Gian Paolo and their entire family are so welcoming and generous and the food was excellent. The dining area and rooms were very comfortable and filled with lovely family antique items. My wife said she felt like we were staying in a cozy, quiet family farmhouse even though we were not far from bustling central Milan! We highly recommend this special place.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rented a car from the airport and had no trouble finding the place. Owners were very nice and accommodating. The room was comfortable and clean. As we are used to American hours we had a hard time with the late hours of the owners and their friends. This is not a complaint just an observation. Nice grounds and very good breakfast when we had the time to eat. This is the kind of B&B we enjoy. Family run and it's their home. Kids doing homework, friends coming by. Just a warm home and warm hospitality. The only thing I would change if I were them is payment method. We were on our way out to get the car back and instead of using the credit card on file I had to set up a PayPal account and then use my credit card. Not horrible but kind of a surprise when in a hurry out the door.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is situated a little outside of town in the western suburbs but bus and metro connections are great. They have a big secure yard where we parked. Drove the rental car to the nearby Bicigelle Station and parked all day for 2 euros then took the metro everywhere. Norma and family are the best. They were so super helpful and Guilia their daughter has excellent english skills. You will love Norma's breakfast. Fantastic. Fresh baking every day. Our room was lovingly appointed with ensuite. Very clean and a nice balconey overlooking their courtyard. On arrival we had drinks and then they took us and another couple downtown to the Grande Canal district for dinner and a tour arround. How good is that! Norma went out of her way and booked us tickets to La Scala, EXPO and more for our stay. Super hosts. They make you feel like family.We would stay here again in a heartbeat.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As for me this is the best place to stay in Milan. Quiet neighbourhood, easy access to the city center and to the airport both by car and by public transport, nice airconditioned rooms, very good breakfast, hospitable owners. I would recommend it to everyone. Many thanks, norma and Gianpaolo!
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B is a truly amazong place. My husband and me had a wonderful stay there. Norma and her family are so warm and generous - great hosts! Normas husband even picked us up with his car after a concert in San Siro. The breakfast is incredible and the rooms are very cozy and beautifully furnished. We definitely come back!
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Milan by car (850 km) to visit the world expo 2015 and stayed 3 nights in this lovely B&B. Norma's hospitalty has no limits. She and her family did everything to make our stay very pleasant and comfortable. We stayed in the green room which was very clean,fresh and quiet.You can feel that she, her husband and daughters work with a great heart for her B&b in special vintage style and super breakfast.Ivo and Juliette (Belgium).
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hosts, went out of way to help, even drove us to train, great breakfast , Norma your peach cake was to die for, thank you we enjoyed it on our trip to France.Bus stop at door takes you right to train and then right in to city, no problems.Very quite and peaceful place 10 out of 10 , so clean and great bathrooms , would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in Milan Liz and Alan Australia
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Norma is an artist!!! We haven't stayed in a more prettier homestay/hotel in all our holidays. We were a family of six staying overnight at Atmosfera and wish we could have stayed longer!! Norma and her wonderful family are fabulous hosts and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and helped us with getting to the metro station and even directed us to a wonderful restraunt for dinner! Fabulous breakfast completed our stay. The only flip side is that the property is a bit away from the city centre but worth every minute of the commute just to experience the hospitality of Norma and her family!!! Thank you for making our short stay in milan so memorable!!
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful house with a warm, welcoming hostess (the lovely Norma) and her family. Large, comfortable room with many amenities. A short drive to the train station, and then a quick trip by train to central Milan. Norma recommended that we visit the Navigli area one evening, and then made reservations for us at a local restaurant the second night; both recommendations were fabulous. Breakfast was delicious and healthy. Also enjoyed talking with Norma's family and meeting her pet dogs and parrot!
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay here. Quiet and charming, and an easy commute into Milan. But the thing that really sets it apart from other excellent places to stay are Gianpaolo and Norma. They are so unpretentious, warm, and generous that it is hard to believe they are not old friends. Even their dogs are sweet. Yes, the house is charming. Yes, the breakfast is wonderful. Yes, the bed was super comfortable. But our hosts made it special. Next time in Milan we will stay here again. Can't recommend it highly enough.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had to remind ourselves many times over that we were in the hustle and bustle of Milano. Perfect host and hostess. A perfect place to come back to after a busy day in Milano, and to wake up to start our day! We stayed in the Green room, it was fabulously decorated to make you feel welcomed and relaxed. The common area is full of history and warmth. Thank you, we would recommend it to anyone who wants to be a bus ride and underground ride away from Milano. It is easy to get to both the city and a place to rest.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Atmosfera di stagione is a unique self-contained compound in the Muggiano district of Milan, sheltered from the rather ordinary surrounding apartment blocks, which is a testament to the individualism and creativity of the Nicoli family: Norma, Giampaolo, and their daughters. The guest rooms (we stayed in the Camera Verde) are designed and fitted out to the highest standards, luminous and impeccably clean, with spacious bathrooms and more than comfortable beds. Our breakfasts changed daily and, with Norma's homemade pastries and jams, and surprises like fresh fruit in yogurt, cheese and prosciutto, were worthy of a Michelin star. We have stayed in many nice B&Bs, especially in Italy, but the artistry and extra attention we experienced here were unique.We drove from the airport and kept our rental car in the enclosed private parking area. This turned out to be a good decision as it allowed us to get back and forth conveniently from the metro station, where parking is very inexpensive. We were also able to travel a little in Lombardy south of Milan, visiting the town of Vigevano, with its celebrated Renaissance piazza and shoe museum -- also recommended.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfirend and me found this B&B property via Tripadviser. After reading all the positive review, decided to book our 1 night stay there. No regrets! Norma and her husband are warm and very helpful. We've stayed in the Camera Verde (Green coloured room), spacious room, extremely comfortable bed, very neat, clean bathroom, all details well thought for the guests. Lovely breakfast spread. Private enclosed parking space within the property. We drove, so it was not too difficult to find the location with the help of GPS. To avoid the traffic in Milan city, Norma sent us to the Metro station which is 5 mins away, otherwise, there's a straight bus (about 15mins ride) and connect via Metro to Milan city center(less than 30mins). It's a pity we only had a night there before flying back home. We will definitley be back after this great experience!
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Norma and gianpaolo make you feel so welcome that you won't ever forget your stay and for sure want to come back.The rooms are top in terms of design and quality and have been decorated with very good taste.So is the breakfast and anything else you may be offered. The b&b sits a 10 min bus ride from bisceglie metro station. If you want to jump in and out of your room during the day maybe not the ideal distance from the center. But the owners make up for that by helping you out literally wherever possible and getting you from bisceglie or taking you there. If you are travelling by car, you won't have that issue and in any case it's a highly recommendable b&b. And once you are in the setting of the b&b, you have the feeling of being in a peaceful countryside area. And having that in milan in itself is quite an experience.Paul, From Luxembourg.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being in milan for business a friend suggested me this B&B. All the promises in the description are real, pictures, positions, services etc. Very warm welcome by the Nicoli family who try to make guest feel at home. Rooms are big enough, with private bathroom. Furnitures are a mix of country and modern styles. Bed confortable, and the surroundings are quiet enough to guarantee a good sleep. Breakfast is tasty and abundant, with home made pastry and jams.The B&B is at a walking distance from bus stop, which takes you to Bisceglie metro station in 10 mins. Center town is at less than 30 min away. Very close to highway access, and half hour driving from Fiera Milano Rho.I spent only a couple of days there, but if I will be back this is the place where I will stay. I will suggest this place to friends.
hotelName:
12    B&B Atmosfera di Stagione
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Accessible to public Transport, just a stone throw away from central train station- Airport transfer was a breeze and the room is very homey- Clean and organised. The free breakfast was a bonus with very accommodating staff. The color mood will make you Smile :)
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was clean and quiet spacious. Breakfast was included in our price and was well worth it. Our only problem was the cleaner nether put out toiletries and we had to ring reception twice. I also had to plug the rooms TV in as it seemed some one had unplugged it for some reason. Otherwise a great stay. I didn't give five stars as there is always room for improvement.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel via easyjet holidays. We flew from Gatwick to Milan. Hotel is about an hour via the train from the airport. A single ticket is 13 euros and the train is very safe. Hotel is clean, 6 minutes from Central underground station. We booked the bed and breakfast option. Choices each morning were fair. Cold buffet cereal, toast etc, tea and coffee. Additionally, eggs were available. Most hotel staff speak English and staff are helpful. I felt safe in the hotel. My view from my window was nothing amazing. Rooms are clean and well stocked with toiletries (these are regularly changed) . However, some of the hotel looks a bit tired (carpets and lift only fits about 2-3 people).Near the hotel are a number of restaurants, food at these restaurants is pretty good. Some staff at some of these restaurants are little pushy. I did not like this but most restaurants were really friendly and good value for money. We also visited the city of Turin via the high speed train. People are very nice there and there is lots to see. If you book a few days in advance you can visit Venice or Rome for 40 euros. Guys I had an amazing holiday thank you Hotel Mediolanum Milan. xxx
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near the main station - 8 minute walk , lots of restaurants nearby. Processo in the hotel bar for 12 euros a bottle ! Great supply of eats at aperitifo time . Lovely team who looked after us . Would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights with family to explore Milan. The staff were very helpful and informative, and the location quiet but not far from train station and metro. Ideal for a short stay, nice breakfast too.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited this hotel at the beginning of August and we were delighted with it. Great location about 10 minute walk from Milan Central/Metro Station. The Hotel itself was was very modern and spotlessly clean and the amenities were excellent. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast was very good. You could even borrow bikes at no charge. I would definitely recommend this hotel. If you like cats there is a cat cafe across the road which serves delicious fruit sundae’s
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mediolanum is a 10 min walk from the main station. They checked us in efficiently and the breakfast was also a good spread.The family bedroom was spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The air conditioning worked well and the tap water was drinkable . It's in a quiet neighbourhood but a 20 min walk to the old town.Overall, it was a nice stay.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel Mediolanum is about 8-10 minutes walk from the Milan Central/Metro station.The walk with two suitcases was not too bad. Great modern looking rooms and amenities, and bathroom. The service was excellent. The breakfast choices was great. The coffee was exceptional. The staff and front desk was very pleasant and were able to accommodate some of our last minute changes.The Hotel is in a safe location. Nearby restaurants and grocery stores.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a 4 day break, this hotel is conveniently located just a 5-10 minute walk from the train station. The rooms are modern clean and comfortable and they offer a good breakfast selection. The staff were polite and friendly. There is a good selection of bars and restaurants within the area.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel because it's close to the Milano Centrale and didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised with good location and accommodation and great breakfast to boost. The staffs were very helpful also. Will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for my 40th birthday with my husband.The hotel was lovely, close to transport and amenities so great base to get to Milan Malpensa Airport by train. The staff could not be more helpful or friendly.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off a quick run down of why this hotel is so good. 1. Value for money2. Location - short walk from the train station and a pleasant walk through the park to the city centre3. Great staff4. Plentiful and varied breakfast 5. Nice rooms and general areas6. Some good local restaurants7. Great local bar ‘the monkey bar’Now some detail. The hotel does not cost the earth for what you get. The location is great if don’t mind a stroll, if you want to walk out straight into the tourist hotspots this is not the place, but you’ll not get the price either. The staff were brilliant providing us with invaluable information about the local area and how to get to the lakes. The rooms are great, we had a deluxe one and would recommend paying the extra. Ask for one with a walk in shower and it will be even better. The general areas are clean and quirky also. The restaurants in the local area are good also, although most of the restaurants in Milan are great. The local bar is not to be missed if you like a cocktail, especially if you are opened minded and don’t quite know what you want. All in all this is great option and would not hesitate in going back.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is roughly 12-15 mins walk from the main Milan station which isn't too bad. The staff were very friendly on the inside. The hotel at first has a very 80's feel to it but the rooms are very different. The rooms feel a bit more modern and are a nice layout. Batrooms are a bit on the small side but that is just nit picking. The breakfast was decent but seating is very limited.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hope this information helps.Booked this hotel for 3 reasons: Price, Distance from Central Station and positive reviews and I believe I nailed it.Just got back from 3 days in Milan with Hubby and it met all expectations. The price was on the lower end but within 10 minutes walk of the station. We arrived by shuttle from the airport at the side of the station so to find the hotel, walk to the front -the big apple sculpture on the right, if you look straight on you will see the sign for the Just Hotel , head towards this and keep going down this road. You have a restaurant on the corner, pass and walk road between this and Miscusi Restaurant. You will see sign for the hotel -you need to take the next left and its on your left.So having mentioned the great service, Pasquale via email arranged a birthday surprise for my husband - a birthday bottle of bubbly and a cake from local bakers -lovely - tried to eat the whole cake but even we admitted defeat. Eitherway we were treated very well by all staff, even lent us a plug adaptor when ours refused to work and called us a taxi ( 35 Euros and arrived within a couple of minutes to get to Linate airport.) All staff were polite and can't thank them enough.Our room 210, was spacey, bathroom was fairly big and the bed very comfy, we had a fridge and kettle which made early mornings much easy.Breakfast was great, a good variety and definitely saves cash for you to spend on ice cream later.About the trains/underground - to buy underground tickets you need to go into the station, go down to metro level and find newsagent who sell the tickets. 1 euro 50 each way. Very easy. We also bought our other rail tickets to Lake Como and Tirano ( for Bernina Express) on line as its very easy and you just print out your tickets - no need to exchange - the ticket collectors are happy when you show them the printed copy.One more thing, there is a ATM just around the corner - You'll pass it on way to hotel.I think that's it and it might be helpful.Thanks Hotel Mediolanum and its staff!Caz and Martin
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Efficient staff, spotless quiet room, great breakfast buffet, striking (and pleasant) decor. 10 min walk from the main station. Several bar/restaurants nearby. We had a good stay. All the linen was changed daily - which isn't too green really.Yes, a good base for exploring Milan and beyond. Recommended.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our arrival the staff were welcoming and helpful. Our room was spotlessly clean and spacious. The bathroom was well decorated with a great over the bath shower. The self service breakfast was excellent and plentiful. The location of the hotel was ideal in easy walking distance to the shopping areas and bars and restaurants. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to others
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was less than 10 minutes walk from the central station. I found the location very safe, quiet, and convenient as it was surrounded by many stores and restaurants. Check in and check out were fast. My room was ready by 12:00 noon, so I was allowed to check in early. The hotel had elevators -- very small but they served their purpose.I stayed in a single room for three nights. The room was small but the space was well utilized to accommodate a wide bed (wider than I expected for a single room) that’s very comfortable at the same time. It had a mini-bar, electric kettle, desk, chair, safe, flat screen tv, and mirrors. The room was painted in bright, invigorating colors. The bed linens were clean and pristine white. Wifi was fast. There were several electric outlets, some conveniently located beside the bed, for simultaneous charging of multiple electronic devices. Lighting was very nice. It was a relief to find that the floors were not carpeted. The bathroom size was okay for one person. However, the shower cubicle was too small even for a small person like me. The towels and bathrobe were pristine white. Basic toiletries were supplied. The room was not soundproofed. I did not have problems with boisterous neighbors the entire time I was there but I did hear the opening and closing of doors and moving of furniture in the other rooms.The buffet breakfast, served at the basement, was surprisingly good – several choices of cold cuts, fruits, breads and pastries, fresh juices, yogurt, cheeses, veggies, eggs, coffee. The staff were very courteous, attentive and efficient. Dishes never ran out as they were immediately replenished and there was always a clean table to occupy every time I went down.Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at this hotel. It exceeded my expectations in terms of quality of the room (at very reasonable rates) and staff service. Will not hesitate to book again if I go back to Milan.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern hotel, close to the Milan Centrale train station ( 6 min walk). Comfortable room, with all necessary amenties. Did not get to use the breakfast service as we had a very early checkout. Will stay here again as it is convenient.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a unique and funky hotel with a "fun character". My room was clean and plenty big enough. The windows have electric shades on them for privacy. The breakfast buffet was delicious. It's only about an 8 minute walk to Milan Central Station. It's a very easy walk with having to make only one turn. I would absolutely stay here again. It's very bright and cheery.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for four nights for my wife’s birthday. Hotel manager and staff were very helpful and accommodating, helped us find a room of our choice and couldn’t do enough to ensure that they met all our requests. Gave complimentary bottle of champagne to celebrate. Located near the main central train station and lots of bars / restaurants but 10 min metro to Duomo square / central Milan. Continental breakfast wasn’t great, hot options were limited, but again the staff were very always helpful and friendly.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel within easy reach of the central station. 30 min walk to Duomo or 10 mins on tram/ metro that are nearby. Good restaurants nearby. Very colourful hotel! Rooms very clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet good and coeliac extremely well looked after with great gluten free selection. Staff all friendly and helpful. Would revisit.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A spacious room, very silent, excellent cleaning ,nice and helpful staff, the breakfastbuffé superb. The hotel is situated close to Centralstation for Metro and Shuttlebus to the Airport. We stayed here 4 nights. We are more than satisfied.-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay for a night only. Very convenient to Milan Centrale station. We (2 females) walked at around midnight from station and felt very safe for the approximate 5 minute walk. Check in easy and quick and straight to top floor room. It was a very standard motel room. Small desk area, small wardrobe and bathroom with shower. We had a queen sized bed and it was very comfortable. Enough for 1 night. Minimal street noise and we had a 12pm check out. Breakfast was basic but enough. Additional option of ordering other cooked items at additional cost. Cereals, yogurts, toast, small selection of pastries, juices, cold cuts, cheeses and cold grilled veggies. Would overnight here again, but a week may feel a bit to cosy for me. Great location, clean room and comfy bed.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The position is quite nice, close to the Central train station, out of the restricted car area. Cr valet parking available for 30 € per night. The rooms are quite big , bed comfortable, the hotel need a renovation, but overall my opinion is definitely good
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel close to the Milan railway station and not far from tourist attractions. Spacious room, good breakfast spread, enjoyed our stay. Get day pass for free and hassle free travel by metro, trams and buses.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate my birthday. It was a great choice of hotel. From the moment we walked in and were greeted with a smile and a very speedy and efficient check-in to the time of check-out we were happy with what this hotel offered. A very small bar area but well stocked and a peaceful place for a quiet relax. The reception were always happy to answer our questions and help with maps etc. Very nice room. We asked for a low level which we were given. Very clean and confortable complete with lots of hanging space, a safe, fridge, kettle and good size bathroom. Breakfast was lovely especially the fresh warm bakery items. Great hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay. Hotel is very colorful, comfy, clean and inviting. StaffWas very friendly and service exceptional. Breakfast had a greatSelection. We are happy we chose this hotel, and we would suggest it to anybody who wants to see this beautiful city!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights in a standard double room. Would describe it as a very small double, there was only one bedside table! Clean and comfortable though, the glass box of a bathroom was different!The housekeeping would benefit from a checklist, we had to ask twice for teabags and a loo roll on our last day!All the other staff we interacted with were efficient, especially the two chaps who worked the breakfast service. Happy to bring espressos to the table. The juice at breakfast was AWFUL stuff (we just had to have the Prosecco instead!). Breakfast otherwise was okay.Location of hotel is good, near the Central Station and a few nice restaurants nearby. Would go for a more expensive room if to be staying any longer than a few nights.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay 28th Oct - 2nd Nov. We had a superior room and paid £405 via Agoda . Room 218 was overlooking the road outside - an electric blind kept ot most external noises, sleep quality was very good. WiFi was excellent in all areas.The double bed was very large, extra pillows via reception. Room servicing was excellent. All bathroom fittings were of an excellent quality, although the shower cubicle was on the small side. TV had some English speaking channelsWe took an airport bus from the airport which drops you at the side of Centrale Station. It's a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Centrale is also the nearest Metro station which you will find useful for your city exploring.We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Mediolanum Milan and would recommend it for your stay.The breakfast room is on the lower ground floor, and provides all you need for the day ahead - choises are extensive.I hope you find my review helpful!
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. It was our worst nights in italy. It was difficult for them and they were not happy to carry on our baggage. The room was not bad. The corridors of hotel were like train’s corridors. At the morning 5:30 am suddenly we woke up by terrible noise of crashing lots of glass bottles and also garbage truck. The noise took long for almost 2 hours. We called reception and they told us it is happening on Monday’ morning. So we couldn’t sleep and it ruined all of our day. The only good thing in this hotel was breakfast. Totally I don’t suggest this hotel. It was look like 2 or 3 stars hotel.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located about 15-min walk from Milan central train station. There are many hotels in the area. Hotel room is small, but maybe this is not uncommon in the expensive city like Milan. There are many interesting artpieces in the hotel which make the ambiance a bit funny.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greeted nicely by the staff at the front desk. Introduced to the city of Milan and how to get to the popular destination with the cheapest methods. Taxi services are available from the front desk which makes traveling very easy at this hotel. The rooms are abit old with some damp smell though. Hope they improve on this.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite a big mismatch between marketing and reality. I found it very basic against the price and the commercial, not practical for business, with a not working WiFi - at least on the day of my stay - that generated delay and inconveniences.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were highly disappointed with this hotel. We were travelling with a small child and the room that we got given was not very practical at all for a family. The hotel forgot to put a cot out and when asked about it the reception staff’s response was that we would get it for free. That was not the point at all as it was part of our booking already, the staff member provided no apology instead perceived that providing the item for free would make up for it. It just seemed that everything was such an inconvenience. The breakfast staff were polite and very helpful. The hotel in general had a strange feel more like a upper class backpackers rather than a four star hotel. I certainly wouldn’t stay there again, as they made us feel very unwelcome.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are staying here for 3 nights and very impressed. Room is comfortable and quiet. Hotel decor is very clean with lovely bright colours. It has a welcoming feel. The breakfast is delicious. I would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for five nights and were very pleased with our stay....the room was large and comfortable; staff was friendly, attentive and helpful...and breakfast was very good. We also had drinks in the bar and ordered food from there one evening as we were too tired to go out looking for a restaurant. The food was delicious. The hotel is really well located to Centrale Train Station - 5 minute walk as well as a short walk to the Metro and the tram stops.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a 4 night stay here with my daughter. Hotel was chosen because of proximity to station centrale (easy 5 minute walk) and option of chromotherapy room as something a bit different from usual bland beige hotel colour schemes. The room was a good size and very comfy beds and very clean. The staff were pleasant and always on hand to help with questions. Mini fridge allowed room for our own water and a few other items. There was a kettle and tea/coffee provided in room - staff willingly supplied extra milk when asked. Breakfast was good, though juices could have been better quality and not much hot food (mostly cold savoury items for continental palates) - you had to pay extra for fried eggs. However, there was plenty there to keep us going for the day. Hotel is very near to main shopping street of Buenos Aires and several metro stations. About a 20 minute walk to Duomo.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 2 nights at the start of our 2 week holiday travelling italy. Fantastic reception staff welcomed to the hotel. Offered help with our luggage and also provided a bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary! Lovely clean rooms, great bathroom which was very modern! Tea/coffee facilities and a fridge provided. Breakfast was quite basic but good to start the day with. Overall a great hotel, great location 10 mins from centrale station and metros.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel. Helpful, friendly, polite staff who speak several languages well. Food was diverse and good. The location was quite central. The rooms were clean (even the showers) and well-stocked with coffee, tea, etc. RECOMMENDED.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I had. Very pleasant overnight stay at Hotel Mediolanum. Great value for money and the room was much roomier than we were expecting. Great location a 5 minute walk from metro stations and Milano Centrale. Staff were very helpful and also arranged a late checkout for us with no drama.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved my stay at Hotel Mediolanum. It is super close to Milano Centrale and the staff is really nice and friendly. The breakfast buffet has a lot to offer and the room/bathroom were quite comfortable as well. The location is great too! The hotel is far (but not too far) from touristy areas like Duomo and I found that quite relaxing. The only thing I would recommend/request is better soundproofing in the rooms. I could hear everything happening in the hallway (doors opening/closing, cleaning staff, footsteps, conversations etc.) as well as the garbage truck outside my window that sadly came very early Monday morning.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly people at reception upon arrival and throughout stay. Nice modern room with enough free space. Breakfast room is a bit tiny, but nice. Breakfast is very nice with different things to choose.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property was a little tough to find late a night simply because the street signs are on the sides of the buildings and our google maps was on the fritz. However, a couple hotel concierges along the route were kind enough to guide us in the right direction. The room was spacious, bed comfortable, it has AIR CONDITIONING plus you could open the windows. The bathroom was comfortable with Bigelow shampoo etc., bidet. The morning breakfast was lovely with a good selection. Our only regret is not realizing there is a great set up each day for 'happy hour'. Snacks set up and the bar tended so you could just chill out in your own hotel. We highly recommend the restaurant around the corner called Osteria Italiana just around the corner. Excellent pizza, cold beer and the seafood fettuccine is the best I have EVER tasted. Perfect al dente pasta and the plentiful seafood is all perfectly cooked.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel because of the centra location and easy access to several subway lines and restaurants. I really enjoyed my staying at the hotel. The street is very quiet and the room as well. I was impressed by the staff hospitality and dedication. I got my room in 20 seconds, real customer-first approach: "Here is the key, go check your room. You can collect your passport later". All hotels should do this. Also, all is very colorful, not the typical sterile chain-hotel design. I will definitely come back next time I need a room in Milan.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable 4 star hotel, less than 5 minutes walk from centrale stazione. The walk is short enough for an easy roll from the train to the hotel, but far enough to be away from the seediness of the station and its immediate surrounds. The Mediolanum is a quiet, pleasant residential area with several nearby restaurants. The hotel is comfortable, helpful and friendly staff, and has all you need for a short stay. The rooms are compact, especially the bathroom, which would not work for a larger person. A bidet has been squished in next to the toilet, and only a smaller person can easily navigate past the oversized basin to use the toilet. The included breakfast was plentiful with lots of options. It was surprisingly quiet at night. All in all, a good choice for a short stopover in Milan if you are travelling by train. If you are staying longer, I would recommend you stay around the Piazza Duomo. It’s a 25 minute walk to Duomo from the Mediolanum.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient for travellers arriving or departing Milan by train. Reasonable walk approx 30 mins to heart of city, metro close buy for those who do not wish to walk. Good local cafes and restaurants, helpful staff and good breakfast provided.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good choice for a hotel near Milan Centrale train station. It truly is a seven minute walk from the station, but the trick is to have excellent directions or that seven minutes can escalate real fast. Clean room with a comfy queen bed, mini fridge, safe. Not sure if it was me, but I would question the air conditioning at night as the room did get warm. As for the breakfast, go hungry, leave stuffed. Decent restaurants in the neighborhood. Very good stay for a night or two.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Mediolanum on a recent girls’ holiday. There were 4 of us and the hotel was perfect for our few days in the city. The location was fine. We had a pleasant 20min walk into the city centre. The staff were all welcoming friendly and helpful. The rooms were colourful, comfortable and clean. I loved the colourful quirkiness of the place. The breakfasts served in the cosy breakfast room were excellent. My only minor criticism was that we needed to keep asking for milk and tea bags as these didn’t seem to get topped up. But once asked for they were provided promptly. I would recommend the hotel. And don’t forget to sample the jelly sweets on the reception desk - very fruity! I would also recommend the restaurant ‘Jumping’ just over the road. We had a great meal there.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had the time of my life!!! Good food good hospitality good service@....nice rooms lovely collection of paintings like a art Nouveau hotel brand new and much more Lovely view from the room bank includedNice locationNice peopleBella Italy
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely clean hotel. 10 mins walk from central train station and close to tram links to duomo. Staff are so friendly and were really helpful with maps and what metros to use. No question was a bother. Staff on hand 24 hrs.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is not too far from Milan central station. 5 to 10 mn walk to M2 line. The Hotel is Clean and recently refurbished. Staff is very helpful. Rooms are ok, but noise from other rooms could be a problem. Breakfast is very good with plenty of choice.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights and I must say how delighted we were with the room and the service. We chose the hotel because of the proximity to the Milano Centrale station as it was only a 7-10 min walk. Breakfast was included and it was very good with plenty of choice. A great stay
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice, average every day hotel, nothing to get excited about but nothing to be worried about either, Simple hotel, simple rooms. i stayed only one night but left thinking, for business in the area, its a clean room and a okay place to sleep, shower was a bath tub with a shower handle,
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 3 night stay at the Mediolanum was brilliant. The staff were welcoming when we arrived and we were quickly checked in ready to make the most of our short break.Due to the hotel’s location, we were able to get anywhere we wanted to go quickly - it’s just a 5-10 minute walk to the central train station with Metro links.The included breakfast offered a good selection, mostly continental style, but some warm options too. The coffee with breakfast was amazing. It’s true what they say about Italian coffee - wherever you go it’ll be great!The room was comfortable and adequately sized, but the ensuite could be a little bigger as the toilet was right up against the wall, with barely enough leg room in front so if you’re tall you may have to sit sideways. If you’re looking to travel light, the range of products in the room was enough that you’d only need to bring a couple of bits with you.We had a great stay and would recommend the hotel for couples and professionals.
hotelName:
13    Hotel Mediolanum Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the staff was very nice and the service very high. The rooms were good with well functioning air conditioning. The breakfast was good and there were good with good opportunities. The internet was very fast and worked grea
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have enjoyed a 4 night stay at this hotel in order to attend a wedding and to do some sight seeing. We have been exceptionally pleased with many aspects of the hotel. It’s location is very convenient. The Lima metro station is just metres from the hotel door. The M1 Metro line connects directly with a number of metro stations next to popular tourist spots e.g. the Museum of Modern Art (w the Duomo and associated features and the impressive Castello. One change on the metro from the M1 on to the M2 takes you directly to the canal area with its many bars, restaurants and market stalls. Metro fares are very reasonable, for all the main areas a 2€ standard ticket lasts for 90 minutes (in zone 1 to 3) and for 7€ a day ticket can be used anywhere in zone 3 any number of times all day. The hotel is close to the central station. A 20 minute walk in a straight line from the station or a five minute taxi (about 8 €) There are also some very nice shops within short walking distance from the hotel. The hotel itself is sparkling clean and our room in the fourth floor was excellent, beautifully furnished and appointed and cleaned scrupulously every morning. Breakfast was good, the usual fruit, yogurt, cheeses, ham, rolls pastries etc etc. There are a number of restaurants and pizzerias nearby for an evening meal including the characterful Piccolo Ischia Pizzeria. Reception staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and well informed. For a weekend break in Milan you can't do better.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Except for the fact we arrived in a heat wave which put undue pressure on the AC we cannot fault this hotel. Staff. Food. Value. Location all great. Only suggestion is they should offer beer in the bar.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel a total of 5 nights and were very happy with the accommodation, service, breakfast etc. The staff was very helpful whether it was holding our bags, getting us a taxi or finding us a restaurant at the last minute. The location is excellent...walking distance to just about any of the local sites. Would definitely stay here again. The only downside I might say is that because you are on a main street, it can be very noisy at night...but coming from NYC, it really didn't bother me.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were pleasantly surprised when we checked into this hotel for the night before our flight home to Australia. The staff behind reception could not do enough for us especially Alberto who carried our heavy cases up the 8 stairs to the elevator and down again in the morning. Our room was large king bed and heaps of room to put our cases probably the largest room we have experienced over the last three weeks. The air con worked well. Another lovely surprise was tea and coffee facility in our room and bottled water. Down at reception there is a coffee machine you can use any time free of charge and a bowl of fruit a nice touch. We were given a welcome drink voucher to use which we did but did not expect all the lovely nibbles to go with it. The choice of red, white or proseco was offered. Breakfast was more than adequate. I would not hesitate to recommend staying at this hotel, it is in a good area for shopping and only a ten minute walk to Milan Centrale.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 4 night stay here was an absolute pleasure. The staff at Reception were outstanding in their welcome, assistance with sightseeing plans, and general support. Massimo in particular was able to get us booked into a Last Supper Tour at the last minute, something we’d previously given up on after many attempts on websites in the previous couple of weeks. We were thrilled! He also recommended local eateries which turned out to be fantastic, gave us ideas of other places we could visit here and in other parts of Italy, and was patient and fun as we put our limited Italian to the test. The breakfasts were great - lots of healthy and tempting choices with attentive, friendly and staff who reached out to our needs. Kristina willingly made great decaffeinated coffee, the best we’ve ever tasted! Our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, and we enjoyed our free welcome drink in the foyer, a lovely way to meet other travellers and visitors to Milan. The lift was an asset for us as senior travellers, and having the Lima Metro station close by was a real bonus, making travel to the Duomo area only minutes away. We’d have no hesitation in returning to this hotel, and feel as though, on departure, we’re leaving family!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Best western was short but perfect. The hotel was so easy to find as it is well situated, next to a station and 4 stops from Duomo. We were a group of three, we accidentally booked the wrong offer but when we got to the reception they were able to accommodate us. The room was big, very airy and clean. The bathroom was spotless and had enough towels and toiletries. The internet connection was really fast. The staff at the reception were really lovely and polite. Only downside it got really cold at night and we weren’t able to adjust the heating in the room as this gets switched off at night but they were able to provide us with additional clean blankets. The breakfast was amazing had some great options and the staff in the restaurant were lovely too. We over slept so we checked out 30mins late but they were patient with us. Our over all experience was amazing.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is near Lima metrostation so quick connection to centre. Hotel isn’t to big but has everything you need; free WiFi, good and cheap (4euro) breakfastbuffet with decent choices, nice little roofterrace for a sunsetview and a tiny gym with one machine and indoor and outdoorshower! Stayed in a 1 personroom. Size was ok, efficiënt lay-out so enough room for my stuff. Room comes with fridge/minibar and tea/ coffee facilities. Tv-channels in several languages. Bathroom also oke with toiletries, bidet, and bathtub/shower. Free bottle of water is included on arrival. Several, mostly italian, restaurants around. Located 15minute walk from central station. Would definatly consider it again on a return trip.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, spotless renovated room (comfy bed) on the 7th floor (balcony) with a brand new bathroom featuring a huge mirror in the rainfall shower.The breakfast offers a great choice of classic items (scrambled eggs, sausages, a nice selection of cheese and cold meats, pastries, croissants, yogurts, fruits etc.) as well as pizza, pie, veggies, olives and pancakes! For 3€, this breakfast is just incredible... You choose this hotel for its location but you will go back for the people.Eliana was extremely kind and compassionate during my stay (I was in Milano in sad circumstances). She also provided me with useful info anytime I needed it. Massimo I briefly saw before I left was very nice as well. Actually, anyone I met there during my stay was nice and courteous. I will definitely choose the Best Western City for my future trips to Milano and I have already recommended it to my friends.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located on a major shopping street in Milan. It is surrounded by stores, restaurants and cafes, and only one short block from a subway station. Room was clean and comfortable with excellent beds having a walk-in shower (bonus..no water on floor). Staff are helpful and all are friendly. Breakfast is very inexpensive (3€), has a variety of hot and cold foods and is not to be missed. While there isn't a restaurant, there is room service in the early evening that is very affordable with tasty selections. While the street is noisy, our room had double glazed windows and a shutter that you could close. Suggest reserving room with a balcony to observe the street scene. Tip: Get to know the subway system to reach city attractions. Cost is 1.5€ a trip and saves hours of walking. Actually simply to use.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Medium size City Hotel is conveniently located in heart of shopping Area on Buenos Aires Street in Milan... Located relatively close to beautiful Central Station..Convenient either you coming or leaving by plane (bus for/from airport Malpensa) or directly by train, this Hotel is located 950 metres only or by 7 minutes walk, 5 minutes by bus (#60) or 3 minutes by taxi (10 Euro ). Only 100 meters from Subway..Walking distance to some attractions, like Porto Venezia, museums and parks, less than 1.7 km (25 min walk) of center, like Dome, Scala, Galleria...Outside appearance is nice..Modern, blue glass buildings look. Inside, neat, clean and quite, acclimatized, small but effective reception, but with no seating and resting area.. Small but working elevator (1-2 person + luggage), with 7-8 stairs up from reception..(Not convenient if you have heavy luggage or disabled). Very slow, but no long waiting.. Very helpful receptionists, kind stuff. Fast check in..Receptionist kindly gave coupons for complimentary drinks. Very nice on such a hot day.. Thanks Massimo...Rooms are neat, quite and clean, nice looking with all amenities, beside standard, like free Wi-Fi, safe, fridge.. Cold AC was already on..Which made very pleasant and calming experience after outside heat..Complimentary water, coffee, tea, etc.. Cold drinks in fridge are for charge. We were on 6th floor with huge window, street view but inside was quite.Bathroom, in white tiles and clean, plenty of fresh and neatly organized towels, changed daily. Complimentary shampoos and soaps, convenient bide, Couple of cons..No bathroom fan inside..Strange.. And, you know, that might be "..Naturally unpleasant.." sometimes..Hair dryer did not work, but no big deal..I could ask for other one.. Floor metal plate was displaced..However I saw renovated bathroom in another room. Cleaning lady said they working slowly on renovation throughout so future guests might enjoy much better new bathrooms. We did not have included Breakfast, so after offered for 3 Euro we accepted. Good deal..Breakfast was fine and worthy of that money. Good breakfast with plenty of food, with something for anyone.I recommend one.Breakfast Room on 1st floor was nice and clean, always neatly settled, not much rush inside.
