Stuff was neat, clean and uniformed, very kind and with warm greeting when you come and leave.Only thing that bothers me here, Stuff was starting closing too early.They work up to 10, but they start closing at 9:45, cleaning, making noise by bringing out spoons, mugs, glasses, moving around, taking out some of food, making me feel unwanted and bit nervous. If you come late, like I am, your choice of food getting limited. Beside those small cons I had, I would approve 3.5 - 4 stars (because of size, small reception and elevator), but location, comfortable stay of 4 nights, and other things as well as always smiley and helpful stuff made it up and was all right. I will be back and I can recommend this hotel..So enjoy...and have a nice hotel.. :)
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay here most years as part of a Monza F1 weekend. Its in a good location on 10mins walk from Milan Central. It's basic, but it does the job. Ok breakfast. Clean and comfortable. Will be back again.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Western Hotel City is situated near the railway station, only 15-20 minutes on foot (so you don't even need a taxi from Express train), but not so near to be surrounded by railway sounds, of course. It is situated in Corso Buenos Aires - large street with lots of shops, restaurants and cafes. I liked everything about this hotel! Very clean rooms, excellent breakfasts (do not hesitate to have them), very friendly staff. Absolutely advise to everybody who wants to explore Milan.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice comfortable rooms! spacious bathrooms, nice breakfast. One of the receptionists has a terrible attitude and smoked at the door all the time. That was probably the only glitch. It’s nicely located very close to subway stations and stores and restaurants.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel in some 15-minutes walk from the train station, and directly by the metro-station Piazza Lima. I was traveling alone and got a single-room with a balcony, rather small but comfortable. Good breakfast, helpful staff, possibility for baggage-storing during the day, good ratio between quality and price.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel . Great location. Rooms clean and well appointed. Walkable distance to many interesting sights. Shopping great. Hotel is close to train station. Lots of lovely spots to eat . Close to Metro.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a delightful stay at a delightful, friendly, professional and clean hotel. The hotel is very centrally located close to the Central Train Station (either a 15 minute walk or 5 minute taxi ride) in a fantastic shopping street and a 20-25 minute walk away from the Duomo di Milano. We were greeted warmly and offered hot drinks and pastries on our arrival. After dropping off our luggage and freshening up in our spotlessly clean room we were then offered a free welcome drink of Prosecco and nibbles. For an extra 3 Euros per person we had a delicious and endless buffet breakfast. You cannot fault this hotel - extremely friendly, helpful staff, clean facilities, great wifi. We are happy to recommend this hotel and hope to stay again. Thank you
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even for an economy class hotel it lacks a lot. Although very new the hotel it didn’t have A/C working. Come on! Paid more than 3 hundred euros and had to sleep with windows open and surrounded by mosquitoes?!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had everything I wanted - it was within walking distance of our drop-off point at Milan Central station, it was easily walkable to the main sights, it was a good price and it served breakfast. On top of that, the room was a decent size and was in good condition, and the staff were helpful. Its on one of the main shopping streets in Milan, and this made the walk into the centre more interesting. I'd definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good weekend break at the Hotel City. The room was not huge but very clean and comfortable. The staff on reception were very helpful and friendly. Excellent breakfast. A good location for getting around the city. Recommended
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wasn't a Trip Advisor person until lately. But this BW really is nice. I loved the fact that there was a lot of shopping on this street. The staff was nice. I was there 10/2016. There's a great restaurant next door. I might stay downtown if I ever go again.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel in the main shopping Street Buenos Aires. Bedroom and bathroom clean and large. Tasty international breakfast. Good parking service. Great position near the metro stop. Staff very kind and helpful.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is right on the Corso Buenos Aires so in a good location for high street shopping. The entrance is tucked away in an arcade so it's quite easy to miss. The room I was given was a very decent size with a huge bed. The decor was probably from the early 2000s and was a bit rough around the edges. The sink unit was very large and took up so much room that you had to use the loo sideways. The towels were thin and my shower leaked all over the bathroom floor. On the upside, breakfast was only €3 which for a hotel in central Milan is crazily cheap.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance to the train station. Not too far from the main attractions of the city. First night wasn’t brilliant, the subway is so loud at night we struggled to sleep, we asked to move the morning after and they had no problems moving us, we felt they actually upgraded us also but this was possibly just coincidence. Bed good. AC Good. Food Good.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was clean and pleasant. The room was bright and very quiet at night even through our room faced the main road. The bed was large and comfy. The towels were great. Maybe the only thing is the size of the shower. It is a bit small, it was fine for me but if you are a large person it might not work for you. The breakfast was very good with a large selection to choose from. The manager made his presence know to us and he was very pleasant and accommodating. All in all I would recommend this place to my friends. You access the main door off the main street down a small walk way. There is a lighted sign on the main street with a arrow pointing you in the right direction. I say this as the cab driver did not see it but we did.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently situated on a very busy shopping street in the heart of Milan, but the outside noise doesn't really bother you as the hotel has soundproofed its rooms, at least we were not disturbed by it on the 5th floor. It is within 30 to 40 minutes level walk to the centre of Milan. We arrived here late morning and were not allowed to check in until 2pm, though it appeared other people arriving were checking in - can it be just our room that wasn't ready? Our room was comfortable and clean but the bathroom was very small with a toilet that was very temperamental and a tiny shower cubicle with flimsy doors that kept falling apart. The shower fittings were also badly situated - each time you tried to move in the shower, the handle was knocked stopping the water completely. Breakfast was ok - large selection to choose from but I personally don't like eggs bathing in water or chopped up bits of frankfurter. The staff were not overly friendly either, only speaking to you if they had to, with the exception of Alberto on reception who showed more courtesy. Beware if you have mobility problems too - to reach the lift, you have to climb a flight of stairs and the lift itself is also a tiny space suitable for a maximum of 3 people.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for sightseeingAlittle tricky for our taxi driver & us to spot though as entrance is inside a shopping arcadeLovely touch of a free welcome drink in the evening in the lobby area & nibblesBreakfast good for continentalSofa's alittle shabby in lobby for a 4* hotel Lift can only take 3 people alittle squashed when you have your luggage.Bathrooms could have been designed alittle better as our toilet was behind the door, rooms clean & good room service menu.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is okay, you can say it's cosy, rooms are quite small unless you get a suite. Overall very clean and breakfast is very good.Best thing about his hotel is the location, in the mid of the busy Corso Buenos Aires, a shopping hub, also it is about 20 min walking to Milano Central Station. There is also a metro stop very near to the hotel.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- excellent location. Easy walking distance from Milan central (both trains and busses from the airport stop there)- Lima metro station a minute away- good location. Lots more of shops and places to eat nearby- breakfast is incredible value at only 3EUR per person per night- spacious clean comfortable and quiet rooms- complimentary welcome drinks and snacks- great service from the staffCons:Nothing to note here. Would be very happy to return.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It takes a hour on the train from the airport to milan central. We walked to the hotel from the central train station and it took about 15 minutes. On arrival were were offered a free welcome drink and given keys to our room on the 4th floor overlooking the road. We did not find the road noisy except for a couple of loud motorcycles. The air con had been on and it was nice and cool. The bed was large and super comfy and room size was as expected with a bathroom with well stocked toiletries. Breakfast was amazing for just £3 each! Lots of choice with a small hot offering. You could not find better in the whole of Milan! You also have free coffee/hot chocolate available in the small bar all day long with free croissants. Reception staff really helpful. The lift is small but we only used it to get our cases up and down to the room. The metro stopped almost outside - the red line - and Lima stop. You can get a full day pass for£4.50 if you wish. We walked everywhere, the cathedral Dumo took us 25 mins and the castle another 10 on top. We walked 13 miles on both the full days we were there. We found that food was a lot cheaper outside of the main tourist areas. One restaurant offered a 1 litre of coke for 18 euros!! As for Milan, well it's not a patch on other cities and not much to see apart from shops and graffiti. The hotel was great and would be happy to recommend but as for Milan, we won't be back in a hurry. Go to Prague, Berlin or Amsterdam, sorry Milan!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Selected this hotel based on central location and price.Arrived in Milan in the morning - no problem to have your luggage stored before you can check-in. Hotel itself has no parking you will be directed to a nearby parking garage. about 5 min walking distance.Concierge/Check-in Staff is friendly and helpful. First problem you have to conquer after check in - the elevator - to small for 3 people and luggage, so someone has to walk to the 5 floor. Note the elevator will become a "bigger problem" in the morning when everybody goes to breakfast and wants to check out - prepare for some waiting.ROOM - well the first room we got [family room 3 beds] had an A/C problem - water dripping from the sealing - since the elevator was now occupied by cleaning staff - walk down 5 floors, complain - no problemo, hotel staff arranged right away for new rooms. Now we have 2 rooms for the same price - single and double same floor.Checking the air condition -> no sign of operation -> all right, walking all the floors down - complain - explanation power problem will be fixed later. OK - lets first conquer Milan. Coming back in the evening - A/C still not running, new staff downstairs, no idea what i'm talking about - so sorry. Well so much about the A/C for a hot summer night in the city.Breakfast is a bargain for the money paidOverall and with a smile - the hotel is OK for 1 night with no A/CIf you stay longer you want to get this fixed
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located on the main shopping street, Corso Buenos Aires, and less than a minute's walk to the Lima stop on the metro red line, the location is really great and you can make your way around the city from this central location. Surrounded by shops, restaurants and bars it was great for going out in the evenings. The breakfast was standard mainland European but was nice and they did have a few hot options to choose from too. The bar/lobby area was small enough but really nice and the service provided by hotel staff was quite exceptional. The elevator is very small (Fits maybe 3 people, or 2 with small suitcases), so most of the time we would take the stairs... Simply because it was quicker than waiting.Also with a street facing room, the traffic noise can be pretty loud when a door or window is open, when closed this wasn't an issue as the soundproofing was really good, we generally used the A/C and had no problems. I really enjoyed our stay here and I would definitely return!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was quite small but good enough for 2 people to share. Space is not generous in terms of storage and relaxation. Centrally located within shops and close to everything. Plenty of eateries to choose from nearby.Breakfast room was good size. Good service. I would have liked to see an extra water dispenser (i.e. hot water for tea/coffee). There was only one hot drink station and only 2 people could use it at a time. When it got busy there was less supply of hot water. Hot flask readily available for tea on busy times could do the trick. One downside to my stay was I encountered a problem bringing more than 2 people in my room. I had guests reconnecting from childhood days and happened to be living in Milan. I appreciated it may be to do with hotel policy but it was quite of a disappointment as I would have preferred to move less. I was recovering from tiredness and did not want to rush to go out. Simply because my guest and her daughter were not allowed in.We were given a complimentary voucher for a welcome drink to consume whenever we were ready, Which was nice. Over all my stay was comfortable.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel as a best average of price, distance to center and what it had to offer and i was not disappointed. Close to metro, located on a good street for shopping. Clean and everything in general was up to par. Ps. Breakfast was only 3 euro more and was very worthwhile. Dont miss it!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I checked in on April 17 AM and left on the next day. Room was equipped with a little kettle that did not work. I brought to Alberto, the Manager & he assured that I'll have one replacement shortly. I was kind of skeptical, but within 5 minutes when I went back to my room - a lady came with a replacement!I was also offered a nice yummy bread loaf when I told him of my hunger:)And btw - breakfast room is really cozy and food is well presented and nice!What I did not like was room was facing a block of apartment that can see right into the room. Water in bath was also not running properly.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is at a very central location! Near central station and about 20 min walk to Piazza Duomo. The staff is very friendly and willing to help anytime. Clean! The breakfast has a really good variety for every taste. Recommended!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I rarely find myself having to take to Trip Advisor however after attempting twice to make contact with this hotel after my visit; I am. Nothing wrong with the hotel or general service. Bathroom problems were fixed after a bit of perseverance. Great central location. One of the best breakfasts for the money to be found. However; I urge future guests to check very carefully any taxi arrangements made by or through the hotel; specifically for cost. I'm an experienced traveller but I was still stung when I booked a taxi thro reception and ended up paying almost 4 times the going rate. I've emailed the hotel directly to enquire why I wasn't informed of the excessive charges but no one has replied. If the manager would care to get in touch or reply to both of my emails then I'd welcome that. In the meantime; just check fares and bookings made thro the hotel very carefully.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three days. The hotel was located on Corso Buenos Aires and a lot of shopping and restaurants were to be found nearby. The room was very nice and clean. The breakfast was good, offering yoghurt, cereals, eggs, croissants, bread and fruit. Nice and helpful staff. Overall a very good experience!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its an excellent hotel the personal and the manager are very friendly and it is a very animal friendly hotel. The hotel is very central. The Breakfast is good and the rooms are clean and quiet. The rooms are big. The metro station is near the hotel.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with great location at the Corso Buenos Aires. In the middle of shopping and restaurants. We had a nice big room with a little balcony. Very welcoming and helpfull staf in the reception area. Free wifi in the rooms. Nice breakfast. Only minus is that you can hear everything from the corridor, the walls are not sound prof. Alt in all a great experience.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really like this hotel. Rooms are very spacious and comfortable. Bathrooms are also very big and the bath is a bonus. The room was spotless and very well maintained. Breakfast is very good with plenty of options. Staff at reception and in the breakfast area were very friendly and helpful. I stayed here on a previous trip and was happy to book it again for this trip as I liked it so much. I hope to return on my next visit to Milan. The hotel is very convenient for the Metro and is about a 20 minute walk from Stazione Centrale.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, clean hotel at a good location. Only 50 meters from the metro station Lima, from where you can be by the metro at Duomo, city center, in about 7 minutes.At the doorstep of the hotel is the biggest commercial road, Corso Buenos Aires,the OXford Street of Milan, where you can do your shopping.Staff was kind, breakfast also good with great variety.Highly recommend this hotel, I would stay again.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel for a long weekend with family. Recently we had a positive experience with Best Western hotels. And this one was not an exception, it even exceeded our expectations. Very clean rooms, hotel close to metro station, service at reception very accurate and proactive, but not too much. We will certainly return when in Milano. Thanks for making our stay a very good one.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best Western City Hotel offers quiet, clean and comfortable accommodation in a city where money seems to be no object, especially when it comes to fashion. the staff are friendly and willing to help. the breakfast buffet is typically European and provides a great start for the day. It is within easy walking distance of the fashion centre and historical sites.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a great location for transportation and sightseeing! It is located at the heart of the city and on one of the popular and live street of Milan. Great customer service and friendly stuff. Hotel manager Omer Bey is very kind and professional. Comfortable, clean rooms. Breakfast is amazing. I highly recommend this hotel during your stay in Milan.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience here was ok. Not bad, not great. Good comfy bed and spacious room. A jug was provided with ample free tea and coffee (not always a given in parts of Europe!).Breakfast was plentiful. The continental parts were great with lots of fresh fruit but the cooked elements (bacon and scrambled eggs) always looked dry and unappetising. Shower was old and the sliding door a little broken. Reception staff were obliging and friendly enough but it kind of felt like they were just 'going through the motions' and we were just another set of guests to check in. Having said that though, the breakfast buffet staff were very friendly! Overall it was ok. Very pricy but that was probably due to the location. It felt old and tired.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here with my husband for 2 nights. The hotel is only a 10 minute walk from the train station which was handy. Hotel was really nice! Breakfast room was lovely and well stocked. Room was very clean along with the bathroom. Free wifi and safe usage was a bonus. Quite a reasonably priced mini bar in room too. We were surprised that our room had a terrace which was lovely to relax on! Staff were friendly and very helpful, giving advice on trips out etc. The only downside was the small lift which took ages to call as it served whole hotel which had 7 floors! Sometimes it was quicker to walk to the 7th floor! Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here with my wife and 20yr old son, July 2-5, 2016 and loved it. Great location, 20meters to the metro. It was very clean and the room was very large. Breakfast was awesome as well, hardly what I would call continental as each morning there was a great selection of meat, cheeses, brioche, fruits, cereals, yogurts, pancakes, eggs and bacon! The staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations. The bathroom was very large and clean and the maids were very efficient. They take the towel conservation as well. As we normally hang the towels on the hooks provided, if you don't throw them on the floor (as per the sign) the maids will not change them. However, as soon as we called for new towels we received them without delay. Great place, great price. If we get back to Milan we will definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling on my own, I was a little worried, but it turned out it was an excellent find. It's only a 15min walk from Milano Centrale, and a 20min walk to the Duomo. My room was at the back of the hotel so it was blissfully quiet, and even though it was a single room, it wasn't as 'cosy' as I was expecting. Clean and modern throughout. The staff were lovely and friendly, and ever so helpful, and adding breakfast turned out to be a bargain. My only complaint, and it's not even a complaint as it didn't apply to me but it may be problematic for others, is the lift is a little small! Other than that, I'd definitely stay there again, and recommend to others.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Milan during Champions League. City was crowded. Booked late on ? Website. Did nt look around enough so got absolutely fleeced.Thought with Best Western you get a reliable chain but it's an Independant / franchised so can charge what they want.Will be very carefull again. Charged 6x normal rate. Disgrace but I the mug.Staff friendly and helpful, very centrally situated, but Website has it in a different part of city so diff to find. ( as at best it is a 3 star , so does nt stand out - but clean).Would not go there again.Thank you
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel suited our needs. It is standard international chain hotel, the kind you like or don't according to your personal taste. Room was good size, quiet, facing away from street, spotless as was the bathroom. The breakfast was top class, good fresh fruit and cheese, hot croissants excellent coffee - with a terrific, vigilant, 2-woman team making sure that everything was replenished before it ran out completely, tables cleared efficiently. All calmly and quietly. The lift is tiny, and you have to climb a few steps to access it so that would be a difficulty for a person with walking disability. Otherwise,
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is not the kind of hotel we like to book because we would prefer little accommodations with a  character. But this is just a personal preference.The City hotel is nice, clean, nice room and you can feel that there is a management strongly customer oriented.
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here from 3rd to 9th March as part of our 3-wk European holiday/honeymoon. We had chosen to stay here because of its' close proximity to the metro and that it is along one of the bustling streets that has shopping and eateries. It is also a good 20-25 minutes of walk to the Duomo Milan cathedral.The location came up to be one of the best for us.The breakfast selection was average but it wasn't bad. Nothing over the top. They had eggs and a selection of croissants. There were meat too for those non-vegetarian & non-Muslims to enjoy. We don't expect much anyway considering this hotel as one of the budget stays.The room had a very tiny kettle for about 500ml of water which we felt should be upgraded to a 1000ml of kettle. It is rather inconvenient making hot drinks when we have to boil it again & again. The tea & coffee sachets provided for us were certainly useful though.The bed was big enough for the 2 of us, and we slept really well throughout our stay. This is great despite having our rooms facing the street. Our other gripe was that it gets too hot in the room (considering that we are Singaporeans & we come from a country which is generally 30-degC thoughout the year!) and we had to open the balcony doors a few times at night to cool ourselves down. But it's not something that will stop us from selecting to stay in this hotel again if we come to Milan next time.Access to wifi should be improved. We had to constantly request for a "ticket" to get a new username/password every 24 or 48 hours during our stay. They don't have the normal free wifi where you access via given username/password once. Best Western may need to look into this. It's quite inconvenient having to keep asking for new "tickets" when we are in the middle of planning our trips on our mobile or laptops.Other than the few gripes, it was a lovely and comfortable stay at a convenient location!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has nice rooms and good location. Breakfast is nice but gets boring after couple of days. There's one lovely male staff that works the breakfast room and is very friendly. Housekeeping staff are friendly but reception staff not as much. There is one lovely friendly lady called eleina on reception that works normally in the day, she is very helpful. The men staff not as friendly. There's not much to do at the hotel but there's plenty of shopping around. It's also very very close to Lima metro stop which is very convenient. There's also a small supermarket and tabacci shop close by. Good location of hotel for short shopping trip!
hotelName:
14    Best Western Hotel City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel to be greeted by builders at work and a very apologetic owner. The work should have been finished, but they were overrunning by about a month. The newly installed lift had teething problems and we were forced to walk up the cluttered staircase to our 4 floor room. First impressions of the hotel were not good. The room was a modest size, clean and comfortable and had recent been re-equipped. We stayed for 3 nights and each day parts of the hotel became accessible and new furniture appeared. At the end of our stay the reception looked reasonably complete and the basement breakfast room was up and running. All credit to the management, who kept the place running in difficult conditions, they were above and beyond the call of duty to be helpful. When completed this hotel is going to be very nice indeed. Close to 2 metro stations, just a couple of stops from Duomo or a 15 min walk.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luckily for us the renovations at the hotel are almost finished. We had a "penthouse" room on the 8th floor and the elevator only went to the 7th so the concierge insisted on carrying our luggage up the final floor for us. Parking was available in a garage about a block behind the hotel. Our room was very lovely, bright, modern and clean with a large bathroom and a big window overlooking the street. It was an easy walk to restaurants and shopping and the attractions in the city. All the desk personnel were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was plentiful.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were a lot of renovation works going on at the hotel which I completely appreciate need doing from time to time however we were disappointed that we were not informed of these works prior to our stay. The reception/lift area and corridor of our floor were left in a total mess by the workmen including tools and a drill being left out, the route to the stairs and fire exit being blocked by some sort of trolley/table and the door to the electrical fuse boxes being left open unattended (see photos). I note that the website references the works ending on 31st Aug (our stay was 4th Sept) and I undersyqnd these things can run over but we received a direct message from the hotel through booking.com a few days prior to our stay to confirm the details and the works were not mentioned here. We also received no acknowledgement or apology from the hotel staff for them. We arrived earlier than check in time and were able to store our bags at the hotel however we found they were left on full show behind the reception desk all day rather than in a secure room as would usually be expected at a hotel. When we arrived later to get the key to room we were told that someone would bring our bags up (after offering to take them ourselves). 20 minutes later they had still not arrived and we had to go and get them ourselves. We were only given one of our bags and when stating that the other bag was also ours there was no check to confirm it actually was and feel that anyone could have said this during the day due to the changeover of staff on reception.The room itself was basic and fairly dated but as you would expect for a cheaper 3 star hotel. It mostly felt clean however there was a hair left on the shower head and a broken plug cover in the shower (see photos). The breakfast room was probably the nicest part we saw of the hotel and the selection of food was average. The location of the hotel is in an area which has quite a few building works going on however it was a good distance from the main square and also the Navigili district where we had dinner.The main positive of our stay which should be noted despite all of the above was the helpful lady who was on reception when we first arrived who gave us a map of Milan and talked us through the main sites and her recommendation of an area for dinner. Hopefully the hotel itself will be much nicer once all of the renovations are completed!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a very good and this hotel is a best in the world you know about this hotel in food bed water everything very excited me So good please listen about this hotel daily coming customers in Hotel 5 Thousand thanks
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for just one night, 3 in one room, and enjoyed the spacious and very clean bathroom, location and above all, very friendly staff with great English skills and eager to make you feel welcome beyond what’s expected for a relatively cheap hotel - breakfast was not included nor avaialble due to renovation, but found good alternative within 100 meters. Would fully recommend, whether for leisure or business, good job!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In general, there is nothing to justify the over €100 per day price tag. Some of the furnishing and the air condition are of good quality, but there are also quite a number of poor quality issues (see pictures). The common areas are what I would expect from a hotel with a much lower star rating and price tag. A big problem is Noise. I got repeatedly woken up on the 3rd floor from shouting and banging coming from the street. Forget sleeping in late, the cleaners will start banging and dragging furniture quite early. There seems to be little insulation between floors. When I visited the hotel, they were doing renovations while the hotel was open and guests were there!!! Very loud noises from drilling, cutting metal and banging the walls and floors for most of the day. They refused to move me to another hotel or even change my room. They lied twice about the construction work finishing on the next day. This was unacceptable, I paid over €120 per day to literally stay in a construction site. Even though the staff are helpful and friendly, the hotel management's and especially the "director's" attitude was of total disregard for the welfare of the customer.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only spent one night at Hotel Canada, but were very pleased. After a long flight and then making our way to the hotel, we were worn out. Although our room wasn't available yet, the desk clerk offered us a drink and happily stored our luggage. The drink revived us and we went off to explore Milan. Our room was very nice and the breakfast buffet was excellent!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The night clerk, Tarek was fantastic! He was very professional and friendly. He went the extra mile to help us. He is the BEST staff for your hotel! Also, the location was excellent and the staff was very attentive.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I were delighted to be upgraded to a larger room in this small hotel when we checked in during the second week of June. Our five-night stay was pleasant. The front desk staff (no concierge service due to the small size of hotel) was patient with our questions, accommodating with our requests for help with taxis and directions. Breakfast was very good, eggs of two kinds (hard-boiled and scrambled), cold cuts, cheeses, nice array of fruit, breads, cereal, yogurt, etc. Coffee and tea were made to order. A shout-out to the breakfast staff, in particular, Manne, who prepared the coffees and teas and always made sure the guests were taken care of with big smile and warm greetings. The location of Hotel Canada Milano is in walking distance, about 5 minutes to the Crocetta Metro Line, about 20 minute moderate pace walk to the Duomo. For those, who need a pharmacy or mini-mart food, there is an Express store about 75 meters (about half a block; closes at midnight) on the same side of the hotel and another mini-mart for basic food items and other staples on the opposite side of the hotel as Santa Sofia continues around the curve of the block of the hotel. Our room on the backside of the hotel was quiet. The minor downsides of the hotel, which we were told has about 30-something rooms, were (a) single guest elevator, which accommodates about 4 adults. However, since the service elevator was broken, the elevator was also used by the service staff. At times, waiting for the elevator took a while.(b) cleaning staff was not regular with the schedule. We were gone in the morning; by 1 p.m. on three different days, upon return for an afternoon rest from the building heat outdoors, our room had not yet been attended. Room rates were variable. This was not exclusive to Hotel Canada. Since two major events were taking place while we were in Milan, the room rates for some days increased 69% over the rates of other days. It would be a good idea to check out when events like the Men’s Fashion Week is being held. There was also the World Congress event that was held during the week that we were in the city. If one is visiting, it might be prudent to check on major events during the time of visit. This is a no frills, basic three-star hotel. Wonderful and helpful staff, which is a reason, that I’d recommend this hotel to other visitors.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for only two nights in a triple room. The room was comfortable and typically sized for what we saw in triple rooms throughout our trip. Experience with staff were hit and miss - some seemed indifferent while others (the early evening front desk gentleman in particular) were extremely friendly and eager to offer advice on where to eat, help reserve a car to the airport, etc... Unfortunately the Wifi was terrible. We could connect but it would go in & out making it virtually impossible to rely on. I ended up turning on my international roaming data to get us checked in for our flight out the next day. Also the coffee machine was out of service at breakfast - no espresso, cappucino, etc... only thing on offer was decaf instant coffee. You may also want to ask for a rear facing room if possible. Ours faced the main road out front and emergency vehicles with sirens went by constantly in the night, making for a less than optimal sleep. If we were going to be here more than the 2 nights I would have asked for a room change and complained about the WiFi, but as it was we just dealt with it before moving on.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and i just completed a 5 night stay at this hotel. The hotel is modern and clean. I really liked the size of the rooms and the bathrooms, brought a lot of comfort to the stay. The location is also good, approximately a 10 minute walk to the Duomo. Plenty of restaurants around as well. The staff were very kind and went through a local map to show us whats around. Breakfast was also fairly decent.Would recommend this hotel for your Milan stay.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great central hotel. Good size rooms, great service, good breakfast. We stayed only 2 nights and were very satisfied with everything. Hotel is very close to Duomo and many trandy shops. The rooms are very clea
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast poor, could be a little bit more choice of fruits. Bread was very dry - Italy has much more better bread. Staff not really friendly, to get coffee was sometimes difficult. Service in the breakfast room was better in earlier years.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed for 2 nights, we had 4 rooms and we like the hotel very much. they have very good and friendly service, the location is nice, 13 minutes from the center, and 15 minutes from the navigly erea.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room ( new and renovated ) no Street noises, Good Windows and doors The bedˋs are very comfortable not to soft , like in Other hotels ( 4 Stars up)very clean an nice bathroomsBreakfast is good ( eggs , smoothies , bacon ,,,, )Very nice staff ( got. an room Upgrade for free , early Check in and Late Check out )Could easealy have 4 Stars
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is easy to locate and is well located in Milan. I had a huge room which was clean, comfortable and well lit. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was really great too. I would definitely recommend Hotel Canada.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Canada has very nice rooms, spacious and very clean. We enjoyed breakfast; and all the staff were attentive, respectful and very nice, specially at the front desk. We forgot our passport and money inside the safety box of the room and they promptly attended to this situation. Thank you.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here all go out of their way to be helpful and give you lots of useful information to improve your stay. The room/bathroom both clean and well appointed and there is a lot of choice at the breakfast buffet. The city centre is 10/15 minutes walk and there is lots of reasonably priced public transport nearby. For those who complain about the noise of emergency vehicles - Milan is a city and you would get this at any hotel in a city. A minor problem was dealt with quickly and satisfactorily.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here during our trip to Milan. The hotel was noticeably cheaper than anything around but the reviews were good so we gave it a shot. First, double check the location...it’s a longer walk than the hotel let’s on. About 15-20 minutes to get to the center of town. The room itself was relatively nice/clean, but the bed was not very comfortable and the room was VERY noisy. You could hear EVERYTHING happening on the floors above and below you. A great bargain for doing Europe on a budget, but not the sleek, comfortable hotel that I thought I would be staying at based on other reviews.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredible! Amazing terrace with views for miles, wonderful breakfast, spacious and clean bathroom, super close to metro and the Duomo, grocery store is right down the street. I can't wait to stay again!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean room, great breakfast with everything you need to get you started. Nice big bad. We had late chack out that helped us.Helpful staff. Great location.We enjoyed our stay! Thank you for a nice city break.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love to see the city by walking and had a great stay in Hotel Canada. Spotless room in 7th floor was peaceful, and the hotel is not too big and crowded. The bathroom was very nice and towels big and thick. Few metro stations very near, also tram and bus. Walking distance to Duomo, lovely Navigli area etc. The breakfast was good and had a lot of options, but the breakfast room could be more spacious. Staff was friendly and everything went well. Recommend especially for couples and families with bigger children.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has great location, within the city center, just 10 minutes walking to Duomo. Rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. The stuff was really friendly and helpful. Excellent breakfasts!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have been staying in this hotel for 10 years and still love it! The new rooms are amazing and the staff is so friendly! The location is perfect, close to Il Duomo and also to Navigli, with many cute shops and restaurants. This hotel has a great value for money with a delicious breakfast and its superb location for the best Milano experience! Thanks again to Barbara, Milly :), Mauro and all the other staff members! We will be back next year!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 15 minutes from Duomo this is a great hotel with good rooms, great shower, terrific breakfast and wonderful Italian hospitality. recommended and we would stay again notwithstanding the extensive and temporary roadworks in the vicinity.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Already the reception was extremely friendly, helpful and unbureaucratic. The double room with twinbeds (our wish), enough room, very practical with luggage rack and enouh shelves for all the stuff, writing desk, plenty of lamps(being at all the important places!). Then: enough plugs, free WIFI, very practical everything! The bath with daylight and a window to be opened electrically. A really good shower with an extra mobile showerhead (great for all women who do not want to do a handstand in the shower every morning :-)). Rich breakfast buffet until 10.30!Everywhere REALLY CLEAN! In the room NO unnecessary day-pillows, rugs and bedspreads as unhygienic dust collectors, thank you! Last but not least: Free beverages (also cool beer!) and fruit basket, and YES! A waterheater for tea and coffee! We definitely shall come back....
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What hotel does not have an iron and a ironing board for guests to use?Pathetic effort Hotel Canada and wouldn’t recommend for anyone with a creased piece of clothing.Nice staff though and rooms decent but don’t go with creased clothes.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You are guaranteed a lovely welcome at this hotel. They even change the carpet in the lift to display the day of the week in English and Italian! Our room was great and beds very comfy. Super shower and good towels supplied. On a negative sadly is the quality of the thin toilet paper and it's a shade of brown. The toiletries supplied are really good, shame about the poor quality of toilet paper. The breakfast room is small and when busy is hard to get to the food and back again to the table. The food is fine and well displayed and the breakfast staff are friendly. All in all this is a pleasant hotel where staff go out their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All employees were very friendly and helpful. The front desk provided useful directions and recommendations to shopping areas, restaurants and site seeing. Francisco even filled up my friend’s hot water bottle. We walked everywhere so this hotel was conveniently located.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was great, room was perfect. I loved the extra surprises we found. Fruit in our room, mini bar full and included in price and snacks in the lobby for guests. Breakfast was excellent with a wide selection definitely something for everyone
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location between the Duomo and the canals. Clean, quiet, modern room. The staff was great. Gave us a multipage list of area restaurants when we asked about suggestions. Great breakfast and there were snacks in the lobby in the afternoon. No onsite parking but there was a large garage about a block away which the hotel gave us a 20% discount card for.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This a nice hotel; very comfortable beds, large rooms, large bathroom, lots of plush towels, refrigerator, and even a couch. I also liked the fact that we could adjust the temperature in our room to how we liked. Our room faced the busy Via Sofia but with the window closed, the noise was quite subdued, with the occasional siren breaking through. The television had lots of channels, most in Italian, but we were able to a few English channels; Little House on the Prairie, anyone? The desk staff were all friendly and helpful, giving us excellent advice on navigating the city. The breakfast provided was very good with lots of options like scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, juices, fruits, yogurt, pastries, cereals, and milk. The area around the hotel is safe with no street people or beggars and it's only about a 12 minute walk to the Duomo.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What an amazing hotel experience. We had a large modern room with a balcony overlooking the city. It was within walking distance of restaurants, the Duomo, and subway. Benedetta answered my email questions immediately. Giulio had answers for every question, even called the airlines to untangle a problem. Definitely do not ask for an early breakfast bag, but otherwise breakfast is just OK. We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visit here in 2016 and was superb so revisited in 2018!! Staff are friendly & very helpful! Didn't have tea/coffee making facilities in our room asked at reception and a tray with kettle etc was brought up immediately.Rooms are clean Free mini bar & fruit a nice touch too!Would definitely go back!!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Trip Advisor rating, stating this is a 3 Star hotel is accurate. Facilities were clean, rooms were quite small but adequate. Unfortunately we had to pay extra for an electric kettle in the room. But what I didn’t read, was about EXCEPTIONAL STAFF are, especially at the Reception Desk! We did not book this hotel, our host did, but if 3 Star is your thing, do choose this hotel as seriously the staff were fabulous. One morning I even received free lessons on how to pronounce names in Italian for a speech I made! And apparently I accomplished the desired result! Thank you!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Hotel Canada in early September. We picked it only for its relative closeness to Bocconi University and we were very pleasantly surprised. The staff could have not been nicer! The room was very clean and the bed really comfortable: it was a great value.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here were very friendly and helpful, and the room was attractive, clean, and comfortable. Breakfast had a good number of varied options. The location was convenient for the city centre and especially convenient for the university, just around the corner. I would definitely come here again on any future trip to Milan.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reception and breakfast staff were all very friendly. Rooms are clean with power shower and all necessary facilities.Good choice of breakfast. Very near to the metro and walkable to Duomo. Lovely stay, would return!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the Canada Hotel!!Upon our arrival to the hotel in Milan, we were greeted by friendly and helpful reception staff. We were thrilled that they gave us a room straight away (which we requested in advance knowing we would have just flown for 25 hours) and it was only 7:30am. We were also given a map of the city and our receptionist circled the key ‘must-see’ areas of Milan which proved to be so helpful!Our room on the first floor was on the smaller side but it was just perfect. The bed was big and comfortable, the ensuite was more than adequate and the TV had international channels. It didn’t bother us that the room was small because we were hardly there - there is so much to see and do in Milan that you need all the time you can have.The location is fine. The hotel is situated about a 10 minute walk from the Duomo and we quite enjoyed the walk (although not as much after a long day of touring). However, having said that, it is in close proximity to two metro stations and the tram so if you were really tired it was easy to get back. The hotel is in close proximity to restaurants and shops. The included breakfast was great. It had a selection of breads, spreads, hot food and fruit along with barista coffee. There were plenty of tables so whenever we chose to come down and eat, we could sit down straight away.The reception staff were terrific. It didn’t matter which one you spoke to, they were all so helpful with any query we had - how to get around, places to eat and where to shop. They’re english was fabulous so it was very easy to communicate with them.We thank the Canada Hotel for our great stay and it has set the bar pretty high for the rest of our accomodation on our European adventure!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely great spot at walking distance to the main tourist hot spots (piazza del Duomo, galleria Vittorio Emanuele, Scala, castello Sforzesco). Staff is super friendly and always willing to help you with some Geheimtipps, such as restaurants where the locals go. Room and facilities are spotless, breakfast is amazing with many choices to start your day. Excellent value for money.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was wonderful! The staff was welcoming and extremely helpful! The hotel itself was very clean and centrally located to public transportation and walking distance from many points of interest. We would stay here again!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Canada Hotel is located a couple of blocks from the metro and near lots of stores, cafes etc. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but clean and well taken care of so I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On average, a good hotel. Location is convenient. Staff are very helpful and sincere. Room is clean and tidy. Reasonable room size with that price. Breakfast is of good quality although the room is quite small.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is close to the Dome, 15 minutes walk. If you come from the airport the bus station is 3 minutes away . There is a carrefour market at the corner. The staff is very helpful. If you need sth they will do all the best to solve it. The room is clean. Very good breakfast with a lot of variety :scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, juice, sparkling water, cola, fanta , sprite, prosciuto cotto, chesse, pastries, friuts, coffee, capucino, etc. I recommend this hotel
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +lovely stay, room with enough space for 3 people (adults), very clean room and hotel ( congratulations), nice location, friendly and helpful stuff (in all positions)breakfast was ok- reception and lobby need to be upgraded
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are from the US and were on vacation when our daughter was unexpectedly hospitalized for a period of time. All of the staff were extremely kind, caring and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed the for one night, we just wanted somewhere close the train station and we got what we expected. Nice beds and nice staff. The room was very clean and the hotel was quick in my inquires. Good stay
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to Milan on business for two nights and, as planned, stayed another four nights on vacation using Milan as a base to go out of town on several of my free days. I chose this hotel out of two recommended by my hosts for its closeness to my place of work. Overall I was satisfied with the choice, though there were a few things I personally missed. For instance I'd have preferred a reception area that was more appealing as a place to sit, rest, wait for people and taxis, etc. At least there was such an area with several comfortable seats, chairs and tables, and a computer available to guests with the possibility of printing things out. I appreciated the provisions that were available gratis in the reception area at many times of day: a jug of orange juice, bowl of olives, and various small bites: ideal as a snack when coming home in the evening. I also appreciated the daily news sheets offering the days' news from different countries in the relevant languages. Breakfast was buffet style and served till 10.30 a.m. It had a good range of breakfast foods and drinks and treats. The staff at reception were courteous and helpful, a pleasure to deal with. Though I disagree with one who said that the Duomo is "a few minutes" walk from the hotel. It's not that close on my interpretation of "few" unless you walk in giant strides. But it is in walking distance. On arrival in the evening I had a problem figuring out the lighting system in my room. It involved using the key card to my room and pressing buttons in various orders. At the time there was only one person on staff who could help, and she was needed in reception. With her help I managed to access enough light for my purposes that night but never fully figured out the system. I recommend the hotel put a card in the room explaining how the system works, not that that would help someone searching for light on their first night. I would also have liked some discussion of the air-conditioning system on such a card. It took a while to realize that I could not adjust it myself, but it was controlled by reception: on or off, basically. I may be particularly obtuse about these things but I doubt that I'm alone in preferring to be given such information without having to figure it out. My room was spacious and quiet (as requested, high up) but, I felt, lacking in character: it had all I needed (including a safe and small fridge) but lacked any kind of personal touch. The bathroom was great and I was grateful for the shower caps. Though the street on which the hotel is located is pretty faceless, there are plenty of shops very nearby including groceries, and places to eat. In sum: the staff at reception were great, the room was fine, the location worked for me.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the perfect place to stay at if you want to be not to close to the hustle and bustle of the city center. It is not too far but around a 15 minute walk. The rooms are clean, affordable, and we would definitely stay here again. The staff were also very friendly and we were always greeted with a smile.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Canada Hotel for two nights before heading back to Toronto, Canada. I had read a lot of the reviews before booking our stay so I knew what to anticipate when we arrived. The hotel is clean and so conveniently located. It's close to restaurants, shopping and of course the Duomo Cathedral, a must see on any visit to Milano. We were checked in right away and was offered drinks and snacks which as great since we had been driving in a car for almost 3.5 hours. Our room was clean and very efficient. The bathroom was nice, but I do need to mention the shower stall is quite compact. Don't drop the soap...The beds were comfortable and the breakfast was a nice start to the day. It is an older building but this is to be expected in Milano. We would stay here again on a quick trip thru Milano.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly front desk staff. Room was a decent size although they did say they upgraded us to a suite (no addition charge. nice) but it was still smaller than a normal hotel room in the USA so makes me wonder how big the normal size rooms are. Room and common areas appeared to be very clean. We left early so not able to enjoy the breakfast although they did make use a bag to go, mostly packaged snacks which we mostly tossed so would probably pass on that. We were able to walk to the Duomo in about 10 minutes as well as several restaurants so a decent downtown location. Although is was a little difficult to find even with the GPS. Recommended.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm reviewing this hotel after my second stay because I was not impressed with two things:1. No iron available due to "safety concerns" according to a front desk staff member.2. It was raining for two days during our stay and the first night we turned the heat up before bed, and were still pretty cold through-out the night and the next day. We informed front desk that the heat was not working and he said "we turn the heat off in the summer months." What a dumb policy, and for this reason, I won't stay here again. The breakfast options are average, but the staff are all very friendly and helpful; Manny is super nice and cheerful at all times!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very helpful and friendly, the room was very clean and pleasant. The hotel was located near to two metro stations and within walking distance from the Domo. It was very comfortable to move around the city. There is a grocery store next to the hotel and an ATM.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was selected by the organizer of the symposium I participated in and I think they made a good choice.My room was spacious, very clean and quiet. But on the last day they forgot to change the towels in the bathroom, and then I happened to ask to change it to a boy who was obviously not Italian. He did not use the courteous form ("Lei" form) and gave me "del tu". This tiny thing however damaged a bit the impression of this nice hotel.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Canada Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cozy rooms in a unique atmosphere. After a warm welcome, we visited Milan with some helpful advices from our host. Wonderful breakfast, and in the evening we enjoyed the warmth on the rooftop. It was great to stay here and we will surely come back! Thank you guys for this B&B
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at RossoSegnale B&B, in large part because of all the great reviews on TripAdvisor. And what everyone has noted before was true. The owners were very communicative, which made an early check-in possible. Breakfast in the garden was a treat (and they were great about accommodating my wife's request for gluten-free options). The room was cozy and comfortable - with a unique design that made it special (and memorable). It also had air conditioning, which was helpful as it was quite warm in Milan when we were there a couple weeks ago. Location wise, it's a short walk to the subway and also within walking distance of many other things in Milan. All in all - a great option and we had a great two night stay.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm hospitality in a comfortably creative atmosphere. The room and shared space were way fun and functional. Good breakfast served by gracious staff. Public transportation easy to access with many sites including restaurants walkable. Raoul quickly became our friend. We will hopefully return someday.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the RossoSegnale B&B for a week and used it as a base for exploring certain parts of northern Italy. The B&B's location just a few minutes walk from the Loreto subway station made it easy for us to go to and from Milano Centrale - the main train station - which is only one stop away from Loreto on the green subway line. We used our rail passes to travel from Milan to places like Torino, Verona and Genova - all in about one hour each way - using the high speed train service from Milan. High speed trains do require seat reservations, so in order to avoid standing in line when you need to be able to depart, we strongly advise committing to a schedule and making seat reservations on the Frecciarossa before leaving home. With the rail pass, the reserved seat supplement was no more than about 10 euros each way even for a distant destination like Verona. We loved not having to change hotels or to carry our luggage around just in order to do a full day of sightseeing in other cities. We also used a regular train to visit Bergamo which can be reached from Milan in under an hour. The B&B's welcoming proprietors, Alberto and Raoul, have done an extraordinary job of restoring their building. In addition to the beautiful decor, large bathroom, small writing room and lovely balcony overlook the back garden, our room - called "Giallonovecento" - was accessible by elevator which makes it possible for those who experience difficulty climbing stairs to enjoy a comfortable stay. The breakfast each morning in the charming downstairs breakfast nook was excellent, and in warm weather guests can enjoy both the beautiful garden and the roof terrace. We also liked the fact that there are a number of decent places to eat nearby. When we wanted a quick, inexpensive lunch we simply walked to the bakery located on Via Nicola Porpora about a block and a half away. They will heat a slice of their pizza for you, and also have drinks and some good pastries. There are stools for sitting, so patrons on the go can eat right there. For dinner, we enjoyed the Osteria Nuovo Convento recommended by our B&B hosts and located only a block and a half away on Via Giovanni Ricordi. For a comfortable, well appointed, quiet, welcoming place to stay or to use as a base for extensive local and regional sightseeing we can not too highly recommend RossoSegnale.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RossoSegnale B&B is a fantastic bed and breakfast situated in a great location, with very accommodating hosts. Raoul went above and beyond to make sure we had a comfortable stay. The rooms are very clean, spacious with good amenities. It has a lovely art gallery on the ground floor and a beautiful garden. I would certainly like to return again and would not hesitate recommending to future guests. Thank you for having us.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am writing today a new review, because it has been about 10-12 times, that I stayed there in the last 6 years. I am regularly for work in Milan and the Rossosegnale has got for me my second home. I love it there after all these years still for everything: It’s style in the rooms, the breakfast room, the whole house and garden (Pippo!), the silence in the middle of Milan, the comfortable beds, the friendliness of the hosts Raoul and Alberto, the connected small art gallery, which has been several times for me a place of big “aaaahhhhs”, (because from time to time I bought there some pictures) - and finally the terrific recommendations for restaurants in the evening. Ena, the helping hand in the house is always smiling and knows always in the right second (!!) when I like to have my second coffee at breakfast, which makes me smile each morning as I leave the house for work or to travel back home. I would have had enough possibilities to change the place, but I didn’t. I mean: Travelling with the sensation of coming home..., it couldn’t be better. I made already yesterday my reservation for the next trip in September to Milan. Ah - and years ago I rented their loft close to the Navigli. Guess what? The first thing I did there was phoning my husband at home and I remember hear me saying: “I will stay here forever, when will you come?”
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have been to the RossoSegnale for a weekend trip and we were not disappointed. The B&B is decorated in a way that it shows the passion and love for good quality by the hosts and owners Alberto and Raoul. Our room had a lot of items with personal history and good stories to it, which Albterto shared with us. You could see the eye for details at almost every inch of the house. We enjoyed the time at their B&B. When we are in Milano again we will certainly come back.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights at RossoSegnale and were very pleased with our stay. The beds were comfortable, we enjoyed the small balcony in the room, and loved the rooftop which was a perfect place to relax. Alberto provided a lot of information about places to go in Milan. Breakfast was delightful and featured plentiful options. The train station is a short walk away, but we chose to walk to the Duomo and window shop along the way.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed one night, but received a warm welcome and the rooms where so beautifully and uniquely designed (very clean as well). A few minutes drive from the center, with no problem at all finding a parking space right next to the hotel.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 2 nights.Lets say that this will be by sure my place in any visit from now and on.Great quality materials in the room, towels,pillows, matress.Unique decoration in every room.And the most important , the two owners by far the best smile in Milan.Great guys. Keep the quality job you doing
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived Alberto took care of us. First he showed us the whole house from garden to roof terrace and then he told us a lot of things we could do in Milano. Beside this tips, he also recommended places to go for lunch or dinner and spontaneously booked for us place (which was very good!).The whole house is decorated with art, the lower floor is used also as gallery and in the bedrooms you have also every kind of art. The bedrooms and bathrooms are clean and good. The bedrooms have air conditioner.Breakfast is good and you are taken care of!We will come back!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a word, this B&B is beautiful. Just three rooms, spotless, very comfortable with very friendly and helpful hosts. Raoul met us, explained everything and made us completely at ease. He showed us the garden where we had an excellent breakfast and the roof terrace where we sat to escape the heat of the city. Generous with his time, Raoul gave very good recommendations for sightseeing and restaurants. Osteria Nuovo Convento was excellent and in the next street, good food, good wine, good value. We loved the Boschi Di Stephano Museum-Home, a nice walk from the B&B also recommended by Raoul. Our flight was in the evening, we were welcome to leave our bags and return in the afternoon for taxi to the airport which Raoul arranged for us. We would like to have stayed longer and will definitely return to Rosssegnale. Location is very good, relatively quiet and close to a Metro stop, 3km walk to the Duomo. A lovely place to stay, we would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two great people, Raoul and Alberto, turnde this former garage into a great warm place to stay and ENJOY Milano!! With a warm and personal touch they make you feel at home, breakfast is super and served by a warm and friendly lady wich also gives you a “being at home”-feeling...Also a great mix between fine art and design done in a great way!So If you want to visit Milano, book Rossosegnale, a place with a ❤️
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice bed & breakfast located relatively close to the central train station, which was just what we were looking for. Chiara met us at the facility, showed us the property (including an old car park - now enclosed in glass - and a delightfully pleasant back garden. Intriguing art everywhere. The owners made a recommendation for dinner (a nearby restaurant that had a fine menu, at very agreeable prices, also with pleasant exterior seating). My wife and I had to leave very early to catch our train to the airport, and Chiara was able to settle the bill at the start of our visit (not all that common in Europe). Overall, very good value.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights at this delightful B&B in Milan and had a wonderful stay. Alberto & Raoul are exemplary hosts and they were so helpful in listing things to do and restaurants. Breakfast are beautiful sitting in the garden and served by the lovely Ena.There is a rooftop terrace which is a lovely place to relax. We highly recommend this place to stay in Milan
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Trip Advisor was right - all the 5 star reviews convinced me to stay at this B&B. The hosts Raoul & Alberto were lovely and couldn't have been more accommodating and helpful if they tried. We stayed in 2 rooms over 2 different nights and both were unique and comfortable and immaculate. The artist gallery, backyard, roof and unique features of this place enhanced the stay. The Milan neighborhood location offers wonderful restaurants and close proximity to the metro. Highly recommend!!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As beautiful and comfortable as this hotel is, it is surpassed only by the thoughtful, gracious kindness of its owner-hosts. Raoul and Alberto provided recommendations for places to see and eat, made sure we had everything we needed each day, and went out of their way to attend to our comfort and enjoyment of the city. The rooms, garden and gallery are filled not only with works of art selected by Raoul and Alberto, but by their many artist friends. The B&B is located within a short walk from a metro station and trolley stop; the breakfasts are delicious and the choices plentiful; the elevator is a godsend; and a number of good Milanese restaurants are nearby. We enjoyed our stay here enormously, and will be back!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a two for one. You get a room and an art show all in one. Our party took two of the three rooms. So in comparison one is decidedly more comfortable as it was roomier. We took the smaller room with the tiny bathroom. But we loved our stay and would do it again. Delicious breakfast prepared by Ana. Very hospitable hosts, Raoul and Alberto. There is an elevator for those that can't handle the stairs.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my mother to Italy for her 85th birthday. We could not have pick a better home for our time in Milan. Raoul and Alberto gave us the best suggestions for dinner and you could tell how much they wanted our stay to be wonderful. We had an early flight home and they had breakfast ready and made sure we were in our cab on time. The home is lovely with wonderful art, furnishings and a nice balcony and outdoor seating area. 6 months after our stay my mom still talks about how wonderful our stay was. Would definitely recommend to others.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very reasonable price, and outstanding rooms. Very clean, and had view of the garden, and a terrace also.Owner very attentive, help with our wheelchair, will call you a taxi when needed, and helped with luggage. There is an elevator also. We left medication in room and he overnighted the medications to us in Palermo. Very good feelings about the whole concept.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lucky enough to stay six nights in early December at RossoSegnale Concept Art Gallery B&B. A beautiful spot with charming, friendly and wonderful hosts, Raoul and Alberto. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable, the bathroom quite spacious for Europe :-) and the building itself was a treat to explore. Every day we found a new treasure, a new piece of art in the room, in the hallways, in the kitchen. Modern, sleek, but with a very homey feel. We miss the morning cappuccinos and the beautiful music that played in the dining area. Some have noted that the B&B is a bit away from the city center. Of course it is not next to the Duomo, but it is located in a safe, quiet residential neighborhood. If you walk the five to seven minutes to the Loreto Metro Station, you can be practically anywhere you want in Milano in no time at all. And at RossoSegnale you have Raoul and Alberto to advise you on the best of their magnificent city.My husband and I highly recommend you end your search and book your stay here if you are lucky, like us. We hope to return during a warmer time of the year to enjoy the lovely gardens. Gratzie to our hosts.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a short 3 night stay in Milan and we could not have made a better choice for a place to stay; it is just great.Raoul and Alberto are outstanding hosts. On arrival, Raoul spent time with us showing us around the property and ensuring we had all the details (lots of insider hints and tips) so we could make the most of our stay.The property is conveniently located near Loreto (Milan Metro) on a residential side street and it is just a 5 min walk. Our room was quiet, clean, stylish and comfortable, situated at the back on the 1st floor overlooking the garden. Raoul recommend a couple of local restaurants and we had a good night at the Osteria il Melograno. The breakfast provided was ‘continental’ in style (eggs, pastries, cheeses, meats, cakes, etc) - I have to mention the delicious homemade chocolate & almond cake and potato & cheese ravioli.
