Along with fresh cappuccino, it provided a great start to the day.The October sunshine was magic. From top dining (Rinascente Milano) overlooking the Duomo to Apertivo at MAG, all recommdations from our hosts. We had a fantastic time in Milan. We also managed a train trip to Como with a day exploring the lake.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is like coming home. Lovely, clean and Alberto and Raoul are wonderful hosts. Close to the metro station and far away to be quiet. The perfect place to stay if you want to explore Milano. You can really recommend this place.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent and exceptional choice - Alberto and Raoul are wonderful and helpful hosts and make this place a home away from home. Five minutes to the next taxi stand, plenty of restaurants around. The entire house boasts an exceptionally tasteful and artistic interior, combining modern design with playful and more traditional elements. Very well equipped rooms including W-Lan, great bed, comforable bathroom, very nice garden. Small fitness room, ok for a workout. Delicious breakfast. Despite being downtown, relatively quiet. 100% recommendation.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The heart of every small business needs a passion burning brightly in its veins. Raoul and Alberto have brought so many of their passions to life in this sweet and unexpectedly delightful B&B on the outskirts of a city that can leave you feeling anonymous. We loved the back garden, the rooftop terrace, the gorgeous breakfast, and the general feeling that we were warmly accepted into a treasure-filled home of immaculate care for as short a time as 2 nights. Our room was quiet, calm, and charming. Easy to reach by metro, and far from the bustling rush of the city center, the house was simple to find. We were grateful for suggestions and recommendations from both Raoul and Alberto, as well as the conversations we felt lucky to share. A wonderful experience on every level! Thank you!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well done to Alberto and Raoul, the hosts of this B & B. They obviously love people, love art and love Milan, and want to help us get to love Milan too. We were there for 2 nights and although I was a bit wary about not being in the centre of the city we found the Metro so easy to use from Loreto Station just a few minutes walk from here. Alberto gave us a detailed map and some great suggestions for sightseeing, some of which we would never have found - I loved the Villa Necchi Campiglio especially.The rooms are quirky and full of interesting items including art and antiques.They have a small art gallery, and if you happen to be here when there's an 'opening' then you're extra luck!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B was clean, adorable, and perfectly located. The hosts were friendly, accommodating, and gave me great suggestions of where to go within the time I had. I will definetly recommend this site to my friends.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The decor was very sleek and still felt like home. The location was very convenient, minutes walk to the Loreto Subway station, there's BikeMi station one block away. The house only has 3 rooms and I was assigned the street facing one which I loved. I had the pleasure to stay here 5 days which was considered a 'long' stay for Rosso BnB. Enjoyed the breakfast and the friendly chat/tips given by Alberto and Raoul. All in all a great Milan experience.There's a very nice garden in the back and breakfast was served by Enna and it was just like waking up to mom's cooking every morning.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A review of this B&B has to start with the hosts Raoul & Alberto. They helped make our stay enjoyable in every way. Their recommendation on dining spots led to several memorable meals, especially Bracelleria where we went for my wife's birthday. The various forms of art around the house was very unique and we went home with a gorgeous necklace that was on display in our bedroom. Overall one of the best B&B experiences we have had in our travels.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A perfect place to stay in Milano! Your hosts Alberto and Raoul are exceptional! Wonderful art is hanging everywhere for you to admire and each room is beautifully decorated . There is also an area exhibiting artworks from artists of diverse styles from around the world. The breakfasts are delicious, served in the pretty garden in warm weather. The location is so convenient for the metro, to take you anywhere you wish to explore in Milano. We had a small terrace to relax on after a busy day sightseeing ,before heading out for dinner. Alberto is always ready with tips for dining and will also book anything for you if you wish. A little gem ,hidden in a busy beautiful city! Thank you Alberto and Raoul for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful charming spot - so artistic - wonderful hosts- totally enjoyed. Beautiful back garden and also roof garden. RAoul was very helpful with suggestions. Good location for walking and a very nice small restaurant close by.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charming hosts, and comfortable stay. Unfortunately was only an overnight stay, to rest after a 26+hour journey. Convenient location. And a special earlier-than-usual breakfast time was arranged for me due to departure time = appreciated :-). Sorry 'bout the late review chaps. Til next time.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful place to stay, roughly a 30-minutewalk from the central train station. Large roomswith neat and interesting art work on all the walls.Good restaurants adjacent and Raoul is especiallyhelpful with information and maps of the area. Veryclose to the subway line. Breakfast for every taste with small garden area and rooftop terrace.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed for 5 days, Raoul and Alberto are extremely helpful and interesting guys, amazing knowledge of Milan, good recommendations for restaurants, found one ourselves; Sabatini's, just off of the Buenos Aires main road, lovely food good prices.GET THE MILANO CARD, free entry offers ok if you really really like church basements, didn't do the highline as we treated ourselves to a glass of bubbly on the roof of the department store next to the Duomo [Rinascente .pricey but worth it]Milano card brilliant if you want to travel around the city, tube, bus,train,tram.go to the Navigli district for happy hour, you wont regret it, check out the little galleries and music shops, 10euro gets you a cocktail and buffet try 3 or 4 different bars during the evening.had a nice romantic meal on the roof terrace,fantastic breakfast each morning in the garden, clean rooms,interesing art work all over the house,mini bar good prices, small supermarkets close by, buy your own and keep in the fridge.recommend a trip to Como, 40 mins by train,£20 return pp.I work in hotels and these guys could give great lessons in customer service and room layout. couple of minor room maintenance issues but nothing that spoils the experience. photos don't do this place justice, you have to visit to appreciate it fully.smoking allowed outside, if you need to.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Raoul and Alberto have set the standards so high! That's why now it would be really hard for us to choose the accomodation elsewhere - after our recent stay at this wonderful BnB no hotel or appartment in the entire history of our travels (which is quite extensive!) can compare to Rossosegnale. This place is so unique, and we loved every tiny corner, every single interior design item and every second of our stay! The hosts are so welcoming, outgoing and friendly that they really made us feel at home. It's so precious when people not only love what they are doing but also share the best that they have with others! The room, the breakfast, the house itself, the works of art that surround you everywhere, the overall atmosphere and the location - everything was so perfect that I couldn't find a negative aspect even if I was presistently trying to!Well, I believe that no words can do favour to this place, but if I could describe it in one phrase, I'd say: usually we prefer sightseeing and being outside, but here we wanted to stay as long as possible inside:) And we are already thinking about coming back in winter! PS: Raoul, Alberto, thank you for everything and I wish you all the best.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is super! Super clean, comfortable, convenient, well located and well priced! My room was spacious and the little balcony overlooking the quiet garden was just lovely. Breakfast was generous and delicious. The roof terrace and the gallery are unusual and wonderful places to chill. I was surrounded by great eating spots and a few minutes walk from the metro. My favorite part was the warmth and genuine care of the hosts: Alberto & Raoul. They are super friendly, super knowledgeable about their great city and really wonderful folks! This will be the place I call home in Milan.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would give it six stars if I could! Unique & very pretty with lots of beautiful artwork throughout the entire residence. Lovely garden & rooftop terrace with many potted plants, making it feel like a home away from home.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent B&B with super friendly hosts. They have great knowledge about everything in Milan. We enjoyed walking around in the district, and tried out different restaurants and cafés. Breakfast was delicious, and the service was with a smile. Would strongly recommend to anyone on a budget (or not) in Milan! The rooftop terrace and garden is really nice.The bed is hard though, as often in Italy. But they do have different options in pillows! Keep up the good work.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alberto greet me on a rainy day - such a warm and experienced host. This is a just perfect place - very clean (yes they do cleaning every day) and stylish. Homemade breakfast, convenient place, beautiful vintage white curtain, really nothing to complain. Paoul would stopped by and said Chiao and checked if anything you need every morning before he went to work...just like an old friend...I also quite like the local areas and restaurants they recommended...similar people always come together maybe.A very pleasant staying indeed.Sharon from Hong KongSusanna from Seattle
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RossoSegnale is a wonderful experience in a great city. As a combination art gallery and B&B it offers a unique and interesting experience in itself. It is well located very close to the Loreto metro station (where the red and green lines connect) so it is convenient for trips to the center and other areas of the city--it is true that the Milan metro is extremely easy to use. Our bedroom was certainly large enough with excellent bathroom facilities and a balcony overlooking a lovely garden area where breakfast can be served in good weather (but alas for us Milan was cool and rainy during our stay). The breakfasts were excellent with a variety of choices each day.The hosts, Raoul and Alberto, are extraordinary in their hospitality and in their willingness to make recommendations as to restaurants and attractions. They arranged a guided tour of architecture and design for us that was a great introduction to the city.RossoSegnale has a great spirit and we would recommend without hesitation or reservation.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a very pleasant week at RossoSegnale B&B , which I would rather call an Art Boutique Hotel :) The owners Alberto & Raoul are very friendly and always ready to help. They can advise you on city tours which only Milanese can know! B&B is located in city center, 5 min from Loreto metro station and a walking distance to corso Buenos Aires - a well-known shopping prospect. The B&B is very cozy and unusual, as it has an operating Art gallery on the ground floor, and pieces of art everywhere. B&B has an inner garden, a small cozy kitchen and only 3 rooms, so you feel a real spirit of Milano and a personal approach living there. I felt like home or visiting a very close friends' house. My room had my favorite balcony overlooking a quiet inner garden, large modern bathroom, the bed was comfy, area is quiet so you can sleep well. In the garden you can have breakfast ,if weather allows. A lovely lady Ehna makes fresh breakfast in the morning and keeps the room clean. WIFI is fast. I stated all which is important for me when I travel and hope it will be helpful for travelers. I would recommend this place without hesitation and would like to come back again , as I really miss its spirit:)
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This very special BnB is a well thought out home, your hosts live there!We found the property a charming, delightful and easy place to stay. It is in a quiet residential neighbor with good access to all transportation and some really good restaurants.Rauol was the person I spoke with each day--a gracious man. He was very informative while answering all my inquiries via phone, email and in person.Ainnie, the breakfast lady was a delight.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RossoSegnale is unique: a small, beautifully appointed B&B and a very interesting art gallery and garden. Arturo and Raoul are perfect hosts, their neighborhood restaurant recommendations were perfect. I would add that the photos on the website do not accurately represent the simple beauty and size of the rooms: ours was far more interesting than we'd anticipated and the bathroom was wonderful. Five stars!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is only a b&b not a five star boutique hotel but you get a five star stay. The boys are super charming and so helpful you feel as though you are part of the family. The place is also part art gallery so there are loads of interesting pictures and objects.Good breakfast. Slightly further out but the nearby metro stations made it easy to get about and let you see more of fantastic Milan.Recommended.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here made the trip to Milan all the better. The place was FANTASTIC!!! The owner welcomed me in close to midnight. The place duels as an art gallery which adds to the experience. The room was an experience of its own!!! Decorated so uniquely and tastefully. Breakfast was wonderful. Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here in our honeymoon in September 2016. We were welcomed by Alberto who showed us around the beautiful art gallery (which also doubles as a boutique hotel), the garden and roof top terrace. After asking us our interests and taste in food and restaurants, Alberto took the time to provide us with truly amazing tips on where to go for sight seeing and where to eat and made us necessary reservations. The hotel was an easy distance to all of Milan's greatest sights (by either walking or using the metro located very close by) and to fabulous restaurants we never would have found without Alberto and Raoul! It was also very peaceful and we very much enjoyed having a glass of wine and unwinding in the afternoon on the roof top terrace before dinner. We absolutely loved Milan and I have no doubt it was thanks to Alberto and Raoul's hospitality and kindness. We will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although only one night I was very warm welcomed by Raol, who showed me the main "lobby" (artwork under glas), the beautiful garden, the roof terrasse and my room, which was so much different from other hotel rooms: full of "quirky" colors and pictures, but still with all comfort including large bathroom, balcony and air conditioning. The breakfast was with a perfect egg, despite having only 15 minutes to eat. Next time I definitely will stay longer....
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We began a 3 week tour of northern Italy with a few days in Milan. This B&B was a fortuitous booking. I loved having the gallery within the same premises. The art on display gave a sense of Milan's modern design credentials. The room we had was very comfortable with a small balcony overlooking the garden. This made it very quiet for an urban location. We ate breakfast in the garden and lounged in the evening on the rooftop terrace. Our hosts were great, offering local knowledge on museums and art galleries. The location near the Loretto metro stop provided easy access to everything we wanted to see.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just enjoyed the two most special nights staying in Alberto's amazing Art Gallery B & B.Not only is the location superb but the room we had was so beautifully decorated and the break out areas to relax were great.Our favourite was the top of roof terrace where we had some great times including chatting with two lovely American couples.We stay in a lot of B & Bs around the world and we found Alberto to be so helpful with his in depth knowledge of Milan and recommended us to three local restaurants all in with in walking distance with our favourite being Atlas Foyer - a must do whilst in Milan.Thanks Alberto and we will be back.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So many good things! Beginning with the hosts Raul and Alberto. They are helpful, kind, passionate about helping, and good communicators before, during and after our visit. The location is close to the metro and the area is quiet. They gave good restaurant recommendations, directions, and maps. The property is in pristine condition and rooftop is relaxing day or night. Good wifi connection throughout. Breakfast was abundant including eggs, pastries, meat, cheese, yougurt, fruit and more. The hostess is very kind. You will not regret your stay!!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the B&B for 2 nights and everything was perfect. It was our first time in Milan and Raoul and Alberto were amazing. They gave us so many insider tips which made our stay even more pleasant. The rooms are lovingly decorated, each room in a different style. Every time you enter the room you find something new that attracts your eye. Breakfast in the garden was very cozy! The combination of a sweet home and welcoming hosts made the stay unfogettable.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our 2 rooms! So trendy and chick. The terrace on each room also where we could have our wine. , the bathroom also was great! The breakfast was excellent! And what to say of Raoul and Alberto, lovely people! Would definitely go back!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night in early August, after flying in from New York on the red-eye. Alberto greeted us very kindly and gave us a great tour of the place and orientation in Milan. The B&B is spectacular, with gorgeously designed, comfortable rooms with private balconies, a relaxing garden and roof deck. It's an easy stroll to the Loreto metro stop--two stops to Centrale, maybe five to the Duomo? Very convenient. Breakfast was delicious and served in the garden. And the place is filled with cool artwork that's for sale at reasonable prices--a fun bonus! Thank you Alberto and Raoul--we had a wonderful stay and hope to be back soon!
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before going to the RossoSengale Loft, we stayed at the B and B. We love the walk ability, the hosts, the room was perfect and the breakfasts were amazing. The Loreto section of Milan is just wonderful.
hotelName:
16    RossoSegnale B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice hotel surrounded by a few restaurants and cafes etc. It is about a 25 minute walk to the Cathedral and the covered market shopping area. Rooms are modern and well kept. Breakfast reasonable by European standards but not a great selection
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came over for Monza GP, wanted somewhere close to Central station and city centre. This hotel was perfect, nice location in beautiful city. It is a well maintained hotel, decorated in a traditional style. Loved the free home made biscuits in reception (and fruit) breakfast was great. Excellent local restaurants.In the end never went to Central station, but used Garibaldi station to get to Lesmo entrance at the track. A pleasant stroll away.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect stay for three nights in Milan. The room was clean and had a fresh smell all the time. Breakfast was including everything in a very large buffet. Tram stations were just outside hotel in order to drive you in Piazza Duomo or Central Train Station. Subway station is about three minutes on foot.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was a very good staying experience. The the staff is so nice and amable, the rooms are very clean and the breakfast with a lot of choices. Also, the location area is very good, you can reach by foot the town center and the Milan Central Railway in approximate 10 minutes
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I`ve staying in thois hotel for more than 6 times during the year of business trips.I would like to underline that hotel is really nice, breakfast, especially bakery is fantastic; the rooms are always clean.Special thank you to stuff from reception - always helpful always in perfect mood! Stefano - thank you personally for your always support and help no matter how difficult the question is!For sure, I`ll recommend this hotel to all business travelers as me and tourists as well.Wish prosperity to hotel!KR,Anastasia Chenusha
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are not spoild when it comes to selection of gluten-free breads/cakes for breakfast in hotels so it pleases us to see a hotel taking this seriously. The rooms are very nice,big and clean. Around the corner you can find a Grom Icecream shop - All gluten-free!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is all about the location when staying in Milano. It is a great positioned hotel, walking distance from the main train station, just around the corner form Buenos Aires street (great for shopping), plenty of options for drinks and food around the hotel. Hotel is clean, staff very pleasant and helpful. I recommend it.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only had one night in Milano so wanted to make the best use of our limited time. Thanks to the staff they guided us very accurately so that we could see as much as possible. We had reserved parking and it was awaiting us. Very nice that the company took our car and parked it for us as driving in Milano is challenging!!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in classic style, Reception staff great and everything organised and smooth. Breakfast was good too and staff efficient and friendly.Good position in Milan central too, lots to see and easy walk around..Will stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked for long weekend and hotel was just the job.Well located, clean and well run. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful, particularly the receptionists and night manager who could not do enough.Well recommended place to stay!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four days in January. I chose this hotel largely because of price and location and, indeed, it was within 15-20 min utes walking distance of Central Station and closer again to one of th e city's major shopping areas, Corso Buenos Aires/Porto Venezia. There are many good and moderately priced restaurants in the surrounding area.The hotel looks quite plush and is warm and comfortable. My first impressions were somewhat unfavourable, however, as the hotel corridors smell quite unfresh (like the smell of a well-used vacuum cleaner bag) and the twin room I booked was smaller than I could ever have imagined, despite having read others' comments to this effect. Nevertheless, I soon found that, although small, the layout was well thought-out and the room did contain all we needed to make for a comfortable stay. After a day or two I stopped noticing the smell of the carpets.Breakfast was variable - always a good selection with lots of bread and pastries (including delicious chocolate and pear flan on one occasion) and also cooked food - scrambled egg, bacon, sausage, although staff seemed to have trouble keeping this warm.One of the hotel's best assets is undoubtedly the friendly and obliging reception staff, particularly Stefano who was always willing to advise us of places of interest to visit and who took the effort to find us an English-speaking cinema. Another member of reception staff, whose name I do not know, loaned me some hair straighteners which she advised I could hold on to until I was leaving.In conclusion, my stay at the BW Felice Casati was a positive one and, if I ever visit Milan again, I would most likely stay here.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Furnished in an artistic way, fancy hotel, good service and eco friendly :) they also serves you free cookies, croissants, tea and coffee :)) The reception is open 24/7 and it’s super warm inside, love it
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. The location is very convenient. Not far away is Milano Centrale and Indro Montanelli Park, in a short time you can walk to the city center if you wish. Hotel service is good and very tasty food. The hotel itself is very cozy and left a very pleasant impression and the desire to stay in it and the next visit to Milan.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is located 10 minutes walking from Milan Central train station and almost 15-20 mins walk from duomo church. Next to the hotel there are 2-3 very nice brunch places.Staff is very kind and always willing to help. Rooms were very clean and the room was quite.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, good breakfast, at near walking distance from the Central train station. Good for a business staying, maybe less for families due to the surroundings which might not be the best for a leisure trip
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is tucked away on a small side street filled with great little cafes and restaurants. One block away from two historic churches. Friendly staff that is helpful with any requests. Good breakfast buffet style with table service. 20 minutes walk to central train station built by Mussolini. That in itself is a must see.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed just one night and while the public areas and the staff were very good, the room was a bit on the basic side with a shower which kept slipping. The furnishings were good just let down by cost cutting on the plumbing!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed this location in an area that feels a lot like NYC with a neighborhood park, small shops, and good restaurants. It's within walking distance to major shopping, again, similar to NYC. The Duomo is bit of a hike, but doable. The staff was great and the room was excellent. We will definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in good location, only 5 mins from nearest Metro & 15/20 mins walk to the Duomo area. We were very lucky to be upgraded to a superior room with large bathroom & bedroom area. Staff are very efficient, breakfast selections extremely good and indoor & outdoor lounges very pleasant.My wife & I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay and visit all the main sights in Milan.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So far the ambiance was good. breakfast was good as well. Room is a little bit cozy but for single one it seems Ok. Train station was nearby Also amenities was sufficient. great hotel. Local clubs were also nearby.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My grandson and I chose Milan for our annual trip this year and stayed at the Best Western Felice Casati. The staff are all friendly and helpful, the rooms are spotless and the breakfast is great. The hotel is convenient for shopping and about a half hour walk to the centre of Milan or the Metro station is very close by. Hopefully we’ll be back!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant hotel, clean and peaceful. Also it is well positioned between central station, historical city center and shopping area, very easy to find and reach. Breakfast is fantastic, the lounge is very confortable and the entire property is spotless. My room was perfect dimensioned for one person. The staff is very efficient and helpful.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with family, we had two rooms. Nice friendly welcome from Stefano at reception on arrival. After going thru check in he then showed us on a map all the areas worth visiting. Rooms clean and tidy and decent size along with bathroom. Found all staff to be friendly during our stay here. Buffet breakfast had some hot food available as well as usual continental stuff. Quite close to underground system, Duomo only a few stops away, and also hop on hop off tour bus as well and Milan Central station only a 15 minute walk. Buenos Aires shopping area at end of road as well along within a few bars and restaurants very close to hotel. If we come back to Milan then we will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first trip to Europe and selected Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati based on reviews for a four night trip to Milan. We took the Malpensa Express from the airport for 13 euros per person to Cadorna FN station ( about 40 minutes), and then the metro to Porta Venezia station (6 stops). It was about a 5 minute walk from the nearest station exit. The hotel staff was very nice, spoke English and the check-in process was very quick. Our room was on the 4th floor with a vaulted ceiling. Room size is what I expected with two single beds. Everything in the room was clean and bathroom had a shower. Room was very quiet since it was block from any busy road and we never heard sounds from other rooms. The room had a mini fridge. The breakfast was included, and was much nicer than I expected with everything from croissants to mozzarella cheese. Hotel wifi speeds were always very fast with no issues. The TV had CNN in English. We did not use the workout room nor bar but the hotel had both.It is about a ten minute walk to Milano Centrale and very easy to get to. There are many restaurants, cafes and shops in the area within a few blocks. Repubblica and Lima station are also about 10 minutes away.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Partner has had to travel on business several times to Milan and each time he has stayed at Hotel Felice Casati as he likes the pleasant staff, clean rooms and good location. I was lucky enough to travel with him there recently and was very pleased with the hotel In every way. I could not really fault it. It is more of a traditional type of hotel, staff really helpful and friendly and within walking distance to the Central train station and the buffet breakfast was lovely, .If you are looking for somewhere to stay in Milan for a long weekend at a reasonable price and not expecting luxury then I would recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located just about 10 minutes of walking distance away from the Milan Central Railway Station in Via Felice Casati. This happens to be a reasonably good hotel & one of the few exceptions in European hotels which still offers options of few smoking rooms for the guests.Breakfast spread is elaborate & tasty.The front office staffs are very friendly & extremely helpful. Even the restaurant staffs are also very helpful
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everybody here knew what to do to make you comfortable and the room was week appointed. Breakfast good and the location was fine, but a little out of the city centre. Some traffic noise in the evening but it calmed down during the night.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got an amazing deal from a website and I was suspicious at first. But when we arrived I was amazed. The staff was really helpful and the rooms were so big. Even though we only were two persons. We even got a “better” room than we had booked. I’m so happy with this stay. Really comfortable beds too!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed here twice now and I must say both time the service and staff have been impeccable. The front office are very helpful and recommend fantastic restaurants.It is in a great location not far from the metro (4 stops) to the centre of Milan for shops and cathedral.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, excellent room, very friendly and useful staff.Location is great in a very nice old Milanese neighbourhood.Good breakfast for a small sum - very smart move of the hotel.One more excellent option for business trip in Milan.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even if the exterior of the hotel is not in the worst condition, the interior welcomes you to a warm, welcoming environment with clean rooms, rich breakfast, very friendly staff. The hotel is relatively close to the Milan dome (25-30 minutes on foot).
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the place. Just right. Don’t really like the decorating - kind of old fashioned - but it is however neat and tidy And well maintained.Beds are a bit hard for my taste but good. The room is very Clean! The Cleaning lady used way too much room perfume - so i opened the Windows for the rest of the day (fourth floor!) And asked if they would not do that anymore. No problem at all! I like the service! Breakfast is not that great. Pretty plain if you ask me. It is not that expensive though (5€ pp) so No Harm in trying. I prefer the coffeebars in town!
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is close to Porta Venezia, not as busy as the Duomo area, some tranquility and quite at night. Good amenities and the front desk is very friendly and helpful, offered a few restaurants suggestions, pleasant stay.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in a triple room and I was worried it would be uncomfortable. I was happy to see the room was spacious ( by Italian standards), the bathroom was amazingly big , the hotel is beautiful with paintings all over, 24 hours snack , tea, coffee, apple. Room service very polite. The breakfast was just right, not a lot of choices but it has what you need. 5 minutes walk from the main shopping street, and from the tube station and only 15-20 minutes walk from central stations. Also there are too many excellent Italian restaurants 10 minutes walking.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a decent location although quite close to Milan's city centre.Our experience was far from satisfying. It started with the reception staff being less than helpful.The moment we reached the room, it literally had enough room for two cabin bags and 1 and a half people on a queen bed. The walls needed maintenance and the whole hotel (apart from the reception) needs refurbishment. Some parts of the hotel were smelly and the lift was so small that even five kids would feel cramped inside. And yes, there was one gentleman from reception staff who did help us call for a taxi later but could not help us with another room despite it being our honeymoon.The only silver lining was the breakfast as the food was alright and the restaurant staff was polite and warm. Extremely disappointed by everything except the breakfast. I should have checked out more reviews before booking the hotel.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and spacious room and hotel itself. Staff was friendly helpful during the check-in and check-out. Everything was arranged very professionally without any flaws mentioned during our 2 nights stay.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located close to major subway stations that give access to the whole of Milan. The neighborhood is safe with many restaurants and bars in walking distance. The hotel is neat, clean, and staff is helpful (and they speak English) and friendly.Room is small, but has everything you need. Bed is good. Everything is very clean. The hotel offers valet parking with a third party, the car is taken to an to me undisclosed location. I opted for taking the car to one of the many underground parking garages in Via Aldo Manuzio. The hotel was not open about that option, therefore I choose to give a four star experience.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel overall is fairly good.The interior is nice and clean.The room was always very well cleaned, confortable and with a reasonable size. The toilet also had a good size.We had a good free wifi internet connection on the room and across the hotel which was a good asset.The breakfast is not very fancy, rather simple but good.The staff were always caring and nice.I really like the surrounding area, you have several nice restaurants and coffee places.The metro Porta Venezia is very close and takes you directly to the City Center -Duomo Plaza.It is also within walking distance from the Main station, like 10-12 minutes.we had minor incident with some left over money we had in our room, which was confused with tips but the hotel staff took care of the issue quite fast.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (my wife, actually) picked this hotel among other candidates for our summer stay in Milan.We finished our long-haul flight from Jakarta in the morning and recognized that having an early check-in need much more luck amid the busy and peak summer holiday -especially in Milan.We arrived at the hotel in late morning, when the front desk lady politely told us that many guests had not checked them out yet. She also promised that our room will be ready not later than 02.00 PM. So, we left our bagagge hotel locked locker room, and we took off looking for lunch.Got back at the hotel just couple minutes after 01.00 PM when we tols that our room is ready.The check in was smooth. Our luggage was brought already to our room.The room as we expect, not so spacious but efficiently designed, moreover it is sufficient for us. The hotel -in our opinion- was run effectively and efficiently. It has all necessity room amenities, some of them are just need to be requested via frontdesk...but it was not a big deal.Locationwise, only within throwing stobe distance to a tram stop (No.1 and No.5) that can seamlessly bring you to Milano Centrale train/metro station. The nearest metro station is only 5 minutes walking distance.On second day -which is Sunday- we decided to back to the hotel early (around 05.00 PM, as we couldn't take the heatwave any longer that day). We found out that our room was not made up. We felt a bit dissapointed, before 10 minutes later the room service lady knocked our door to made our room. She was shocked finding us in the room, she apologized that she was very busy that day (and we were thinking that she was doing some overtime). We told her that she can be back the day after, when she thanked us while handing over sone fresh towels and new bathroom amenities.Great location.Polite staffProfessional staffBreakfast is available with only small charge cost!!! - cheaper than having breakfast at the sourounding cafe.Recommended and worth to try and stay at this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on a tour and stayed two nights here. It was quite a small room, but adequate for two nights. Hotel staff were very helpful and breakfast to a high standard. The hotel didn't provide dinner so we ate at local restaurant. It was central so easy to walk to the various sights.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean neat rooms with all the amenities. Staff were excellent, polite and well informed. Could not do enough for you. Breakfast (5€) was outstanding! Near transport and affordable restaurants and bars. Would not hesitate to recommend
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Slightly out of town, but good city hotel. Rooms very good with lovely bathroom. Excellent breakfast. Fantastic reception staff - nothing too much trouble. We lost some Ted Baker sunglasses whilst out touring - we knew they were in one of 2 places. Not expecting someone to hand them in, the hotel tracked them to the restaurant we had eaten in, have collected them and have arranged for them to be sent back to us (at our cost).
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short walk from main train station. Also short walk to main Duomo piazza area. Good surrounding restaurants and attractions. Room was comfortable, clean and quaint. Staff was accommodating given the fact that my family and I didn't have a place booked until we arrived in Milan. I would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't be happier with the staff or the services offered at this hotel. Comfortable clean room with unlimited tea and coffee, cleaner in every day and fab toiletries provided. Breakfast was amazing, unlimited buffet with great choice. Free use of small gym and bikes plus wifi access and free use of computer and printer. Brollies available for rainy days too of which unfortunately we had too much. Unlimited pastries and fruit available in reception area which were gorgeous. Staff so polite and extremely helpful. Highly recommend this hotel - 10 min walk at most from Milan central train station too
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for just one night so impossible to make a full review…..in a general perspective, a nice propriety, with small rooms but well managed. Comfortable beds and nice bathrooms, although shower space, as usual in many Italian hotels, is ridiculous small. Only problem with the room was the smoke smell in it (in Italy it’s still somewhat common to find “Smoking Rooms” – be sure when booking your stay)…..great breakfast and expedite check out.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice breakfast,(if you avoid the sugarbombs). Terrible music during breakfast though. The room was not big, but big and nice enough to sleep in. And clean. Friendly staff and it was nice with afternoon snacks available. We used the bikes for free. Had a room towards the street but still not too noisy. Good location and not far from metro.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location within walking distance of main attractions. Close to main fashion stores so great for fashionistas.Stayed in a single room, small and compact, but fit for purpose.Free wifi and comfy bed, quiet location.Helpful staff.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one Saturday night in Milan at this very good hotel. Very friendly and service minded staff at the reception. Room towards the yard was very comfortable, quiet and clean. The room was too warm but we could leave the window open during the night for cold fresh air.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent some nights in this hotel. The hotel position is good, located in a quite street. Bedrooms are quite small for two, anyway they are very clean. Goood breakfast, Italian and international style.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really friendly service, tidy room and good location. Breakfast was good quite a lot of choice. Overall a good spot for a 3 night stay, able to walk to the metro to get everywhere! Area has nice restaurants and bars too.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best best western hotels ! Very close to the centre; 3 stops with the metro, 20-30 minutes to walk in slow motion speed;The staff is very friendly , the rooms are clean, beautiful furniture.The breakfast is plenty.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 weeks, the location is not great it is near Corso Buenos aires and the train station. Breakfast is not very rich:( they had no slippers although I asked for, in the end they managed to find a pair. Overall not very pleased...
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was on a flight from Zurich to Milan that almost crashed because of a bad storm. Called the airport as soon as plane was turned around and grounded in Zurich. Was supposed to pay on arrival- was told reservation was cancelled and would not be charged... Had only made the reservation a few hours before the plane left and the hotel was close to empty so they definitely weren't losing the income of renting to another client from me almost being in a plane crash however despite being told I would not be charged, I was charged anyway. Have contacted Hotel Casati on 3 separate occasions and no one has ever bothered to respond. Finally requested to a Chargeback from my bank-they responded to that claiming the charges were valid. Clearly they do not care at all about their guest experience and their customer service is beyond lacking. They legally cannot charge me because Force Majeure which nullifies all contracts because I could not reasonably hold up my end of it- same as if they had an earthquake and the hotel was destroyed- they would not be liable for their end of providing accommodation in such an instance- because it is out of the realm of reason. I will absolutely never stay there in the future and will warn everyone I know of not to stay there because of the horrible customer service. Disgraceful.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here mid October 2016, finishing off a cruise in the med and stay at Lake Garda before flying home.We arrived at the hotel before check in, however the receptionist was very welcoming and friendly. Unfortunately, but understandably, our room wasn't ready, so our bags were put in the secure luggage room which enabled us to go and see some of the sites of Milan.After visiting the museum we went back to the hotel to complete the check in. We were duly given our room keys and then advised that our bags had been taken to the room by the porter - a very nice surprise and saved us struggling with the bags.We reached the room and were blown away by the beauty and charm of the hotel. It didn't cost us much money to stay here. The hotel is very nicely styled, almost Parisien with the dramatic drapes and classic furniture.As we had an early flight we weren't able to have breakfast, but it certainly looked very tempting. The number 1 tram stop is just round the corner, which is the rickety old trams that are so iconic - a fun way to explore the city.
hotelName:
17    Best Western Plus Hotel Felice Casati
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nico at the reception gave us many tips about visiting Milan, which was really helpful. The building itself is amazing, the tarace on the rooftop is lovely, the rooms and bathrooms are comfortable and clean. We even got a coupon for a free cocktail. Choosing Babila was one of the greatest decisions I've made while planning my trip do Italy.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it'a architectre is very good the best place is it's TERRACE with a wonderful view but it's they had music on the first floor with loud sound & we in first floor couldn't sleep well:(((( their shower is very well unless private but is good & don't disturb others
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was very convenient - a short walk to the city centre, Duomo, etc. Also down a nice quiet street, though, which was a plus. The building itself is quite cool and unique too, as it is architecturally old and detailed, but revamped inside.The included breakfast was a great touch, as it took out some of the guesswork for where I should eat and gave me more time to spend on my actual plans for the day. Not super diverse, but very tasty.The staff were always pleasant, and willing to answer questions and help you if you needed.I'm on the fence about the actual rooms - I loved how there was an individual lamp and power point/charger connector with every bed (bunk beds), and the room was light and spacious with big windows. However, I did not love that the rooms had their own bathrooms - yes, it was more convenient than walking further to a more communal one, but being the only female among five male strangers made me a little uncomfortable to use the bathroom, and the shower stalls were so small that you could only really use the whole bathroom when having a shower, which made it hard for 6 people.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went there for 1 night only and my stay was absolutely pleasant, the room was clean, various breakfast included and I also get a complimentary drink in the bar. The location was perfect just 6-10 mins from the metro so it's easy to move everywhere...
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great clean and friendly hostel. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped. The bar is a great place to have some drinks and enjoy some live music. And it is in a great location. Will definitely come back!
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were super clean, modern and comfortable. Had the usual bedside light, shelf and usb ports. Towels provided. Comfy bedding. The bathroom was huge with 2 separate showers and a separate toilet and sink. Good storage for luggage with key provided.They serve food at lunch and tea so I ate my evening meal here which was cheap and tasty with a free drink included. They had an acoustic band on as entertainment who were fab.Location felt like it was a bit more out of it but was walking distance everywhere - just not close to much. 40 minute walk to train station. I would visit here again!
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group stayed in five different rooms and in three of them we found bed bugs. The service was often very rude and it felt like the staff didn't care about us at all.The location was good though...
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best backpackers we have stayed at! You feel very welcome from walking in the door, they had a bbq on the balcony that night where everyone could get to know each other in a relaxed atmosphere. The rooms were spotless and the bathrooms were amazing (hotel quality)
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a shared room with 8 beds (4 bunk-beds). It has a big bathroom inside with two shower stalls, 2 sinks, and a toilet. The staff is very friendly, helpful and speak perfect English. There is a breakfast buffet. There is also a bar on the 3rd floor, and a dining area next to the lobby where you can order dinner from their menu. I am satisfied and love my stay there. Only one con is that the lift/elevator is very small, so if you have big luggage, it's better to use the stairs.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve got the room next to the kitchen. Even if there is a rule to stay quiet in the late evening, we couldn’t sleep, because the sealing of the room is bad.Howewer staff and atmosphare is nice. :) :)
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have booked this hostel for me my wife at 11 p.m 09.06.2018. When I came at hostel at 8.30 am 10.06.2018. Receptionist and I found out that happened horrible mistake at Hostelworld and I left without any accommodation.When I have called to Hostelworld, they said that hostel Babila could cancel order without any penalties but hostel decided without any mercies make a penalty for 1 night. So, no more comments.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night here. Great location, easy check in, felt safe and friendly. V Clean and modern, v comfortable with great facilities. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay, best hostel I think I’ve ever stayed at!
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostel has very clean rooms with modern bathrooms. I slept on the first floor and it was kinda noisy sleeping with the window open (which was needed because there is no airconditioning). All common areas aresuper clean and great to hang out. Hostel staff is very friendly and the roof terrace is super chill. Breakfast was a little subpar, but not bad.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The crew and the food is nice. Very friendly. Completely overpriced for what it is though. The elevator is extremely small and uncomfortable and you can barely fit the luggage. There is no snack machine. I've stayed in incredibly better hostels for the half of the price. Very clean. The relaxing and game rooms are super nice, you have PS4, huge TV and nice chill areas and terrace. The kitchen is big, clean and nice. The laundry room is ridiculously small, there is only ONE machine. You can probably get an AirBnB for the same price as a private room in here.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a really great stay here. Close enough to the metro. The room was nice and big and had it's own bathroom. Everything is really modern. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Breakfast is ok, small selection but everything you need.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a hostel to stay, I definitely recommend this place. It has all the necessary amenities: wifi, shower, clean beds, good location...They also have a restaurant & bar so you don't have to step outside for food and drinks. The building has beautiful Gothic windows and a very modern interior.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located about 15 min walk from the grand cathedral, yet connected to all the public transport. Located also in a more locals area which is a great Milan vibe. The hostel is clean and really pretty. Very antique vibes which adds to Milan vibe.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They are professionals, everything is in the right place and the personnel is always ready and prepared for any issue one may have. Super clean, super nice. Highly recommended.PS. I lived in Milan for 5 years and I can tell the location is perfect! 10 mins walk from Duomo. Only thing, not many cool bars and such for aperitivo around (it's more a nice and tranquil area) but if you go to Piazza 5 Giornate and then Viale Montenero you find a "Navigli like experience" (10 mins walk).
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is super new and super Clean, probably because they storm into your dorm turn on the lights and start cleaning at 9:30am when check out is supposed to be at 11:30am. Not impressed by that at all.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly opened and excellently appointed bathrooms, shared kitchen with small but neat shared rooms. The staff are fantastic and hostel in a very good location. Loved Milan and the hostel was a plus to the trip. I arrived off an international flight at 10.30 pm and was able to get dinner and whilst there 3 days staff were always on hand to serve a coffee, give advice on daily activities and fix phones/ SIM card issues . Didn't take photos as advertised photos are accurate.
hotelName:
18    Babila Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes it is near the train station and we could easily walk to it with our bags in tow. But after walking all over Milan we were tired and resorted to room service for dinne which we never do. What an excellent presentation by the staff. They made two small orders into a grand result; even providing some small dessert items free of charge. Actually the pasta we ordered was better than some we had earlier in Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located conveniently next to the Milan train terminal, only less than 10 mins walking distance.Because of the great location, there are lots of business travellers but also people travel on pleasure. Hotel staff are very friendly and professional. You feel welcomed as soon as you walk in.The suite is spacious and functional.This is an old building but maintain well by the hotel.Very comfortable bedding and very quiet at night.The lounge provides great snacks and bar and also happy hour service everyday. Hotel breakfast is also excellent with choices from western to eastern cuisines.Thanks to the great leadership of the GM, the hotel provides not only the professional and efficient service but also a feeling of home away from home.Definitely the top choice for visiting Milan.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a nice Hilton, located a short walk from the central train station making it easy to travel the countryside and to use the local metro to see the sights. What makes this Particular Hilton OUTSTANDING is their staff! Our trip was last minute and we had not made definitive plans on what to visit in the area. Pio, the Concierge, was fabulous...his restaurant recommendations were spot on, and he moved mountains to help us book a private tour of Parma. Our evenings in the restaurant and bar were all the more enjoyable due to the friendly and extremely capable service provided by Susana and Andrea! Pio, Susana and Andrea have made this trip so enjoyable we are already planning our return! Highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located close to the Central train station in the business district. The rooms are a bit dated but very spacious. Mr. Papazoglou and his team run the hotel very efficiently. His assistant, Moira Cattaneo, makes sure that the guests get personal attention and is willing to go out of her way to help. The staff overall is courteous and very helpful. The executive lounge is always open and provides a good place to relax. The breakfast offering is large and will likely satisfy all palates.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were really satisfied to stay in Hilton Milan during our family holidays to Milan on 1-2 July 2019. The hotel location is very close to Milan train station so it would be easy for you to go anywhere in Milan and other cities in Italy. The family room is spacious, and they provided us 4 beds for family with 2 children, which are very comfortable. The menu for breakfast in the hotel is also very various, which is American breakfast standard where we could eat as much as we can. They also provide menu for kids. However, from the pricing point of view, it is a bit pricey, which is common for 5 star hotel like this.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are comfortable, plenty of space and the A/C works well. If you are lucky enough to have Hilton status, the Executive Lounge on the 8th floor city offers views and a wide assortment of complementary food and drink. That said, get there early! This lounge is not a secret and is well attended. A word of caution, the outside patio looks welcoming however, it’s the smoking lounge! So if smoking is not your thing, think twice before you select an outdoor seat (yes, been there, done that : / )This hotel is also within walk distance to the train station. An easy walk to navigate unless it’s raining, in which case a cab will not hesitate to take you. Cabs are always waiting outside.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious room . Good location just close to Milan central. Public Bus stops just front side of hotel. Hence no need to walk from Milan central if you hold day ticket. Smiling and helpful staff. Breakfast can be improved.No fresh juices.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strong Business Hotel in convenient location close to Milano Central station. As Diamond members we were upgraded to an executive room, with club lounge access. The room was well appointed, with good bedding and roomy bathroom. Executive lounge is of acceptable level, it is very dated although the F&B offerings are well executed. Good breakfast with ample choices for everybody and good service too.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a night at Hilton Milan and wished that it was longer. The location is terrific and so is the property. Breakfast was great. Room size was adequate and the hotel does come across as a luxury place. I will definitely go back whenever I go back to Milan.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super location right across the road from the railway station Milano centrale and about 5 mins walk. Very good rooms great service helpful concierge and warm ambience made my stay very pleasant. Would visit soon.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was great very helpful. Location is really good if you are traveling by train. Not in the city center but close to bike rentals which will only take about a 10 minute ride. Room was clean, mattress was not very comfortable. Parking was right next to hotel and operated by a third party at 25 euro a day.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have stayed probably 4 times here, always enjoy it. Very convenient location - easy walk from train station, pleasant walk to Cathedral and Brera areas, easy access to metro and trams, and underground garage. The lady at check in was so nice - upgraded to balcony room (my favorite) with Hilton Gold status. Breakfast food is excellent, the young ladies at the hostess stand are so pleasant, only negative is service can be uneven. The housekeeping was excellent - a special mention to the lovely Cuban housekeeper who is so friendly. The lobby has been updated and is quite stylish. The rooms could do with an update, but they are still nice looking and in very good condition. The hotel is a real winner and is quite often excellent value compared to other central Milan hotels. Looking forward to returning.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel only a block from Central station which made getting around very convenient. There are many restaurant choices within walking distance. The hotel restaurants are expensive and the dinner menu was too expensive and unusual to tempt us to use it. The carpet in our room was very worn and should be replaced. Our room included a balcony but to chairs to sit and enjoy it. Lastly, the bedding included a down comforter covered with a duvet but no top sheet which I found off-putting. The comforter was too hot to sleep comfortably and the pillows were very flat and hard.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you wish to be near the Central train station, this hotel is a great choice. The hotel is modern and clean. We particularly enjoyed the buffet breakfast and executive lounge. The staff was always helpful. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent one night in this Hotel for a business trip and it was a good experience overall. Like in almost all Hiltons I’ve been.- Room: My room 764) although I got upgraded, was not the biggest room ever but definitely clean and perfect. The bed was good. The Minibar full. Furniture in good state.- Staff: very friendly, professional and competent.- Concierge Gianluca: very friendly and helpful. Thank you Gianluca! - Hotel lounge, bar and restaurant are all good (see attached menu) and also look very nice. - ATM available in the Hotel on the ground floor. Very good.- Executive Lounge: an ok one on 8th floor with very good food. View on the city is nothing special.- Location: in the center of Milan, walking distance from the main station (Milano Centrale) but definitely not the best area of the city, especially at night. If I come back to Milan I wouldn’t regret coming back here.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the occasion of my mother's 75th birthday, my wife and I gave my mother a 'weekend in Milan' gift.Yesterday we arrived at this hotel and tomorrow evening we will fly back to Amsterdam. A few things went wrong at check-in, but fortunately this was solved to our complete satisfaction. Today my mother was really spoiled. I am very grateful to the manager for that.The hotel is not in the heart of the city, but it is close to the central station, the metro, tram and bus. This makes it easy to visit the main attractions of Milan. I considered renting a car, but afterwards I'm glad I didn't do that.The breakfast buffet is very extensive for European standards. The staff, from the concierge to the duty-manager and from the check-in staff to the chambermaids, are friendly and try to make you feel at ease. In short, we highly recommend it!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a Hilton Honors Diamond member, I prefer to stay at Hilton properties when possible. Hilton Milan is in a great location, just minutes walking to Milano Centrale for train travel, Metro, or even the Hop-on Hop-off bus stop across the street from both. Travel was a breeze. (Note: We goofed on our arrival and chose the wrong exit from the train station, so we ended up rolling suitcases over cobblestone and going "around" the hotel. Make sure you go out the main entrance (you'll see a big apple sculpture), and then it's a simple two blocks on the flat sidewalk!)The room we choose had extra floor space, perfect for keeping our luggage out of the way.The executive lounges are always one of my favorite benefits, and Hilton Milan was no exception, with one small annoyance. There is a sign at the entrance about consuming food and beverages within the lounge, but in all the hotels I have visited (which are many), taking a soda back to my room has never been an issue. On our last night here, we were stopped from taking 2 cokes back to the room, and it wasn't done in a very friendly manner. Honestly, if we were taking plates of food, etc., I would expect to be stopped, but for two cans of coke? Hmm...We had dinner in the restaurant one night, where service and food were both excellent.I would stay here again if I visited Milan, even with the grumpy man in the Executive Lounge.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent 3 nights at the Hilton Milan with my family, I booked the reservation using my Hilton Points, as I had read some good reviews about this hotel. I have to say they were spot on, from the moment we arrived at check-in, we were greeted by Daniela, who I have to say made our family feel totally welcome. We stayed in a family-sized room, very spacious, good AC (it was hot when we were there and we really appreciated that), we used the Executive lounge throughout our stay, relaxing prior to going out to dinner or just a quick coffee before heading out for the day. A good supply of snacks and drinks, a good-sized lounge that serves its purpose, no complaints. I also have to call out the concierge, Pio who was amazing and gave us some great places to check out for shopping, dinner, and sightseeing, that we could fit our 3 full days in Milan, I think we pretty much covered them all, he was super helpful. Overall we had a great stay, and for me, as this was a family break, we all really appreciated the efforts made by the staff to make us feel welcome and appreciated, even the little polaroid photo that the staff at breakfast took of us on our first-morning breakfast was just another WOW moment, small thing, but highly appreciated and a nice memento of our stay. As for location, the hotel is about a 4-5 min walk to Milan Centrale station that also has an MTR line, so having this as a base is also a great idea.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So on my travels, many times I am able to take advantage of my husband’s Diamond status with Hilton. So I have now become a Hilton gal! So I want to say this review is going to be more for those with executive status as this is what I am reviewing.So if you have diamond status, you automatically get upgraded to a room with a king bed or close to the executive lounge. The executive lounge is great because it has food or snacks almost all day long. After a long day, it was nice to come back to the lounge any time for soft drinks, water and snacks. Of course alcohol is at the happy hour! I loved it but my husband who travels to a lot of Hilton’s said it was not as amazing as he had elsewhere. The lounge was just packed for happy hour with almost no place to sit. People were there who purchased a room with executive benefits. But.... it was August when we came to Milan!! In the Executive lounge, there is an outdoor patio but since many people smoke in Italy... I did not like to be out there much. Rooms are clean, staff is friendly and try to communicate on English if you don’t speak Italian. Food is good (warm food/antipasta for the happy hour) and of course the wine and coffee were great!Very large work out room!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very handy to the railways station. Excellent staff - very friendly and helpful. The room was a little ‘basic’ and just as well I am not a large bloke - not sure I could have comfortably sat on the loo otherwise - it was stray close to the bathroom vanity.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with outstanding customer service! Concierge service was simply outstanding! Close to Milan train station. Exceptional breakfast buffet. Hot food hot and cold food cold. Lunch and dinner in restaurant very tasty. We highly recommend the Hilton in Milan! Thank you!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Special Thanks to Daniela from Front Desk who listened to my requirements and suggested a very good room as per my needsPerfect service. Will definitely Come back and stay here.Breakfast was a special experience. Loved it
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night at the Hilton Milan this July with our two teenagers. The hotel is perfectly located one block from the Milano Centrale train station, which makes transferring from the airport a breeze! Upon arrival the front desk staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming, with a special thanks reserved to Riccardo who was excellent. Our family suite with a connecting twin room was vast and spacious - the three bathrooms were certainly appreciated by our teen girls! The hospitality team delivered a bar cart laden with appetizers, sweets, prosecco and drinks to our room as they knew we were touring and missed happy hour in the executive lounge. What a treat! The buffet breakfast was truly impressive - my girls voted it the best breakfast in the entire month we were travelling in Europe. Kudos to hotel manager Nassos Papazoglou and his team for managing this hotel so well. We will definitely stay again the next time we are in Milan. Thank you for making our stay specail - grazie mille!!!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stop by every year since this hotel is in a great location, it offers an unbelievable breakfast and its staff is fantastic, always helpful and accommodating to any request. Wonderful hotel to relax and enjoy Milan.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel good location near train station and bussen good breakfast only matras was bad quality and bar and lounge Nice. Service is fine and lobby also nice place to be at evening. Also location nearby the bus station
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were super relieved after a 7 hour long delay and train trip to Milan to find the hotel near the station. The rooms are large, the staff accomodating, and the amenities of a bar and breakfast convenient. The Hilton is my go-to option any time I travel and, once again, I was not disappointed.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself& my husband are just home from a two night stay in this hilton hotel & i was just so impressed from start to finish.its ideally situated v close to the train station and our room was v spacious& comfortable with excellent air conditioning& a massive v comfy bed.the staff were v friendly& helpful & went over& above the call of duty to make sure we were happy with everything.they helped by giving us directions & telling us all about trains to the airport etc. I would definitely stay here again if visiting milan& i would highly recommend it!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went for 2 nights and were disappointed. The room was large enough but the bed needs to be replaced. The bathroom so small bang my leg against the bidet almost every time. Breakfast good but 45 euros for 1 day for 2 people seems high to me.Will not return to this hotel
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually dont like to put a review . But i was not able not to write. I am a hilton diamond member from 2013 . I usually always come to milano for business and shopping minimum 30 nights a year and always stayed in hilton milan. But this time was quite exceptional . The staff was really super exceptional from daniele valente the front office supervisor to Alice also the front office supervisor they were amazing. I really first time i felt i am home in hilton milan. But the super exceptional is Gianna Sardone guest relations manager without any doubt any single doubt to me she is the best hilton staff i v met in my life. Gianna thank you for everything you did to us you are one of a kind . Thank you for making hilton milan a home not and hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel next to the train station, very well organized, professional staff, a real pleasure. The lounge is nice, clean and the staff is super friendly, will do business again. Thanks for a great memory.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First class hotel with great welcoming staff. Extensive varied breakfast buffet. Perfect room and extremely fast room service. Good air conditioning which was important during the heat wave. Good bedding and bathroom. A first class hotel in every way.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the proximity to the central station makes it an ideal choice for a hotel to stay at in Milan, which is of very good standard, clean and convenient, especially for business travelers. the hotel has a nice lobby , and easy access.
