hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, near train station, overall staff was good with one person named Dannielle was superb. The bed @314 needs replacement. Water heating was very well controlled & Free internet was good. Breakfast was excellent...
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I get to this hotel every time I stay in Milan overnight. Usually everything functions well.. not this time.Our room was exceptionally hot (these days are super-warm, but it was predicted many days in advance), I had to wait for about 1 hour before getting a replacement - despite there were replacements available immediately. Tired from a long day at work, I ordered room service: despite having a room with access to the executive lounge, I could not find a single table available there.I got my room service ordered delivered in due time, but the food was not what I had asked for (omelets and fries for two, very simple order: yet they forgot to deliver the fries and the omelets were not cooked as asked). When I called to inform them about the mistake, they almost did not acknowledge it...Keep it up Hilton Milan, get back to your usual standards! I miss being treated as you used to
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, good location with great service. The central station is a few minutes walk with good connections to the rest of the city. Reached the hotel before the checkin time and was accomodated. However, the room decor seemed a bit outdated.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Design and layout of room was modern. It was also very clean, spacious and comfortable. Good quality toiletries provided in the bathroom. Breakfast served a good spread, and staff at the cafe were friendly and proactive. Most staff very friendly. Good location - just 5 min walk to Milano Centrale train station.Only negative: asked one of the female staff at front desk to help store some stuff in the cloak room freezer. When she was about to do so, a more senior male staff told her that she should direct us to the concierge. Then he mansplained to us that we should approach the concierge. I really don't understand this fine division of labour. There was no queue behind us, so there's really no need for her attend to other guests. Couldn't she have just attended to us? That male staff is really a gem.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 1 night prior to leaving Italy. The location was great. Not quite in the middle of all the attractions but right next to the train station so after only 4 stops, we were in the middle of Milan. The public parking is in a garage right next to the hotel with an entrance directly into the hotel lobby. Our room was very big and everything was super clean. Being a Hilton Diamond member, we had access to the executive lounge and the happy hour they had was perfect for us. Small bites and drinks were available. We had to leave really early the next morning and when they found out that we wouldn't be there for breakfast, they had the kitchen prepare "to go" breakfast packages for us that we picked up on check-out. It was so nice and it was a lot of food. If we ever head back to Milan, we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the upside, this hotel is in a great location for business (by Centrale Station) and the bar staff are fabulous with great attitude and service.The downside is that the Executive Lounge and particularly the rooms seem very dated. I know many Hiltons are older in style but this one definitely needs work to bring it up to modern standards - especially given the room rate.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a pleasant stay at the Hilton which is close to the central station so easy access to the trams, metro and trains to local area and beyond. Malpensa express also stops here.Staff on the whole were helpful either the concierge providing advise and dinner reservations. Staff at breakfast a bit rushed and we were not always shown to a table or provided with a hot drink.Room - king exec was big enough although the bathroom was cramped and if we were staying longer than a few days would have liked a bigger one.Hairdryer was miserable as is usual for hotels. Take your own if you have long hair.Exec lounge had a good selection of drinks but the snacks were a bit hit and miss.Overall though I enjoyed my stay and will return the next time I am in Milano.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was the smallest room I've ever seen even for European standards. Barely enough room to fit a king bed and the bathroom was so small couldn't fit two people at the same time. The only thing good about the location is that it is near the central train station; otherwise, it is a dead part of town. Workers were fine, executive lounge was nice. I would not recommend staying in this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located, and another great Hilton Experience. Place is a bit dated, but ain't nothing wrong with that. Staff was courteous and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choices. And the train station is only two blocks away.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful and courteous staff - Concierge went out of his way for directions, sites and to gain a ticket for a popular attraction (Antonio). The same with dining room staff and great food tool. Being close to the main train station allowed quick day trips to Bergamo, Como etc.. as well as access to two subway lines.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we used train as the primary transportation in our 14-day trip in Italy, Hilton Milan is perfect for us to its proximity to Milan central station. Very convenient for us to travel from Milan Airport and carried on to Venice. The metro station is just beneath the train station.Friendly staff, room feels a bit old but clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was short in terms of time, but the experience was unbelievable! My wife and I were greeted by a great Front office Supervisor! He treated us as though he knew us for years! Next, the room was so massive, I had to call my wife on my phone to find her. Clean, comfortable and totally an unforgettable time. At exit, front office trainee, Monique greeted us with an amazing smile and left my wife and I with a great departure!!!!! Thanks!!!!!!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We extended our cruise vaction to travel to Milan to see The Last Supper painting. As loyal HIlton members we booked the Milan Hilton hotel. We stayed in an Executive Room and booked daily breakfast. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and servers very attentive to our needs. The Executive Lounge was good size although very noisy. But snacks and drinks we plentiful. Servers were very attentive clearing tables and providing the needs of the pantrons. The room left a little to be desired especially for an Executive Room. Our room was what I would classify as a standard hotel room. The hotel locations was about 2 blocks from the central train station of Milan and close to Metro and bus routes. Overall I would recommend this hotel
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well what should I write about this hotel. I was skeptical about my decision when I booked this hotel but today I am happy that I have chose Hilton Milan in Milan. Location is just 200 Mtrs away from Milan central station. Currently I am staying in this hotel and moment I checked in it was pretty smooth . I was treated with smile by Gentleman name Johnny Giovanni. My check in was smooth and being the Hilton Honours Gold member I was upgraded to executive large room with executive lounge benefits. I was surprised to know that this guy is working in this hotel from last 39 years. Then we were helped by Faisal at Bell desk who really helped with our bag which was damaged during travelling and he always greeted us with smile .We are Asian vegetarian so the duty manager Ricardo and F&B manager really helped us in Breakfast and in executive lounge that we get vegetarian food specially prepared for us . Andre at executive lounge really look after us very well. Paola at concierge is a great guy and great help for us to plan all our trips . These are jewels of this Hotel and this Hotel is very lucky to have them . I strongly recommend this hotel to all my fellow Indian friends .
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hilton Milan is conveniently located 2 blocks from Milano Centrale, the main railway station, which provides easy access to the airport and the city. The lobby is very bright and modern, but I thought that the decor of the hallways and our room seemed dated and a little worn. However, we still had an excellent stay. The executive lounge was large, had an outdoor terrace, and was well stocked. The room was very clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff were all very friendly, welcoming, helpful, and professional, and provided excellent service. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be fair, it is the best hotel I booked in Italy. Professional and efficient service and good food. Having said that, it is is not a great hotel by any stretch of imagination. The hotel is old fashion with a 1970s style decoration. For instance the bathroom was too old or the safety deposit box fell apart. I was told €18 for parking but I eventually paid €25 - maybe I misunderstood!Despite this review I may use it again as Italian quality of hotels is not up to my standard.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Diamond Member and I stayed here at this property in February for 2 nights.It was an amazing experience . Everything has exceeded my expectations. Lately I am quite dissapointed with Hilton in general because the standards are going down and down. So lately in the executive lounge you only get beer & wine , at the breakfast there is no more fresh orange juice, just from concentrate and so on.But here they had everything you wanted, the executive lounge has several different options of spirits , beers and wine. The food is at a good standard too.The room was clean and perfect , I had a very good night sleep. The breakfast was the highlight of my stay, they have freshly squizzed orange juice, they have so many different types of pastries, italian cheese, they even have some Asian cuisine to choose from. I will definetely stay here whenever in Milano.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being our last leg of our little Italian adventure, we decided to treat ourselves and booked in here for 2 nights. When checking in however, we were informed that there was no free WiFi. (I know we don't go on holiday for the WiFi, but to use the internet to be able to plan your day, check in online with the airport and talk to family back home, it comes in handy) we were given the option to sign up to some club/newsletter this than entitled us to free WiFi, rather than pay the €20 for 24hrs. This did disappoint me a little. As well the disappointed look on the receptionist persons face when we said we didn't wanna pay and add the breakfast to our stay. We already paid so much and it seemed like they wanted more money from us. The room however was very nice and clean, and a decent size. The bathroom was nice and clean, but the shower could do with being updated. Hotel is in a good location to train station & metro.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2nights at Hilton Milan for a long weekend. The hotel was okay , with good service and clean. However Executive lounge Absolutely needs a facelift! It is old not very cozy but the food was very good!Easy access to hotel from central station and an easy 25 min walk to City centre!
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great staff and friendly receptionist is our first impression when we arrived at Hilton Milan. Rooms are spacious (equivalent to US rooms). it perfect if you travel by train since its only 4 min walk. 25 min walk to Duomo, or 6 min taxi ride (10 euro)
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The communal spaces of this hotel are lovely, clean, design forward and comfortable. The breakfast offering is enjoyable. The location is okay, but a bit of a walk if you are a tourist vs. in for business. The rooms are small. The beds are hard and the rooms run hot. The hallways are noisy. Between the temperature, noise and stiff bed, I never sleep well at this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's say you have a lot of luggage, and you are taking the train into or out of Milano Centrale. IF that's you -- this is the perfect location. It is a couple of miles from the Duomo and other downtown sights - but it is ONE block from the train station. Friendly, helpful staff - recently renovated lobby - good restaurant/lounge - "breakfast on the go" options - clean, well-appointed rooms. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hilton Milan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: · Location is perfect. 10 min. walk to Buenos Aires and Metro, Red Line. 3 stops to Duomo. Place is super clean. Matteo and Maria are excellent hosts and very helpful. Matteo responds momentarily for anything we need and always available. Communication via WASSAP works fine. Also, bunch of restaurants ( local people and authentic food ) right around the corner. Especially recommend Trattoria K2, just 100 steps away. · Internet basically doesn't work. Wi Fi is so weak, that I had to use my own roaming plan for $10 a day. Also, you need to be ready for shared bathroom. It is not convenient. And, most of the problems was very squeaky floor and echo. This is old Italian building and every move is seems to be very loud. If you are sensitive in this way, think twice. For young people, probably ok. ( This is only my opinion and referred to those who is sensitive for noises during sleep time. There is no intention to discriminate anybody by age whatsoever). And, I've been honest and write my reviews, based on my fillings only. Always. I can't say that everything is absolutely super. It is always good to have a room for improvement.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To start we really liked this place. It appears to be an older apartment with just two bedrooms. There were just a few issues that kept me from giving 5 stars Two of the issues aren’t really under anyone’s control...1. The BB is in an apartment and office square. So late at night and in the morning it’s loud...really loud...especially if you have a window open. I think the noise is from garbage pickup. I can sleep in noise so it didn’t bother me as much but it’s legitimately loud. I highly doubt a small child could sleep with that level of ambient noise. Again it’s not really something the B.B. can control 2. On booking.com the advertisement said free parking no reservation needed. While this is technically true they failed to mention that this is in reality street parking. Again not an issue except this is Milan and parking is a nightmare - especially for out of town guests who aren’t used to it. That said we parked on the sidewalk. Yes on the sidewalk. I will try to attach a photo to this review to show. So you not only have to identify an open spot but then navigate a rental car in some tight places. If you happened to rent a full size car parking would have been impossible and you would have to find a pay garage. My only issue here is that when someone says free parking you tend to think they have their own parking spots or lot for guest use. 3. Another noise observation. Since this is an older apartment it’s very creaky and noisy. So if the people using the other bedroom come home late there is no way to avoid hearing every step and door closing. 4. My final issue isn’t so much an issue as an observation. The proprietor is not located on site. Therefore when you arrive you may have to call them to come meet you. It was only a pain for us because we had to walk up to the second floor. Figure out no one was there and sort of double park while we called them. Again since parking and traffic is tough this wasn’t the easiest maneuver. All in all it was very nice. Good cold breakfast that is set out the night before. Good location and helpful proprietor
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a wonderful location to explore the older sections of Milan. Maria was a excellent and most helpful host and provided a very clean, large and and well appointed space for us. There was a great selection of breakfast foods and the setting was very quiet away from the street. Bathroom excellent as well. She gave us expert advice on the transit system, which was easily available from this location. Her whole approach made for a great stay in a new city. John and Liz McDonald
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our travel plans changed at the last minute and we needed a place to stay in Milan that wouldn't break the bank. We found Libeccio on Trip Advisor and Maria was able to accommodate us. What luck!! She is a lovely person who makes you feel right at home without being the least bit intrusive. The accommodation is lovely and clean, well located and very comfortable. If you are the least bit fit you can manage the walk from Milano Centrale just fine, but there is also a bus--Maria gives you all of this info well in advance of your arrival. She will offer helpful suggestions, give directions, make a restaurant reservation...you will very well taken care of at Libeccio. Maria explained to us that the name comes from that of one of the Italian winds, specifically the south wind, which is associated with warmth and hospitality. A perfect name for a perfect B&B!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for three nights and Maria's hospitality was one of the highlights of our trip. The guesthouse is located about ten minutes by foot from a metro stop with a small supermarket and a few restaurants and pubs close by. Maria was incredibly accommodating - from allowing us to check in later than the usual hour to organising an alternative route so that we could attend the Radiohead gig in Monday (we only realised there would be a public transport strike the day before)! The guesthouse is spotlessly clean, toiletries are available, beds are very comfortable and a generous spread awaits you each morning (typical Italian breakfast - lots of sweet things)! Overall, I would absolutely recommend that you stay here if you are visiting Milan.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can reach this accommodation walking from main train station and city center.Intern courtyard, the B&B has privates balconies.The entrance is the 'reception' and a large corridor gives access to the common restroom, the kitchen and the two rooms for the guests. Owners choice is not to have any TV in order to have a quieter stay and they promote books reading.Very nice simple furniture, inside a typical milanese flat.Breakfast is self made (they provide everything from the day before) and this makes you really feel at home- I loved it!!The place is so quiet.Hope to go back. Thanx Maria for your kindness
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice room, very clean, very friendly host Maria, we come back !good bed, bathroom clean and all you need such as hairdryer, shampoo....kitchen with coffeemachine, toaster, good biscuitsjust for myself a little bit far from the metrostation, but will not hold us to come back
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely fabulous!I was really surprised, because the whole apartment is bigger then I imagined from the pics.Everything was super clean and new.Both of the rooms (two) face the internal court, so deep sleep is guaranteed ))Maria (the host) makes feel you like at home. She is really kind and helpful.The location is perfect if you come for short stay to Milan (for vocation or work). The b&b is situated in just 25 minutes walk to Duomo and 5 minutes walk to Buenos Aires av. - one of the main shopping streets of Milan, and it's like 1,5 km from the Central Station which is really comfortable.You will find supermarket, different bars and cafes nearby, but that ones you'll need only for lunch o dinner, 'cause Maria provides a complete Italian breakfast.You won't regret!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did short honey weekend from Vilnius to Milan and to choose this place was one of the best choices we could make at this trip - We got even more than we expected! 1. Excellent value for the money. 2. Everything inside is very nice and really good quality: beds, furniture, bathroom and so on. 3. The place is cozy and you can feel like at home (Generally speaking, that was the first time in our experience when photos = the real view of the room). 4. Well located in walking distance to all the sights of the city. 5. Owners are very kind and always available for helping suggestions on restaurants, transportation, etc. The worst thing that I still miss amazing breakfast served in this place... :) Good luck for You, You do great!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked both rooms in this B&B so we had the whole place to ourselves. It is perfect for a family with at couple of kids or two couples who don't mind sharing a bathroom. It was spotlessly clean and nicely decorated. We had every thing we needed. Maria was lovely, gave us great directions on how to get there, greeted us on arrival even though our flight was delayed several hours so we were late!. She prepared a simple breakfast everyday, coffee, juice, fruit, yogurt, cereal, muffins. Had we wanted a cooked breakfast all the equipment we needed was there.It is not far from the Metro and in a great shopping area. I would definitely stay there again. You do need to walk up a flight of stairs, so if that is a problem it is the only downside.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just have stayed for four nights at Libeccio and can assure you, this is the best accommodation I've ever had in Milano. Tone location is perfect, just a short walk from Porta Venezia metro station and one of the best shopping streets in Milano, Corsa Buenos Ayres. There are a lot of authentic restaurants just outside the door, having authentic nor den Italian food and menyes not translated to English which is the good sign for food lovers. At tusdays there is a local food market which was a nice surprise for us, who love authentic food. Our host Maria has been perfect in each perspective possible; she is very friendly and helpful. She keeps the place unbelievably clean, have never stayed at an apartment so clean and fresh as Libeccio, bravo Maria! :) Every afternoon she sets the table for breakfast and every morning cleans the kitchen after breakfast. We got fresh pressed orange juice every morning, can you believe it? Maria helped us with the taxi and all the questions we had, about local food, transport, shops, etc.We had the perfect stay at Libeccio and will sertanly recommend this accommodation to everyone who wants to have a pleasant holiday in Milano.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Matteo was there to welcome us and he was very friendly and helpful. Comfy and room and very clean, breakfast in the morning perfect. Great location just 25 min to city center nearby good typical restaurant and shops. Definitely recommended...
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Matteo and his wife were very kindly and helpful : He even recomand us a good typical restaurant very close to the B&B. The room was clean and well equipied. Definitely going to sleep at this place if I get back to Milan !Thank you Matteo !
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely fantastic place for people who like to spend evening in a peaceful place after day of hard sightseeing. The decor of whole place is classic and warm. Owner is a very kind and helpful man. There are lots of fantastic restaurants and bars around where we met practically no tourists. I could not find anything I did not like about this place. Definately perfect choice for its price!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location close to the bus that goes to the city centre, the rooms were large and the bed was comfy. Beautiful modern decor and Matteo was great. Highly recommended and I will try to go back in the future!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: just returned from a quick trip to Milan with my daughter to see a harp of all things. Libeccio is actually a two bedroomed apartment with a large well-equipped bathroom plus a very pleasant kitchen. There's no TV (how wonderful) and plenty of books and local information. We arrived late, and our host Matteo, who lives with his wife close by welcomed us after 10pm with ease. Super breakfast. Very close to local pizza places (Portobello), Linate Airport (18 EU transfer by taxi or 1.5EU by bus (73 then 60) and a delightful 25 mins walk to the centre. Great place!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The bed and breakfast was wonderful. Matteo was great. The rooms are very nice and spacious. The shower in the bathroom had the best shower head. Of all the hotels I stayed at during my time in Italia, this place had the best shower head. The bed and breakfast does not have air conditioning, but I was not hot. I visited Milano in July of 2014.It had a shared bathroom. My first night I did not have another guest. My second night I had another guest. The lady was from Switzerland. I talked to her for a good hour. She was lovely. It is close to the city center and train station.  I would stay again. Ciao.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed 3 nights in Libeccio B&B Milan, and found our stay very pleasant. Matteo was great in responding to our queries in a very timely manner and was very good to deal with. We arrived via train, and the B&B was only 7 euro taxi away from the central station. The check in was efficient. Our room (a double) was spacious and homey. The apartment was very stylishly decorated. The first night was just the two of us, so the apartment certainly felt very big! Fridge was filled with fruits, yogurt and juice. Coffee machine was good. Breakfast was plentiful. One thing about this B&B was its location in a nice suburb. While it's about 6-8 minutes walk to the closest tram/subway stop, the surroundings were very pleasant and you got a taste of what life was like as a local. We walked to Duomo on the first day (40 minutes) - I probably wouldn't recommend it, as it's so much easier to just take the tram that is 8 minutes walk away. There are quite a few good restaurants and shops within walking distance and the neighbourhood feels safe. The apartment is inside a locked gate and it felt really safe. One thing to note is that if you call a taxi to the central station (or anywhere), you might want to get there early (say 5-10 minutes early before your taxi is supposed to arrive). We got to the gate 1 minute before our scheduled time, the taxi was already there, and the metre was 10 euro...so even though it was a short drive, our taxi cost more than double of what it should be. Alternatively you could take the bus 60, which has a stop just outside the apartment gate.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights, wishing we had stayed much longer. The apartment had two large double bedrooms, a kitchen and shared bathroom. The b&b was very stylish, beautifully designed and had so much attention to detail. It was so luxurious, and so immaculately clean. The kitchen was also very modern, and had plenty of choice for breakfast. The host was very friendly on arrival, and recommended us placed to eat out and how to get around Milan. This is a really wonderful place and will recommend to many people looking for great value for luxury. Will definitely be coming back in future. Thank you.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 相當棒的住宿經驗，環境漂亮乾淨，主人相當友好，也推薦許久好吃的餐廳As a backpacker, we did't feel well in Milano, but we recommend this B&B as it's friendly atmosphere.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B was perfect. Matteo and Maria were great hosts. Matteo picked us up from the bus stop and carried my luggage to the room. They also recommended some great places to eat which we really liked. A couple of the restaurants were walking distance from the B&B. The B&B was clean and neat and was really nicely decorated. Our room was a double and had a window that looked out on a courtyard which made it very quiet. We had a lovely breakfast in the morning with cakes, pie, danish, cereal, bread, coffee and juice. It was always set out on the table for us. It was only a 1 minute walk to the bus and a 10 minute walk to the subway. On the subway, you could get to the sights within ten to fifteen minutes. All in all, it was a great stay and we would recommend this B&B to anyone.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This bed and breakfast was an amazing find!! Most of the time we had the place to ourselves, which is such a treat in a massive city. It is so clean, comfortable and the owner is so kind. I wanted somewhere that would remind me of my apartment in Verona and it was a truly Italian experience as I had wanted. I cannot recommend this place enough, we had an excellent stay.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: stayed here a couple of nights, and felt relaxed and replenished as we sadly left. Wonderfully decorated, and in a beautiful old building. Breakfasts were great, as well as comfy beds.In a lovely location, not too far from town, and only a short walk to the metro. Thankyou! Hope to return again.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just as perfect, romantic, old/new stylish as on the pictures. Driven by the sweetest most wellcomely and organised young people. You can use everything in the apartment for breakfast(even though it's included in the price!), dinner etc.This is YOUR dream apartment for all the days! You do what you want, and even get great tips for things to go visit in the beautiful city.Tram just outside the door, metro 10 minuttes away on foot.Best stay ever!They will do everything in their power to give you a great holliday!Grazie!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night and were very impressed with the warm welcome and cleanliness of the whole place. There is a bus service that runs just outside of the B&B that will take you straight into town (15mins journey).The breakfast was absolutely lovely too. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Libeccio B & B is the absolute "home" away from home in Milan. The location is perfect. It is only a few minutes bus ride from Centrale (train station), the Duomo, Teatro la Scala, and the upscale shopping areas. Mateo was extremely accommodating and very helpful. He was more than happy to provide us with whatever we needed to make our stay comfortable and our visit to Milan memorable. Whenever we had a question or needed directions around the city, he was immediately available through texting or phone calls.The apartment unit was impeccable. The streamline decor is beautifully done! It was spotless. The bathroom and kitchen were always cleaned everyday. Towels and sheets were fresh and new. The kitchen was well stocked with breakfast foods. The table was always ready the night before and the foods laid out for early morning breakfast. Everything we needed was made available to us without hesitation or delay. If you like clean, friendly, safe, reasonable rates, and personalized service, Libeccio B & B is the perfect place for you. We recommend it 110%!
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Libeccio for two nights as a solo traveler on the final leg of my trip through Turkey and Italy. Mattias and Maria are two of the nicest people I've ever met. Their house is impeccably clean and decorated. My bedroom was beautiful. The bathroom is gorgeous. It may seem different to some to share someone's home with them, but I found it nothing but delightful. There was an excellent selection of breakfast foods, including Easter cake on Easter morning. The train station is very close - either walk about 15 minutes or take a bus for six stops. The bus also continues straight to the Duomo, and the Metro is also right around the corner. If you're like me and prefer to stay in small hotels and B and B's, I 100% recommend you stay here.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, wonderful old house, cosy contemporary room and delicious breakfast in easy going atmosphere! Superbly welcoming and clean apartment, fresh and quiet. This place has become my Italian home: can't think of staying in an another place anymore when I'm in Milan.Arja L.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were made to feel at home, which was wonderful, as it truly was someone's home.The room was lovely, spacious, airy, the breakfast however was the best aspect, freshly squeezed juice, fresh coffee, pastries, cereals and more. Well beyond average expectations of a continental breakfast.It is set in a lovely apartment complex, in a nice area, walking distance from the centre of town.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B is very easy to locate and is situated in a beautiful traditional appartment block. The room is stunning and the whole B&B is super clean. We were made to feel very welcome and had a wonderful breakfast. The B&B is small with only one room but don't let that put you off. It is very well organised and the hosts are lovely people who will help you find your way around the city. We would recommend this B&B to anyone visiting Milan.
hotelName:
20    Libeccio Bed & Breakfast Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is really friendly, nice rooms, it’s like an all inclusive hostel, you have a welcome drink, breakfast and dinner included, also you have pasta and snacks all day at their kitchen with a nice terrace on the 3rd floor. The atmosphere is great, everything is very clean and nice.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This home is THE PLACE TO BE in Milano. Its way more than a simple Hostel. Valérie Bobo Max everyone was simply amazing. Feels like home. Your 3 friends from Algeria! And at the end of the day .. we all say: juve **** :D
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the place to stay in Milan - super friendly and welcoming environment, great free breakfast and dinners, cool activities like karaoke or free walking tours, convenient location, respectful crowd, cosy common areas, clean and comfortable rooms (tried both private and female dorm) and nothing feels like to be too much trouble for the staff here. Will return again for sure :)
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay in the hostel, mainly because of the great location. Ten minute-walk to the Doumo, the church Santa Maria delle Grazie, the canals. It is in a shopping area, full of life. The hosts were very nice and the rooms were clean and comfortable. I shared it with seven guests. In general, they were very respectful and quiet.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is in the perfect location - half way between Il Duomo and the canals where loads of restaurants and bars are. Azzurra (receptionist) was amazing, very helpful and always smiling. Only downside was that the air conditioning was turning itself on and off which wasn’t ideal on nights where it was 32 degrees c. Free breakfast is decent and free drink on arrival is a nice touch. The bar of this place is quite popular even amongst locals it seems so there is always a buzz in the main common area :)
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greeted on arrival with a friendly welcome and cold lemonade! This level of hospitality continued throughout our stay and we were made to feel at home. Outstanding buffet food and we were encouraged to eat as much as we liked. Room was tidied every day and overall a very clean space. Beautiful balcony spaces and communal spaces were great chill out areas and events every night were a great way to meet new people. I would recommend the free walking tour from the hostel which was great and the close proximity to the Duomo means it's very easy to get around Milan on foot. An outstanding hostel!!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great hostel for a short stay in Milan. The staff were incredibly helpful and always went the extra mile to help. The hostel has a great atmosphere and it was right in the centre of the city. For the price and the experience this place is unbeatable I would 100% recommend staying!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As you might expect from a highly-rated hostel, this double room was spartan, but reasonably large and clean. It also had a nice balcony. Things I liked were the key-card security for all doors and elevator. That certainly made me feel more secure. Perks included breakfast and dinner. Being a vegetarian, their dinner suited me fine: pasta, salad and several kinds of beans and corn. They also toss in one beer or soda per person. Breakfast was basic: eggs, a type of meat, toast and several types of fresh fruit. The fresh peaches were perfect. Please note that I could have booked this significantly cheaper on Booking.com ($99 USD) than I did directly on the phone (104 euros plus another 4 euros tax). When I mentioned this to the desk lady, she didn’t seem to know anything about it and suggested I book it online.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was super friendly and made sure had everything we needed in order to organize a pub quiz! The atmosphere was great, and the location is very close to the center of Milan. Would 100% recommend!!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in mid April as part of a two month trip in Europe... The hostel was a welcome change from the hostels I’d been staying in for the past couple of weeks, with comfier, more spacious beds, warmer blankets, clean bathroom, beautiful terrace, bar, and way more selections of foods at breakfast as well as a free dinner, and some free food available in the communal kitchen...I lost my glasses while I was in this hostel, I only need them for reading so I hadn’t realised I’d lost them until a few days after I left, I emailed the hostel and they were very quick to respond, let me know they had them, and that they would keep them safe until I could pick them up. Unfortunately the way my trip was planned I was unable to pick them up myself, so the person I was corresponding with said that she would be able to send them to my home address, they arrived this morning, so thanks to them I managed to save having to buy a new pair of glasses or flying back to Milan just to pick them up! Would definitely recommend this hostel!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is what every hostel should aspire to be.Everything is run very smoothly, it has an excellent vibe, and the beds are extremely comfortable. It's also right across the street from Milano Centrale.It's rather expensive, but there is clearly a reason for it.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly Staff, relaxed atmosphere, welcome drink, sturdy bunk beds, comfortable mattress, the room, toilet and common spaces were very clean, great shower pressure and water temperature, very good breakfast, the fact of always having food available in the kitchen, just steps away of various attractions ... it was a perfect stay!!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ostello Bello realy deserves its place between most famous hostels of the world. Perfect location in the heart of the city, 500 metres from Duomo. Free welcome drink and walking tours. Many of great ideas how to make easier the stay in city. Great buffet breakfast (genious brownies!) and dinner (!!) including in price. Amazing multilingual stuff. Permanent offer of free food (yoghurts, pasta, sauces, fruits, cookies, tea, coffee) during whole stay in the kitchen, co you haven´t go to overpriced restaurants. Two nice terraces. Excellent bar (I definitely fall in love with the Long Island Ice Tea here). Perfect cleaning service in room. Only few tiny negatives: the air-conditioning in our room doesn´t work best and was a little noisy. And during the evenings, the bar was overcrowded, so the dinner was not the calmest for us. However, it is rather irrelevant reproach:)
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time staying in a hostel. I was so nervous, but all of that immediately disappeared when I got to Ostello Bello! The staff were friendly and caring. They provided a welcome drink and towel, which I wasn’t expecting. The room was clean, sheets were crisp, and the bathroom was sparkling. Most importantly, I always felt safe. The hostel lobby is a popular place for locals to drink and eat, so it can be noisy at times. One night, they had an amazing swing band perform in the basement! Even with all this excitement, I never noticed the noise once I was in my room. I can’t speak to the food due to eating at restaurants, but it smelled and looked great every night. In the morning, I always had the free cappuccino or espresso, and they were delicious. Finally, the location was very central. I waked everywhere, but it’s also close to the metro if you choose. Overall a wonderful time and experience!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hostel experience. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay from the minute I walked in to the minute I left. The staff, the amenities, the location, the vibe. This is the reason why I gave 5 stars! I liked the fact that breakfast, and dinner was included. The drinks are cheap! The staff gives a warm welcome.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this hostil to any one who will decise to visit Milan, the hostil location is vey good it is too close to duomo which has everythings shops, restaurants, bars , ..etc. The hostel's bar is awesome where you can meet friendly peoples coming from different countries, they have a free welcome drink and a free breakfast. And they are delicious, the staff are so friendly and very helpful. The rooms are too clean beds, towels, bathrooms, the bathroom's area is big.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People was very nice in the reception. They help you with everything. T he bedroom was clean and the bahroom too. They have breakfast and dinner so you dont have to spend more money. Perfect place for those whose are travelling by theirselves.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 200m from Milan Centrale station. Happy and friendly staff, great ambience. Don't miss if if you pass by Milan. Check it out and have a free drink as you walk in ! Amazing breakfast and even aperitif. Give it a try and be happy
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was perfect for a solo trip. The crew was really nice and all the time tried to make me feel comfortable and home. The bedrooms were nice, big and really clean. Location is great, only 10min walk from the duomo and city center. The price is really good considering the fact that you have breakfast, snacks and dinner included. The bar was really fun and karaoke night too! Really enjoyed staying there and willcome back for sure
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been travelling for over 2 months and this has been a memorable and favourite hostel of mine. They give you lots of free food and the atmosphere is great! I usually keep to myself but I made lots of friends in this hostel. I would definitely stay there again. It is definitely worth the price!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sounds pretentious, I know, but the atmosphere and vibe were spot on. Enjoy drinks in their main area with guests and locals in the evening - don't worry, you don't have to mingle because it's not about organised fun. We had one of the 2 bed bedrooms on the top floor - as expected small but you don't need more. Plenty of space to sit indoors and out on different floors, kitchen with some basics (milk, yoghurt, fruit etc.) to get you going and equipment to cook for yourself, friends/family. Good daily recommendations on where to go/what to see in the city and a lively schedule of their own events in the lounge/basement. We arrived too late for their 3pm walking tour at 3pm - good to get your bearings..if you're into that! I would recommend staying at the hostel.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ostello Bello is an awesome place full of friendly smiling people who made our stay to be an unforgettable memory. Located in the hear of the city, offering clean rooms, various common spaces, wonderful atmosphere, great local recommendations, tasty breakfast and dinners and lots of other freebies is really hard to beat. Cheers to Federico and his team - was nice to meet you all and hopefully see you again :)
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I totally enjoyed my stay there. I was welcomed really friendly and even got a welcome drink later at the bar of the hostel. On friday night there are a lot of young people going out and meeting first for one or two drinks in this bar. You can also buy there pizza etc. The breakfast was amazing. The inner court is one of the most beautiful i have ever seen.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ostello Bello Grande was a great stay, the staff are informative and friendly which is apparent right away. The hotel may not have a pool but the amenities and services they offer made everything simpler. For example, they have portable wifi hotspots you can use/rent. Free breakfast and dinner, two terraces, a free-to-use kitchen and events every night.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is amazing! Friendly staff, fun social activities to meet other travels and free breakfast and dinner! Central location, you will feel at home straight away. The kitchen, 24/7 bar and outside terrace make this place a home away from home. I will definitely return here.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Ostello Bello. Immediately upon walking in we were offered a warm meal by an extremely upbeat and friendly host. I had fun listening to live music at the downstairs bar and their food and drinks were well priced. The room was very unique as was the entire location. Tons of color and spunk made this hostel my favorite that I have been to in Europe to date! I can’t wait to go back.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hostel, clean, conveniant. There is an area to put/lock your stuff underneath your bed, and plugs for each bed.The staff is welcoming and very helpful. Garden area and rooftop to chill and enjoy the free beer that they give you when you arrive.Highly recommended
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is probably the best hostel I've stayed in. Conveniently located next to the central train station. Super friendly and helpful staff. Clean, quiet and comfortable rooms. Free band, dinner and breakfast. Nice mix of people from backpackers, families and older travellers. Ticks every box. Perfect hostel experience.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is PERFECTLY located walking distance between the duomo and canals. Immediately upon my evening arrival it was, 'hey wow you must be hungry, here's a plate of spicy pasta - and what do you want to drink ?'. The staff was SUPER friendly and helpful, quick to share a tip, or even hang and chat with a small group at 2am over a digestif if you make the effort to engage with them. Rooms had thick curtains (for late sleepers), comfy beds, and HUGE drawers with a lock for belongings. Always had great music playing in the main area, helping add to an already fantastic 'vibe' and energy level. HIGHLY recommend it !
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location (7 mins to Duomo), very clean and safe, staff is super friendly, food is delicious! If I come to Milan again-I’ll stay there for sure! Thanks Ostello Bello for very cozy comfortable days!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the stay. Like the fact that you have a welcome drink, 24 hours snacks and drinks etc. Free breakfast and dinner is also super great. The staff are friendly and super cool. Enjoyed my stay. Only main issues was- SO MUCH PLASTIC IS BEING WASTED!!! Right from the cups to the small sized dinner plates, everything is single use, non recyclable plastic. I'd be glad if they could take action on this and find an alternative for this.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On our way to Switzerland, we spent two nights at Ostello Bello. Friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable rooms. Included breakfast and pasta dinner was excellent and great value. Great central location in Milan. Great space for our group of 9 - including six 14-year-olds to stretch out. Thank you Ostello Bello - great experience beginning to end.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been there just to drink a beer but I immediately understood it was a special place. Cheap prices for the hostel and the bar and nice environment ( full of guys and girls ). The perfect place for a visit of Milan or a night with friends
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, very welcoming right when you walk in you are greeted and offered a drink. Please very nice offered maps right away with additional information. Amazing terrace on the rooftop with hammocks. Met amazing new people. You dont have to look for nightlife please is packed by the evening with the bar right there. Place also very need and not at all rundown :)
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On Friday, June 22nd, I went to Ostello Bello with a group of Brazilian friends to watch the game Brazil vs Costa Rica. We've chosen the place because of its friendly and youthful atmosphere, but this time we didn't get the service we expected.The game was early, 14h, and there were mostly Brazilians and tourists there, plus a couple of Italians. At the beginning, it was all quite cheerful, but then some situations put us off quite a bit.First, they asked to take a picture of us, but without the only guy that was with us. They wanted a photo with "Brazilian girls" only. Then, they kept asking us to dance funk, although all of us were there just watching the game and cheering for our country. It got to the point where they muted the game and put funk music on.Some may say that it was a joke, or they just wanted to keep the mood light, but it didn't feel like that to any of us. It was annoying and uncomfortable. And it shows that Ostello Bello's staff is not able to see their customers beyond commonplaces and stereotypes.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first time staying as a hostel and was NOT disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful since we arrived a day early and altho they were fully occupied they helped us find alternate accommodations for that night. Also helpful in printing out train schedule for our departure. One Free glass of wine offered, and our stay included a daily breakfast (eggs/meats/pastries/coffee) and nightly aperitivo which was more than ample. We had the double room with private bath which was spacious and very clean. Even though we were probably the "oldest" people in the place, the staff made us feel welcomed and right at home. We loved it!!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an amazing time at OstelloHostel, it has a very convenient location all the main attractions are in walking distance. Hostel: clean, organized. The kitchen has absolutely everything.Bathroom/Shower super clean. The rooms are perfect. They even give you a large towel and a locker if you need one! Very nice roof top area to relax! Breakfast and Dinner included! That makes it an super value for your money :) and you get to know other Traveller and even Lokal who come around. Would like to give a special mention to the lovely staff. They were very helpful and made me welcome from the very first moment I walked in! Side note: I arrived very early, and the manager offered me straight away a Cappuccio, I don’t drink dairy milk, so he went out to get me soy milk! I stayed in good hotels before and they didn’t bother, this is just a hostel! What can I say... TOP Grazie mille!! It’s funny but this place is my favorite part about Milan :) Sending lots of love from Munich,I’ll be back soon!Julia
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceeded my expectations, which were already high! Everyone was so friendly, I made friends the first night playing fussball and chatting. I met so many people in the 3 days I was there and even went out sightseeing with a group of them on my last day. The food was good and there are lots of common areas to hang out and rest, and the staff was very friendly! Would definitely recommend to anyone, and would go back again for sure :D
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay at Ostello Bello Milan was amazing! That's pretty much due to its atmosphere and people that I've met there. It of course includes the amazing peopleware from the staff. A special thank you to Gabi(ria) and MaTia! <3Besides that, the place is good and have a nice infrastructure.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very nice, the rooms clean and the food and beer were great. At night there's no noise so I didn't had a problem sleeping, plus the mattress was good too. I have no complaints other than the common bathrooms could be a little cleaner, but it's understandable when there's so many people using it non stop
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to start! I have stayed in many hostels all over Europe and Ostello Bello is, hands down, the best one.The staff are some of the nicest people I have ever met. They were so welcoming, helpful, and accommodating. They made check in easy and showed me the best places to go in Milan while also giving me great tips on my next destination. They facilitated a great social atmosphere that made everyone feel welcome at the hostel.The actually lodging was great too. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff made sure you had everything you needed. I really enjoyed free breakfast and dinner, which is very hard to find in most hostels.Lastly, the location is perfect for sightseeing in Milan. You are a 10-15 minute walk from everything you would want to see.It is a little pricier than other options in the city but it is well worth your money. If I were to return to Milan, I wouldn't consider any other place than Ostello Bello!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was one of the greatest places I've ever stayed in. It was very clean, beautifully decorated. The staff there were very helpful and polite. They would serve free coffee. The breakfast was amazing and everyday you could taste different things. Amazing atmosphere!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ostello Bello was a clean, comfortable hostel. I was particularly appreciative of the staff that made arrangements for me to stay with a friend after booking the hostel last minute. Good vibes and good people.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ostello Bello was the best hostel I have ever stayed in, anywhere in the world! My time Milan was made by my experience in this Hostel. The BEST PART about my experience at Ostello Bello was the staff. The staff were so friendly, fun and helpful. In particular, Helder was the best hostel staff member I’ve EVER had. He was so helpful, fun and made my time here! He did the best quiz night too and was always looking to make your time enjoyable. Highly recommend Helder and this hostel!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there with my brother for his birthday. We had a blast. Clean hostel, easy to find. Friendly staff, delicious food. Good vibe overall. The hosts went above and beyond what I was expecting. Would gladly stay there again. Grazie!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the atmosphere here, the staff were genuinely helpful, the location was just fantastic both for getting into and out of Milan, and for getting around. I was arriving late from St. Moritz, and had an early flight and I wanted to maximise time exploring. Couldn't have asked for anything to be better. My (single/double) room was spotless - N.B. it was two beds together. The bathroom was very well appointed with towels and toiletries, and they were very good at minding cases and bags for people. I didn't need this, but it's always nice to know. I enjoyed the free arrival drink. The food and breakfast aren't worth rushing in for if you're arriving late (as I was), but if you're staying for more of a hostel experience it's lovely to eat and chat and meet folk. I didn't get up to the rooftop as it was raining, but it's there, and there's a lift, that works perfectly, although it's small, old and slow, which is to be expected in an old building in the centre of town. Room temperature was perfect too.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Welcomed with a plate of pasta and an espresso on arrival. The friendly receptionist took the time to give me a tour of the hostel and showed me to my dorm. Great equipped kitchen on the top floor with a sunny roof terrace, though there is a free ‘aperitivo’ buffet every evening in the bar and breakfast in the morning. It was nice to see a hostel bar popular with both guests and locals. Live music in the basement.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great & happening hostel with free food, breakfast and dinner served on a daily basis. Breakfast is until 12 noon! Clean towels, soap, shampoo and hairdryer are provided. There's live band performances. It's located within 15 minutes walk to Navigli, Duomo, Castello and Zani Viaggi. The only downside is the walls are thin, hence, you could hear almost every noise from next door. However, that can be overcome by using ear plugs, which are distributed for free by the friendly staff upon request.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of those hostels that has both top-notch facilities and people. The staff are incredibly friendly, they go out of their way to speak to everyone, make you feel at home and give you advice about your trip. I also met plenty of solo travellers staying at the hostel and they were also incredibly friendly and sociable. In terms of facilities, there is plenty of space both in the rooms and the hostel - with two terraces, a living room, a dining area and a bar. In the room, you get a charging station next to your bed, a locker underneath the beds, and the towels are free. At the hostel, a lot of usual extras come free, and here, just because it's free doesn't mean its bad - the evening meals were delicious. If I ever come back to Milan, I am definitely coming back to this hostel. I was talking about the staying in 'the best hostel in Milan' with another traveller in Florence, and they immediately knew where I was talking about. Its reputation precedes it and you should believe every word of it.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like the vibe of this place. It has a feel of home, helpful staff, good coffee and live music. It has very good prices as a hostel for the center of Milan. I recommend this for young people and for those who want to relax and/or study.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though not as new as OBG, OB is located a bit further in town and it does offer you the authentic hostel experience. The rooms are neat and the breakfast was great. The staff were amazing and really friendly! Will definitely go back!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Milan was my first stop after a long 30 hr travel time and a lost bag!I arrived at Ostello Bellow @ 10:30pm, was greeted with a smile, plate of pasta, and beer. A beer on the house was provided when they heard that my bag was lost. It's also a local hangout for people in their early 20's to early 30's. Local to the shops & Duomo means you can literally walk everywhere.100% would recommend.
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is very well maintained and very cute. There is a patio where you can have great drinks made at the bar. There is also a secret garden with hammocks, great to chill out after a long day around the lake. They serve breakfast and light dinner. All the kitchen appliances and the whole amenities in general are brand new. When we were there there was live music in the patio which was very nice. There is a big supermarket next door, very convenient as it is opened 24/7. Downtown Como is 5 min away and the ferry to other spots around the lake is also 5 min away. As I believe it is the only hostel in Como, the prices are high. Btw, beware of mosquitoes during summer!
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hostel in Milano. Very helpful and friendly staff. Beautiful and cozy place to enjoy a stay in this beautiful city. From the check-in to the check out everything was perfect, especially the glass of wine when you wait to check-in. Definitely a place where you wanna go back and recommend !
hotelName:
21    Ostello Bello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived at this hotel before mid day for a 3 night stay.We were able to check in and leave our luggage in a secure place. The front desk staff were more than helpful in giving directions to where we could go marking this on a map.The hotel is an easy walking distance from the Duomo, La scala and Galleria Vitorio Emanuelles.Our room on the first floor was spacious with a good size unsuite and comfortable bed. The room was spotless and maintained well throughout our stay.Breakfast was very good witth a good selection of fresh fruit scrammbled egg bacon and saucisse and an array of cold meats ,cheese bread etc cappuccino was served at our table on request it was very good.Only complaint about breakfast was the juices were too sweet for my tasteNice bar area for a nightcap in the evening.Despite being busy the hotel was quiet and we slept wellAll staff we encountered were very pleasant and helpfulI have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for a stay in Milan
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from 3 nights at the Hotel Manin .This hotel is ideal for seeing Milan with the Duomo only a 15 minute easy walk.The hotel is modern inside but the rooms a light and quiet .The beds are comfortable and we had a view out of the park . Breakfast is a buffet but has a good choice .The housekeeping is to a high standard.The reception staff are excellent with good knowledge and very friendly, particularly Cizane (hope I have her name right).
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my husband and college aged son in the junior suite. Very clean and lots of room for the 3 of us. Short walking distance to the Duomo and other attractions. Arrived in early am and they stored our luggage until room was available. Hotel staff was super friend and accommodating! The free breakfast was awesome. Highly recommend for the price and value.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Manin is located in a nice location right across from a park and walking distance from the Duomo and restaurants. The room with double beds was spacious for Milan. Bathroom was also very nice. However, the staff at the front desk were not nice. The bell boys and the bartender were polite. Front desk staff (multiple) were very rude and not helpful. Although the hotel was nice, I would not return to this hotel. The front desk person who I had initial contact with set the tone for me and the rudeness continued with other front desk agents and I even witnessed it with other guests. Management needs to change the front desk employees.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was great. Lovely park is just across the street and you can walk to train station, duomo, fashion streets etc.Rooms were nice, clean and well taken care of daily including towels etc. Breakfast was versatile and delicious.Staff was very helpful and friendly. Service was truly excellent, especially breakfast was enjoyable experience every day during our stay for four nights.Highly recommend!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Milan. Hotel in great location, short walk into main area, very central. Staff very friendly, and helpful. Hotel very clean, room lovely, mini bar, safe, coffee making facilities . Very comfortable bed, excellent clean each day, and change of towels. Would highly recommend .
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to Milan for the first time and stayed in Manin. We had the standard room in the first floor and It was practical and clean. Manin garden is really beautiful and great place to hang out and enjoy. Reception was really helpful with everything and guided well when needed. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was having some serious buyers remorse after booking Hotel Manin, I opted to upgrade for a room with a Balcony, I stayed three nights and it was $2,200 USD total the room overlooked the gorgeous Giardini Pubblici Indro Montanelli (park, a must to explore). Upon arriving, I was delighted! The bed was so comfortable and the view of the park was very peaceful. I felt very safe and I definitely appreciated the attention to detail (most notably, the cleanliness). I loved wearing the really plush robe while laying on the memory foam bed and ordering room service, it was a dream! They even provide a complimentary Italian cake. The wall paper was trendy and the purpose lighting was luxury! I suggest getting the breakfast, have a latte and eat a croissant filled with cream. On my last day there was a guy making canoli it was amazing. I can not wait to come back but next time I will probably opt for the standard room. You should definitely stay here if you're wanting to be in the city center withing a 90 second walk!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i been with my friend and we had a great time, nice food and absolutly great service and stuff, i am already planning to go back soon.some staff speak English which is always a bonus and the staff and service was excellent, we can highly recommend a visit here if in Milan, very impressed.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just across a big park, yet in walking distance from Duomo and most of tourist attractions, the Manin hotel has given us some great vacation in MIlan!Our rooms were very clean, cozy and comfortable,our beds were excellent, the personnel was very helpful, friendly and kind, especially at the reception and the bar!My only wish is if they had some more choices on the menu of the bar for a quick dinner, for some really tired tourists like us...…Again, I think the location is a great advantage for this hotel, congrats to the management for the personnel!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superbly located, walking distance from Duomo and fashion district. Amazing (park facing) room. Magnificent beds (and pillows), spacious bathroom, good breakfast and friendly staff at a competitive price : will take it again when back in Milano.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A quick weekend trip to Milan and the hotel Manin was a perfect choice. It's walking distance from the duomo, the staff were friendly and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had a quiet room looking out the back. Breakfast selection was superb - organic yogurts, freshly baked bread, fruit, eggs etc. perfect for setting you up for a day of sightseeing or shopping!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most rooms are small. Be sure to get a terrace room if you stay here. Worth the extra price. The hotel has kind of a W vibe to it but not the lounge action. Hotel is city center but still a bit of a hike to get to the Duomo and some other attractions. We did Uber. We thought our Uber trip was a bit expensive going to Duomo 14 euros. So we took a taxi back 7 euros. Don’t use Uber in Milan. Taxis are less expensive and easy to get. They are also very nice.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Poor. Room far too hot and had to call into the pharmacy because of bites. Staff seem friendly but porter lacked solutions to sort out the heat. Would not turn the heating down. Spoke with other guests who were facing the same problem. Clearly not taking on board feedback?
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great position, walking distance from everything. The staff is very friendly and helpful; they looked after me in every aspect. The price of the room is very reasonable, especially because of the privileged position.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We went to this hotel with great expectation but it was not as we imagined by the nice pictures from the web. Best think was the brioche in the morning. Even in Italy never had such good ones. Rooms were so so but we had deluxe so I wonder how small the normal room would be. In general looked very cold atmosphere
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at the hotel have been very helpful from the time of my online booking. They have always replied to my emails quickly and with good information. The hotel is located in a very good area within walking distance of the centre of Milan and most attractions. There is public transport located within 5 minutes walk. There is a lovely park opposite and also plenty of restaurants nearby. Our room had a great view over the park and had a balcony with room for a table and lounger. The room was a great size and decor. The hotel also has a restaurant which has both indoor and alfresco dining. The food was very good and the waiters were very attentive. Even though they were short staffed the night we ate. We would definitely stay again and can recommend a stay there.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good and spacious hotel in middle of Milan, 10 minutes from the center and 20 minutes from the Domo. All furniture are of the solid quality and tasteful Italian design. The team is very helpful and friendly.The bar restaurant is enjoyable in the evening and offers a big choice for the breakfast.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: Good location within walking distance of several Milan markers. Dinner: The hotel has a lounge and restaurant that is not controlled by the hotel. I wouldn't recommend it (see separate review) Room: Clean and very small. Contemporary in decor. Sleep quality: Fine Service: Average to below average. The vibe here is not about customer service. We felt as though the staff was doing us a favor to be able to stay here. Overall Feel: Stand-offish and not inviting. Recommended? No. There are too many other good hotels in MilanReturning?: Nope
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient location, strategically placed closes to the ‘Quadrilatero’. Quiet and reserved. Good breakfast. However, very small room and not great welcoming staff at my check-in: very formal, detached and cold, which I found quite annoying
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival there was a warm welcome and staff were happy to point out local attractions. The rooms were clean and it was pleasant sitting out on the balcony. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was very good. The electric points were not easy to use. Breakfast was included and I enjoyed the food but unfortunately on going down to breakfast at the weekend the restaurant was full and so we decided to eat outside. There were no tables so we had to set up ourselves. This wouldn't have been a problem had all the waiting staff not been involved in moving tables for an evening event. Their priorities were wrong. On one evening we were invited to a cocktail party. There was a small charge but we didn't know what was included. It seemed that none of the staff did as we were told to ask 3 different members of staff. In the end we gave up and went out elsewhere. It is near the metro and a shirt walk from the duomo.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very impressed with Hotel Manin in Milan. The room was very well decorated with all the modern amenities that you would expect in an upscale urban hotel. The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean. The bathroom was also quite large with counter space (not something we always had in Europe), a great shower and amazingly soft towels. The staff all spoke English well and were professional and helpful. The breakfast buffet was large with breads, cheeses, meats, as well as hot dishes of eggs, bacon, sausage, etc. The hotel is centrally located near the Brera district and within walking distance of the old city including the Duomo. I would highly recommend Hotel Manin.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Either if you are going for business or just for shopping this 4 star hotel is a good alternative.Price is affordable and the hotel has been fully renovated. Rooms are comfortable with a nice king size bed. It’s not a luxury hotel but has good standards . Do not miss the bar with it small but cozy open area perfect place for an evening drink . Hotel is just located 5 min walk from Via de la Spiga and Montenapoleone.They have a correct breakfast buffet and staff is very polite.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a small and old hotel located in an alley in the center of Milan.The service is terrible and the staff personnel is quite rude.The rooms are old with a quite poor maintenance.The breakfast is about average.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were spending 1 night in Milan and we wanted something new, clean, close to everything and with a parking as we were driving in. Hotel Manin checked all the boxes! Hotel is freshly renovated, facilities are great, we got the most basic room and it was great! Fantastic bed and surprisingly big bathroom. 10 min walk to old town and to design districts. 35€ overnight valet parking. Worth every penny as street parking in Milan is sooo expensive. Staff very very nice and helpful. In sum, a perfect choice. The fact that is 100% renovated made the difference for us.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel in Milan. Situated opposite a large park. 10 mimute walk to the city centre around the duomo. 10 minute walk in the other direction to Milan Centrale station. Clean rooms and pleasant and helpful staff. Would recommend.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to mention that I am not a person who usually posts bad reviews, instead, I usually try to post nice reviews because I really believe that great service deserves great feedback and if I have a bad time somewhere it just can be an accident.
