This, however, is a warning to travelers. I think it’s best if you stay away from this hotel. I myself will never ever come back here.After three terrible days staying at this hotel, they even stole our backpack inside the hotel, and then threatened us not to call the police. The receptionists are very rude, we NEVER ONCE got a simple apology, instead, they lied to our face. Camping in a tent in the middle of the woods is safer than this place! We had to call the police so prove them that they stole our backpack!!I booked Hotel Manin for my family (5 people) who came to Milan to visit me from 18.03.2018 to 22.03.2018, a Double Room and a Junior Suite for 3 kids.On March 18th, we arrived at the hotel at 12:00, when we checked in the hotel receptionist told us our room numbers and explained that the rooms are very large rooms viewing to the park beside the hotel one in the 6th floor and the other one in the 3rd floor. Then he asked us to pay all the cost (1587,52 euro) in advance without showing us the rooms. Since it was strange for me, I politely asked if it was possible to pay at check out, which he refused, telling us that in our reservation conditions it was indicated that we must pay at check-in. I trusted him and paid all in advance. Then he told us the rooms will be ready for check-in in 2 hours. He said to leave them our luggage and come back in 2 hours, and they will bring our luggage to the room too. So we decided to have lunch and come back to the hotel at 14:00.When we came back, they gave us the keys to the rooms, however, we found out that the room numbers are changed. Anyway, we went to the rooms to check them, and we found out that their junior suite is a really tiny suit, with 2 single beds and a sofabed. We were quite surprised to see the smallest standard room for 3 people. We checked the windows and they had no view of the park and also our luggage was not in any of the rooms, so we thought maybe they gave us the wrong rooms. Then we decided to go back to the reception and ask why the rooms were changed and why our luggage was not in the room. When we talked to the receptionists (a man and a woman) both denied having said that the rooms are large with a view of the park! They were very rude to us and kept pretending that they never changed the rooms, they said that they never talked about the room size or the view of the windows. They claimed that we are confused and tired and that we are making a mistake. Finally while discussing to her I saw a paper on the reception desk, on which I could read my name with our previous room numbers. The funny thing is that the room numbers on the paper were exactly the numbers she told us in the beginning. So I showed her the paper and it was proven she was lying! At this point, both receptionists tried to take the paper from me telling me that I because of privacy rules I shouldn’t have read that paper, while just 2 hours ago they themselves gave that paper to me to find my name on it…!I told the receptionists, that if there is any problem with our previous room they could tell us honestly and we would accept, but lying to us is not a professional manner!But the lady refused to even say sorry!!!I insisted to talk to the Hotel Manager, but the reception refused to let me talk to anyone.They refused to cancel our reservation and refund us, so we asked them if they could at least add another bed instead of the sofa bed, but they said they can not!So since we had already paid 1587 euro, we decided to stay in the hotel although we were not satisfied.The second night during our stay, my daughter said that late at night she heard a lot of noise from another room and couldn’t sleep, then suddenly someone knocked on their room’s door, as soon as my daughter opened the door the receptionist started to yell at her, to stop making noise, then he entered the room, and only when he saw that the noise is coming from upstairs and not from our room he just excused and left the room!The last day, while doing check-out around noon, someone stole our backpack inside the lobby. We were so much sad and shocked, we asked the hotel to call police but, they were acting very shady, they told us that the police is NOT coming, and they tried to threaten us, telling us if the police comes they will block our passports and we would not be able to leave Italy anymore. But this time we didn’t trust them and called the police when the police came, hotel manager first didn’t allow them to check the Hotel’s security cameras. After the police and we insisted finally they let the police see the tape. The police said they could see the face of the thief in the tape, and that they will search for him. But since we had a flight at 16:00, we had to go to the airport.We will come back next week to Italy and we will make sure to go to police station and make an official report.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think it's a mistake just four stars for this level of facilities and service. Really nice stay and easy access to downtown. You can see the history of dedication of this family in every detail, like the unmissable restaurant.Totally recomendable!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are comfortably equipped with a good bed, though quite small for 2 people (luckily I was alone). Looking at the pictures the old rooms where much bigger but that's no issue. Very nice breakfast. Friendly and efficient personnel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a hotel I can recommend. We experienced a comfortable clean and quiet room, a rich and tasty breakfast. The staff was friendly and effective. The location perfect if you want shopping, historical places and restaurants within a short walking distance.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, clean lines with comfortable bed. You FEEL like you're in Milan.  Really nice full breakfast with eggs, meats, etc. Hard working staff keep it fresh & clean. Can't beat the location. Stayed here with our adult son in two rooms.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Manin in Milano, Italy, with our small group, back in May, 2017. I agree with some of the other reviews written that this hotel has a modern "vibe" about it; however we are back to the small room sizes again. Which Americans just have to get used to while in Europe. The room had a nice flat screen TV and a large bed, however the bathroom was almost as large as the living/sleeping area (again, very good per European standards)....anyway, the outdoor eating area is very welcoming and inviting. You just want to sit down and relax with a drink while waiting for your dinner reservations to arrive.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at the Hotel Manin for 3 nights.Our room was modern and very clean. We had a 6 foot bed which was very comfortable. The bathroom had a walk in shower and again was very modern.Our room had a small balcony overlooking the Montanelli public gardens (if you get chance go into the park as it has a lake, museum and planetarium).Breakfast was in the Hotel restaurant that overlooked the gardens. They was a good choice of both hot & cold food. Just a note to be aware that the Hotel restaurant does not open every evening.The reception staff were polite and helpful. The location was good as we walked to the Duomo cathedral, Brera area where there are lots of restaurants and Via Manzoni shopping area.We would stay at this hotel again when we return to Milan.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have recently stayed at this hotel during a short trip to Milan in November. This hotel is ideally located due to the number of metro stations with access to the red line this made is so easy to travel around Milan in no time what so ever with so much easy. Room was clean, beds where comfortable and staff where very helpful and friendly. Which really makes this hotel great value for money. I would recommend anybody to stay here. There is a dog walkers park opposite which was a lovely walk. The room was small but the bathroom was really big and spacious which was strange as it was so cozy in the room. You can get an iron you need one you just need to call down for it don't think there is space to keep in in the room I stayed in. The breakfast wasn't the best I have ever had but there is something there for everyone to choose from. I recommend trying the pastries really good. Great value for money and would stay again
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Manin is in a great location on the edge of the fashionable Brera district of Milan. I've stayed there a few times and generally enjoyed my stays. I think the majority of rooms have been refurbished relatively recently so I usually get a nice room. There has been the odd occasion where I've had one of the older rooms but they're still comfortable despite being a bit dated. There's a great outdoor bar that looks very pretty at night. Beware the mosquitoes though. Breakfast is also slightly better than your average hotel and you can take it outside which is a definite bonus. There are lots of shops, bars and restaurants within walking distance, as well as a beautiful park right outside the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent in the hotel a night. The hotel was very clean and the bed extremely comfort. The breakfast was excellent and the staff very helpful and friendly..although we paid for the parking 36€ and 4€ for a bottle of water in the room.. P.s. the area is quiet, beautiful and near the center!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 nights at this hotel was just enough. Any longer than this would be unbearable. Room was nicely appointed and modern, and that was good. However, when we first went up to the room, there was a dirty tray of room service right there at the door. Not a good sign. Then when I moved the phone to plug in my iPad, there was bread crumbs or sandy substances on the night stand. I immediately got a wet towel and clean all surface inside the room. Most disappointing aspect was the "uncaring/cold attitude" towards guests from almost all the staffs, front desk, restaurant, and bar. Could it be a racial issues here? Do non-White guests receive different treatments? Milan did not charm me, and this hotel also, confirmed my perception about the city.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Due to train breakdown we arrived late - so disappointed we did not have more time to enjoy this lovely hotel. Due to late arroival we had a room service meal which was served beatifully. About 10 min taxi ride from Milan Centrale Station. Beautiful modern decor which the Italians do so well! Very comfortable room. Excellent buffet breakfast. Very helpful staff.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located - just a few metro stops to Central Station, Cadrona station, the Duomo, and the Piazza Castello. The metro stop is less than a block away. Not: some of the escalators only go up, and they are motion activated. There are others across the street that go down (if you don't want to get a workout by running down an escalator going up).The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband began staying in this historic family-run hotel almost 40 years ago when he regularly traveled to Milan on business. He liked the great location, just outside the city wall, with easy access to both tram and subway service. Naturally, when we traveled to Milan together for the first time three years ago, we stayed at the Manin. Last month, we returned to find the property beautifully remodeled and a greatly upgraded restaurant. The staff members were very helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, and the food was very good, both at breakfast and the two dinners we enjoyed in the restaurant. It will definitely remain "our" place in Milano!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was well located for exploring Milan. The room was ok, not as booked, no bath or balcony. Beds were very comfortable and breakfast good. The staff were extremely unhelpful to the extend of completely ignoring us!! Left feeling very unhappy because of this after a very lovely few days exploring Milan and Lake Como. We can't wait to go back but will not be staying at this hotel.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel because of the location to center city and ability to relax in a beautiful outdoor garden bar after a long day. Staff was very helpful and corner room was spacious and comfortable. Great breakfast spread with excellent croissants and breads.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is well located with a 10 minutes walk to the Duomo and the neighbourhood with restaurants, park, ...Staff could be a more sociable and smiling.We had a junior suite which was very nice. Some sound from the outside bar in the evening but not very loud.Possibility to have breakfast in the outside garden. It's a close garden between buildings but nicely installed for a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd like to make clear that my two-stars is based on the terrible rudeness both my wife and I experienced from the receptionist. In honesty this review would be one star if the manager had not been very professional and apologised for the behaviour of his staff member.It all started when my wife phoned the receptionist, Lucretia, as there was only a standard four-seater taxi waiting for five people at the airport who had a large number of suitcases with them. Yet instead of apologising for this mistake, she told my wife this was her fault for not requesting a minivan! This was total nonsense as in my email, which the hotel confirmed, the very first sentence stated, "I would like to confirm a minivan for 5 people with room for up to 10 suitcases".When I bought this up later with the receptionist, she said well it didn't matter because the minivan driver had to wait for my wife and our guests anyway while they were eating! They were only eating because they were told it would be an hour for the minivan to arrive and decided to do that while they were waiting! Instead of apologising for what was clearly her or somebody else at the hotels's mistake, she argued and argued in a very aggressive manner. It is the worst attitude I have ever experienced from somebody working in customer service. She lied, could not accept responsibility and was rude and aggressive, only seeking to escalate the situation rather than resolve it. It was very shocking. The other staff were all friendly and helpful, the room was clean and nice with a good terrace, the hotel is very well-located and this would probably be a 4-star review if it wasn't for the terrible behaviour of one employee. Whether she'd had a bad day or not it was totally unacceptable.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is slightly out of the centre of Milan, however is only a brisk 20 min walk into the heart of Milan.Its decorated very modern, very clean. The Bathroom was very good.Breakfast is excellent - lots of choice with hot cooked, cereals, continental and they do a fabulous take away breakfast if you need to leave to go on a trip early before breakfast starts.Disappointed that the restaurant wasn't open at the weekend, however there are plenty of restaurants nearby.The Hop on hop off bus stops right outside the hotel which was handy
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, pieceful, good quality hotel.We enjoyed a long weekend in hotel Manin. The hotel is perfectly located close to the arts district. Close to a bunch of nice restaurants and not to far from Theatro della Scala and Duomo - all within a walking distance!Good food, nice personnel and good sevice with clean quality rooms. We can warmly recommend this!Thank you for your hospitality!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good hotel. Rooms are a bit small but ok. Friendly staff, clean rooms. The problem is the air conditioning: its April but in my room it only pumps air and the room temperature stays at 26c. If they improve the AC, it will be more pleasant from April to Sept.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Manin for the weekend. We had recomendations from the staff about best places to eat around and We really had a great time in Milan. Next time we'll stay there again. Highly recomendable!
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed the extra large room (by European standards) and within waking distance to the Duomo and opera house. Clean rooms, nice bar, excellent breakfast area and totally enjoyable stay at this hotel. Lovely gardens.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect hotel. Close to city center. Nice room nothing to complain about. Booked online looking at the provided photos. Nothing was missing in terms of facility and amenities.Recommended for sure. Only stayed for 1 night but was so relaxing stay as a last leg of Italy trip.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying at Hotel Manin is like staying at home. Right from the check-in staff to the bell boy, Roly, the restaurant manager to Ylenia who is from the the hotel management team, all at the hotel make you feel so loved and taken care of. The rooms are recently renovated and look so modern. The Hotel is centrally located that makes it easy to walk around everywhere in Milan. A park in front to go for a morning walk and shopping at Via Montenapoleone is 10 mins away. Great value for money and when next in Milan staying at the same hotel. highly recommended
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a good 3 (!!!) star hotel, definetly not 4!! There were no barhrobes in the room, slippers were made of smth like paper. It was very cold in the whole hotel. Besides the bed was really short and narrow.  And the most unbelievable thing was that once when i came in the room i found out that my teacups vanished. Soon i realised where- i stepped with my naked foot on it. The maid had broken it and didn't took it away!!!!!! There were pieces of the cup everywhere. I asked a man at the reception desk and they cleaned it. However there were no apologises. The only plus is that the hotel is really near the center of the city and all the shopping streets. And the staff was nice. Maria at the reception desk was really helpful with everything. Thank you.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very pleasant stay , check in and check out were pleasant and efficient. Room was upgraded on arrival - had a nice view over the park - with a balcony with a jacuzzi- bit cold for that this month. Bar area was ok but a bit lacking in character- great service and some very tasty complimentary bar snacks.Breakfast was ok - better coffee and OJ would have improved the meal.All in all a good and comfortable place to stay - utterly spotless .
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone from the reception staff, bar tender, porter, and the breakfast Wait staff provided superior service. We never had to struggle with any non English speaking people. The room was very clean with everything taken care of in our three day stay. The hotel was located so that we walked to do all our sight seeing.
hotelName:
22    Hotel Manin
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Helpful and friendly personell, good tips for restaurants in the vicinity as well as good suggestions in in general. Rooms are big and comfy with powerful Air conditioning. Free Nesprresso Coffee machine and water always available.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were welcomed on arrival by a friendly young man who made sure that we had everything we needed and who later printed our boarding cards without fuss. Our room was spacious and pleasant and the bathroom large and well equipped. We met the owner Mary the following morning at breakfast. A selection of fruit and cereal was very welcome after too many croissants elsewhere. We really enjoyed our night here in this delightful place. Mary is a very warm and friendly host.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about this B&B is fantastic. Room, location, food nearby, ease into the centre of Milan, Mary and her helpers, the breakfasts. I would highly recommend this place to everyone. I even found 2 tennis centres nearby which was a bonus.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mary is really friendly and she can give you a lot of information about how to spend your days in Milan.It is clean, good breakfast and with A/C! It's a short walk to a nice neighbourhood with a lot of good restaurants.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything, would a lovely BnB Mary runs, personal and with great service. Not only was the breakfast included, but it was also wonderful . Mary is a great fan of everything cultural, and will help you figure out how to best spend your time in Milan.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is close to a metro station, which is very convenient. Mary and Lorenza were really helpful and nice during our stay, making sure to answer any questions regarding our plans or stay. The staff speaks English. The room was clean, spacious, well maintained. Our breakfast was very good and plentiful.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a Weekend-Trip to Milano. Very friendly, they helped us with questions about Milano. Good breakfast. The hotel is near the San Siro Stadio and you can go to City-Centre with Metro. All Top!!!
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The outside of the BnB Hello Milano is not very attractiv, but the establishment hat very nice rooms. Bathroom is very modern. Breakfast was perfect. Keeper was very friendly. Very good start for visiting Milano.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't thank these two ladies Mary and Lorenza enough!!! You both are one in a millon very knowlegable and most of all caring.my husband and I were in imtimidated when we first arrived but not for long you both made Andre and I yes ladies it's Frances at ease.You both were there when we needed you the most Lorenzo you booking our train tickets to Florence was a great load our head because Mialno Centrale Train station is big. we couldn't of done without you.Everytime I see a Smart car I think of you Lorenza.Mary you were there when we first got to the BNB and welcomed us with your big smile and was always there when we needed you.This place will make you feel like your home away from home.My hubby and I went to Florence for 7 days and returned back to the Bnb for 2 more days before our trip home. we traveled to Florence with one of our suitcases and the ladies held the rest of them for us at the BNB. Thanks. again for that ladies. I usually say to my hubby there's no place like home and i was saying that on the train back to Milan to the BNB.Anyone out there reading this it's all true..This place is clean and breakfast was great most of all the two ladies rumnning it Mary and Lorenza are truly Genuine.Love you Ladies hope we see you again.xoxo
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took all four rooms, just perfect for our multi-generation group's needs. Mary and Lorenza were very helpful with suggestions and arrangements, including early-morning transfer to Malpensa when we left. Plenty of restaurants and shops in the area, Metro stops 5 minutes away, maybe 10 minutes by Metro to the central area. Rooms clean, comfortable, and a/c worked well. The breakfast they provided was perfect for us; the pastries and hard rolls were especially good (totally worth the calories...), with cheeses, meats, fruit, etc. also, and fruit/cake/cookies/water/coffee always available. We saw a couple of small supermarkets in the area but worth checking out also the neighborhood food market stalls just outside the Wagner metro station. If you have a chance to go to the Pirelli Hangar art exhibition space, do; it is fascinating (and free).
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed for one night with two kids.the place was clean and comfortable, very welcoming for the kids and the hosts was truly friendly and helped way beyond her "job title". i am recommend this b&b for anyone who is looking for accommodation in Milan.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the perfect place to stay in Milan. The two partners who ran the bnb were fantastic and friendly!Gave us tips on what to see in Milan.Very nice room and very clean!Wonderful taste of Italy in the breakfast included!
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (4 people)only stopped on a day in Milan. It is easy to find and impossible to park near. However, host informed in advance the address of clos garage where car ken be kept with 50% discount (which is quite generous!). Room was clean and tidy, we liked the design. Breakfast was outstanding! Kids received small kinder-suprises, and that was very neat.It is located 5 minutes walk from the metro, but if weather is good and youare in the mood to walk more - everything is withing walking reach.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited last week to watch Football match at San Siro and had fab time. Mary our hostess was very knowledagable about all aspects of Milan and great ways of seeing everything. BnB was extremely clean and breakfast was perfect
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This BnB is absolutely perfect. The access is via a metal gate and through a courtyard which ensures that your sleep will be peaceful at night. The place is beautifully decorated with lots of attention to detail and it is spotless. The land lady could not have been more helpful and friendly. She did all she could do to help and even directed us to a local street full of restaurants for dinner. The breakfast had a mix of cold meat, cheese, bread and cereal and pastries from a local bakery which were delicious.It was a 20 minutes walk to Congressi Milano and the walk is nice, especially before heading into a full day of conferences indoors. All main touristic attractions are 4-5 stops in the metro. I cannot recommend this place enough.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderfull place in wallking distance from metro station. staf is very welcoming and helpfull.We reserved a parking garage near by for 10 Ero per day.We recomend this B&B very much and shure will come back.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We both really enjoyed staying here. Lorenza was a marvellous and accommodating host. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The breakfast is pretty much your choice and the time is your choice as well. The blue room we stayed in was very spacious for a city hotel and I would certainly stay here again if we were in Milan.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent small hotel in Milan, very accommodating in our late arrival. Great breakfast included. Room was great, ac really worked well, would definitely stay here next time we're in Milan! Both Mary and Lorenza were extremely helpful to 3 jet lagged travelers. Perfect accommodations. We loved Hotel B&B.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a perfect place to stay. Very clean! Perfect hostesses! Awesome dinner recommendation. Delicious and filling breakfast. Thank you for everything. We had a wonderful stay. We look forward to coming back to Milan and staying with you again.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, as a family with four kids and grandmother, just loved that place: friendly people, good breakfast, near to the center, very clean, reasonable price, save car parking near by .., Next time when we'll visit our friends in milano we'll stay at your bnb again!
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lorenza, the delightfully friendly and helpful concierge, made us feel very welcome. The clean attractive rooms with lovely ensuite bathrooms were perfect for our needs. We received great recommendations to ensure our Milano experience was special. The breakfast was delicious and we would surely stay here again!
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The facility is clean, cosy, and has facilities all we need. The ladies taking care of us were all kind, friendly, attentive, and helpful. There are a lot of fine restaurants, casual restaurants, bars, cafes, etc. in the area. We were able to go to points of interest by taking trams and subways that is in five min distance.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only 6 subway stops from the Duomo. Easy and safe parking for an extra 10€/24h.Helpful and friendly staff.Free tea and biscuits. The place is clean and quiet.The room is large enough for our 2 kids and us. The bathroom has everything you need except a bath.Excellent value for the money !
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice room, very clean and quiet. Location is excellent as it is very close to train station. Breakfast was great, with many nice things to choose from.My overall experience was excellent and I am sure to visit again. Thank you.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this B&B is very good. It is about a 30 minute taxi ride from the airport or about a 10 minute walk to the Metro. For a large city the Metro felt very safe and was easy to get around. The Metro can be taken right to the city centre and all the sights including the Duomo, Galleria Vittorio Emanuele, La Scala, etc. The area the B&B is in, is out of the tourist area and there are many small bars and restaurant in the area. In fact the first night were suffering from jet lag and went to a fantastic fish restaurant only a few steps from the B&B. It was in fact one of the best meals we had on our trip this year.The B&B itself is up two floors accessed by either an elevator or stairs. The room B&B is very modernly decorated and very comfortable. The room we had was large with plenty of space for putting clothes and cases. The bathroom was also nicely laid out and a good size. The breakfast was good with cereals, yoghurt, croissants, bread, jams, juice, cake, cheese, ham and boiled eggs. So you will certainly start the day off well.Mary, the host was very helpful, kind and accomodating. Six months before leaving we were trying to book tickets over the internet to see The Last Supper. We were having trouble doing so, but Mary was able to help us out with this. Mary is also a great source of suggestions as to where to go, what to see and where to eat. So thank you again Mary. If you are looking for a very comfortable, easily accessible accommodation, outside of the tourist area, this is the place for you.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The recent reviews match our experience. Clean, comfortable, quiet, modern. Hosts were very helpful; breakfast to our needs. Five-minute walk to metro, then four stops or so to central district and Duomo, so leave time to get to/from the major sights.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed together with one friend in a 3-person room. No complaints whatsoever. The facilities and furnishings are modern and aesthetically pleasing. Air conditioning and free wi-fi both worked flawlessly. Breakfast service is good. Close to metro station.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very welcoming hosts; clean, beautifully clear lined design, clever use of limited space; fresh colours; I've found all I needed, from hangers to local information and plenty of sockets for all the electric equipment that needed recharge. Breakfast almost to personal order, fresh fruit all day long. Don't hesitate to stay there – I won't ...
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mary and Lorenza, the owners of the BnB Hello Milano, provided me the best accommodations I have ever had. (I travel twice yearly to Europe for medical congresses.) The BnB is immaculate, the food terrific, the wifi reliable, the AC digitally controlled, the beds comfortable and the location ideal, as it is close to the Metro and walking distance to the Congress. The neighborhood has grocery stores, restaurants and I felt very safe. There is also a gym in the same building, but I found a couple good running routes.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little B&B is run efficiently and is brand new, with funky decor and attention to details! Mary goes out of her way to make sure that you're happy, and provides the best there is: nespresso coffee, homemade cakes, fresh croissant with jam and cream, ham etc. This is a wonderful deal, money well spent!!
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent trip as a result of warm, friendly hospitality shown by the team at BnB Milano. Accommodation; clean, modern and exactly what I expected / needed for a trip to see Celtic with my son and his friend.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms spacious and very clean Staff really friendly and helpful. Breakfast more than enough to start the day with.Tea coffee making facilities available, Free Wifi Maps, underground and tram routes and recommended lists of restuarants provided. Within walking distance of San Siro and 7 stops on the underground to the Duomo. Would have no hestitation in recommending
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very good night in this BnB.It is bright, simple and clean that we had about this BnB at the very first sight, especially comparing the hotel we stayed previous night.Mary is super kind and helpful. Once you have questions, she is eager to answer you, no matter what she is doing at that moment.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was new, the place was spotless and spacious! Breakfast was incredible and the staff were super friendly and helpful!!Was an easy walk to and from the soccer stadiumCould not recommend more highly.
hotelName:
23    BnB Hello Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An entrance on a narrow side street in the historical quarter of Milan leads to an exceptionally stylish, modern, tranquil and charming hotel. Friendly and helpful staff accompany guests to their rooms which are sparkling with white tiled floors, large comfy beds dressed in spotless linen and a spacious very well quipped bathroom. Breakfast is buffet style but provides everything one would want, from fresh fruit to tempting pastries, cold cuts to eggs and meats, juices and yogurts to fresh coffee. The bar is open in the evenings serving a free first drink, a pleasant guest-friendly gesture which can be enjoyed in the garden area. Attractive modern art, sculptures and wall reliefs adorn the public areas. The location is perfect for sightseeing in Milan being barely 10 minutes’ walk from the Duomo. This hotel doesn't have the glitz of some of the upmarket city hotels - or their soullessness and superficiality. Instead this hotel has a distinctive individual style, with the wellbeing of guests at the forefront. Through thoughtful design of space it provides a welcome respite within the centre of a busy bustling metropolis. It deserves to be recognised as one of the best hotels in Milan.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small quite modern hotel in a central location, staff at reception were nice, and thought the free first drink at the bar was a nice welcome gesture, would highly recommend if you're looking for somewhere in central Milan
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is just something creepy about this hotel. Yes, it may be new or renovated but only part of the facility seems to have been renovated. Other parts look abandoned with opened, dark windows and construction materials visible in other windows. Upon arrival we were told our room was not ready. When we decided to wait, there was then a room ready immediately which I could not understand. There didn't seem to be any guests when we arrived - the place looked like a ghost town. At the evening cocktail hour (1 free drink and snacks) we saw around 10 guests. Our room was clean and appeared new and sparsely decorated. (No kettle or coffee was disappointing). The hair dryer attached to the wall required me to constantly hold a button down to keep it running, which frustrated me enough to dig my own dryer out of the bottom of my suitcase already packed for travel home. We could not get the air conditioner to work. The staff did schedule me a taxi for an early pick up which arrived on time. The location of this hotel is indeed is good, withing walking distance to Duomo and a walk-able hike to Cordona station (thus the taxi). However, we couldn't shake the uneasy feeling we both had when we left this "Bates Motel."
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay in Milano at the Hotel Milano Castello. Location was perfect and within walking distance to all major attractions. Breakfast was nicely done with a wide selection and service was excellent. Courtyard was beautiful and very peaceful, calming. Beds were very comfortable and rooms had all necessary amenities, with good functional design. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Rooms were very clean and well maintained each day.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Milano Castello for 3 nights. We have been very happy with the location, the bed, and the bathroom features. Rooms are austere, but clean and fully functional. Mattress is softer than we found in many hotels in Italy. Breakfast is quite adequate. Fresh expresso is available on request. Walking distance to shopping area and outlet bus. All in all, good value.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close enough to the Centre with access to transport in a convenient location within walking distance to transport accessing most of the city. Walking distance to the centre of city and a majority of attractions including train line to Lake Como. Good breakfast. Modern, clean and spacious room and bathroom
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time at Hotel Milano Castello. I booked because the others hôtel I used to go were full ... what a surprise ... 5 stars for everything .. staff kindness ... huge and quiet room ... buffet breakfast with many choices ... close to the shopping street and Cairoli if you take the car for Serravalle Outlet. This hotel is definitely an hotel to stay if you visit Milano. I will come back for sure. You deserve to be a 4 stars hotel
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed for one night on the last night of a business trip. The hotel is conveniently located near many tourist attractions and is about 10-15min walk to the Duomo, San Maurizio al Monastero Maggiore and the Basilica of Sant'Ambrogio. Nearby are many shops and restaurants/cafes. I had a very pleasant stay and wished that I could have stayed another night. The staff are very pleasant especially Valentina at the front desk. I arrived early and luckily a room was available and she was able to check me in. They stored my luggage after I checked out to allow me to do some last minute sightseeing before leaving for the airport. The hotel seemed new or recently renovated with a modern yet spartan decor. My room had a very comfortable double bed and it was quiet. It was on the smallish side but not surprising for a hotel at this price point. Both room and bathroom were very clean. The photos for the hotel are pretty accurate. Lobby, dining area and terrace were very pleasant. The breakfast was included in my rate and it was fine—nothing memorable but it did have cereal options as well as pre-made eggs, ham and bacon. I would definitely stay here again but would like it more if the decor was less austere. Art and colorful textiles/bed covers in the rooms would make a big difference. The room would then skew more chic and less budget looking. Lastly boxes of tissues in the room would be a plus
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel and its included breakfast are both very nice. The location is perfect, walking distance to the Duomo, the Sforza Castle, and La Scala. The staff held our bags for us while we continued sightseeing after checkout, and when we returned they greeted us with water bottles - just what we needed after a hot afternoon of walking around! - and called a cab for us. Would absolutely stay here again if we return to Milan!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really appreciate this hotel because it’s simple but very chic, extremely clean and the staff is friendly and helpful. Located in a very quite area, the hotel has an amazing garden where you can have the breakfast (cool one) or a glass of prosecco in the evening (offered by the hotel in some happy hours). If you walk 6 minutes you can arrived at the Duomo or Teatro alla Scala. If you need a connection to the rest of the city, you have at least three underground station. I strongly recommend this hotel. Congrats guys!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t say enough nice things about the hotel and staff. Very friendly. Clean well appointed rooms. Remarkably quiet despite being minutes walk from shopping and all the major sights. A lovely garden... did I mention the hotel staff? Great value.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel for four nights. The staff was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and obtaining taxi's as well as insights on things to do. The rooms and bathroom were large, well designed and decorated in with modern marble accents. The breakfast was also very good as there does not seem to be local places to eat a morning meal. The design of the hotel was very tasteful with special emphasis on ecological practices. One artist was featured throughout the first floor. The hotel is very conveniently located 10 minutes front the Duomo, the Sforza Castle and the Berea artist/shopping district, Each is important to visit. I would recommend that the hotel develop a laundry service for its guests. We highly recommend this small, modern hotel. We will return.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient situation, close to the centre and the metro, but a quiet haven of peace. The room was spotlessly clear and quite spacious. There was a lovely outside courtyard to enjoy breakfast, a quiet sit or an evening drink. The early evening Happy Hour was definitely a draw.The staff were friendly and helpful. I would definitely choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely, tranquil hotel in the heart of Milan, walking distance from everything. The little outdoor cafe area is lovely, and the breakfast is nice, as well. Staff is nice, too. The only issue--when I got there the woman told me it looked like I had not paid the extra for breakfast for the two nights I was there. I expressed surprise since in Italy breakfast usually comes included in the price. ..at least that was the case when I lived in Italy ten years ago. The lovely receptionist said not to worry, that I would not be charged--tehy would "offer it to me" free. I asked several times to make sure it was the case and that I had not misunderstood her Italian. Then when I went to checl out after two nights I was given two bills-once for the room and a second for eight euros. I assumed this was tax of some sort and it was not until later when I was already on the train that I realized I had been charged for the breakfast! It was a different receptionist and perhaps there was a misunderstanding, but it was irksome. Otherwise, all was fine. The room was super clean, albeit a little spartan (art on the walls would be nice). The bathroom was great--large by Italian hotel standards, and my room had cross ventilation (a window in the bathroom and one overlooking the courtyard), which was nice as the air conditioner had not yet been turned on for the season and it was hot in the room in the daytime. All in all, I would definitely stay here again, but would make sure to be more careful in checking my bill before I leave.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is close to all the tourists attractions in Milan including La Scala.Located on a side street behind a Church it is quiet.Although a three star hotel it offers modern clean and spacious rooms and bathrooms.Buffet breakfast is included and is quite good with a wide selection of seasonal fresh fruit.The staff is friendly and helpful and the WiFi excellent.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolute top location in the city center, very nice interior and standard in every details. Big breakfast buffet with plenty to choose from, absolutely more than a standard Italian hotel breakfast. Bar with happy our 18-21.00 with free drinks every day!!Can absolutely be recommended!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location (you can easily reach main places of interest by feet), light and clean rooms with a modern design, friendly staff, quite nice breakfasts with a few warm dishes, different snacks, fresh fruits and vegetables. Additionally, restaurant staff is amazing, especially smiling and very helpful hostess Anya!It was the second time in the hotel and everything was brilliant!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was in Milan for only three nights for business, and my job selected this hotel for its location and rate. Had a very pleasant time, and was very impressed by the service and hospitality. The rooms are really sapcious, neutral bright colors, a lot of natural light comes through, and there is a sitting area, perfect for taking calls or doing some work. So happy with the choice, pretty hotel, good strong coffee as well.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel is excellent, close to all the main attractions and many great restaurants. The rooms are a good size, ( we had a suite with the private garden) and clean. The sitting and bar area are charming and the hotel is very quiet. The front desk staff were very helpful in every way, from helping with the storage of luggage, to making dinner reservations. We had some confusion about whether the breakfast was included in the room rate but at €7.5 a person it was reasonable and a great variety of hot and cold food. The hotel bar offers a happy hour each evening, where the first drink is free. A nice touch and a pleasant to enjoy before heading out for the evening. Overall, we found our stay at Hotel Milano Castello very enjoyable and would highly recommend to your stay in Milan.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the galeria suite. A bit expensive but totaly worth it. Because we where in Milan for business the room was perfect. Spacious, a bubble bath and a outdoor terrace. Staff is really friendly and nice. Location is great. Would definately recommend the breakfast for only € 7,50 a person. We are now in Florence and they offer a breakfast for € 14,- a person, ridiculous.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the hotel without noticing is a 3 star!!! I found out at the entrance and was a bit worried!!! But was wonderful ‘ we had a 3bed room that was really big.... as well as the bathroom!!!!Personel was very polite and helpfullBuffet breakfast at the 7,5€ per person is really a bargain for Milan area!! And was really good!!! LOCATION IS REALLY NEAR RO EVERYTHING IN CENTRO STORICO!!!Definitely i will go back next time
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in Milan for 4 nights for work. I chose this location because it was close to where I was working and within walking distance to some attractions I wanted to see. The Hotel is small and almost hidden on a quiet side street, but that is part of its charm. No loud busy street. Only 10 minute walk to Doumo Cathedral and the Sforza Castle in opposite directions. Marble interior design that is very clean looking. Room I chose was very nice. King sized bed, large bathroom, great shower. Table with chairs. Refrigerator with beer, water and soda for a charge. You need to put your room key in slot on wall in order for lights to work. Aperitif is from 6pm to 9pm. First drink is free. Nice breakfast for American who needs eggs. Simple, nothing fancy. 7.50 Euros. Staff was helpful and friendly. All spoke english. I would stay here again !
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, new, ideally located to visit Milan downtown and in a very safe area. The staff was very professional and the room very quiet. Last but not least, I absolutely loved the bathroom amenities with Bach flowers scent shower gel and very good quality recycled toilet paper. Places like this make you want go back to them and not even consider B&B.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of our 2 weeks in Italy we enjoyed this hotel the best. We had 2 rooms for 3 nights. Modern, clean and conveniently located it can’t be beat. The Front Desk staff were friendly and helpful and we would definitely come back again.Most importantly it had a small elevator. This was a blessing with our luggage as it was awful lugging it up and down stairs everywhere else we went in Italy.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I kicked off our Italy trip at Hotel Milano Castello. The location was quiet and close to everything we wanted to see and do. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The room was clean, modern, and spacious. The courtyard was lovely and very pleasant for enjoying a complimentary nightly beverage. The breakfast was typical; the room was a little small and somewhat crowded, but we were in a hurry to catch a train so maybe it felt that way because we were a bit rushed. We would absolutely stay here again if in Milan.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights at Milano Castello recently, two in room 208, a very small single, and one in a suite on the ground floor that had its own outdoor patio and a jacuzzi by the bed (neither of which I used). The small gym has a functioning treadmill. The breakfast is among the best I've had at an Italian hotel, hitting all the bases for just 7.5 euros. Intelligent and helpful desk staff and nice bartender. (There's a free happy hour til 9 pm every night, it seems). I will try to stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, I walked through the street San Tommaso without seeing the entrance, which is relatively small as the hotel is located in a courtyard. Upon arrival, I enjoyed an aperitif, offered by the house, in the courtyard. The room is modern, spacey, and incredible quiet although being at walking distance from the Duomo.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a wonderful hotel! My room was very clean and beautiful. The lady that was at the front desk during my stay, (can’t remember her name) was so friendly and a great help anything that I needed. The breakfast that comes with my stay, was perfect. Everything was beautifully prepared and it tasted amazing! The hotel is also very centrally located. An easy walk to the Duomo and a lot of great restaurants and shopping. If I am lucky enough to get to go back to Milan, I will stay here again.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've seen this hotel listed as a 3-star hotel, which is honestly shocking. Typically in my history, European hotels seem to overstate their quality, however in this case it was quite the opposite. We had the La Scala suite, and it was HUGE with it's own large rooftop balcony looking out over the rooftops of Milan. Hotel is very new, with very modern furnishings and a comfortable bed. Would definitely stay here again next time in Milan, much nicer than other 4-star hotels out there in the city center.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I have just come home from 3 nights at the Milano Castello and we would highly recommend it to anyone.The location is perfect, just 3 minutes walk from Cordusio metro station and a couple of minutes past Cordusio station is il Duomo. The Brera area is also just 5 minutes walk away with a lovely selection of restaurants. We went to the Ticinese canal area for dinner on the Saturday which was really busy, a fantastic atmosphere. We walked there which took about 30mins but caught the metro back which took about 15/20mins. We felt perfectly safe walking around Milan during the day and night and sat on the steps at il Duomo until gone midnight on Sunday night listening to the music coming from one of the surrounding restaurants, it was lovely. The hotel itself is great, nice and new and very clean. The bed was very comfortable and we slept well every night as the room was well soundproofed. There is a wall mounted hair dryer in the bathroom. It's one of those ones that you have to keep your finger on the button to make it work but its a 1600 watt so dries quite quickly so that you don't end up with a flat fingertip!!There aren't tea/coffee making facilities in the room but there are so many lovely coffee shops on the doorstep that you really don't need it. Breakfast was much better than we expected, a small selection of hot food (scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages) but a wide selection of fruit, yogurts, hams, cheeses, cakes and pastries, teas and coffee. It was nice to have the outdoor garden/patio area to sit in to eat breakfast and enjoy the complimentary drink in the evening. Even thought the hotel is very central it's lovely and quiet.As many other people have mentioned, the staff are very friendly and helpful and kindly printed our flight boarding passes for us. The WiFi was very good, even in the rooms.All in all, a lovely hotel in a perfect location.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights in this hotel, room had plenty of space, and was in a very central location. Under 10 minute walk to the duomo and other tourist attractions within walking distance. Only an hour by train from Milan Caldorna Station to Lake Como which was a highlight of our trip. Staff in the hotel were very helpful and friendly, the room was kept very clean however the air-con in our room didn't work properly.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found this hotel searching for something close to La Scala and what a pleasant surprise we had. The reviews on Tripadvisor were positive but it was even better than we expected.It is located in a small street and has a specific atmosphere due to its location in a kind of an old area with an, I think, small church in between the reception and the restaurant/bar and room area.Check-in was friendly and swift and the room was spacious, modern and with all comfort one requires. Clean with good beds and a nice and large enough bathroom and shower.Also the hotel has a nice garden where one can have a drink or breakfast. There is no evening meal service but with the possibilities around one will easily find something for lunch/dinner.For the breakfast one pays EUR 7,50/person and it has more than enough choice of nice and fresh products. Very much worth its value.When we went for a drink downstairs we received the drinks as a treat from the hotel, very nice gesture. Also the other times we ordered a quick drink we got it offered for free, excellent service and customer friendliness.Overall the service was very nice, we really enjoyed our stay here and whenever visting Milan again this will be our hotel of choice!!Highly recommended!!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great hotel with nice large rooms and comfy beds. Very modern Italian decor. It was in the center of town but on a nice quiet side street. Could not have asked for a better location that was centrally located close to the Duomo, shops and cafes.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose this from the internet and we were happy with our stay here. Location was good and service was great. Hotel is only 6 months old. Only thing stopping my review from being 5 stars was the price.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We run into this hotel while strolling around Milan. It is set along a very quiet side street, a few steps from pedestrian area. We live near Milan and just were curious to have a look, to possibly recommend to friends and business partners. Staff was simply fantastic, giuded us around with a smile, and they offered to show us a room. This hotel is a true gem! Stylish reception and breakfast area, secluded garden away from noise and crowd, spacious room with impeccable furniture. We travel across Europe a lot, and we can say this is top standard for a 3-star hotel. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location 5 minutes walking to Castello Sforzesco, very near Metro station. The room was very modern, very comfortable, friendly staff. Wireless worked well. Breakfast was outstanding, with a excellent fruit salad, cherries and peaches. I loved it.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, located on a side street, is fairly new, nicely constructed and furnished, and has first rate personnel to greet and assist you. The room was unexpectedly elegant, being done in white marble and leather furniture, with its own private balcony. We had not one bit of difficulty while staying there, and found it very conveniently located to shopping, restaurants, museums, La Scala and the train station.Milan proved to be one of the most hospitable places we stayed during our three week trip to Italy, and we look forward to returning to it and this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very modern. The bed was extremely comfortable. I think it was a tempurpedic mattress. There was plenty of hot water a flat screen TV and a minibar in the room. There is a rain shower and a magnifying mirror in the bathroom along with a bidet. The breakfast was not included. The hotel has WiFi I highly recommended.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location was very good room was spotless and good size with fridge full of drinks at reasonable prices. Only small problem was tv had no English Channel.Breakfast bit dull and and restaurant quite small if all guests turned up at same time there would not be enough seating.Only problem we had was some friends came to meet us and the hotel refused our request for them to be allowed to have a drink at the bar while they waited.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is as every review says the best hotel. We had a great stay here. Everything is up to date & modern. The breakfast is continental however the best one I have had a hotel everything is fresh, the two lady Work really hard refilling it. The hotel reception are very kind & nothing is to much trouble. It’s near duomo & the castle 5 min walk from the hotel. We have loved our stay here. Defo recommend & would stay again.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was one of the best hotels i have visited in my life taking everything into consideration. From Malpensa airport, use the metro line 1 to cordusio stop from there it is 260m to the hotel. Di not take the bus to central station, that leaves you with another metro ride and 300m walking. I do not know why google maps doesn’t show this as easily the best way to get to the hotel. The hotel is clean! Marble floors, the fridge is stocked full with drinks and it is free. Rooms are big bathroom as well. Location is great, shops around it, as well as places to eat, duomo is also very close. They give two pillows per person on the bed, why cant everyone do this from the start. Staff was very friendly and you can leave your luggage on the last day when checking out, safer than most other hotels. Breakfast was amazing and you can even order cuppachino, breakfast buffet include various pastries, ham, salami, boiled eggs, cheeses, cereals, yogurt, 100% fruit juices in bottles and sweet stuff such as macaroons etc. so that is enough to get you going in the morning. I know it doesn’t sound different to most other good hotels but it just was, for us at least.
hotelName:
24    Hotel Milano Castello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern stylish rooms/apts with funky features, very clean with pleasant staff.Our experience, however, was adversely affected by street performers outside the apts windows with extemely loud amps and speakers. We moved rooms after 2 days but this room was also affected with construction noise in the building. We were given some money off but less than we thought was appropriate for the disruption.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just behind the Duomo you can find a collection of flats that will complement your taste for understated luxury. The apartment we rented was spotless and we enjoyed the privacy that gave the feeling of owning your own place in Milan. everything is a walk away, restaurants and shops at your doorstep and the interior reminds you of how luxurious life can be, enjoying a splendid shower and living the life of an uptown high-so Italian yuppie. We really enjoyed the crossover between a private apartment and a full-service hotel setting.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd actually give this 4.5 stars if possible.Stayed here for 4 nights in June 2017. Our apartment was Emmanuelle Vitto (it has the teal bed accent in the photos). This room overlooks the backside of the building, so no view to speak of. What I liked: location is superb, good bed and pillows, air conditioning actually gets cold, HUGE shower with rainfall and shower wand. Apartments were exceptionally clean. Plenty of electrical outlets and even a USB port that connects to the television. The kitchenette was a clever design; it was equipped with basic stemware, dishes and flatware for 2, small refrigerator/freezer, 2 burner cooktop, microwave, electric tea kettle and Nespresso coffee maker. I think there was only one skillet and one saucepan, otherwise no other cookware. Also no cutting board or cutlery to speak of other than the serrated steak knives. We arrived at approximately 11 am and were allowed to check in early, which was very nice. My understanding is that there is someone at the “desk” (it’s really more like a closet) every morning from 9-12, but check-in is by appointment. Access to the apartments is secured by a very heavy door that is accessed via key card, as is your apartment, so I felt very secure. The main door to the building is also locked after a certain time at night and must be accessed using your key card. Aparthotel staff was very helpful in securing transport to the airport for 100 Euro. Comparable to the price of a taxi, it was very convenient and prompt. Our one small hiccup occurred on the Sunday morning we were to check out. We decided to go for a walk and grab a pastry before our airport transport was to arrive at 8:30 (checkout is at 11). But when we returned at approximately 7:30, our key card didn’t work to access any of the doors. Luckily, I had the phone number to Aparthotel staff programmed in my phone so I called and they were quickly able to unlock both doors remotely. So cautionary tale – always take your phone with you and put the 24 hr. phone number in your phone! They do tell you this when you check in, so I'm just reinforcing it.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped two nights whilst site-seeing in Milan. It makes a great base being just a minute from the Duomo and a few minutes from sites such as La Scala. It is a small place made up of half a dozen apartments with a part-time office. However what is great about the place is its style. Our room was done out all in white. Had a circular bed and TVs hidden behind mirrors. I particularly liked the hidden kitchenette - hob and fridge only. The guy on the reception was really friendly and kept in touch beforehand. Go there. You will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious and very nicely designed rooms, comfortable bed. Very friendly and helpful reception. Great location a few steps from the Duomo, plenty of restaurants and shopping opportunities in the neighborhood. A top pick in Milan.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just few steps from Duomo this modern aparthotel was beautifully designed. I really liked the bathroom and the separate shower. Free wireless connection was fast. Although there was no reception for 24h, the staff was helpful.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The self catered apartments are fully equipped with a kitchenette and all necessary staff to make your stay in Milan a nice experience. Five min away from San Babila metro, next to La Rinascente, free WF, air condition, sofa, two huge screens (opposite) for satellite TV, small eating table ( a chair is missing), free espresso machine, slippers, bathrobe, toiletries, hair dryer, champagne and wines in the freeze, safety box and a super design bathroom! Front Desk personnel "Keyhan" always very helpful with a big smile. We stay in a double apart with no street noise, non smoking floor, king size bed, good quality mattress. Cosy and friendly accommodation, value for money in a busy city like Milan.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment had much more space than I expected and had very modern amenities. (Personally I enjoyed the huge bath!). The location in relation to the Duomo cannot be closer, but if you want to stay away from tourists perhaps this isn't the best spot. The only thing to note is the apartment is located in a business building which had a woman at reception who kind of just seemed confused as to who I was and why I was heading up the lift.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you could want in an apartment. Spacious, clean and well thought out with good security. Staff were extremely helpful, especially as we arrived at 6.30 am. Location gives you access to the vibrant centre of Milan but was still within walking access if you wanted to do tours outside the city - in our case to Lake Como. Highly recommend the apartments to anyone who wants to be central with the added bonus of basic cooking facilities to eat in.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only small, about 6 rooms and in an office block type building this is truly a great place to stay in Milan. A view of the duomo from the window, close to the galleria and all the shopping streets with modern designed rooms. Good range of toiletries, robes and slippers provided, a rain fall shower plus a comfortable bed. The front desk is not manned but if you need anything just ring. We had a terrible smell in our first room (ancient plumbing I suspect) but were promptly moved.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious and spotless rooms with all amenities one can imagine, next to Duomo (less than 50mts). The staff is excellent in keeping the standards above 5 stars and also very helpful for arranging transport, meeting requests.If you are planning to stay in the heart of Milan, next to Duomo, this is the address to be in. Apart being close to all that is happening around Duomo, the rooms are actually small apartments fitted with microwave oven, cooker, two large-screen HDTV's, high-speed wifi and a Nespresso machine. Coffee was essential for me and my wife, in fact we carry our coffee during our trips. We did not.Highly recommended and confirm the other reviews.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for two nights with my wife and we really enjoyed the rooms the interior design is outstanding special the rain shower with the mood lights. Also the location is in the center beside the shopping and the Duomo with is a great pick for all
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in October 2015, in the "Gallerie" apartment. Large room with a kitchenette (including a small choice of mini bar items and a Nespresso coffee maker), a huge walk-in shower and a separate bathroom (toilet and 2 sinks). Very comfortable bed. They have no permanent reception desk so you have to make appointments for checking in and out or fetching your luggage - everything went flawlessly though. The location is very central, right behind the Duomo and 2 minutes away from the subway entrance. Free Wi-Fi worked perfectly.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not rate this apartment more highly. Staff were very professional and friendly, Accommodation - spotless/modern everything you could need and more. Location PERFECT!! You are right in the centre of Milan directly at the back of the Duomo. Food, shoppping, transport at your door. You absolutely cannot go wrong. This is the benchmark. You will not be disappointed worth every cent and more. I only wish every hotel was like this. Thankyou Aparthotel Duomo
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a few steps from the Duomo.Located on the 4th floor of an office building at the corner of Via Agnello and Corso Vittorio Emanuele II, just beside the Rinascente.New, modern, clean, and quiet. Highly suitable for couple but good enough for family or business too.A good surprise is that, when I emailed an inquiry before booking, I received a response just within ten minutes!
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in this really very unique hotel with amazing furniture and the location is, exceptional. You are just in front the Doumo !!!Its more like a smart-tech apartment with around 5 or 6 well designed Rooms . There's no Room service (restaurant or BF) and not quite good for families . The location was a bit difficult to find in the beginning as it's more inside business building but once you find it, u know it was worth the looking..
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only a year old this mini hotel of 5 rooms is in a fantastic location. The rooms are very modern, the service is exceptional. Quite a unique experience. Prices are steep but good value compared to anything of this standard in this location. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great Hotel in a magnificent ubicacion big and modern room with all the facilities need it to have a great time 100% I will return . is a 2 minutes walk from the Duomo all inside is new with great taste .
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This very new property is more apartment than hotel, although self-catering facilities are somewhat limited - but who cares when you are in a city with hundreds of great restaurants right on the doorstep.The entrance (only a few steps from the Duomo) in what seems to be a rather boring office block is a little disconcerting, but once through the super-secure entry door on the 4th floor, everything is wonderful.Huge black and white photographs of iconic scenes in Milan cleverly conceal cupboards and even the small office area.The overall décor is white on white on white - very clean look, very chic and super stylish as one would expect in Italy's fashion capital.The bathrooms are huge with fabulous shower fittings. Some rooms have a spa bath as well.Two enormous plasma TV screens with more channels than one can be bothered to count are mounted on two walls.An extremely comfortable bed with high quality linen is mounted on a raised white (of course) platform. White floors give a clean and bright feel to a generous room space.State-of-the-art electrical controls operate everything from concealed lighting to the highly effective blinds.This is a superb property with a great individual feel about it.The office isn't manned 24/7 but receptionist/manager Luca could not be more charming, helpful and personable. He should be running the Ritz.Having stayed in a number of much more expensive and fashionable hotels in this city of overt fashion and self-conscious chic, I can unhesitatingly recommend the Aparthotel Duomo.I won't be staying anywhere else on my next visits to Milan.5 stars.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Aparthotel duomo - we got married in Milano and the preparations took place at the hotel - the result was perfect with many beautiful pictures. the rooms are very well decorated and made it the perfect venue for our purpose! the staff was extremely helpful and nice and responded to our needs in the most professional yet warmest manner! In the end this has been an experience that we will never forget! Highly recommended!!!!
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just a few steps from Duomo, shopping area, cafes, restaurants and everything else. The design of the hotel and rooms is very modern. Common area and rooms are very well cleaned everyday. They have the best bed and linen in our 2 weeks, 5 hotels trip in Italy. Our room has a partial view of the Duomo which is a plus. And the shower, my wife and my daughter love the shower. The hotel attendant, at first we didn't really like his attitude but eventually we feel he is ok.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location was great being near to the Metro and Duomo. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The design of interior was very good and the quality of finishes was excellent. We only spent one night here while traveling through Milan so did not use the small self catering facilities but it could be handy for those staying for longer.The apartments are on the upper level of a commercial building and the common area is not so great but ok, but I imagine the owners have no control over this. Once inside the apartment the ambiance created is excellent.Some have reported it is difficult to find. Please see enclosed image from Google Earth showing the entrance which is between a restaurant's outdoor dining area. The entrance and signage is a bit innocuous but if you know what you are looking for it is easy.This is a great concept and would definitely use it again if we return to Milan.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all: Best shower ever. We already missed it the day we arrived back home... ;-) But also the rest of the aparthotel was very good, new, very stylish, very clean(!). Located close to the duomo and lots of restaurants and shops. Thanks to Luca! He is kind and helpfull and absolutely uncomplicated. See you again!
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location and excellent state of the art apartment!Management was very kind and helpful.Will definitely recommend this properly to anyone who is planning a visit to Milan!Hope the standard will be maintained in the same manner in the future as well!
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Aparthotel was just fantastic! The room was in immaculate condition and the management more then just accommodating. Location could not get any better as well. We highly enjoyed our stay there, and would stay again.
hotelName:
25    Aparthotel Duomo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place at a good price. 10 minute walk from Milano Centrale train station, 20/25 minute walk to the Milan Gallery and Duomo. From MC there’s the train that takes you directly to Malpensa airport.Clean and hospitable service. Breakfast is good and enough variety for a 2 to 3 day stay.
hotelName:
26    UNAHOTELS Century Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
