Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a great weekend stay. Staff were excellent, helpful and efficient. Room was comfortable, clean and welcoming. A good variety of fresh food for breakfast. Within easy reach of the centre via tram or metro. Would stay again.
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good sound insulation, no discernible street noise even at 3rd floor. Sometimes could hear the tram squeak in the morning. Ultra comfortable bed. Loved the breakfast. Will certainly stay again. Close to Gae Aulenti and to my favorite walk to downtown
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly situated for everything Milan has to offer. Hotel itself was superb, clean and comfortable rooms and the free water in the minibar was a thoughtful touch. The breakfast choice was excellent and the coffee the best we had in Milan.
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely rooms, very attentive staff and good food. Not too far from centre of the town, with great shops and restaurants nearby. Although a lot of street noise, to be expected given location. Very comfortable bed and high quality linen.
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. near to metro station and walking distance to many shopping areas. Bathroom was big. Room was spacious. Breakfast at the cafe below was good. Could be better if they provided electric kettle in the room for us to make tea. Drinks in the mini bar were free.
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice but rooms are very small with not much space for suitcases. Other than that it was very niceStaff was very polite and the hotel was very clean.Breakfast was great and the staff at restaurant were very polite.
hotelName:
28    Windsor Hotel Milano
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can definitely recommend a stay at Savona! We slept two nights in one of the suits and we felt super comfortable. The rooms were absolutely clean and everbody was more than kind. Also the service was absolutely courteous. The hotel is about five minutes from the canal district where you have a lot of small restaurants and bars and where you can get an absolute authentic Italian feeling. The centre is about twenty minutes away by foot. Another recommendation: Aperitivo in the hotel‘s pretty courtyard. I would always book again in Savona.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Milan in May and stayed at Savona Suites. There is nothing negative I can think of! The terrace was splendid and we were offered free drinks at arrival. Room was very clean and furnished with quality furniture and style and I have a demanding taste, I can assure! There was basically no noise at all, like we were the only ones at the hotel which really wasn't the truth. Breakfast was very good. Above all, everybody was superfriendly and greeted us with warm smile.The location is excellent, two subway stations are easily within walking distance and the restaurants of Navigli are very close.I have been to numerous hotels around the world and this was one of the very bests.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed my two night stay at this design hotel. I was greeted warmely by the reception desk staff (Serena). Offered something to drink and then personally showed me my room. The room itself was very big, like a little apartment almost. Nespresso coffee machine was much appreciated, coffee tasted delicious. Beds are very comfortable, only thing I didn’t like was the pillow which was very thick. There were four of them but they were all the same size. The toileteries offered were very cute-looking. I didnt have breakfast at the hotel because I didnt have the time but I was told it only cost €10,- which is probably the most affordable hotel breakfast I have ever come across.Overall, I definitely recommend staying at this charming hotel!
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival we were treated to drinks in the bar whilst we were checked in. Luigi - the man for all seasons - was very helpful in recommending local restaurants, bars and anything else you may need to know. The suite was lovely and spacious with top quality soft furnishings. Breakfast was included in the cost and everything was very fresh and nothing too much trouble. The reception staff were all lovely and so helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this place! The location is great, the rooms are very nice and the service is the best. Breakfast is good and in general the staff ensures the vibe is very relaxing. Great hotel to stay for business or a city trip.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is cool and out of touristic zone. The rooms are relax and comfortable.staff was so friendly.breakfast is not continential, Italian style Subway and other public transportation stops are close to hotel
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property was wonderful. As of this writing, it's only one year old. The staff was extremely accommodating and called my airline for me, assisted me in finding restaurants, etc. The rooms were well appointed, EXTREMELY comfortable bed, very nice. The neighborhood was full of shoppes, bars and restaurants. No need to go further than a few blocks. Convenient to the subway as well. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Coming to Milan in summer requires you to be somewhat heat resistant. So it is even more important to stay in a nice place from where you can set off and explore the city.For us Savona18 suites became this place for two days. From arrival to check-out we felt very well taken care. Our room was spacious, clean and beautifully furnished. The bed was heavenly.Breakfast was included in our rate and we liked every bite of it. Not because it was a huge buffet as you find it in tourist resorts but because it had the right things - fresh and in perfect quality.Everything accompanyied by the friendly, attentive and competent staff members. Here, especially Alfred and Luigi were the ones who made a difference.I can definitely recommend staying at Savona18.Although rates are definitely steep... see if you can find a good deal like we did!
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights at the Savona 18 Suites and were absolutely delighted: Super friendly staff (thanks a lot Alfred for taking such good care of our restaurant reservations!), modern and spacious rooms, great location, nice breakfast. Several nice restaurants are situated in the same area as the hotel. Otherwise, the public transport is nearby and you are quickly in the heart of Milan. We had an apéro in the bar on the terrace/courtyard of the hotel which was very nice as well. We would definitely stay here again! Only point of improvement for us would be to add a cheese selection to the breakfast buffet.
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Calm, trendy and beautiful hotel in a trendy area filled with locals. Away from the chaos and crowds near the Duomo, but filled with great restaurants, bars and shops. Spacious and modern rooms, and lovely outside area to relax in the late afternoon. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ... calling the suites is a bit of an exaggeration. rooms are normal or a bit small.in fact, as a consumer acitvist i would say its a bit of a "fake" claim, however - the place treated me well and and the front desk was joyful and helpful all day, plus the Bar is a nice place, too, so why should we complain??Hotel made me feel home and forget the room size!
hotelName:
29    Savona 18 Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all I would like to thank Walter for the great hospitality. Me and my wife remember with warm feelings every breakfast in Bronzino house. I think only in Italy you can meet host like this. You really believe that you met an old friend. And about the flat: it is cozy and quiet place that is ideal to relax after a long day in wonderful Milano. Thank you so much Walter! Hope to see you again!Kind regards, Nick and Katarina.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the immaculate Bronzino House in Milan for three nights during a visit to Italy in May 2019. Bronzino House is located in the Citta Studi neighbourhood of Milan, four metro stops from the Duomo in a quiet residential area near many very good restaurants and reasonably priced shopping. Bronzino House is a fully and tastefully modernized two bedroom apartment on the upper floor of a century old apartment building built around a courtyard garden. We stayed in one of the generously sized bedrooms (each with its own modern bathroom including rain shower and a great hairdryer) and were served a daily continental breakfast (including fresh croissants and cappuccinos!) by our host Walter (who lives in another apartment in the building). He graciously assisted us with restaurant reservations in the area; guided us on the use of the nearby metros; helped us prioritize our visits to major sites; and arranged a taxi for our return to Milano Centrale train station. On top of all that, Bronzino House is very will priced for a major city. It certainly deserves“ its rating as the #1 B&B in Milan.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot comment enthusiastically enough - we are delighted! Our room feels like home, quality furnishings and fixtures, beautiful ensuite, quiet and relaxing and spotlessly clean. Our host: a friendly and lovely man Walter who felt like a long time friend. Every morning we had a lovely chat while being spoilt with a great breakfast (croissants, assorted jams, toast, cereals, juice, fruit, Yoghurt and endless Cafe). Walter offered suggestions for dinner/excursions/local events and even booked our taxi to the train station when we were departing. Just book it you will not be disappointed!!!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walter, the host of Bronzino House has shown great attention to detail in the accommodation he provides. The accommodation consists of two separate bedrooms each with an ensuite. There is a small lounge area, a kitchen and a balcony for guests to share all decorated tastefully with details which gave a warm, comforts-of-home feel. Our room was comfortable and had superb soundproofing. The wi-Fi was fast and we had cable tv in our room. The fine details such as sweets in our room, complementary drinks in the room fridge, quality toiletries and the provision of tea making facilities and a coffee machine added to our comfort. We loved the location which is in a residential area but within walking distance of restaurants and bars and three metro stops from Centrale and the Duomo. The rooms are located on the fourth floor of a secure building with a small but functional lift available.One thing we particularly enjoyed was breakfast as it was a chance to chat to Walter who is a warm and friendly host. Walter also provided gluten free food for my husband. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had heard varying reports about Milan but we loved our first visit to this fascinating city and Bronzino House is highly recommended too. We enjoyed the location - a v short walk to local bars and good restaurants eg. La Piola on our first night and Ristorante il Delfino on 2nd night (good idea to book)...both were Walter’s recommendations. Walter, the host, is a lovely friendly man and kindly showed us around the B&B as we have an interest in building and architecture (he’s an Architect)...such a quality renovation/fit out with everything you would find in a top end hotel including a delightful 1923 lift - very handy as we had 2 large bags as in Europe for 2 months. This stay was lovely and we would highly recommend it to both individuals, couples and families - there’s a small kitchen and a shared dining space with pleasant/small verandah (see photos). A short walk (about 10 min) to the railway station through a well maintained area - mostly residential, apartments etc...train takes you into central Milan to see the main attractions (I think it was Lima station to San Babila station?) - for window shopping!... in the famous fashion district. Then onto all the famous places including the Piazza Castello (historic castle) etc. Walter recommended an itinerary and we had a wonderful day. Lunch was focaccias at a very popular bakery (Princi)...food delicious everywhere! Breakfast at Bronzino House was very good too. Thanks so much Walter...we hope to return! Christine and Tony
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hosts Walter and Evelina are just too good to be true. The B and B is not in Central Milan and this is a plus. It is truly modern, clean, convenient and has welcoming hosts. We arrived on a recent Saturday afternoon and we were greeted enthusiastically by Walter. He explained things for us to see and how to get there. But most importantly he gave us a recommendation for dinner locally. Not only did he recommend the restaurant but gave us the translation for items we would like to eat. He said get there before 7:30 or you won’t be seated before 10:30. We did as we were told and got there at 7:15 when we were promptly told no seating before 7:30. Evelina greeted us for breakfast later in our stay and was as warm and welcoming as Walter. She also had advice including a restaurant, which the other couple staying raved about. The B and B is in a wonderful neighborhood just 30 minutes from central Milan, including the walk to the Metro. Please stay here but understand it is only two rooms so make your reservation early. We felt like family after 3 nights!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had a wonderful 4 days in Milan at this very special B&B called Bronzino House! 5 Star hotel quality service second to none! The accommodation was spotlessly clean, modern and very comfortable. We had breakfast made for us each morning by our hosts Walter and Evelina who made us feel very special and welcome! Our hosts were so helpful with directions and ideas for our daily excursions! The metro was only a short walk away with supermarkets, bars and restaurants also only a short distance. A fantastic place to stay if you want to be 10 minutes away from the city hussle and bustle!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a wonderful B & B.It is spotlessly clean, tastefully presented, comfortable and very convenient. Bronzino House is located in the student area of Milan. It is a short taxi ride (€10, less than 10 minutes) away from Milan central station and very conveniently placed to explore Milan centre ( 5 minute walk to tram station, and 4 stop ride to the Duomo in the centre), It is found in a beautiful old apartment block , accessed via a 100 year old lift . The apartment has 2 bedrooms, both en suite, a small kitchen /dining area and a very pretty private terrace. The bedrooms are spacious, well furnished and very comfortable. The bathrooms are spotlessly clean and have a very airy shower.. Breakfasr is presented to guests by the owner, Walter, in the dining area. We had fruit, yoghurt, cereals toast and croissants all washed down with fruit juice and tea and coffee. Walter is a very friendly and kind man. He was helpful and nothing was too much trouble. He had refurbished the apartment about 5 years ago and everything was just right! If you need a small, convenient, clean and comfortable place to stay as a base for exploring Milan Bronzino House is the place to go. You will NOT be disappointed .
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just perfect, Walter helped us with the parking as we arrived and was warm and friendly throughout, he gave us great recommendations and made our stay so enjoyable, particularly as we were in Milan for just one night.The accommodation is stunning, and would be a great base for a longer trip too. Perfect.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Bronzino House in September at the beginning of a 5-week trip in Europe. We are now nearly at the end of this trip and I can say with complete certainty that Bronzino House was the very best of all our accommodations, especially in terms of the beautiful furnishings, the extremely high-quality linens, and the loving attention to detail provided by the owners. Walter was also an invaluable source of information about restaurants, galleries and museums, and other places to visit in Milan. I would not hesitate to recommend this B&B to anyone, no matter how discriminating their taste!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with two friends and my wife for one night but would recommend staying here for much longer. The host Walter was more than gracious and presented us with many tips on where to visit and what to eat. We followed some of his tips and are in awe of his services. The flat is really top-notch and a testimony to the architectural artistry of the host. The rooms where equally nice and we slept like royalty in the comfy beds. I will definitely return if I am able, as I can't think of a better stay in Milano!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B from Walter&Evelina is fantastic!! High standard rooms with a very tasteful interior, a perfect bed, air-condition, great breakfast with croissants by Walter and so much love in the details. Perfect location in Milano, tube station very close, public parking garage just around the corner. Just perfect, so we will definetely come back! Steph&Sascha
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at the B&B Bronzino house, and it was spectacular! Walter was an amazing host! He provided us great information about what to do and where to go, and wrote down to us what to order! And it was the best meal we had in Milan! The place is supper clean, quite, very convenient, I highly recommend this place for staying in Milan! And I'm definitely staying there if I go back to Milan!Thank you Walter☺
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bronzino House was a great choice for the start of our trip to lakes Como and Garda.The location is quiet, peaceful and safe. Bronzino House is a tastefully renovated two bedroom apartment overlooking a very pleasant private courtyard on the one side and a quiet street, from the terrace, on the other.The en-suite rooms were spotless, attractively decorated, with attention paid to detail. Walter, the host was very friendly, helpful and accommodating – I (one of 4 friends travelling together) arrived at 11.00 p.m. and he made no fuss about it. The continental style breakfast served by Walter, was adequate – the bread could have been more interesting.I wouldn’t think twice about staying at Bronzino House and would happily return in the future.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose Bronzino House because of the good reviews and the proximity to Linate Airport. As others have pointed out, access to your quarters on the fourth floor of an apartment building is by an antique lift, the type that used to be common in Paris. There is a surprise element when you are shown your room as it is larger than most hotel rooms and wonderfully designed and decorated with soothing colours. Window opens on to a nice courtyard. The bathroom designed by Walter himself, was excellent with a great rain shower. Lots of nice touches in the room, a radio which is rare in accommodation these days, and a press I liked as it had a light which automatically turned on as you approached it! Very comfy bed and the quiet make for a good night's sleep.Nice light breakfast in the morning served up by the host Walter who chats with you as you eat, something that would normally annoy me but as others have pointed out he is such a simpatico host with a fascinating background that we really enjoyed it. His restaurant recommendations were informative and helpful.Truth be told, we stayed in Bronzino House as a stopover on the way back from a holiday in the Piedmont and it turned out to be one of the most enjoyable evenings of our entire vacation. Highly recommended, and extraordinary value in a normally very expensive city.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very friendly and helpfull renter (walter) and we think this location is more than a pretty room in a wonderful appartement. We stay in April for one night and we certainly come back. best regards to walter from wolfgang and martina (austria/vienna)
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bronzino House is perfectly located a few metro stops from practically everywhere you might want to go in Milan and is a 20 min walk from the main central station. The b&b itself is located in a lovely building with an amazing old lift that takes you to the top floor. The b&b itself is elegant without being flashy, extremely spacious, with a lovely balcony where you can sit out and sip your wine. What makes it truly special is the owners. We met the husband, Walter, who came to make us breakfast every morning. It is difficult to imagine a more hospitable host - fun, interesting and never ingratiating. Absolutely perfect.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What i loved most about B&B Bronzino House was the tasteful furnishing and attention to detail in the apartment. Walter and Evelina are such gracious hosts and they make you feel so much at home that you want to stay there longer! The rooms are beautifully maintained by the cleaning staff who comes in daily to keep the place immaculately clean. The apartment is centrally located in Citta Studi and close to popular bars, pizzeria's and restaurants. ( Do not miss "Bar Basso" which serves a very unique "Negroni" and the "Osteria La Piola" which served the best Osso Bucco I've tasted. both of these places are located just a stone's throw away from the apartment. The Metro is also a 10 minute walk from Bronzino House as well. A point to note: If you Love Art or are an Art Aficionado, try asking the host, Walter for advise/recommendations on viewing private art collections in Milan that are open to public but are off the "popular tourist map". My stay was pretty short so I just about managed to view one of them but there are definitely more that are on my wish list to see. So I am definitely going back :-)Oh did I mention this... The apartment has a quaint little terrace that is JUST PERFECT for an early morning espresso, cappucino or a simple cuppa tea that is served with your breakfast every morning before you start exploring Milan..I definitely will go back to B&B Bronzino and highly recommend it.Sharmila
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What makes a great place to stay? First is the location. The Bronzino House fulfills that as it is in a quiet, safe suburb of Milan. Last thing we want is someplace that is noisy and surrounded by other sterile hotels. Second is the comfort of the property. Here we have a perfect choice as it is updated and comfortable, but feels as if you would have chosen the design yourself. Two ensuite bedrooms [plenty of storage]with a kitchen/dining area and cosy outside terrace if you just want to relax and read. Quiet neighborhood with necessary stores nearby (e.g., grocery store/restaurants/pharmacy/tram[#23 to the Duomo] and metro stops a short distance away). Don't be put off by the high floor location of the apartment as there is a funky antique lift that gives you the feeling you have traveled back in time. Fit and finishings are extremely well done. A/C is welcome in the summer. Price is important and for a world-class city such as Milan it can't be beat. Finally, an intangible that is a tie-breaker is the owner. Walter and Evelina picked us up at our car rental return (extra charge, but less expensive than a taxi) at Malpensa as we did not want to struggle with luggage and the attendant hassle and gave us a nice tour of Milan before we settled in. Their enthusiasm and genuine friendliness was apparent from the moment we met them. He meets you each morning with fresh croissants and other goodies and recommendations if asked as well as his stories Re growing up in Ethiopia (who had a lion at his house?). Rely on his suggestions for restaurants as well as things to see in Milan. Wish we could take them with us on our travels. Definitely would stay with them again.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walter and Evelina are the most impressive hosts of any B&B we have stayed with. Walter was our first contact by picking us up at the airport. (Fee). The apartment is perfectly shared with another couple. It's 2 nice sized bedrooms with all of the modern conveniences. The bathroom is beautifully appointed. The bed was wonderfully comfortable. Walter comes and makes breakfast each morning. There is a common dining room table and lovely terrace for the 2 bedrooms to share. It's not in the city center but easy to access by tram or metro. We will be back for sure! The rooms are very quiet.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walter and Evelina are delightful and accommodating hosts - nothing is too much trouble - Walter comes to make breakfast every morning and even played taxi driver, coming to collect us from the train station (for a small fee). Bronzino House is a two bedroom B &B, and while it is not right in the city centre, it is close to the metro and trams, and taxi fares to town are extremely reasonable. There is no laundry in the apartment, but there is a very good laundromat close by, and Walter has a wealth of knowledge regarding things to do, sights to see and where to eat. We spent 4 thoroughly enjoyable days at Bronzino House with another couple - it is modern, well appointed, and has a lovely terrace to relax on with an aperitif! We would return there in a heartbeat. We miss Walter and Evelina already!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I love our hosts Walter and Evelina. Their freshly baked croissants and warm hospitality keep us coming back to Bronzino house. We love the location and the space the B&B offers. It feels like home. It's perfect for a family of four: book the entire apartment.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Husband and I stayed at Bronzino House for 2 nights at the end of June, Walter and Everlina thank you for your hospitality, your B&B is the best we have ever stayed in, the lovely Italian building, the lovely apartment and the friendliest hosts,if you are going to Milan you must stay here, we will definitely go again and recommend it to all our family and friends.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very friendly and kind host, really nice room like a 5star hotel, very clean -> just perfect, if it is free just book it. breakfast was also very good. there is no reason to look for another place in Milan
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderfull time at Bronzino house. The rooms are very clean, the beds are perfect and the breakfast really nice. Location is easy to get to by metro and not very busy. We loved the old elevator! The host is very helpfull! We will go back next year
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights in March at this B&B. This B&B is situated in a quiet residential building with a pretty courtyard.We were warmly welcomed. Our room was very comfortable and very clean and the standard overall was excellent. There was also a kitchen/breakfast area with a balcony. Breakfast each morning was outstanding with fresh croissants and delicious local honey.What particularly made our stay memorable was the friendliness of our hosts. Evelina and Walter made our stay very comfortable and took great care of us. If we ever come back to Milan again this would be our accomodation of choice.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As my daughter and I only spent about 30 hours in Milan, we wanted to extract every moment of Milan's essence possible. This included our stay at Bronzino House. The Bronzino House, named after the street, and the building is very unassuming. Once buzzed into the building, we felt like we'd entered into a portal of hundred years of Milan's culture. The courtyard teemed with terrace gardens and would be gardeners who'd taken advantage of whatever green space they could call their own in the middle of a bustling city.The courtyard gave such a lovely presentation for our entrances and exits. Once inside, we were greeted by the hundred year old historical elevator which carried us up to the third floor. I thought the elevator was the charming and unscripted surprise of our stay. Once inside the apartment, everything looked exactly like the photos on this page. We learned that Walter's love of contemporary sleek lines inspired the design in his BnB. If Walter designed the bathrooms himself, I think he deserves acclaim because the shower and the sink and the whole bathroom for that matter was on point with the design boutique hotel we stayed in the following night in Paris. What I appreciated about our stay the most was Walter's charm. He obviously loves his time hosting wayward travelers. I would describe him as a generous people person. He took great pride in the breakfast part of our stay. He carefully selected every detail down to the best butters, jams and what we would describe in the States as "upscale Nutella". He offered both an aesthetically pleasing and filling breakfast fare. Our Sunday morning breakfast was relaxed and quite enjoyable as we got to engage in conversation with a lovely Italian family from the part of Italy as they called it the "Heel" of the Italian boot. Most wonderful about Walter, and he is the most wonderful part of the BnB experience, is that he generously agreed to allow us to keep our bags in our room for the balance of the day. He didn't have to allow us to keep the room keys past the time of our check out, but he did putting our needs above his own. We greatly appreciated this. He helped us secure our arrival and departure times and he even hailed a taxi for us to Linate Airport when it was time to go. How great it was to have that guidance when we were unsure of the times it would take to travel from place to place. That is just the kind of host he is.Walter understands traveling, anticipates his guests' needs and passionately strives to achieve hospitality perfection. There is no doubt that we will call upon Bronzino House again and we believe it is a fantastic choice for any would-be traveler.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the best b&b in milano for sure....it was very clean....quiet...nice desighnethe room was large with small nice balcony and kitchen..and the owner mr.walter was helpful and very friendly for any needthe breakfast was small but anoughits not in the city center but its in very nice and quiet area.....with 5 minute walking you cam fined the mtr staition who take you to the city center in a few minutesi go back again
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was travelling with my husband. Milano is our last stop and we stayed there for 3 nights. The house is located on top floor in the residential building with an elegant architecture and nice neighbors. It is very easy walking to there from metro station. The house contains 2 rooms with its private toilet and shower room. We chose Ebony room which is the first room after the main door. The room is very stylish, comfortable, quiet and clean. The room cleaning was made daily. The host - Walter comes every morning to prepare the breakfast for us and chat with us :). The breakfast is a continental style serves croissant, toast, cereal, yogurt, juice, coffee and tea that are enough for a start of our day. Walter loves interact with different people. The chat with him was enjoyable. We hope we can return some day and stay in House Bronzino again.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this apartment through Trip Advisor and the great reviews were spot-on. It's in a friendly neighborhood with lots of nearby restaurants, bus lines and metro stops.The apartment is thoroughly modern with lots of conveniences that we now take for granted like wifi, large comfortable rooms and beds, very modern bathroom, etc. The apartment has 2 bedrooms, kitchen, dining area and outdoor patio. They provide an information packet with restaurants and attractions. We were given some great tips on some local restaurants and metro lines that you can easily walk to. This is a great place to stay in Milan.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late to a warm welcome & the most comfortable bed . After a well needed sleep we had an early morning coffee on the terrace off the Breakfast Room overlooking the street below. Walter & Evalina are excellent hosts & feel more like family ! As we had visited Milan before & seen the major sights, Walter gave us some other extremely interesting things to do that we would never have discovered by ourselves. Also the list of local Restaurants & Bars was invaluable & we had many pleasant evenings working our way through this list. I would recommend Bronzino House to everyone ! The breakfast was delicious, fresh, still warm flaky croissants with Walter's secret stash of honey was just perfect . We want to go back !!!!!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed here before and love Bronzino House. Walter and Evelina are excellent hosts and my kids love that we have an apartment to ourselves. It is ideally located. Just a few metro stops away from the Duomo it is in a quiet, friendly neighborhood! Love it
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are a ton of places to stay in Milan, but very few that are worthy of a 5 Star review. Bronzino, however, definitely is! Expect beautiful rooms - which really can be put on par with the most expensive places to stay in the city (Walter, the host, works in construction management and has overseen the design and building of numerous hotels). A delicious breakfast is served every morning, and you're just a stone's throw from central Milan. We will definitely be coming back!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you read about Bronzino house it true, Walter is a fabulous host, very friendly and helpful. Or room at the B& B was beautifully designed and very quiet.Close to two Metro stations, so you are in the centre of Milan within a few stops.Walter recommended a local restaurant Il Trullo, which was so good we went twice.Highly recommend Bronzino HouseThank you Walter for a lovely stay at your B&B.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Italy for 3 weeks, stayed in 4 hotels and this was the best! After 2 weeks of carrying our luggage on and off trains, we decided to base ourselves in Milan and do day trips so we chose Bronzino House as our Milan base. What a great choice! The apartment is very clean, has beautifully furnished, modern bathrooms and nicely sized bedrooms. The wifi worked like a charm. There is a lovely terrace to enjoy and a sitting area between the rooms which has a bookcase stocked with maps and guides for the metro system and local points of interest. It was wonderful to stay in a Milan neighborhood which gave us a taste of what it is like to live there. One of the best things about Bronzino House is Walter himself! We so enjoyed our morning chats with him over breakfast. Walter gave us tips and information about nearby restaurants, the metro, local events and itinerary advice. We followed his advice and were never disappointed! We always felt very safe walking around this residential neighborhood and its location is very convenient as it is close to Linate airport and 2 metro stations. We were only 3 metro stops from the city center (Duomo, etc.) and only 3 stops on the other metro line from Milano Centrale the main train station. We very highly recommend Bronzino House! You won't be disappointed!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is a reason B&B Bronzino House has such a high rating on TripAdvisor--it deserves it. We were there in May and had a truly wonderful stay there. The B&B is in a lovely courtyard on the fifth floor (Italian fourth); the building has an elevator and also a large staircase. Our room was terrific, with ample closet space and a large chest of drawers, air conditioning, a refrigerator, and a great bathroom with probably the best shower you will find anywhere. Walter Amlesu, our host, designed the entire space beautifully. Outside the two bedrooms are a lovely sitting area with built-in bookshelves (filled with books, some in English), the breakfast area and glassed doors leading to an outside patio. We love B&B's, where we have a chance to talk at breakfast with our hosts and other guests, about our traveling experiences. All of that was true here, but Walter and Evelina made our stay in Milan immensely more enjoyable. We had wonderful morning conversations, especially with Walter, as Evelina works at another job. Yes, about things to see and do in Milan, and wonderful restaurants to try, but about so much more. About common interests, art, music, their lives and ours. The very essence of what makes traveling so spectacularly wonderful. And we aren't unique; if you see other reviews of this fantastic place, you will find similar comments. If you stay here, you will of course find an immaculately clean place, a lovely breakfast and all of the accouterments common to a hotel that travelers hope for but rarely get in a B&B. But I would venture to say that the consistent 5/5 rating this B&B deservedly receives from traveler after traveler is for the intangibles, and most especially for Bronzino House's wonderful hosts.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once again, we went with the TripAdvisor rating (#3 out of 217 B&Bs) and reviews ... and we scored! Bronzino House is situated in a large, five-story, stately apartment building in a quiet neighborhood of Milan. One enters the building through massive front doors, walks through an inner courtyard, and rides an old-time elevator to the next to top floor. The apartment is nicely furnished--contemporary, bright, with lovely artwork throughout--all the creations of an architect friend of the proprietors. Our room could not have been more comfortable ... a balcony off the dining room was very inviting. Walter, a retired civil engineer, is a fantastic host--breakfast was excellent, and the conversation wonderful and educational. Via Bronzino 20 is close to busy thoroughfares, good shopping, and great restaurants. For us on our last night in Italy, it was the perfect place to stay since Linate Airport is just a few kilometers (a ten-minute) drive away. We give Bronzino House our highest rating.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in May 2015 at the Bronzino House. It was clean with a very comfortable bed. The air conditioning worked quite well. The B &B was very quiet-we never heard a sound from anything! We enjoyed having the outdoor terrace area as well. The location had very easy access via the Metro to all the sites. Walter was a very good host and had lots of helpful hints for us. His recommendations for dinner were all very good and he was kind enough to make the reservations for us, which we appreciated.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here recently with my family of 4 (including 2 teens). The great thing about this apartment for us was that we had the whole apartment to ourselves because we rented the two rooms in the apartment. Both rooms have their own bathroom / toilet facilities. There is also a small kitchenette, dining area and lovely balcony which the dining area looks out at. The apartment is furnished very elegantly and beautifully. It also looks new and is well maintained.Our hosts, Walter and Evalina, both seem like really lovely and friendly people. Unfortunately we did not see much of them only because they were away over Christmas. Walter gave us really good recommendations for dining and made reservations for us, too. He also assisted to help us make the booking for the cab and came very early on our last day in the apartment to serve us breakfast.This apartment is not near the Duomo area and the walk to the nearest train station (Lima I believe) is a good 10-15 minutes depending on your speed. If you need to get to the Milano Central Station, you would probably need to take a cab if you have luggage. However, the location feels very safe as it is quiet and mainly residential. And on the upside, there are NUMEROUS eateries and some shops just a lane away.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful stay, too short, I wish i could have stayed longer in Milano.Service is very personal, Walter and Evelina made my stay unforgettable. They made some great suggestions for me to see and do, to get the most out of my stay in the city. So much so, i returned in September. My hosts could not have been more helpful.The B&B is well appointed, beautifully designed. Very contemporary decor with some nice antique touches. The shower is big, the bed warm and comfortable. The B&B is on the top floor, and hence very quiet. The beautiful courtyard and streets immediately below are quiet.The location is very good, it is close to two Metro stations, or just a short walk from shops and Cafes' on Corso Buenos Aries. Breakfast is good, a nice choice of cereals, toast, fresh brioche and fruit. Coffee is served how you like it. There is a small but perfectly formed outdoor terrace, great to relax with a drink or book, or both.Ci vediamo l'anno prossimo.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a brilliant 2 night stay at Bronzini House and cannot wait to return! The location of the apartment is ideal; it is situated in a safe district in very close proximity to the tube station with a variety of restaurants and cafés nearby. Central Milan is a 10 minute walk, followed by a short tube ride. The apartment itself is beautifully decorated and exceptionally clean; pictures don't do it justice! Walter and Evelina went above and beyond in every respect and were exquisite hosts. They ensured that they were very prompt in responding to all emails, were around to welcome us, provided us with umbrellas and even went as far as sourcing some wholemeal bread at our request. We had a very early start on one day of our trip and they arranged for us to have breakfast at a cafe opposite free of charge! We learnt that establishments such as this in Milan are unable to provide home cooked breakfasts due to constraints within the city but breakfast was plentiful all the same. There were hot drinks, juices, toast with a variety of spreads, cereals, yogurts and pastries. We were also pleasantly surprised with the drinks and snacks that the cupboards and fridge were stocked with! It is evident that Walter and Evelina love what they do and take great pride in running this wonderful bed and breakfast. Walter was incredibly accommodating and wowed us with his charm and knowledge of Milan. He was kind enough to spend time helping us plan our journeys around the city and indicated points of interest on a map. Bronzino House felt like a home away from home and we would whole heartedly recommend staying it!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is long overdue. We were lucky enough to stay at this wonderful B&B in June 2014 with a couple of friends. It is a perfect place to stay if you are travelling on your own and especially if you are travelling with another couple. We felt like we were in our own mini apartment, it really felt like we were residents of Milan. Evelina and Walter are perfect hosts! We enjoyed their company so much, they truly made you feel like you were at home. They provided great recommendations and they were so accommodating always ensuring we had enough water during the heat of the day. Communication was great, we arrived earlier than I anticipated and they were available via e-mail, replied quickly, and made sure their son was home to greet us and help us with our luggage. Rooms are lovely, very modern, and have everything you need. The patio is another treat to enjoy some outdoor space. Very safe, great residential neighbourhood that is close to metro and some really great restaurants! Perfect place to stay in Milan! We really would not want to stay anywhere else!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is well located within the city of Milan with good restaurants and metro within walking distance. Comfortable, quiet, very clean, attractive, new, modern, good bed, nice bath, great hosts. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at B&B Bronzino in July 2014 for 2 nights. The room was exceptional - everything was clean, modern. I wouldn't have changed a thing!Walter and Evelina were excellent hosts - even drove us to the train station for our departure because it was raining! The breakfast they provide includes croissants, toasts, yogurts, cereals and wonderful coffee. We very much enjoyed their company at the morning breakfasts - they are truly wonderful individuals and made our stay all the more enjoyable!The neighborhood is nice - we felt comfortable walking at night from the metro station. As well, its a significant walk (~2/3 miles) from the Duomo - but can be done stopping along the way. Easy walk to the Lima metro too!This B&B was the one with the best value for our money (95Euro/night) for our whole trip!We loved our time in Milan and wouldn't stay anywhere else!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walter is a wonderful host! He was friendly, gregarious, and extremely helpful. He has exquisitely renovated this B&B. The fixtures, furniture, and towels/linens were all top of the line. The building is cute and well-situated between two metro lines in a quiet neighborhood. We only stayed one night, but the Bronzino House made us want to stay longer. The next time we're in Milan, we will certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second trip to Italy and we love to stay in B&Bs. This one, Bronzino House, is one of the best we have stayed in. It is in a very convenient location in Milan, we walked from there to all the places we wanted to visit so we didn't have to use our car. We had a suite with two bedrooms, one for us and one for our adult kids, a sitting area and a kitchen with seating. Every morning Walter and Evelina brought us our Italian breakfast and made tea. Then they stayed and chatted and helped us with finding the best places to visit and how to get there. They were delightful and very helpful. Our rooms were modern and nicely and comfortably furnished. It was in a very safe neighborhood and was very quiet. The only negative is that you have to search for parking on the street. But other than that the Bronzino House is awesome and we definitely recommend it to anyone staying in Milan!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a charming, modern, immaculately clean with recently refurbished bathroom. Bed was wonderfully comfortable. Linen beautiful. What really made the stay were the very generous hosts who not only looked after us but gave us the very best advice on what to see and where to go. This apartment is well located for delicious food, bars and all of the things we wanted to see in Milan. Had not expected to be so impressed with this exceptionally valued home. Will definitely use it again and recommend to friends.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bronzino House is like a cool apartment that you've always wanted to have but not sure how to decorate it the same way yourself. The apartment is beautifully decorated. The bed was nice and soft. Staying here is like being at home! To explore the Milan, it is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest Metro station. Friendly and warm service. There is a Nespresso machine in the living room that you can use any time! Best place we've stayed in Italy!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't praise Bronzino House enough. The newly-redone apartment in a charming 1900's apartment block provides five star comfort at three star prices. The two double rooms are restfully decorated in brown and cream, the bedlinen and towels are top quality, the bathroom is state-of-the-art with an enormous shower and complimentary toiletries. The closet space is generous and the light inside is a nice touch. There is a small refrigerator in the room and the wifi works perfectly. The room faces on to an internal courtyard and is very quiet. The breakfast (with fresh croissants and Nespresso) is served in a charming room with a terrace for use in good weather and you can make tea and coffee at will with the electric kettle and capsule coffee machine. Your charming and helpful hosts Walter and Evelina speak fluent English and French and are only too happy to help with anything you may need. There is a tram stop nearby which takes you straight to the Duomo and the metro is about a ten minute walk away. I would thoroughly recommend Bronzino House.Carolyn, Morcote
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the B&B for two days, just before our way home after a 10-day holiday in Italy. Like the city, the B&B is beautifully decorated, very thoughtful and chic. At the same time, it's warm and like being home; I wished our home can be as nice as this. We loved the bathroom, the dining room, the hall way; surely the bedroom... everything! Highly recommended!
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited this B&B as the first stop on our Italy trip and we're not disappointed. There's nothing to complain about this lovely B&B. It's clean and modern, very well constructed. The beds are the most comfortable ones we have experienced during our two weeks trip, so is the quality of the towels. It was great chatting to Walter and we wouldn't hesitate coming back on our next visit to Milano.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I stayed here at the end of august of this year and were unfortunately only in Milan for less than 24 hours. While we were definitely on a budget, this place was super affordable and it is crazy how nice and modern it is. We had the entire apartment to ourselves, and I can't convey how absolutely beautiful, clean, and awesome it is. It is in a quiet, safe neighborhood and is close to a few different metro stops. We met Walter and Evelina at breakfast the morning we left and they are so warm, friendly and hilarious. I wish they would adopt me and let me live in this apartment forever! If you're in Milan, you HAVE to stay here.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is simply awesome and I can only place a full recommendation here. The interior design of the whole building and the rooms is magnificent. There is every comfort you can imagine, the hosts are most helpful and kind. They have really understood good what an excellent B&B should be like and can easily compete with the best hotels in town as well. I can only hope that Bronzino House is going on for a long time so that I can always spend my time in Milano there.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay at Bronzino House. Walter was incredibly welcoming, helpful and kind. Our room was beautifully decorated. The room and facilities were incredibly well priced given how luxurious they were. The breakfast was plentiful and it catered well for our needs. The location was within walking distance of the main city area and was well serviced by transport routes. We have already recommended this lovely b & b to family members and would not hesitate to stay again! Thanks, Walter, for a lovely stay. From Fawzia and Phil.
hotelName:
30    B&B Bronzino House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is welcoming. The place is luminous, and rooms are really comfortable. I'd certainly stop by for my next trip to Milan. The restaurant should offer more diversity tho. At 8 pm, on Saturday, nothing interesting was offered on the menu
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights. The rooms are very clean, with not so much decoration, but totally fine (that is the reason for the 4 and not 5 points). The location is very central with very good connection to public transportation. Breakfast is for Italian standards very nice. Really the best part about the hotel is the staff. They are all super friendly and very helpful and polite. Especially Antonio helped to make our trip unforgettable, as he had the BEST restaurant recommendations! You had the feeling, that he really knows everything about Milano and especially about drinks and food. If you are not sure where to go, ask him and you will not be disappointed. Thank you so much Antonio!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A home touch in everything. Unexpected pleasant surprises upon returning in the evening. Abundant tasty breakfast. Fresh cold water for the guests. Nothing posh , everything is managed. Nice place to stay in overcrowded Milano
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a good position in the city center good service. Only the Wifi coverange was not on 100%. Tram is nerby therefore is important to have a room on other side of hotel. The hotel service and food was very good
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family visit was on May , the check in was fast and the room was ready but there was a problem in the reservation that i made on booking for bed and breakfast but they said it is only for bed and I have to pay extra charge for the breakfast and I have to do so for my kid , the room is renovated and large with nice large bed and large toilet , the breakfast was perfect having many varieties many fresh juices and bakery it was for 15 euro per adult and free for my kid the restaurant is wide and the service is excellent, the hotel lobby is large with accessibility for wheelchair and strollers and having two large elevators for your rooms , the location is perfect just close to piazza republica and its metro station and few steps from Corso Buenos Aires a nice shopping street , the hotel is just three metro station from the duomo and one metro station from the central station, just two problems we faced the first was the WiFi in the rooms is poor and I told the reception and the a/c was only working on hot and the weather in May was hot and I asked the receptionist he told it is set for the whole hotel at warm and he can’t change and I can open the window and that what I Did but it was a surprise for me that a four stars hotel at Milan I have to open the window !!!!! Last problem that the ladies at the reception was totally un experienced and lack any information about Milan as when I asked her about where to take the shuttle bus going to the sereville village mall or about how to reserve a tour in jeuventus stadium she told she don’t know but at last day I met mr Antonio who was so friendly and cooperative he make a taxi reservation for the airport and he fixed the WiFi in my room , he was a really a great receptionist an experienced cheerful cooperative one , in general the hotel is perfect for a family vacation and with a reasonable price
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located and comfortable, and has a good and extensive breakfast provision. My room was adequate and clean, but quite small and dark, looking out on car park. However, the wifi is really weak and frequently drops out completely.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed to stay in this Hotel. Super friendly Stuff. Parking Lot. Real good breakfast. Very Close to Fashion mile and Park. Best value for price . Just a bit Mouse from the old Tram. See you soon
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We pre-paid for a room for 3 adults with 2 beds. They gave us a room with 1 bed for 2 adults. Despite complaining, hotel didn't switch us to our room, nor did they offer to give any substantial help e.g. book us at different hotel, offer refund, etc.Avoid at all costs!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good choice for a holiday stay close to the center/duomoPublic transportation to center (No. 1) or Milano Centrale (No. 5) within 100-150m Great all you can eat Sushi restaurant (Nara) at about 100m;
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just okay. It was well kept and clean. Room size was good for Europe. Only comment would be that the location of the hotel is not really that central. Definitely located more in the business district.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel! Super nice personnel! They were all friendly, helpful and professional. Nice room, clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend for anybody. Parking places free of charge directly next to the entrance. :)
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was fantastic with the hotel and the room. The breakfast was huge, with a lots of variety of the lactose free dishes. The staff was super kind with us, they was super helpful. I’m pretty sure to come back!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location of the hotel /Rooms were big enough to accommodate family with 1 child.Breakfast was delicious . public car parking is next to the hotel since unfortunately the hotel parking spots and limited.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked a three bed room (family with 8 year old kid) and they provided 2 rooms, one double and one single room at the same price,. Rooms were quite big and luxury and the stuff was very friendly but also very professional. They supported every question we had and were willing to help all the time. Location is also very good, close to the Main strain station of Milan
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time visiting Milan and I really loved it over all. what made it an amazing trip really was the staff and stay at this hotel, they were extremely friendly and accommodating! it's also at a great location. Going back in June for sure!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a young couple (+dog) on tour for a combined work & leisure period in Milano. We’ve stayed in the NH Machiavelli hotel for six weeks (october till december). Well, then one get to know how good (or bad) a hotel is run. And we can confirm: by far the best (NH) hotel experience we ever had.And believe me, we’ve seen a lot of hotels insideout.To cut a long story short- from arrival throughout staying and departure; it was smooth, friendly and warm. No complaints whatsoever. But if we had an issue; it was solved quickly and professional. After this experience there is nothing that keeps us away from booking again. Thanks for making our stay as if we were (back) home.Extended review:What is important for us and was provided in this hotel? Clean, quiet and spacious rooms; good beds; enough supplies; a warm atmosphere; close to a supermarket; within walking distance to the city (20minutes) or public transport (1 minute); luxury; big breakfast buffet with at least lots of fresh fruit (Kiwi’s, Ananas and Oranges, etc.) and plenty to choose from. The frontdesk run by Carmen, Roberta, Giada, Antonio & Rocco plus all the friendly ladies. Antonio became our assistant in everything. The housekeeping ladies were every day on their best. (Thanks for keeping our room clean every day during our stay). The executive Chef Eduard and his kitchen staff are working hours every day their butts off to get a broad fresh breakfast buffet and evening diner. The personell running breakfast: Roberta, Rosario, Giovanni, Gilda such an amazing team. Special thanks to Gem for being so friendly in cutting our four kiwi’s and take care of everything. Tip: Get yourself a capuccinno made by Tarun; he is a Latte-art artist and makes the best capuccinno from their entire team (sorry!)Roomtip: if you are a light sleeper and like to sleep with an open window, avoid a room on the frontside. The trams in Milano sounds terrible while driving over the rails. And the avarage car driver will honk his car horn every minute. Further, the airconditioning in the hotel is shut-off after october by law. (We prefer an AC-cool room of 19 degrees). Open up the window when you are gone during the day. And in these days it’s quickly cold enough inside. If the room gets too cold; heating is modern, sufficient and swiftly warm.One complaint though: please change your background music in the lobby every once in a while. We know the cover song tape now from A to Z and backwards. ;-) perhaps an internet radio with mixed music styles?Last but not least, the general manager Davide is visible every day. During breakfast or late night diner. He is there. A good sign.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:1. Staff is really helpful and friendlyCons:1. Very noisy, because of tram right under the windows. 2. Rooms are dated3. Not possible to manage air condition. It always work on same degree, which cause to be cold at night.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly warm and attentive staff, rooms are spacious (we also had a baby crib in the room) and the location very central and well connected with public transport.The usual NH quality with a touch of family feeling: highly recommended, we will definitely go back again!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review could have been at least 1 or even 2 points better, but due to extremely heated rooms we have to degrade. If your room have 26.5 degrees it is not acceptable, and it was impossible to sleep.Location great. Breakfast good, service good, cleanliness good and bed good. But, way to hot in room!We (unfornunately) did not complain-but other errirs was fixed in a day.Room price was about 200 Euro, so I would have expected good and cold sleep.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Machiavelli for 4 nights. This hotel is centrally located and within walking distance of most of Milan’s main attractions. If arriving by train it is a 10 to 15min walk to the hotel. The hotel itself is clean and beds are comfortable. It is not the most modern, but is well located and functional. Breakfast is a buffet. It has a large range of breads and pastries, but hot food is very limited, making breakfast a little expensive for what’s on offer. Staff are helpful and polite. Would stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room with ample space for a family of 3. The air conditioning was a welcomed plus. Easy to walk into the centre of Milan from the hotel. Whilst we did not eat at the hotel the staff were very pleasant and helpful indeed.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a decently priced hotel, it offers a comfortable stay with clean and spacious rooms. The staff was also friendly and service was good overall. The issue is that it is NOT really “Free WIFI”. They charge you for higher speed, which you need if you want to do anything online.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights and had a lovely time.Hotel is in a great location and the rooms were very comfortable.The hotel reception staff were always on hand to help out .The breakfast was very good .We would definitely stay here again .
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room spacious and clean. Continental and hot breakfast available. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Whole experience let down by no coffee and tea facilities in the bedroom other than through room service at 2€ plus 6€ cover charge. On principle this is not acceptable for a quality hotel. Disappointed as Italy is reputed to provide the best coffee in the world.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a business trip so quick visit, but super hotel, had a wonderful nights sleep. Pillows and mattress amazing and very quiet, great location and helpful staff, would stay again.we ahd a very alte check-in of 12pm and it wasnt a problem, only a 13 minute walk from central station.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here several nights. From the outside it's pretty nondescript and easy to miss, but it's right next door to the much more visible Hotel Ibis if you're looking for it. The weather was extremely hot, and the complimentary ice-cold lemonade in reception was well received. The superior room was roomy, pleasant and well appointed if somewhat dull in decoration. The wifi was hopeless and the TV reception was just on/off/on/off all the time. Staff were pleasant, the windows pretty soundproof, the a/c worked and breakfast was very good. There's a useful small supermarket next door and it's on a tramline to the city centre. There are plenty of nearby restaurants.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast is super Room is very clean staff is very helpfulLocation is not the best No free minibar No cattle and hot drinks in room12 minuets from central station 10 minuets from Corso bunions Aires I recommend this hotel for business trips Many valued restaurants around in central like XIER Chinese restaurants
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We largely chose this hotel because of price as we found Milan accommodation generally pricey. Our standard room was slightly dated but it was perfectly comfortable, clean and well appointed. There was little drawer or shelf space - I suspect because it is mainly used by corporate guests who perhaps only stay a couple of nights. Breakfast was good and the location which had slightly concerned us was actually ideal. It was simple to walk to the duomo and there was a metro station about 10 minutes walk away. We also walked from Statzione Centrale where the Malpensa Express arrives. There were lots of good restaurants nearby too
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. I was staying for 3 days and loved it. Only 15-20 min walk from Duomo and other attractions. Modern. Clean. Awesome breakfast!!!!!! Nice and attentive staff. WiFi sometimes slow. Overall A plus
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel overall was great. After a long flight it was nice for a staff member to be attentive on arrival, check in was prompt and hassle free. Breakfast was excellent and seating area was clean and staff was courteous.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is close to the central train station and stands out for being a large modern hotel in the somewhat rundown neighborhood. The rooms were spacious and clean. Ours was a suite that included an espresso machine and two full bathrooms. Breakfast was included and was excellent. Staff were very helpful and gave us great advice for restaurants and directions. We were so impressed we plan to look for other Nh brand hotels in the future.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights here. The service was friendly and welcoming, with a particular mention to Roberta in the restaurant/bar who was so friendly and couldn't do enough to help. The room was clean, spacious and tidy with the bed comfy. The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the train station, and then another 20 minute walk into the centre of the city (although there is a subway stop near the hotel if you don't want to walk). The walk into the city is really nice through some gardens and quadrilatero della moda where all the high-class shopping is. There's also a variety of restaurants within a short walk from the hotel.Breakfast was great with a wide choice of food for all tastes. This is a great place to stay as a base for exploring Milan.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at a great location!! My first trip to Italy and I am glad I stayed at this hotel in Milan. Very close to Milano Centrale and the shopping district! Excellent service and hosts who helped me each step of the way with various needs. Thank you Rocco, Guida and Roberta and everyone else at the hotel!! Hope to be back!! Highly recommend this place as a base for travels around Milan!
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an excellent stay at the hotel and will definitely recommend this hotel . The staff was amazing . The location is great . Breakfast is excellent . Shopping are not far away . In general amazing location
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment of my arrival, the NH Machiavelli proved a smooth, comfortable fit. Absolutely lovely bed and beautiful breakfast buffet, plus a really central location combined to make my stay a very comfortable one.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and well equiped rom. Nice Staff and well organized hotell.Breakfast was really good!We had a quick overnite stay. We walked to the hotell from the trainstation. It was very convinient. I can reccomend this hotell.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn't really expect too much from this hotel since it was a last minute affair - the ski resort we were on our way to was snowed in so we decided to spend the night in Milan.The staff was super friendly and th ehotel is actually in a good location if you are not into focusing only on visiting the Duomo. The rooms were all right - the walls were a bit thin as we found out when our neighbours decided to have some fun :).Breakfast was more than adequate.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 3 days in Milan recently and this hotel was a great addition to our Italian traveling itinerary. We had a corner room which was spacious and comfortable. Room for a coffee table and chairs which is rare in a European hotel. Once we had orientated ourselves we found that we were in easy proximity to tram, train and shopping districts. There was also a huge choice of restaurants within easy walking distance. The staff were courteous and helpful and humoured me in my desire to practise my limited Italian. Breakfast buffet was excellent. .
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location to explore milan, within easy walk of duomo area and close to tram lines. Comfortable, clean, bedrooms, and great selection of food at breakfast. Staff were helpful. Good value for money
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is part of the nH chain. Located only 5 minutes walk from the Porta Venezia Metro station, its location is quite convenient. Plus, there's a supermarket right next to the hotel.Breakfast had a wide variety of cheeses, fruits, pastries, yogurts etc. All were delicious and fresh. They also have a couple.plementary lemonade and cookies in the afternoon at the lobby. The coffee machine at the lobby is open 24/7 for guests.The room was clean and nice, everything was functional. The bed was comfortable.The staff was always courteous and accommodating, always with a smile. This hotel is highly recommended for a vacation in Milan
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at the NH Milano Machiaveli before finishing our trip in Italy. The location is in between the train terminal and most of the tourist places. The hotel itself is beatiful. Rooms are large with nice decor. Hotel employees were kind and helpful during our stay and helped us on every question we had. The breakfast has many options and is tasty.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a nice hotel with great customer service. The rooms were better than expected for the price. The breakfast offering was pretty basic. My only real complaint was the lack of air conditioning. It seems it had been shut off for the colder months but we had some unexpected heat.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am here just for one night and generally prefer NH for my business trips for the general comfort of this chain of hotels. This time I found an outdated structure which definitely needs renovation. Urgent need: electrical sockets close to the night table to recharge the phone overnight (!!). Further I was disappointed not to find any coffee/tea set. I thus ordered 2 cappuccinos and continental breakfast in my room and was willing to pay 10 euro for the service but what I received was 2 cappuccinos, juice and 4 biscuits. So I have decided that this hotel is NOT for me.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is 12mins easy walk from the train station and a 5 min walk from a very accessible metro. Room was large and spotless with all you could need - fridge, tv with English speaking news channels and bathroom amenities. Staff couldnt be more helpful and water upon arrival in reception is an excellent touch.Breakfast was ample - hot and cold choices with very large selection and very tasty.Not many bars/cafes etc in the vicinity but enough to keep you happy for a few nights.Would recommend
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a one night stay at the NH Milano Machiavelli.The room was clean and comfortable, but, as others have noted, could benefit from a bit of modernising and a refresh. The bed was good and I slept well.The staff were friendly, but check in and check out was a bit slow as they only had one person on the desk at a time.Breakfast was a relatively modest buffet tending towards continental style, but it was adequate. Dinner was less impressive; a rather greasy plate that was rather unappetising, served in the near empty and soulless restaurant area.I would consider using again, but would also compare other options.

review_body: We found this location suited us and it was easy to get around. There were good food options close by. The staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was a good size the bed comfortable and very clean and good furnishings. The breakfast was plentiful and fresh.

review_body: My husband and I stayed 8 nights. The entire facility is clean and staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room and bathroom we're generous in size and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was awesome; the variety of items available accommodated all guests. Thank you to the entire staff for taking care of our large group so well!P.S. we loved the chocolates on the pillow every day

review_body: We spent a week at the Machiavelli and had only positive experiences with the entire staff. The room was comfortable and quiet. The restaurant serves very good meals. The breakfast selection is absolutely fantastic. Convenient location to restaurants, shops, metro, bus, train.

review_body: We have stayed in this Hotel many times. Tend to come here every time. Very nice hotel with friendly staff! Location is excellent. In the very center of the city with a convenient access to two main lines of the metro. the bed is comfortable, rooms properly cleaned, breakfast - excellent. Strongly recommend to stay in this Hotel while in Milan!
