review_body: I love this hotel and choose it often for my business trip to Milan. It is very clean, has everything you need to offer, breakfast is great with fresh cappucino on demand. Love the whole atmosphere. Front office desk very professional and helpful.
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent 3 nights at Machiavelli and were welcomed by extremely friendly reception staff who were all willing to help throughout our stay. We stayed in a junior suite and the room was spacious with 2 bathrooms and good facilities- exceptionally clean too, which is always great. We had a good nights sleep and the hotel seemed quiet. However, the decor feels very basic and when we tried out the bar the 'barman' clearly didn't know how to make a mojito (which was on the menu) as it was filled 3/4 with vodka and we also ordered a martini based cocktail which I saw the man simply pour a whole glass full of straight martini! It was striking that we were the only people in the bar/restaurant at 8pm at night.. Breakfast was better with a good range of food and drink to set you up for the day. One lady (I think the manager with blond hair) was very friendly. The location is ok and is close to 2 metro stations and a 20 minute walk to Centrale station or 20ish minute walk to the cathedral. There just aren't many restaurants in the local area and it feels rather run down. Overall, I would say this hotel is perfectly catered for business men/women with function rooms & carpark, but for tourists I would probably suggest an alternative- especially if you are looking for 4*. (If it were a 3* hotel I would have given it 4* on Trip Advisor, but I don't feel it lives up to other 4* hotels in European cities)
hotelName:
31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are excellent, all staff and managers were above friendly and extremely accommodating. Food was outstanding. Service was incredible. There is just nothing negative to say. Can't wait to visit NH Machiavelli again. Thank you to all for making us feel like we were at a home away from home.The first few days were for business thereafter holiday. We returned back to the hotel after our other trips.

31    NH Milano Machiavelli
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I found the staff to be ok and the foyer and halls looked modern but the actual room itself must be a second priority to having a nice hallway. I stay at a similar looking room in Thailand and pay 500 baht. This is 99 euros and has cracks in the walls.Trying to find food in the area on a Sunday afternoon was not easy. Walk around the area outside and everything was shut. Restaurant in the hotel "kitchen closed". Room service don't answer phone. Ordering food online was not working either. The hotel advertises the restaurant to be open in the lifts and upon check in however only has a few dishes available to order. These must be pre-prepared or warmed up by the clerk as she insists the kitchen is closed.At 6pm I ask reception how I can get something to eat. She advises 6pm is a little early but sent me to mamma rosa 2 blocks away. Which was helpful. Breakfast buffet in the mornings... the spread is good and adequate. Lots of choices for cold items. One very small container of bacon and eggs that was empty the whole 40 minutes I was there. I left it open so staff could see it but they just closed it and wern't interested in topping it up. Buffet times are odd. It finishes at 12.00 on Sunday but 10.00 on Monday. So I missed out on breakfast on Monday arriving at 10.30. Doesn't make any sense to me. Also not seeing the "verandah" mentioned on the website.Other thing that annoyed me was cleaning staff ringing my doorbell at 9.30am on the day of checkout for no apparent reason. "Scuzzi" is all they said when I got dressed and answered the door. Then continue to talk loudly for 30 minutes outside my door.Airconditiining controls: Someone else mentions they are "complicated". I thought this was odd but now I understand what they meant. They controls are actually quite simple but not really working correctly. Incredibly touchy and you need to fiddle with it for a few minutes if you want to turn it off. Even then it is more like a fan and not very cool on it's lowest setting anyway. You can't open a window either.Wifi is free however late at night it can get quite slow. They do have a premium option that you can pay for which I didn't try.No tea and coffee facilities in room.No free drinking water in room.There is a safe in the room but it is very small and requires the room door card to operate. I presume housekeeping also possess this card.Its a very basic place and in some regards closer to a 3 star hotel if not for the carpark, buffet and nice halls.Also I notice an odd vibe both on check inn and check out. 3 clerks and 2 computers and a queue of people waiting. Just 1 lady working while the 2 others stand by awkawrdly in silence assisting her to fetch papers from the printer 1 metre away and do things she should be doing herself. Very odd.
